Review_Date: Min P wrote a review Mar 22
Review_Text: Let me just get to the three star/Average rating. This is a solid 4-star hotel at the facility level however things happened while I was checking out left bad taste. The lady working at the reception desk that morning spent ample time explaining things in French to two white ladies. I was understandably waiting for my turn. And then a group of French speaking white people rush in behind me. In stead of helping me the lady skipped me talked over my head and started to check in the group. I was almost pushed aside from the small checkin area. The men in the group felt bad and apologized to me. Some women just handed their passports over my shoulders/heads. It was an embarrassing and insulting experience. After the group was checked in and happily went their way the lady‚Ä¶

Review_Date: Martina H wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: An amazing gem of a hotel
Review_Text: What a truly lovely small hotel this is within 15mins walk of main square of Marrakech. From the moment we stepped behind the door an oasis opened up to us surrounding a lovely heated pool. The hotel staff were exceptional in every way polite attentive and so very helpful always happy to please. Nothing was too much trouble. All spoke good English and French for those who don't speak Arabic. Breakfast isn't vast as the hotel is snall but is delicious and more than enough to start the day. Lunch menu is really good and the evening menu is top quality very stylish and delicious. We sampled many dishes and there was a good selection of vegetarian and gluten free options too along with many different deserts. The lemon and banana souflee was my favourite üòç When you arrive‚Ä¶

Review_Title: Good experience with a few exceptions.
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights. Overall it was wonderful. Checkin. We had a welcome tea in the bar which was nice. Then they asked us to choose a pillow scent. I believe we got an upgrade because we had a very large room with a sitting area on the third floor of one of the buildings. Room: gorgeous and sophisticated. Staff: generally very pleasant. One woman at the front desk was a real spur pus but overall great staff. Breakfast: very tasty. The indoor breakfast room which was the main dining room was very dark though. Choices were tasty but the omelet station was not staffed properly and someone needed to summon the omelet maker. Grounds: very peaceful and well maintained. The pool was heated and very soothing. Concierge: I had made a spa reservation months‚Ä¶

Review_Date: Victoria B wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Text: We spent a wonderful 4 nights at Les jardins de la Medina. The staff were delightful our room huge and beautifully decorated and the gardens absolutely stunning. We ate in the restaurant 3 nights out of 4 because the food was good the dining room was bustling and had a lovely roaring fire.

Review_Date: Derek O wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: An oasis of peace and tranqulity
Review_Text: My wife daughter and I loved our stay at this beautiful hotel. We were warmly welcomed with mint tea and shown the fabulous gardens en route to our rooms. The rooms are very well appointed super clean and comfortable. Top marks to the solarium rooms with a private roof terrace overlooking those amazing gardens. The food at both lunch and dinner are excellent and fair value. The pool is terrific warm even in Feb. And a last word for the excellent friendly and super helpful staff-nothing too much trouble.

Our first time in Marrakesh. We researched many accommodations before choosing Les Jardins de le Medina. It surpassed our already high expectations. We loved the location and the facilities. So so peaceful. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Ignore the reviews saying the service is slow. Loved the walk through the Kasbah to the centre. It allows you to enjoy a different side of the city. Breakfast is fantastic. We had one evening meal and it was delicious. Thank you all. We will be back.

Good location and excellent food and gardens also birds and two tortoises. Friendly and busy staff. Helpful tours to Atlas Mountains the sea and the coast and tour of the town in-depth So many sights to visit. Good cultural aspects to the tours. Even the good weather improved the holiday a fantastic introduction to Africa and Morocco. Thank you.

Just spent five nights at Les Jardins de la Medina. Upgraded to a solarium room. Fantastic hotel in a great location. Easy walk to the main square souks and many of the main attractions. The hotel staff could not be more accommodating. The hotel is a haven of peace and quiet as soon as you walk through the door. I would certainly go back to this hotel and Marrakech. Morocco is a spectacular country.

We stayed in January/February and this is one of the top five hotels worldwide we have stayed in. The room was excellent the food top quality and the staff fantastic. Situated in the old city meant we could get around with ease. An excellent place to stay in Marrakech.

We had a most enjoyable holiday at this hotel at the end of January. The room we stayed in was five star the food was excellent and the staff were wonderful. A hotel we can thoroughly recommend and will come back hopefully. The airport is 20min taxi from the hotel and it arranges it for you. The weather in January was chilly in the morning but 20+ in the afternoon.

Review_Date: Min P wrote a review Mar 22
Review_Text: Let me just get to the three star/Average rating. This is a solid 4-star hotel at the facility level however things happened while I was checking out left bad taste. The lady working at the reception desk that morning spent ample time explaining things in French to two white ladies. I was understandably waiting for my turn. And then a group of French speaking white people rush in behind me. In stead of helping me the lady skipped me talked over my head and started to check in the group. I was almost pushed aside from the small checkin area. The men in the group felt bad and apologized to me. Some women just handed their passports over my shoulders/heads. It was an embarrassing and insulting experience.    After the group was checked in and happily went their way the lady said something to me and it turned out 28 local currency tax. I handed her 40 she gave me back 10 and that‚Äôs it. Not sure why she didn‚Äôt give me the full change of 12.    Then the pre arranged text came for 50 local currency to the train station which according to the locals is the maximum one should pay for any places around Marrakech. One the way walking to the taxi the gentleman (not Abdel) working at the reception desk instructed me to pay 60 10 more than the pre agreed maximum cost.    These are not issues about money. It is the trust lost and feel being treated like a stupid ATM. These things should not happen in a beautiful and luxurious hotel like Les Jardins de la Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Martina H wrote a review Feb 2023
Review_Title: An amazing gem of a hotel
Review_Text: What a truly lovely small hotel this is within 15mins walk of main square of Marrakech.  From the moment we stepped behind the door an oasis opened up to us surrounding a lovely heated pool.  The hotel staff were exceptional in every way polite attentive and so very helpful always happy to please. Nothing was too much trouble. All spoke good English and French for those who don't speak Arabic.  Breakfast isn't vast as the hotel is snall but is delicious and more than enough to start the day. Lunch menu is really good and the evening menu is top quality very stylish and delicious. We sampled many dishes and there was a good selection of vegetarian and gluten free options too along with many different deserts. The lemon and banana souflee was my favourite üòç  When you arrive you get asked which fragrance you want on your bed pillows... such a nice touch each night. The beds and linen in our room were top quality so so comfortable! Each evening we were given details of the next days weather given sweets and always with a smile. Our room 120 had a small balcony overlooking the pool very private and had an open fire and seating area. It was very comfortable.  The hotel has a great spa too a must for at least a hamman or massage!  The rooftop terrace was a great suntrap and peaceful if you want to read etc. The amazing waiters even carried your food and drink up the 3 flights of stairs for you....  All in all our 5 day break was 5* and we can't recommend this hotel enough....  Thank you to everyone at JM. We will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Good experience with a few exceptions.
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights. Overall it was wonderful.  Checkin. We had a welcome tea in the bar which was nice. Then they asked us to choose a pillow scent. I believe we got an upgrade because we had a very large room with a sitting area on the third floor of one of the buildings.  Room: gorgeous and sophisticated.  Staff: generally very pleasant. One woman at the front desk was a real spur pus but overall great staff.  Breakfast: very tasty. The indoor breakfast room which was the main dining room was very dark though. Choices were tasty but the omelet station was not staffed properly and someone needed to summon the omelet maker.  Grounds: very peaceful and well maintained. The pool was heated and very soothing.  Concierge: I had made a spa reservation months before arrival and I confirmed it a week prior. They had no appt for us on the day and we had to split our Hammam treatment and massages on separate days. This was quite annoying as it restricted our schedule for two days instead of one. Also the walking tour arranged by the concierge was basically a shopping expedition  of the Medina. I wouldn‚Äôt recommend booking your city tours through them.  Location: in a quiet section on th e edge of the Medina so beware it is a good 20 min walk to the main square. It is convenient to go to other areas of the city since there is easy access out of the medina. Overall: if you can get a good deal on Agoda or another website go for it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victoria B wrote a review Mar 5
Review_Text: We spent a wonderful 4 nights at Les jardins de la Medina. The staff were delightful our room huge and beautifully decorated and the gardens absolutely stunning. We ate in the restaurant 3 nights out of 4 because the food was good the dining room was bustling and had a lovely roaring fire.

The food at both lunch and dinner are excellent and fair value.  The pool is terrific warm even in Feb.  And a last word for the excellent friendly and super helpful staff-nothing too much trouble.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our first time in Marrakesh. We researched many accommodations before choosing Les Jardins de le Medina. It surpassed our already high expectations. We loved the location and the facilities. So so peaceful. The staff are super friendly and helpful. Ignore the reviews saying the service is slow. Loved the walk through the Kasbah to the centre. It allows you to enjoy a different side of the city. Breakfast is fantastic. We had one evening meal and it was delicious. Thank you all. We will be back.

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Absolutely beautiful hotel in a fabulous location.  Probably one of the very best hotels we have ever stayed in and we like our holidays a lot!!!!  Authentic feel to the hotel with fabulous service from all the staff who go the extra mile to help you. It made our 30th wedding anniversary a memorable and very special stay. Marrakech what a wonderful City with wonderful people.  We hope to come back one day. Thank-you so much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: El K wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: Gorgeous setting professional and friendly staff amazing city!  This hotel is situated on a quiet road 20 mins walk to the central square and 5 mins from lovely restaurants.  The staff deserve the first mention. From the welcoming staff to the waiting staff to the cleaners everyone was so professional. Many spoke to us in English and French but a number took time to teach me a little Arabic when I asked too which was nice.  The road into the centre is busy with motorbikes cars and pedestrians and I wouldn't recommend to go with children or r travel by taxi if you do.  I'd love to go back to marrakesh and this hotel in particular. The city is a mix of so many cultures and the hotel is a relaxing oasis!  Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Return trip to Les Jardins de la Medina
Review_Text: This must be our sixth trip to the hotel. We love it and it only gets better every time we visit. The new general manager has made some very positive changes (although the hotel was already perfect in our eyes). Nothing is too much. This time we didn't leave to eat outside the hotel and enjoyed every meal.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel (but not so keen on the area)
Review_Text: This is a great hotel in a less nice part of Marrakech. Once inside the front door its a lovely oasis from the city. We loved our room the beautiful calm garden and pool area the spa and the friendly staff. Breakfast and lunch were great (fresh salads chilled wine) but dinner just OK (overcooked meat and different atmosphere). Wifi was OK but needs to reload every time you use it which becomes annoying.  We loved Marrakech overall but found the Kasbah part of the Medina too stressful. We ended up using taxis to avoid the walk through this district. We chose a solarium room with a private sun terrace which got sun most of the day and was amazing. Looking over the garden its private and very calming. The bedroom and bathroom were spacious and the bed very comfortable. The room was quiet until the last night when some noisy neighbours below spoiled things. The hotel need to act more decisively to address this sort of thing. You can also hear the prayer call from the local mosque but its not too loud.  The outdoor gym area doesn't seem to be used. The spa was amazing with very good hammam which is worth a try and nice massages at good prices. A good choice especially if you value the calm of a large garden/pool area. But more of a good 4 star than 5 star experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Henri C wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Not a luxury hotel and not a traditional Riad either‚Ä¶
Review_Text: Not a regular hotel not a true Riad. We could not avoid being disappointed as the place didn‚Äôt live up the the website and reviews hype. While the service is certainly nice the overall layout of the hotel lacks the charm of a traditional Riad and the pool surroundings are not up to what a nicer hotel would offer. A good renovation/upgrade is probably in order.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful gardens and location - you can walk to main square easily and first 10 minutes is through a fantastic non touristy area .    Room - we had a superior garden room which we loved - v. big and furnished tastefully .. only issue was we thought from website photos it would have a balcony/patio so check what you are getting !    The pool area was great - sunbeds a bit close together but no shortage.    Breakfast ok - had egg station for omelettes etc bit disappointed that one day there was bacon next it was gone !    Service - staff v friendly but service pretty inconsistent. Ie we sat in restaurant area in garden for over 20 mins waiting for service / menu on 2 occasions - although waiters had definitely seen us - and in end had to go to bar ourselves. Exception was the pool area where the young guy was really attentive and service was great.    Overall - might stay again but would look at alternatives..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mr and Mrs Mohomed-Hossen wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. After much research we decided to book this hotel as they catered for vegetarian and gluten free. We were impressed by the quality of the service from all the staff during our stay.They were friendly professional and always helpful. The restaurant staff went beyond their way to make sure there was enough choice for the vegeterian/ gluten free menu.  Thanks you to you all and hope to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernard S wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: Very happy with our stay. Nice room. Quiet location. Good swimming pool. Very friendly staff. Extensive selection of good food for breakfast. Entertainment provided on two nights - one night was a close up magician and live music the other night was a live singer.

Review_Date: Mr D wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: A gem of a hotel in Kasbah Set away from the hustle and bustle of Medina (which in my honest opinion is a very good thing) the hotel is amazing as soon as you walk in. Greeted by friendly and helpful staff and given welcome drinks and snacks. The hotel is unique in that is somewhere in between a road and a hotel. The decor is different from many places you find in Marrakech it‚Äôs colonial. The gardens of the hotel and pool are simply stunning. It is rare to find somewhere as peaceful as this in Marrakech especially in the old town. Highly highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Colin M wrote a review Aug 2022
Review_Text: Amazing place to stay in great location within easy walking distance to the centre of the city. The hotel itself is a real oasis of calm with lovely courtyard gardens and a fair sized pool. Staff were attentive friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the hotel so much we cut our trip to the coast short and came back to stay a second time!

Review_Date: Fiona B wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: This is a small hotel where the staff are lovely and cannot do enough for you. It is very well run and full of small thoughtful touches - such as being able to pick a perfume for your room and toiletries little candles outside lighting up the walkways little terraces to sit and have a drink - its just fantastic. Breakfast sitting outside was a dream - the courtyard is big enough to have a lovely pool which was perfect for chilling out in the hot afternoons. It‚Äôs a good location just inside the south side of the Medina - you can easily walk to many of the site seeing attractions and there is a narrow road outside which means you can be picked up and dropped off just outside. We will definitely go back. We went with two 16 year old boys who also loved it - so works for family couples or friends. Close to a very modern airport so a great bolt hole too if you need a bit of winter sun. Oh and it was very quiet. A real oasis.

Review_Date: The Cat‚Äôs Mother wrote a review Jul 2022
Review_Text: Perfect spot for a long weekend. Stepping into the hotel from the busy Medina streets is an oasis of calm and tranquility.  All of the team cannot do enough to ensure your stay is a fantastic experience.  We had a couple of organised excursions which were great
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We came here for dinner on our first night in Marrakech and truly enjoyed the ambiance and the food. The garden is beautiful and the choice and quality of food were very good. It‚Äôs a mix of traditional Morrocan and European cuisine. They also serve nice local wines.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wendy H wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: Beautiful medina. You wouldn‚Äôt believe it‚Äôs behind the door.  It‚Äôs our last night tomorrow night. We have had a lovely time. Staff couldn‚Äôt be more helpful. Food very good.Great welcome upon arrival. Have had wonderful spa treatments.  Breakfast is very pleasant with plenty to choose from. Would definitely recommend. Great team - thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Would not recommend, better look elsewhere
Review_Text: Property is beautiful and peaceful spa is good room is clean and we had a nice fireplace in the room that was arranged with wood upon request. Reservation team responded in a timely manner which was also appreciated.    With this said service in the restaurant and front desk is very poor and a huge let down for the hotel. The only person that I would highlight is the lady server in the restaurant which was polite smiling and accommodating. And it ends here. Everyone else either only care about elder guests to get more money from them or they do not speak sufficient English or they do not know how to do their job or just do not care and you have to figure out things by yourself.    Concierge help non existent and no one was able to assist in our request to check with the requirements to board a plane back home so we had to do it by ourselves. Only thing they can do is to call for you a taxi (which than charges you more than concierge said it would be - we already expected this).    No personalized serviced. I had a birthday while staying there and not a single gesture was extended even though I mentioned in advance that we are coming to stay there due to that. My wife actually had to ask a spa team if a small cake can be arranged. But small gesture in the room forget about it.    Early breakfast on departure: we requested in advance what we would like to get and at what time since we had to leave hotel before breakfast started. Breakfast was prepared later as requested and only with a glass of orange juice coffee one croissant one pain au chocolate and one yoghurt per person even though on the form you get also cereals bread fruits. This was not done. No bread basket no jam no honey nothing and we had to wait almost 30 minutes after requested time. Not how you want a guest to leave the property.    Dinned twice for dinner: manager is there speaking with only older guests we were completely ignored not even hello or eye contact. Server brought the food and even though it was correct order while removing the cover of the food he mentioned different order and while we tried to open the cover to see what is there he was pushing the cover back down. Seriously? After we saw that it was correct order he turned it into a joke. Excuse me?    We had glasses for wine and water pre-arranged on the desk but when we ordered beer they brought additional two glasses so we ended up with 6 big glasses on a small table and no one bothered to remove the empty glasses so there was almost not enough space for food. No one bothers to offer another round of drinks or remove empty bottles or to offer additional bottle of water.    We used the fireplace and housekeeping did not bother to remove the ashes the next day while cleaning the room.    We booked the couples treatment in spa but for the message part we were in different rooms. This is than not a couples treatment.    Wifi did not work on the balcony of the room.    Overall disappointed and would not recommend. There are much better cheaper options with far more superior and personalized service around Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Loved the hotel and the staff were very good could not do enough to help. Hotel on the edge of the Medina which meant 20 minute plus walk to the large square or around ¬£5 or less each way taxi our preferred option.

Review_Date: Stephanie G wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Title: Amazing and relaxing time with great food and lovely hospitality.
Review_Text: Beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakech. Amazing interiors and hospitality of the staff. The food served in the restaurant in riad was truly great and exceptional. the location is perfect. highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: julia s wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: This is a fantastic centrally located 5 star boutique hotel we visited in April during ramadan .All the staff were very helpful and friendly . Great to have a beautiful garden and pool to come back to after the heat and chaos of the Marrakech medina.We also used the spa for massages and nails which were all very good . You can walk everywhere from here . Arrived here during ramadam so in the evening everything shuts down from 7-7.30pm so make sure you book your resturants to work round this .Ideal weather not to hot .The breakfast was fantastic something for everyone and nothing was to much trouble . We ate in the resturant on the first night which wasnt as good as it could of been  we had the mixed salad starter which was a bad example of this course compared to all the other mixed salad starters we had  it was good service though but we do feel it could be improved and would be great to improve that so you could just come back from a busy day in the Medina and have a good authentic moroccan meal.We would definitley come back to this hotel and would recommend this well situated establishment .

Review_Date: Sunny P wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: This is our third night at this hotel. The garden is beautiful with lush greens and turtles. Rooms surround the garden. We have one of the junior suites which has its own little patio with chaises and chairs. The room is clean and has all the modern conveniences. Each evening someone comes to spray fragrance of your choice on your pillows. They supply 2 large bottles of water each day which you will need every drop of because it is very dry here. I wish I brought some saline nasal sprays!!  Alfresco Breakfast buffet isn‚Äôt lavish but very nice. You can order eggs and specialty coffees.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve V wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: We arrived at a small door in a red wall on a narrow road in the Medina of Marrakech and were told by the driver 'you are here' which was a bit of a surprise. But walking through that door it was like going in to Narnia. We found the most beautiful and tranquil gardens and a truly fantastic hotel. The welcome included mint tea pastries olives and nuts and we were given the choice of three scents that were to be sprayed on our pillows at night. The staff could not have been more friendly and attentive. The bedroom was amazing with the biggest bed ever. Rose petals were always in abundance when the room was cleaned; robes were free for use as was a wicker carrier bag containing straws hats for use around the pool or on the roof top. The food was excellent too. We would thoroughly recommend having a Hamman at the hotel's spa on day one. The staff and quality of the massages were brilliant. I cannot recommend this hotel enough to those who want a peaceful retreat away from the hubbub of the city....

Review_Date: Scott O wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Title: Great place to get away from the chaos
Review_Text: I loved my stay at Les Jardins. It was at the end of my visit to Morocco and I couldn't ask for a better place to regroup. Everyone was nice. The grounds are beautiful. The restaurant and spa excellent. I was so glad I stayed here.

Review_Date: Fabrice D wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Title: With the biggest private garden in the Medina, it is a charming hotel with professional staff. An oasis to consider !!
Review_Text: If you are expecting a fancy hotel with the latest gadgets or design you may wish to consider other addresses in the Palmeraie or Hivernage. Here however the garden offers a historical oasis in the South of the Medina. If its walls could talk some guests names would sound familiar. Professional and well trained staff where nothing is too much trouble.  Comfortable and well appointed rooms I recommend you opt for those with a private roof terrace and shower to benefit from the beautiful view over the expansive gardens.  A good restaurant with a high standard of French/Moroccan cuisine delicious a la carte breakfast served in your choice of the room or restaurant a great size swimming pool which beats any Riad plunge pool. We did not try the spa during our stay but there is plenty of choice for weary travellers    Overall a great choice and oasis of calm in the hectic Medina which I highly recommend !

Review_Date: Jackie B wrote a review Sep 2021
Review_Title: Solarium rooms are brilliant. 7 tortoises on the grounds who love fruit we saved from breakfast.
Review_Text: Lovely hotel we visited for my birthday with my brother and his wife. Staff were attentive and friendly. Nothing was too much trouble. Got there and we had booked a garden room my brother had a solarium room with its own balcony and I liked their room so we asked if we could upgrade as more expensive. Staff upgraded us with no trouble at all and did this for free. We were blown away by this kind gesture and was the cherry on the cake as upgraded room was fabulous. Pool is fantastic the staff are 100% courteous the gardener we met outside helped us find a local artisan shop. Waiters were great as 9pm curfew we had drinks every night on our private balcony and brought us ice buckets every night with nibbles ( crisps olives and nuts). One of the best hotels we‚Äôve stayed at. Five * can‚Äôt wait to come back from Jackie Chris Anth and Marion
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I were using a voucher we had from last spring. We had a lovely stay and would have enjoyed it more if we didn't have to work the next day. The food was absolutely delicious. The chef did a really great job of incorporating non-Moroccan dishes with local food. We also had a massage at the spa and it was equally as wonderful.

Review_Date: Ifigenia P. MIchalis A. wrote a review Nov 2020
Review_Title: A beautiful garden in the heart of Marakesh
Review_Text: The place is very nice and well maintained. The rooms are comfortable. We‚Äôve been upgraded in a room with a nice balcony and individual area in the terrace overlooking the beautiful garden which I believe makes this place unique especially if we consider the location which is in the Medina.  The breakfast was great and the dinner we had the first night in the hotel‚Äôs restaurant was very good.  The service was also very good and engaging. All the personnel did a fantastic job.  My wife used the spa two days and she was very happy with the result as well.  Over all a very nice place to be if you want to spend few days in Marakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: marie w wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: Great room great food lovely staff. Nice to have a pool in Marrakech! Had a short 3 day 2 night stay.  Breakfast was simple but nice lunch by the pool was amazing and great value. Will definitely be back.  Very peaceful and relaxing

Review_Date: Steven G wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We stayed in February and were in a junior suite. Large clean quiet room with a walk in shower. My wife and I had our own sinks in separate areas and we had an outside private sitting area. Great room. There was a terrace one floor above us with lovely views of the city and the Atlas mountains and wonderful for viewing the sunset. The pool is lovely and is heated. The entire property is beautiful and luxurious and is a quiet tranquil oasis. The staff was friendly and helpful. Breakfast is included and it a great way to start the day. Easy walk to the heart of the medina. We had dinner at the restaurant one night and it was a great meal and well worth it. We had a really enjoyable stay!

We stayed here in March 2020for a birthday weekend for my wife  What a lovely place full of amazing staff lovely pool area great breakfast nice bar beautiful spa and lovely rooms  I cannot say enough about the staff they contribute so much to this lovely small hotel  The food is lovely the ambience is great to pull areas so comfortable and the roof terrace is just wonderful  This place is certainly well worth a visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely weekend stay in this oasis of an hotelq
Review_Text: Perfect for us in every way. We were allocated a suite on the 2nd floor overlooking the gardens. Lounge large bedroom and superb terrace in the treetops. The service team from beginning to end were literally faultless- well done and thank you to all of you. A real refuge from the hubbub of the medina near the royal palace. We were delighted to be "home" again each time we got back. Also an easy 15 min stroll to the main square in the city. Thoroughly recommended in everyway.

In my humble opinion it's a really nice hotel but it is overpriced. We had a lovely room though small with a sun-terrace up a flight of exceedingly steep stairs (not for everyone). The sun-terrace was nice though bare. The room lovely but small. Nice comfy bed.  How in Morroco where one supposes that staff etc are much more economical a hotel should be this highly priced is beyond me.

The hotel is a real riad (ie it has a large garden in the centre) rather than a dar (a house with courtyards). It is in the south of the walled city a short 10 or 15 minute walk to Place Jemaa el Fna. Everything is walkable and easy to find. It has lovely roof top terraces with chairs and loungers a pool and lovely gardens (it was nice to sit in the quiet gardens after a busy day). The garden bedrooms on the ground floor open out onto the center garden so privacy here is limited. Other rooms have nice balcony or terraces. Our room was large and had a nice terrace. Lovely Moroccan decorations everywhere. We ate in the restaurant a few times and enjoyed the food and atmosphere. There was a selection of local and international food. Breakfast was also good with a cooking station to cook eggs etc to order. It was convenient not having to find somewhere outside every evening. The staff were efficient and friendly and eager to please. All in all a lovely place to stay. We choose to book an airport transfer with the hotel which made everything easy.

Very tasty breakfasts friendly staff and an enjoyable place to stay. The monkfish on the evening menu was delicious. Thank you!    Tip - possibly include more detail in the content of your excursions folder and include a map.  Tip - for guests staying a week or longer you would benefit by changing the evening meal menu.  Tip - a large noticeboard with places to visit in Marrakesh including up to date information (opening times/admission fee/brief description) would help visitors who want to make the most of their stay.

We stayed in this charming hotel for 5 nights in February 2020. The hotel has 32 rooms surrounding a traditional Arab courtyard garden filled with orange trees palm trees and a pool. The staff were very friendly the rooms clean and well appointed and the restaurant and bar excellent. The hotel is well located inside the city walls. It worked well for us and we can thoroughly recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen L wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Riad les Jardins de Medina Marrakesh
Review_Text: My companion and I spent three days in January at the Riad. Lovely setting and we were woken by amazing bird song from the garden in the mornings. The service is excellent and there was room heating as the temperatures dropped at night. Nice bathtub for a relaxing soak. Food in the restaurant was delicious and breakfasts more than adequate. I liked the lady making making omelettes! The Riad is very good at offering small touches including us a choice of room scents!

Review_Date: Armen G wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Very comfortable stay in historic center of Marrakech
Review_Text: Hotel garden is very beautiful location is perfect breakfast / restaurant are amazing. Rooms (especially bathroom) requires some refreshment but this does not spoil the overall very pleasant impression
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a stylish and characterful hotel giving a peaceful and relaxing setting The service was exemplary - nothing was too much trouble. Staff were always friendly and helpful. Our bedroom was large and airy immaculately clean and either warm or cool just as the climatic condition required. We were impressed with the perfume and the rose petals - a delightful touch!  The food was tasty and abundant including genuine Moroccan cuisine. Log fires were welcome in the evening and early morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brewster B wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We had a wonderful week at Les Jardins de la Medina. Great warm welcoming staff. The food was glorious. The light and space from the large garden courtyard made this your own private oasis in the centre of Marrakech. Rooms were large clean and comfortable and we had a lovely roof terrace all to ourselves.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: The perfect combination of traditional riad and boutique hotel - very special!
Review_Text: Just returned from a four-night stay over New Year. Can't say enough good things about Les Jardins de la Medina. There are many fantastic riads in Marrakech (we stayed at a smaller riad near the main square last time and it was excellent) ‚Äì but Les Jardins is a perfect mix of old-style riad charm combined with the facilities and service of a high-class boutique hotel.    As others have said it is truly an oasis in the mad bustle of Marrakech. Walking distance to many of the city‚Äôs attractions - but more than that we looked forward eagerly to returning to this tranquil haven each day after sightseeing.    We stayed in one of the Sultana Suites room 117 on the top floor and it was perfect for us. Spacious light and airy room (bedroom plus adjacent sitting room) with lots of thoughtful details to make it special. The roomy terrace is tucked high up in the partial shade of the beautiful trees I loved hearing the frequent chirruping of the birds that make the garden their home. The central courtyard gardens are truly gorgeous and beautifully maintained a major selling point. So peaceful and relaxing I doubt there‚Äôs anything else like it in the medina. The pictures don‚Äôt do it justice.    We ate three times in the restaurant and loved it. They have got the ambience just right it feels intimate and atmospheric sophisticated and classy but without being too formal would recommend eating here even if you‚Äôre not staying at the property. One meal was the New Year Dinner it was superb. Five delicious courses spread over the course of the evening with tasteful entertainment / live music in between. The chefs here are really really good. The trio of desserts was spectacular worthy of a French patisserie. So much care and attention to detail went into every aspect of that meal when they could so easily have churned out fairly basic food to milk the New Year market. Bravo to all concerned a triumph!    ALL the staff are absolutely wonderful and work so hard to make your experience great. Everyone from the front desk to the waiters to the cleaning and maintenance team was brilliant. They make everything so easy for you.    I could go on and on listing what makes this place so wonderful ‚Äì suffice to say this would be our No 1. choice when we return to Marrakech. Thank you!

My fianc√©e and I stayed there for two days and had a wonderful time - the rooms have all the comfort you wish for the service is great. If I could change something it would only be that we should have stayed there longer! :-)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauri B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Loved Les Jardins de la M√©dina! Staying in a Riad is so much more of an authentic experience than staying in a hotel. Our family just spent five days at Les Jardins over the holiday week and loved the quiet and tranquilility of this beautiful oasis inside the bustling M√©dina. The staff is so attentive and eager to help. The grounds and rooms are lovely. Breakfast is good and plentiful and served in a beautiful setting. It‚Äôs a special experience.

Like many riads you enter the hotel directly from the hustle and bustle of the busy narrow streets within the Medina. Reception is laid back and stress free with your bags taken care of whilst you enjoy a complimentary drink and discussion of the features of. You even get to choose which scent you would like sprayed on your pillow at turndown each evening.  The highlights are the attractive gardens surrounding a good sized pool with plenty of loungers and towels available. The roof top terrace is an excellent spot to enjoy a sundowner or two. Just call down to the bar on the telephone and they will bring your drinks up for you.  We travelled as two couples staying for 3 nights. We dined with the hotel on our first evening and had some fun with the menu. Some of the English translations mean you have to use your imagination. The theatre of the presentation was a nice touch. A good selection of wine and would recommend the tagines. The lamb shank is superb and creative how your waiter will remove from the bone.  Good location to walk to restaurants and attractions. Saadian Tombs leisurely 10 minutes walk away. Jamal el Fna 25 minutes walk or 5 minutes taxi for ¬£5.

Review_Date: Brendon M wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: I rate this hotel very highly. The service was consistently good the restaurant is great and the pool area and roof terrace are perfect places to relax in the sunshine. My room was large and very comfortable. The beauty of this hotel is that you can plunge into the throes of Marrakesh and then retreat within its wars for some R&R when the activity becomes too much. It was pretty quiet when I was there (the pre-Christmas lull) and some routine maintenance work was being carried out which was occasionally on the noisy side. Apart from that I was entirely happy and certainly intend to go back.

We stayed 3 nights first was prior to a 2 night trip to a desert camp then 2 more nights after our return. The hotel was beautiful. You would never know that just outside the gates was the hectic streets of Marrakech. This was a nice quiet escape. They served us mint tea upon arrival and let us choose a scent for our pillows which was a nice touch. We had a garden room which was comfortable and quiet. The room had everything you would need and was beautifully decorated. Although it was cooler (November/December) we were able to use the heated pool which our daughter appreciated. They had a nice breakfast each morning. We had dinner at the restaurant 2 nights. The food was good service was ok. We enjoyed the roof top was lovely and we had fun relaxing while taking in some views of Marrakech. The staff was friendly and accommodating. We will definitely stay there again.

Review_Date: Brian H wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Very comfortable with excellent staff. One of the issues was that our room was up two/three flights of steep stairs which were uncomfortable for my wife and we had no prior notification because our room was described as a patio room which to me means no stairs!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: C√©dric B wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: Very nice place to stay. The roof tops and the garden is amazing
Review_Text: As amazing as the garden was the room. Very nicely decorated with a fire place and high ceiling. The staff is friendly and very helpful. The restaurant in the hotel is worth a visit too for dinner of lunch. The breakfast overs a very nice choice of local and international dishes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Ian Fuller wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: We stayed in one of the upstairs rooms facing the garden and had a thoroughly enjoyable stay. Room was spacious and had many local touches. The garden surrounding the pool is delightful. Breakfast is excellent with a wide choice. Staff are all exceptionally friendly. Our only criticism would be the rather inadequate heating in the room.

Review_Date: Mehdi T wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Although the room was slightly blank and too cosy the former Palace has an amazing garden and friendly personnel.  Also a bit hard to access by car. A parking is available a 100 m away.  Recommended for couples looking for a quiet escape.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: david t wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: Situated just inside the old city walls you approach the hotel down a typical M√©dina street narrow crowded dirty and frantic . A large door leads into an oasis of calm and tranquility. Greeted by charming staff then shown to a lovely garden room. As the name implies the hotel is built round a beautiful central garden. It was too cold to try the swimming pool in December but I bet it‚Äôs a treat in summer.    Our room was spotless and well appointed all the facilities you‚Äôd expect of a decent standard boutique hotel. Well appointed small bar area and a nice restaurant with outside terrace ( heated during our stay) . We had one lovely meal in the hotel restaurant but each night the menu changed and looked interestingly different a good mix of modern and traditional.    Great place to stay !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Booked for 5 nights for a 25th wedding anniversary.  When you arrive at the closed door in a back street of the old town you knock and do not know what to expect on the other side. The door opens and from that moment you are in an oasis of calm and great service.  We booked a Solarium Room which is a bedroom with a sun lounge and upstairs private sun terrace overlooking the gardens. 5 o clock with the sun on the terrace and a glass of wine absolute heaven.  Took two evening meals at the restuarant beautiful food and wonderful service.  Probably a bit pricey but what a great experience. would love to stay again.

Review_Date: Janet W wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Title: An oasis in the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: Situated 15 minutes walk from the main square and the souk but within the Medina this is a very lovely hotel. As you enter the door there is a beautiful calmness after the noise and bustle outside. Within the first 10 minutes you select the fragrance for your pillows as you refresh your hands and face with a hot towel to then snack on dates and almonds and mint tea. The attention to detail is delightful and the staff are so helpful. The restaurant serves good food the swimming pool is heated to a very pleasant temperature there is a small outdoor gym just in case you have over indulged in the restaurants (great breakfast choice). The Spa is great. Although tempted by other options rated highly on TA we went to the hotel one and were very pleased that we did. The Hammam was great and the massage very relaxing. I was very pleased that I could just don a bathrobe at the end and return to the room rather than being offsite and having to get dressed while still very oily post massage. There are sun terraces which are lovely for an afternoon snooze or good read. We loved having the peace end quiet here after the madness outside the door.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a quiet and comfortable place in a busy city
Review_Text: very nice place and good service.  supra servove in the restaurant...to be complimented  the Lady preparing and cooking breakfast...  and YAYA always there always smiling impeccable service.  very nice garden  very comfortable rooms  rapid and efficient survice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Came with a friend for a first time trip to Marrakesh. From our arrival to our departure nothing was too much trouble for the wonderful staff here. Lovely touches such as choosing your room fragrance to complimentary bottled water a plate of pastries in our room on arrival. The room was huge and the beds very comfortable. The breakfast choice was excellent with something to suit everybody's taste including a chef who will cook an omelette to order. The weather was cooling down in November but we still managed to use the swimming pool and also enjoyed the fabulous roof terrace when the pool area became a little too shady. We ate in the hotel and every meal we had was delicious especially the huge desserts. Reception staff organised taxis and guides for us thank you! My only two minor criticisms are the slightly unreliable wifi and the staircase lighting on the way to rooms 130/131 - on dark nights the staircase could probably benefit from an extra light source. All in all a trip to remember and highly recommended. Hope to return one day.

We loved absolutely everything about this hotel and from arrival to departure we were completely spoilt. Breakfast is fantastic with a great array of local offerings fresh coffee and attentive service. The setting is totally tranquil and in sharp contrast to the surrounding area. Staff were all fabulous and organised a tour guide who was first rate. We‚Äôd love to come back soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Super nice hotel in the middle of nowhere.  Really nice design but also authentic to Bolivia. Staff were so friendly and helpful. WiFi execellent. Swimming pool and plenty of areas to just sit and rest.  Breakfast was exceptional with so much choice and all super tasty!    10/10 for me
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This is a charming hotel in a great situation in the Kasbah. The room was very comfortable and the food was excellent. The staff were helpful and polite. It was a very enjoyable stay for my daughter's birthday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Trevor G wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: We were recommended to this hotel by a friendwhen we arrived it was like going in to an oasiswe were given a splendid room ate there the first night which was excellent.  We eat there another night and the meals that two of had was terriblewhen we called the waiter that took our order to complain he did not care but blamed us for the way we had it cooked .which was wrong because part of the meat was tastefulthe other couples meal was ok.  That night the two of us that had duck woke up with sickness we didn‚Äôt eat anything else during the day.  We reported next day to reception and she seemed concerned.  When we checked out I asked if they were going to charge for our meal which they debited 10% of the meal but the waiter still blamed us for the meal saying we didn‚Äôt eat any so how could we have been sick for eating the mealas I explained we did eat some but the rest was uneatable the attitude of this waiter leaves a lot to be desired we didn‚Äôt lie.  This spoiled a good stay when it could of been handled much better my this waiter  But I must say every other member of staff were brilliant the room staff I must make a special mention to after I had a fall thanks.  Again a good hotel that could of handled a situation differently .

Spent 4 nights there had a hammam massage which was great . Food was of good quality only went half board and menu was the same every dayservice very slow dinner was taking 2 hours on average  alcoholic drinks exceptionally expensive nice location majority of guests were over 50s. Spent majority of time at hotel apart from trip to atlas mountains and when venturing out I spoke to many Brits who found it to be intimidating  people regularly having money taken off them we were offered drugs repeatedly out and about and I wouldn't return to Marakkech in a hurry
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardin de la Medina was a perfect spot to spend four nights in Marrakesh. It was quiet clean and comfortable; service was great as was the food. We loved our comfortable spacious room including the balcony overlooking the lush green garden.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A delightful oasis of calm with excellent service from staff and a high standard of catering . The bedrooms are spacious and characterful with all the extras expected in a quality hotel. My one criticism is the inadequate and noisy air conditioning unit that despite being reported could not be regulated to cool the air. Had the weather been hot this would have been a major issue. The central garden with its lush foliage and well sized heated pool is a delight. We particularly enjoyed the two occasions at dinner with the musicians and the amazing magician.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ben C wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Perfect location lovely vibe and very friendly staff all contributed to make it a very special and memorable holiday. Lovely to have a relaxing haven to come back to after busy days sightseeing. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: a quiet and comfortable place in a busy city
Review_Text: very nice place and good service.  supra servove in the restaurant...to be complimented  the Lady preparing and cooking breakfast...  and YAYA always there always smiling impeccable service.  very nice garden  very comfortable rooms  rapid and efficient survice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: a quiet and comfortable place in a busy city
Review_Text: very nice place and good service.  supra servove in the restaurant...to be complimented  the Lady preparing and cooking breakfast...  and YAYA always there always smiling impeccable service.  very nice garden  very comfortable rooms  rapid and efficient survice

Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: a quiet and comfortable place in a busy city
Review_Text: very nice place and good service.  supra servove in the restaurant...to be complimented  the Lady preparing and cooking breakfast...  and YAYA always there always smiling impeccable service.  very nice garden  very comfortable rooms  rapid and efficient survice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: With a group of friends we have travelled to a number of places together in recent years. This year we came to Marrakesh and I can confirm that we all had a great time. This was made all the more so by our stay at The Jardins de la Medina. Their attention to our requirements were quite remarkable and nothing was too much trouble. Good advice was offered on what to see and where to go and help freely offered with arrangements for eating away from the hotel and guided trips. The food at the hotel was of a very high standard and it was served with a smile! The bar staff were very helpful and often exceeded my expectations! On the speciality Friday evening the magician was a delight and it was great to meet the Director and head of Sales and Marketing. It was also great to be introduced to the six baby tortoises born in the gardens! I usually view my overall stay at an hotel with the simple question would I return? I can say that in the case of this hotel the answer is a resounding YES!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent 4 fabulous days with Les Jardins de la Medina! we were amazed by the venue itself atmosphere and impeccable service. The room was great hotel restaurant has probably one of the best kitchens in Marrakesh! We loved the food and the wine selection.  The whole area is beautiful with an inner garden and pool where you can really relax and enjoy life.  We will definitely come back! Thank you for making our holidays so great!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Good location close to medina but not too close. Private and personal. Average breakfast with average un interested service. Amine at front desk was amazing. Extremely helpful and efficient with bookings and recommendations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Idyllic getaway in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: This is the most idyllic hotel - an oasis of calm in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The gardens are tranquil and calm and so beautiful. The food was excellent. The staff were very helpful and really friendly. The room was stunning and really comfortable.  The only point I would like to make is that to make the hotel completely perfect it would be good to have a better gym - doesn‚Äôt need to be large just have a treadmill cross trainer rower and bike and some free weights kettle bells and exercise balls mats and a bench. I am a runner and as a woman (apart from the heat) couldn‚Äôt really safely go out and run. So a better gym would have been ideal. Just a suggestion to improve not a criticism.  My daughter and I had a fabulous stay here in what proved to be a perfect location for most of the sights. Nice touches such as the Friday night cocktail party and the live music and magician were great! Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Shane S wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Hidden wonders, excellent service, lovely features and bird filled gardens.
Review_Text: Behind a thck wodden door in a non descirpt street lies this hotel. Entry into a manned foyer - welcomed in by staff who are attentive. The design and layout excellent wth seating for meals with a view of the swimmingpool with fine plants tall trees magical birdsong and the sound of the fountain. I was taken as a 60th birthday treat by my daughter and due to the birthday we recieved a room upgrade with our own terrace and courtyard. Food was good though a bit pricey  Breakfast was help yourself options with also fresh cooked delights. nicely served and there was music in the evenings. recommend

Review_Date: Jacqueline B wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: A 200 year old riad built for a princess that is now a 5 star hotel. Lovely staff very friendly. This is a small character 5 star hotel with a beautiful garden pool and a restaurant serving good quality food. We had a very spacious room Sultan Suite with a large terrace on two sides of the room. Hotel was clean and in good order throughout all of our 7 night stay.    It is located just inside the medina walls and walking distance to the main square with some local shops and restaurants almost immediately on leaving the front door. Can highly recommend Les Jardins de la Medina.    Our Sultan suite was on the top floor (2nd floor) and can only be reached by stairs as a corner room it was large and bright with view of the pool and gardens. The very friendly staff will carry your luggage up and down for you.

My deaf mother and I spent a week in this hotel and from beginning to end the staff were more than helpful and kind towards us. They truly make you feel welcomed and looked after from the moment you arrive. Its the perfect place to retire after a day iut in the city and the spaceousness is so refreshing! The pool is beautiful with free refreshments brought around once or twice.  The menu in the restaraunt could do with some more vegetarian options and the breakfast buffet is also a bit.. lacking. But overall a truly beautiful space that we are so grateful to have been welcomed into by such special people üèµ

We travel more than I review and have stayed in Marrakech prior to this trip although not at this hotel. The horrible experience we had in this overrated misrepresented poorly staffed dark musty and moldy hotel cannot be overstated.  We arrived in the late morning for check-in and decided to indulge in a Hamman scrub and massages to relax. The cramped spa was beyond underwhelming and looked like an afterthought. This spa was empty that day and the availability for services not surprisingly was wide open for our entire planned 6-day stay. During the scrub the service provider poured water in my ear while rinsing my hair and gave me an earache as a token of the experience.  When we were finally shown to our room late afternoon it was down a long poorly lit dark hallway. I said to the guest services woman showing us to our room that I cannot stay in this room because I can smell the must & mold. I said that I have allergies and asthma and that she please needed to find us another room. After waiting a brief time we went back to the reception check-in/desk to explain our concerns again. Their solution at that time was to bring an incense burner to the room in an attempt to mask the smell. The hotel manager Mme Christine was onsite and because she was clearly not addressing this issue we emphasized to the front desk that we cannot stay in the room and to find us another room. We asked to speak with Mme Christine but apparently she was too busy to speak with us. We did not want to stay in the room hoping to move soon so decided to explore the rest of the dirty bird and turtle excrement filled grounds. I am an animal lover however being surrounded with excrement is not healthy or acceptable for anyone. There was no towel nor beverage service around the pool and the cramped dirty foliage-covered loungers did not induce a relaxing atmosphere. Not at all looking like their advertising photos. The hotel is filled with birds who will wake you up at 5am screeching like a scene from the movie the Birds. The grounds are worn dated dirty and a health hazard. The amenities are extremely limited and understaffed. Front desk/guest services staff are incompetent or undertrained and neglectful. Mme Christine was neglectful incompetent and overall shady with our situation.    We were tired from traveling and decided to stay at the hotel for dinner and also we were still anticipating a room change. Once again we went to the guest services desk and a man was there and he was aware of our situation but said he would get back to us after his break from fast because he was very hungry. I explained I was already beginning to feel asthmatic after the limited time in our room and that this room issue must be handled. Not surprisingly we did not hear back from him nor Mme Christine.    Fast forward I had a full-blown asthma attack that night  we had been beyond patient and were now very frustrated. We reached out to our travel agent and made alternative hotel accommodations for my health and before I ended up in the hospital.  The incompetent and neglectful hotel manager Mme Christine ( who has been there apparently for many years) came up to us just moments before our car service was to take us to the new hotel. It had been almost 24 hours since our arrival at this place and she and her staff had no sincere concern for my health. She finally made a patronizing weak attempt to offer a new room but she had hours that morning to do this and waited until she saw that we were packed ready to go in the lobby. Clearly she was just covering herself so she could say that she had attempted to give us a new room.  In summary; we were beyond patient and gave this hotel every opportunity possible. This hotel had no regard nor empathy towards my health or safety. This hotel clearly doesn‚Äôt care about making guests happy. We paid for all of our services and night in the hotel and we did not dispute this in any way. We incurred the expense of two hotels for the remaining 4 nights because Mme Christine covered her tracks by  stating that she had done everything possible to try and accommodate us.  This hotel fooled me with it‚Äôs advertising but take note from a seasoned traveler STAY AWAY from Les Jardins de la Medina because your health and money will be jeopardized!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel gardens were lovely service was okrooms were nice and the location was about a 15 minute walk from the square and Souks ...the reason why I booked it was the pool and that did not disappoint.We did not eat dinner there as we found prices a bit out of our reach ($Aud) but breakfast was just ok ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We asked the hotel if they could arrange transport for us from the airport as we had read earlier reviews and were uncertain we could find a taxi driver who could find it in the medina. The hotel arranged everything and we were met on arrival and that was the start of our fantastic stay here. Our room was very spacious with lots of windows and light and beautifully decorated. All of the previous reviewers who rave about the food here are right on the money We had all 3 meals a day here (in between wandering all over the place) and really loved every meal. The staff all spoke excellent English which is so comforting for us and were always friendly and so helpful. On one day the hotel arranged a guide for us to do a walking tour of the medina and Sahib our guide knew everywhere and just about everyone in Marrakech. The people in Marrakech are so friendly we even had a policeman come up to us in the new part of the city greet us when we asked for directions and told us that this was a safe city - it is true. We would definitely recommend this hotel and would definitely stay here if we ever visited again.

Review_Date: Guy R wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We came here as a couple for 6 days in August. This hotel is fantastic.    It's a tranquil haven in the bustling Medina. 15 minute taxi ride you arrive via the small streets to a low key tiny door. Once through the reception the hotel opens out into an Oasis. The hotel feels like a whole city block surrounding a beautiful garden with tall palm trees filled with birds.    The hotel has a large area for drinks a very large restaurant area with the option of inside or outside (canopy covered) seating. A beautiful pool spa seating areas on terraces and within the garden. They even have great little shop.    Our room was ideal a very comfortable bed and a separate seating area. Very quiet except for the birds chirping in the morning. A nice big shower. Tea coffee safe and TV. And importantly A/C which kept out the 40C heat.    Not only is the hotel luxurious but the staff are friendly and service immaculate. Drinks and snacks at the pool were speedily delivered with a large ice bucket the reception sorted taxis in seconds and the restaurant staff are a delight.    The hotel is 20 minute walk through the Medina to the main square or a 10 minute taxi which goes round the pedestrian zone.    We spent the day by the pool lunched at the hotel and then explored the souks and museums in the evening once things cooled down. Coming back to the sanctuary of the hotel for drinks or dinner was a delight.    Breakfast is delicious I'd recommend their freshly squeezed orange juice and omelettes. Lunch was our favourite meal as we shared a few moroccan specialities I'd recommend the prawns with pineapple rice. They have all the traditional moroccan options any dinner tangines couscous although their lamb cooked moroccan style stood out as a favourite. Some of the menu translations from French are a bit obscure.    They sell reasonably priced red white and rose moroccan wines by the glass half bottle or bottle.    The pool temperature is ideal with lots of seating. The sun loungers were grouped in 3's rather than pairs which was a bit odd as it left a lot of empty spaces reducing the capacity when the pool was busy. Although we never had a problem getting tow loungers.    The hotel has about 35 rooms which seems perfect as whilst it felt personal there were still plenty of people about for an atmosphere.There was fun mix of couples and families.    Great staff we'll definitely be returning.    I'd summarise this place as a luxurious boutique hotel with excellent service.

Excellent Indian food away from home. It is in a very nice location where the restaurant is located on the top floor with great views over Marrakech where the food was of great quality and taste. Food was prepared & served as per taste. Yummy

A perfect Oasis inside the extremely busy Medina of Marrakesh. Restful when needed yet central in Marrakesh and close enough to amenities and sites  Staff fantastic -attentive but not over the top  Food excellent- Moroccan but with a definite French influence/ideal.  Room to die for overlooking the pool.  Good sized Pool which I believe is the exception inside the Medina.  Air conditioning superb- best experienced anywhere- and a blessed relief when needed from the heat of Marrakesh  Based in the South of the Medina therefore a reasonable effort/decent walk needed(esp in the heat) to the Square but close to other attractions and Taxis not expensive but chaotic traffic  The stay COULD NOT HAVE BEEN NICER- felt like a longer break than the 4 days actually spent in a very pleasant way  SUPERB COULD NOT FAULT IT!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here with my son for a week this August. It is a quite charming location with good large clean rooms and great bathrooms. The pool and gardens were such a pleasant surprise and a great release from the busy city. The restaurant was good value for money for both lunch and dinner (we had breakfast included) with a good variety of dishes. However what really makes the place is the friendly efficient service from housekeeping through to the Assitant Director - they literally can‚Äôt do enough for you. Oh and if you are short on ideas of what to visit to where to eat the front desk were superb at organising things. If you want to stay in the M√©dina then just stay here
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Ian S wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: A lovely hotel in the heart of the kasbah
Review_Text: Never having been to Marrakech before we found the hotel to be in a location central to many of the places we wanted to visit. Taxi's are plentiful but we always enjoy walking as much as possible as this allows us to see things that others may miss.  The rooms and facilities at the hotel were very good but it was the friendliness and professionalism of the staff that impressed us the most.  The main attraction for us was the garden itself. A real oasis of calm in what could be a very busy and hectic medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Gem hidden in the old city of Medina: full of surprises
Review_Text: Booked this great lovely hotel because of its good review here. The hotel matches my expectation and is in a great location for visitors who wish to explore the heritage of this historical city. It is located within the Medina within walking distance to all historical landmarks. Typical for all Arabic cities Les Jardins is hidden in a maze of narrow lanes and alleyways. The entrance is to the hotel is hardly noticeable and once the little wooden door is opened it opens up to a new paradise which is in fact a small castle.  The room rate is considered high by Marrakech standard stayed there 5 nights in two types of suite. The sultan suite is highly recommended. The are about a handful of such suites located at the corners of this complex on upper floors. The suites are huge with separate living and bed rooms within sun-terrace/ balconies. The suite which I stayed cost about 250Euro per night including breakfast. Spread of breakfast is a bit limited but the hotel offers great dinner which although is great is relatively expensive by local standards when compared to similar restaurants around the 'Square' : Jemma el-Fnna.

We loved the location! The pool was very nice and helped us to escape the heat. The room was much bigger than we expected! The food was very good especially breakfast! The courtyard where the restaurant was located very nice!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: This location and hotel excellent the everything in the hotel was to the highest standard which made my anniversary one to remember. I could find no fault with the accommodation or the staff who were vey helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Awesome hotel needs few tweaks to give the very best to its guests. Touts who sadly were hotel staffs itself are responsible to give this grand hotel bad name as we witnessed ourselves. A bit more diligence in cleaning is also required.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A perfect surprise in the old town of Marrakesh
Review_Text: An amazing hotel hidden in the old town that you would not expect when you walk the street most friendly staff that are happy to help with anything you require greeted each time we came in and left the hotel and the room was just beautiful and prepared each day if required to look fresh and decorated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We traveled to Marrakech and wanted to stay in a Riad (guesthouse). I loved the architecture design of this Riad the bonus was the proximity to the Souks and local streets. Great spot to relax and chill out!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I came away for a long weekend with my mum to celebrate my 30th. It was a fantastic stay at the hotel was such a highlight. As we arrived we were greeted by a friendly concierge and a welcome drink on the terrace. They then shoed us to our rooms which were beautifully decorated quiet and equipped with air con.    As it was so hot we spent a ot of time by the pool. As sun seekers we found the one spot by the pool that managed to have the sun on it all day. The rest of the pool area was in shade. For me I prefer to sit in the sun but as it was so hot you could see why the pool was so shaded. It was very peaceful and relaxing to be able to have a dip in a cold pool after a busy day visiting the Souks.    The included breakfast buffet was fantastic; they had an egg station where a chef made omelettes scrambled eggs or fried eggs and there were pastries fruit and cereals to choose from. Lunch and dinner were not included but we had one lunch and one dinner there and both were fantastic.    Overall it was a brilliant stay and I would recommend it as you get to enjoy the hustle and bustle of Marrakech but then have a chance to escape that at this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Myself and two friend were staying at a riad not too far away but wanted a day of relaxation and to sit by a pool. We found a deal online for the relaxation day which was 650 moroccan dirhams roughly ¬£50. For this you got to sit by the pool all day with towels provided a two course lunch and a 50 minute full body massage. The lunch was amazing you can choose anything off the menu there was not set. I would highly recommend the lamb shoulder - it was the best thing I ate on my entire trip. I thought this deal was amazing value for money The hotel itself looked stunning and i'd like to go back to stay. The staff were so friendly and we really enjoyed the resident tortoises that wander past the sunbeds! Highly recommend for a relaxing day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility in the middle of Kasbah
Review_Text: We just came back from our holiday in Morocco where we stayed in this wonderful hotel. Honestly I don't think we could have made a better choice.  Building: it's a renovated very old building decorated with character and great taste.  Garden: an oasis of tranquility. Beautiful mix of trees and in the middle is the pool. Pool could have been a bit deeper though. (1.60 m was the deepest.) The garden makes a great environment to spend your day and is so calming when you're back from the very noisy city centre. The garden also attracts a lot of little birds which is lovely to hear their singing when you wake up.  Room: We had the Solarium room. The size was good the bed large and very comfortable the bathroom was big as well as the shower. The drain in the shower was quite easily blocked though. When we mentioned it was fixed in no time but a day after the problem occurred again. Not a big deal for us so we didn't mentioned it again. The room had big closets and an electronic safe. Also a nice shaded balcony and on top a private terrace with sunbeds and a view to the garden. Lastly they had some lovely little touches that made a difference like complimentary espresso capsules to use with the machine in our room. A bottle of water was also offered daily tonus for free along with a wicar basket to use around the pool. Moreover a hammock was available for the private terrace too.  Restaurant: breakfast was included and It was very nice. Ok not the best I ever had but it had many things and is difficult to find something bad to say. You could have your own personalized omelette they had variation of breads and pastries and fresh yogurt and juices. In the afternoon the snacks menu need some improvement I'd say as the options were quite limited. As for the restaurant it's quite expensive for what it offers. The ambiance in the garden next to the pool is lovely and our meals were nice but not as nice for that price.  Cleanliness: one word spotless everywhere. Well done! The cleaners are doing a very good job.  Spa: We used the spa facilities with my partner. Again not bad but for the price we payed nothing special. The hammam is not really a proper hammam with loads of steam and the massage we had was more of a gentle stroke (which felt pleasing I have to say) than a proper massage. And that's been said by someone who prefers it soft and not rougher.  Location: Amazing! At least for us is exactly what we wanted. It's located in the Kasbah area next to the royal palace. In general it's a beautiful area very close to the Kasbah mosque and the Saadian tombs (10' walking distance) full of local shops and restaurants where the locals are friendly smiley respectful and not pushy at all with the tourists.  Staff: Last but not least the staff. They were all exceptional. Very professional friendly attentive loads of smiles and all with good manners. Bravo!  In general we enjoyed every minute of our stay and we have already recommended the hotel to friends and family. The hotel offers a very romantic scenery from a couple perspective and the little touches (drinks and nibbles on the welcome) really made a difference for us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: In search of sunshine and relaxation
Review_Text: Our second visit to the region in 2 years. We love the place people warmth food and culture. This visit was part holiday and part of a search for home furnishings ideas. We came back with some beautiful things for our home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Penny L wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: When you are in the hotel it feels so relaxed and peaceful. The service from all the staff is second to none; courteous and friendly. Our room was on the first floor with a balcony with a lovely feeling of privacy. There were so many private places for sitting or relaxing and that is part of the charm.  The gardens are beautiful with many mature plants and the most amazing tall palms.  The pool is well kept. Breakfast was simple but well presented and the goats cheese delicious.  The Friday evening meet the staff was an unexpected touch and very pleasant.  Location we found was good as it was quiet in relation to many other in the Medina and a real treat your taxi could go right to the door.
