Excellent pick up service from the airport via the hotel and glad we contacted them to use it.  Thoroughly enjoyable and relaxing week.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent hotel. What an amazing place an oasis tucked away from the busy streets of marrakesh. Every member of staff from the cleaners to the management were helpful and smiling we can't wait to book again best holiday ever.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Les Jardins de la Medina is a lovely boutique hotel in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: There is much to write about this hotel. The location is very good close to the palace and it is like an oasis. The kitchen is superb ! The lady-chef does a great job !  The service is very friendly but in general with 2 exceptions the lady staff is a lot faster! Breakfast is fantastic. The drain of the shower in our room was not working well so I was a bit scared to fall as the floor gets easily slippery from the soap is the drain is not working well. The bathroom was a bit smelly maybe because of the same problem.  Drinks are expensive !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patrick P wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: This restaurant was highly recommended to us. We strolled through the warm Moroccan evening dodging cars and motorbikes while breathing their exhaust fumes.  The walk getting to and from the restaurant ended up being more exciting than the dining experience.    The restaurant hotel and setting looked good however the food that we were served...not so much.  One of the meal was taken off the bill as it wasn‚Äôt consumed so that kinda summed up the experience.    I think we probably had an off day dining experience as I truly think that wasn‚Äôt the norm. We didn‚Äôt stay too long but long enough to take a short look around and it seem a pretty nice place to both stay and to dine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Sarah M wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I stayed in this hotel with my husband when we visited Marrakech in June. It is a little oasis which you wouldn‚Äôt know was there behind a door in the wall. The hotel was beautiful with amazing gardens lovely pool and fantastic food. We had a very relaxing time. Also had a traditional hammam and massage at the hotel which I would definitely recommend. We found that the hotel was in a good location and enjoyed the walk to the main square although you do have to have your wits about you! All in all we had a wonderful holiday and would definitely stay here again.

Review_Date: The noodlidge wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: A tranquil oasis in a bustling town
Review_Text: The hotel is set around a beautiful riad of tropical orange and banana trees. Tortoises roam free and the staff are discreet yet attentive. Walking through the lobby into the beautiful surroundings is heavenly. Our room set in the tree tops hidden away in the corner of the hotel was peaceful and secluded. Air con and shutters provided comfort whilst sour rooms were spacious and very well appointed.  The restaurant was fantastic with excellent evening meals to a very high standard and quality buffets in the morning for breakfast. All staff were friendly and nothing was trouble for them. The spa provides luxury relaxation and would thoroughly recommend.    Overall 5+ stars we will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alyson e wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Title: An absolute gem of a hotel
Review_Text: This hotel is fabulous! I chose it because of its location in the the Medina- close to the Sadiaan Tombs Baha‚Äôi Palace and el Badi Palace and a short walk to the square. The staff were lovely and welcoming to me and my daughters breakfasts were delicious with a good selection of hot and cold food (buffet) the hotel was clean and the rooms beautifully decorated. The gardens are full of birds and well cared for. One through the door this is a tranquil spot away from the hubbub of the city. We had some light lunches as well all wonderful. Thank you for a wonderful stay a definite 5 star location.

Review_Date: Marco F. wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: I stayed in this small hotel when I visited Marrakech. It‚Äôs just perfect. A little piece of heaven to enjoy a relaxing stay. The gardens are beautiful with the pool in the middle. The rooms are big and nicely decorated. The food is excellent and the staff so kind and helpful. I loved every bit. I would go back anytime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah G wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: A member of staff led us to shop under false pretences where intimidated to buy not in uniform with apparent broken mo ped swimming pool had broken tiles breakfast service poor and charged for milk when none le  ft in foom
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent service and quality only recommendation would be to vary the food menu during the week the same menu everyday does not encourage you to eat there everyday other than that excellent stay and would reccomend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great Experience for a Great Price
Review_Text: The riad is very spacious has a very traditional Moroccan look and feel while having all of the modern amenities that you could want in the heat of Marakkesh. The food at the restaurant is excellent the drinks are a fair price and the staff is always aiming to please. I highly recommend getting a room with a terrace and roof deck as you can sleep under the stars in a provided hammock if you would like.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: "Les Jardins de la Medina a fantastic place"
Review_Text: From the moment my sister and I were picked up at the airport to the moment we were left a the airport our stay at Les Jardins de la Medina was fantastic. The staff the food the service the spa the tour guides the drivers were all excellent. The hotel grounds were soothing and beautifully cared and waking up to the sounds of birds singing was priceless.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richard L wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Dinner there last night. It was fabulous. Great Moroccan food with real depth of flavour and great ingredients. Attentive but unobtrusive service. Wine list simple but sufficient. Easy to find and get to. Can‚Äôt recommend enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The most beautiful hotel !!!! From the moment you walk through the door you are in the most beautiful space ... the gardens and pool are breathtaking  the staff are the loveliest most friendly people.  Nothing is too much trouble  everyone smiles and truly make you feel very special .  The food is to die for.. absolutely mouthwatering !  I have been to Marrakech before and I can say I would only stay at this hotel in the future.  Thank you for making it a truly special holiday !!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Excellent break at this lovely hotel. Attentive staff. Lovely gardens full of birdsong. Several tortoises to be seen. The restaurant is of the best quality. Our room was on the ground floor with a small seating area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sharon L wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: After experiencing the busy streets and wonderful sights of Marrakech stepping through the front door of this lovely hotel you are immediately transported in to a world of peace and tranquility. Our room was large the bed massive and very comfortable plenty of storage great shower and the air-conditioning was good and very welcome. We had a patio with table and chairs surrounded by beautiful well tended areas of trees and plants and quiet secluded paved areas for relaxation. The walls of the rooms are thick and sleep was so peaceful and quiet. The restaurant was very good with excellent service and was situated in the garden area by the pool. Breakfast was plentiful and excellent and lunch was good. Dinner was good but I think maybe a bit expensive. Cannot speak highly enough of this hotel and would definitely stay here again if in Marrakech. Would definitely recommend a room with patio in garden area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a really enjoyable stay in Marrakech not least due to the calm and tranquility provided by this hotel. It was great to escape from the hustle and bustle of this wonderful city and enjoy some relaxing moments in this well-situated hotel. The service was excellent from the attentive and friendly staff and the food was also very good. We had a garden room the most basic of the options but we needed nothing more. The facilites were very good and we found it to be clean and spacious with a small seating area outside which offered a pleasant way to soak up the early evening atmosphere as the temperatures dropped a little.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margot S wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I love the combination of Morocco and France you get when you stay at places like this - two countries for the price of one! This is a lovely hotel very efficiently run with gorgeous gardens nicely appointed rooms and bathrooms and very comfy beds. And just a bit French!  We had a hammam which was lovely and ate at the restaurant for dinner which was truly delicious. Our first breakfast was the best in Morocco but the second was dodgy as no-one was about to cook at the breakfast bar or keep the sparrows off the food and they were really digging in. However it was Ramadan and I think you've got to give a bit when everyone around you is just shattered and exhausted from almost of month of fasting.  I'd recommend this lovely Riad despite the second brekky as everything else including the lovely staff was terrific.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Daisy B wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: This was my second visit to the hotel but with a 10 year absence! My sister and I had the most fantastic stay and they did not disappoint. This is the perfect hotel for a city break but for those who still want to escape the buzz of the Medina. From the moment the door closes behind you there is a peace about the place only broken by the endless birds and rustling palm trees. We both had very nice rooms clean and quiet. The pool area does get quite busy but the top floor roof terrace is lovely and peaceful and has a shower if you need to cool off. We also visited the spa which was lovely. The only downside would be the level of service in the restaurant which can be quite slow. We were visiting during Ramadan so put this down to lethargy etc but it did seem quite chaotic with some diners around us being completely ignored for some time. If they could just get this element sorted as I have noticed other complaints of the same thing then it would be a completely faultless hotel. However if that is the only issue there really is nothing to complain about a truly relaxing escape and I cannot wait for another excuse to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: When we arrived we were taxied down the dusty tight streets of the Marrakech medina we wondered where we were going to end up. When we walked through the hotel doors in to the reception and guided in to the courtyard we were dumbstruck. It was beautiful. A tranquil oasis in the heart of the beautifully chaotic medina of Marrakesh. The greeting was fabulous and our room was wonderful. My only tip would be not to pre pay for breakfast as it‚Äôs not their strong point. You can pick this up down the road. The wine is Moroccan a far exceeds expectation and the rooms are kept beautifully. Thank you for a lovely honey moon. We WILL see you again. üôè
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice hotel in lovely location but needs attention to a few points
Review_Text: Nice quiet setting. Relaxing environment behind a wooden door on a side street. Shaded courtyard with trees and flowering shrubs. Resident tortoises are great to see. Hotel has a very French bias. English spoken well but primarily aimed at French market. Service was generally very good and friendly. Restaurant service a bit hit and miss in the evenings. One evening we waited 30 minutes for service so had to leave and complain. Veal curry on the menu was excellent though.  Biggest problem is pool side. We never managed to get a bed by the pool for the 4 days we were there. I understand the hotel is open to people staying in nearby accommodation for lunch and use of pool. This is not acceptable considering the cost of staying here.  The room we had was great; very comfy. It had outside table and chairs and roof top space with sun beds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Lovely setting for a romantic few days away. Food interesting and of very good quality.    We had a fantastic time.  Thanks to all staff for their helpful attitude at all times.  I would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wish I could stay longer. This is an absolute charming Riyad that brings the homey feeling when you are there. The room is a mix of modern and traditional design and pretty much accommodate everything you need while in Marrakech. Staff are genuinely friendly too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jean J wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Superb location and beautiful gardens. Facilities excellent.
Review_Text: Two items not so good. Our room was dark and the bathroom a little ‚Äúdated‚Äù. Also Did not think the restaurant was good value. The pool area and sun terrace very good and staff very willing to help and were friendly and courteous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was an amazing oasis to come back to at the end of a long hot day. The staff were friendly helpful and always attentive to our needs The hotel rooms and pool and gardens were beautiful. The food was delicious at both breakfast and dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Donna L P wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is an oasis in the bustling medina. Once you step though the doors the lush gardens welcome you to relax after a day jostling through the traffic and crowds. The roof-top sitting area is a great place to listen to the last calls to pray from the several near-by mosques. Attentive staff and lovely breakfast.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: It' s a great privilege To live a visit of this City of Marrakesh ! Frankly speaking I would like To mention a lot of places and areas in the City and even around like about 50kms away ( ImlilToubkal heights ....) ! To anyone who aims to travel and to discover a wonder place : Marrakesh is among the wonders of our little world.  Yours faithfullyzoubir.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Really lovely boutique hotel, a haven from the Medina!
Review_Text: Lovely boutique hotel peaceful and a haven from the medina. A lovely pool set in pretty tree filled gardens. Woke up to the wonderful sounds of birdsong and feelings of peacefulness. Very good Hamman ( would recommend) and lovely spa and treatment. Would definitely re visit the hotel. Nice restaurant as well.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel and its gardens the rooms the staff the food are really excellent.  A hotel that looks like an oasis in the middle of the old town ... a place to come back a thousand times.  Thanks Le Jardins de la Medina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Christian S wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: The Hotel is central located and just a few minutes away from the famous Djemaa el Fna. It has a beautiful garden and the rooms and the service are excellent. If you like a quit Hotel with a high level in the Medina Les Jardins de la Medina is the best.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Visit to Les Jardins de La Medina April 2019
Review_Text: Room : We had a solarium room with a very private terrace . It was large room and terrace with good amenities.  Food : Above average but definitely not outstanding  Service: Staff very helpful exceot lady at Front desk . Did not get her name as she was the only person without a badge so she might be owner / senior . Her attitude was strangely disengaged and distant with a couple of instances where she actually seemed a little angry with life .However you never know what is behind an individuals behaviours so there must be a reason ???  Gardens: Beautiful . A true oasis of calm and relaxation .  I would recommend the hotel primarily due to Gardens/Pool as you can genuinely relax plus very helpful bar and restaurant staff .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jill A wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is in a perfect location and the grounds itself are lovely. There is a lovely courtyard garden and a rooftop terrace with wonderful night views. The restaurant was fantastic. Our room was well appointed and the beds were comfortable. I would return to this hotel again and recommend it to others.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was our first stay in Marrakech and the hotel was a very good decision. The location is very well situated and the hotel with it‚Äôs wonderful garden is a small oasis. Only the quality of the breakfast and the service for coffee/tea should be improved.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We cannot praise the staff of Les Jardins enough. Without exception they were friendly attentive and willing to go out of their way to make our stay such an enjoyable one. The room we had was lovely with a balcony overlooking the garden and pool. The restaurant was excellent both for poolside lunches and evening dinners. The Hamman and massage were a pleasure. Given the bustle of Marrakesh outside it was a delight to return to such calm and efficiency. We hope to visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Honey moon recommend destination for morocco
Review_Text: Unlike normal hotel they treat honey moon seriously when you enter your room you will see roses every where and candle light all over the room very sweet and amazing experience and they also have singer while you are having your candle light dinner quite amazing experience. Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Milly G wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Hidden gem but beware of the local cockerel...
Review_Text: We had a very spacious and clean bedroom. It was warm enough to sunbathe around the swimming pool. Breakfast was lovely fresh fruit pancakes freshly squeezed orange juice english tea lots of options. Dinner was traditional and was followed by a wicked chocolate pudding... yummy!!! I would say that if you have a room with an exterior window (overlooking the street) you might be disturbed by a local cockerel...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A unique juwel in the medina
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay very much. Apart from the beautiful rooms with a nice balcony and sun terrace we were impressed by the hospitality in the hotel. In addition we hardly ever left the hotel for dinner as we enjoyed the delicious food. We will certainly come back again and have recommended the place already to our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Les Jardins! We only stayed for a few nights but wanted to stay linger as the place was so beautiful and relaxing! The room was amazing and the staff were very friendly and helpful. The Spa facilities were excellent and we had a wonderful Hammam massage and Reiki treatment. The hotel is also very well situated close to the Medina. Definitely want to return for a longer stay next time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 4 nights to de-stress and eat well..
Review_Text: I loved this place so much in 2015 I wanted to bring my husband to see why.  We had several issues which after reception not really addressing I spoke with the lady director who really is charming and listened I could list the issues but not about trashing a place that fundamentally is beautiful but is not 5 star!! The director kindly gave me a leg massage in the hotel a very nice gesture and I thank you. However it's not the best idea when addressing the issues to say look at all the reviews how people love the hotel. I did too.    Breakfast needs complete rethink dried bread cakes tinned fruit there is some fresh fruit it is really very poor for what is described as 5 star.. hard fruit. Day before leaving arrived for breakfast 9 40 9 55 there clearing round me I was rushed food taken away.    Its very expensive food is very very average at best!! The calm around is great it has lost something as I explained to the director the spa is lovely.    I am happy to pay for quality food and have during my stay in Marrakech. See further reviews.    I hope the hotel listen and implement change where it is needed you can only run on past successes for a short time.    I wish the director well with her clear following of people return to attention to detail you did it so well.    I have included a photo of just an example of breakfast someone this morning walked into breakfast and walked out saying how poor I saw this from my table.    As explained above this is not about running an establishment down it's about its directors looking and listening with an open mind.    Having spent time working within the Travel industry times are changing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christine A wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: One of the best hotels I have stayed at
Review_Text: Overall the experience of staying at this hotel was impeccable. Friendly staff very clean rooms and facilities quiet and relaxing for a unique getaway! You forget that you are in the middle of the city. Also the spa was excellent providing with one of the best massages I have had.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A most enjoyable stay in a friendly and professionally run hotel. Excellent meals well prepared and presented Bedrooms comfortable (although personally would have preffered a softer mattress) and appreciated the balcony and also the roof top sun terrace Cleanliness as elsewhere in the hotel excellent. A calm oasis after exploring a busy Marrakech. Look forward to a return visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location 20 min walk from Djemaa El-Fna square. A haven to return to after a day in the city. Lots of peaceful areas to relax in the beautiful gardens or on the roof top terrace. Would recommend upgrading to a room with a balcony.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for five nights and were very well looked after. Staff were excellent and the food was very good. The room was well equipped and comfortable. Hotel perhaps a bit out of the central area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is delightful and we got a great welcome. I very much enjoyed the nightly performances on the oud in the dining area. the room was fine but we were sorry it was not possible to keep the windows open at night as they would not have been secure. the room was consequently rather hot. somehow I didn't find the pool inviting though I love to swim as it was rather shady.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have just returned from this lovely hotel. Staff are attentive friendly full of smiles and happy to accomodate any request. They acted without even being asked when our transfer taxi was late by calling and sorting it out for us eventhough it had not been arranged by them.The location is about a 15-20 minute walk from Djemma el fna if you're not in a rush. The surrounding area is real Marrakech with every type of trade and business you could imagine so you are 'really' in the city which we loved. The hotel itself is an oasis in comparison to the attack on the senses that Marrakech will give you. Great pool area shaded quiet spots well appointed quiet rooms and a large bottle of mineral water was supplied every day. Good choice of continental breakfast and omlettes made to order. Restaurant food was good also but you can venture out to eat only a few minutes away. We didnt use the spa. We were there to celebrate a special occasion and this hotel certainly made it special by giving us complimentary champagne on arrival and upgrading our room to the solarium. Fantastic go to this hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have just returned from this wonderful converted riad set amongst beautiful gardens. It is truly an oasis of calm and tranquility where no request to the staff is too much trouble. The food is absolutely fabulous as are the spa treatments. I would recommend this hotel unreservedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Julia M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Everything is perfect  wonderful staff beautiful tranquil gardens lovely rooms. Great position in the Kasbah .Marrakesh is fascinating and hectic so to return to the calm of Les Jardins was bliss.Highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was a really nice hotel to return to at the end of the day. It felt like an oasis. We liked the food at breakfast & dinner and the service. The pool was great (crucial when traveling with kids). The room was very pretty -- the beds were comfortable and the rooms were quiet at night. Great water/water pressure and products. I ended up buying the pillow spray -- so lovely! The location seems safe enough but at night it did feel a little bit too far from the restaurants we wanted to visit so we took taxis (the hotel called for us). We were VERY bothered by the air quality in the Medina which is not the hotel's fault obviously. I do think if we returned to Marrakech we would stay outside the Medina to have better air and just swoop in and out by taxi for sightseeing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Joanna E wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Everything is 100% about this lovely hotel. Fabulous rooms and garden and heated pool. Lovely staff. Relaxing garden. Great location walkable to main square. Bottled water provided in the rooms and lots of other nice touches. The restaurant is lovely but high end - their are other options nearby if you prefer something more casual.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The perfect location for a family trip with people of various ages - beautiful large rooms heated pool (which our 8 year old loved) gardens and lovely restaurant for when we didn't want to go out at night. You can enjoy the hotel when you come back from exploring Marrakech. The market area is a nice walk away - with plenty to see on the way. Perfect location for anyone looking for a place to relax and enjoy Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An oasis in the Kashba of Marrakech
Review_Text: A lovely hotel&garden with very friendly staff and atmosphere. They have their own spa: hamam and massage: wonderful! Staff also very helpful with making reservations and organizing taxi's; they even have an electric TukTuk waiting for you. I would certainly recommend this hotel to others.  Not for familys with small children.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I liked every thing! Especially the room with our own Terrasse on the roof also the fantastic restaurant there was no need to go out after a long exciting day and search for a place to have dinner! The beautiful garden peaceful atmosphere and lovely pool. I also appreciated the wonderful treatments (massages and hammam
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: I would recommend this hotel 100 percent. We are just back from 5 nights there. We were in room 120 with a balcony overlooking the pool. The room was lovely as was the whole hotel. The staff are so friendly and efficient especially in the restaurant where we ate every evening. The food was delicious; we ate Morrocan dishes and especially recommend the pastilla and tangia. The service was exceptional. We will definitely return to this fabulous hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Very good value in the Medina
Review_Text: We found everything to our satisfaction. Particularly helpful were the staff on reception in the dining room. The room was always kept very clean and the cleaning staff unobtrusive but efficient. The garden and other amenities are excellent. The only real problem is location. The approach to the hotel from the town centre is by way of a long street which is chaotic and at least when we were there heavily polluted by traffic fumes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a very well organized hotel and at a great location. Lovely staff who will help with everything you might need. The garden is beautiful and the pool is heated and clean. We felt safe and well taken care of at all times. A very recommendable place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Amazing !!! You live like 50 years ago !! Calm relax take care your self  listem birds  nature  a special energy around  you contact your soul  find your self  answer you question  be happy for what who you are !!!  Roberto
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David R wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: We had a very enjoyable stay. The staff were friendly the garden is beautiful and we had a very nice room opening onto the garden. The pool was warm enough to swim in even in February. The breakfast choice was very good. We also ate dinner at the hotel a few times - the food was excellent and well-presented. The location was also good close the some of the main tourist sights around the Kasbah area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Super hotel within the medina walls
Review_Text: We stayed here for a week in February. Lovely rooms lovely gardens lovely pool. We had a room with balcony overlooking the pool. Temps were in the low 20s which was fine for time of year. Breakfasts were super. We ate once in the restaurant and twice in the courtyard. Taxis are cheap and we took one to the YSL museum and gardens next door. We also took two trips one of Ouzoud waterfalls (worth it) and to Essaouria on the Atlantic Coast (worth it too).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Thank you so much to all of you! It was a very comfortable cozy clean and always friendly stay. Keep it like that :) After having a lot of noises outside the streets and coming home after sightseeing everything was just quiet only warm lights and birds. Thank you <3
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful spacious riad with lovely rooms. A very nice heated pool set in lovely gardens. The staff were unfailingly polite and helpful and we really could not have asked for more. Will definitely be returning maybe slightly later in the year when it is a little warmer. Most days were 22C by early afternoon but early morning and evening can get a bit chilly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A comfortable hotel with welcoming staff. Our room was well equipped and being on the ground floor opened out to the pool and relaxing garden. The hotel only has 38 apartments so never felt crowded. Perfect location for see the sights of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the best location for exploring the market
Review_Text: Great hotel. Walk to the main square easily. Lovely staff two pools and beautiful spacious rooms. The housekeeping staff and those in charge of flowers in the hotel and guest rooms are exceptional. The Moroccan restaurant was great. I would have loved to try the Indian or French restaurant there after many nights of Moroccan food but they were both empty - no atmosphere. The staff were welcoming and excellent.

The hotel has a nice garden and nice rooms. Very nice terrace for sun bathing. The breakfast did not meet our expectations -> to many people - not enough tables orange juice and coffee machine not working fast enough long wait for fried eggs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a Room Solarium for one week the room was fabolous and our Solarium upstairs wonderful to have a rest in the sun. We had not much time to lay down at the nice pool in the middle of a dream garden with orange trees and bananas and..........because Marrakesch was so fantastic to explore. But we hope to come back for a longer time in 2020 so we can relax at the pool and have a nice Hammamm and explore the Medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have visited Marrakech three times and stayed in this hotel twice. I like it because it is unique; the rooms are all individual little havens with their own character and the service is personal and top notch. The food is good and the spa services are excellent. And let's not forget the location - so much better than the luxury hotels that are located outside of town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A piece of heaven a magical garden great rooms and service. Great place. Location is closed to all but environment is not that great in that part of Marrakech. Medina felt better. Overall though this is a great choice. We couldn‚Äôt have been treated better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicolai T wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Very kind personal beautiful garden and relaxing riad like you expect it in Marrakech. Heated pool and complete breakfast. Our room was clean unfortunately a bit dark but you should spend your time outside. Fireplace was not working as well as expected all the rest was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Natt S wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Very nice place to stay so peaceful ! Very kind staff exCellent location and amazing room ! So nice to enjoy a cup of tea in the patio. We really enjoyed our stay there. Definitively a 5 star rating
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lin D wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: Overall experience was good. Great location in the old town. Reception was cordial service was efficient except for the breakfast omlette chef who was rude to us but polite to the white European patrons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Catherine M wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Fabulous Riad, Close to main attractions
Review_Text: This is a fabulous hotel gives you an authentic flavour of Marrakech what sets it apart are the excellent staff who ensure you have a memorable stay from the warm welcome at reception to the dining room and bar staff all great.The rooms are very comfortable lovely soft towels and pillows. Memorable food in the dining room with musical accompaniment lovely place for an evening meal and breakfast is great we loved the selection especially the omelettes. This Riad is very well situated to see all the sights and only 15 minute walk from the main square. We highly recommend our guide Mohamed the Riad organised this and he was very knowledgable and steered us in the right direction we very much enjoyed his company.The hamman and spa treatments are great and I recommend the black soap and scrub and massage really good.We will definitely return to this lovely place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Our visit to your Riad was a wonderful experience for my wife and I the peace and tranquillity was in deep contrast to the hectic pace of life in the Medina which was also a great experience.The room and gardens were beautiful and the staff friendly helpful and attentive and we would most certainly visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Robert B wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Only spent one night but wished we had another day or two in this hotel. Great service from check-in to check-out. Beautiful gardens inside compound to walk through and enjoy. Rooms were very comfortable and ours even had a wood burning fireplace in the room. Nothing like a crackling fire in the evening inside your room with the cool weather outside.    Very nice quaint restaurant ... the food was beautifully presented and delicious.    Would definitely return on my next visit and highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennie L wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: A haven amongst the bustling and fascinating streets of the Kasbah
Review_Text: A fabulous place to stay. Set in the heart of the Kasbah's narrow red ochre streets you would not know that behind the dull red wall there's a large garden with a variety of palms cacti orange trees and flowering plants with a heated swimming pool several small shady seating areas and an outdoor gym all sheltered by foliage. An oasis of peace and calm. And there's a roof terrace too beautifully furnished a sun trap with shaded sections and sun beds for sun lovers - and views of the Atlas mountains and the rooftops of Marrakech..    A smart restaurant with high ceilings and elegant lighting provided some excellent meals - chicken with preserved lemons and the traditional harira the local soup particularly stood out.    There's a small bar with an open fire - perfect for those cold evenings when you get back from a day's sightseeing - and there's an 'open air' room surrounded by curtains in the colder weather where you can eat in the evenings or take breakfast.    Breakfasts were an experience - a wide range of cold and hot foods ranging from an impressive selection of dried fruits to breakfast tagines; omelettes were made on the spot and there's a good selection of breads and pastries plus cold meats cheeses - the local; goats cheese is particularly delicious as is the sweet yoghurt cereal jams and preserves.    Service was generally very good; there were a couple of hiccoughs (sometimes a long wait for coffee in the mornings and the hot plates weren't always working; talk about first world problems.......) but we enjoyed every breakfast we had and looked forward to it each morning.    Our room on the ground floor was delightful - cosy with the shutters closed on cold nights (in addition to the radiator and marvellously hot towel rail there was some sort of underfloor heating) and light and airy with the windows and shutters open looking out onto the gardens; we had a small terrace which could be curtained off if you wanted complete privacy (the foliage was enough for us). The bed was on a raised area with intricate plasterwork on the ceiling and a firm comfortable bed. Our room (Room? We had a lounge area a bedroom and a bathroom - that's 3) was kept spotlessly clean and we loved the little touches - the rose petals the scented pillows the weather forecast for the following day delivered in the evenings. The cleaners were thorough and discreet - and very friendly when you occasionally bumped into one of them.    The staff were great - those on Reception were very helpful and informative and will organise anything you need. All staff were discreet and polite and if you're warm and friendly towards them they respond in kind.    And don't miss out on the hammam. It was a wonderful experience to have the steam scrub and treatment - and I had a facial as well; both were lovely and well worth the price. Staff were charming.    We can't do this lovely ryad justice - it was a unique experience. Luxury. And we're not used to that. It's all very well designed and well run. I think we shall be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nimet Y wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: I never felt at home like this in a hotel. Very friendly staff.Good breakfast. Beautiful garden. Nice and clean room. Good wifi. Good location. We enjyed our stay. If I will come back to Marrakech I wil come back to LJdlM.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Soph Morgan TV wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This was my second stay in this BEAUTIFUL hotel and yet again it did not disappoint. I use a wheelchair and they could not have been more accommodating for my needs. Thank you so much. The hotel itself is utterly beautiful it's lined with orange trees and the pool is stunning. We got the sun and had a swim - in January! The staff are so lovely and the restaurant totally fab. To be honest it's faultless in my opinion. We look forward to coming again soon! Thank you x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Oasis of tranquility in a boutique hotel with beautiful gardens and all just a stroll from the sights and mayhem of Marrakech. Helpful and polite staff. We particularly enjoyed the rooftop terrace ...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Bathroom was not cleanDrinks en food very expensive.It is a beautyful gardena beautyful Hotel.The swimmingpool was nice and warmto muts chemicals.But still we had a lovely holiday. Maybe we wil come again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This must be as good as it gets.Utterly delightful and kind staff beautiful setting ridiculously generous breakfasts glorious sun terrace with views of the Atlas mountains. You would have to be a misanthrope not to love this!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: So pleased to stay at Les Jardins again
Review_Text: We‚Äôve been lucky to visit Les Jardins a few times abs it is always a pleasure. We get a lovely welcome from all the staff delicious food and beautiful gardens. From the taxi pickup from the airport to the trip along the Ourika valley it feels like we are welcomed into the family and nothing is too much trouble. The rooms are large and beautifully furnished and the restaurant menu has plenty of fresh local dishes we enjoy. Les Sens de Marrakech toiletries are much appreciated and we can‚Äôt wait to come back next year
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Visited for a birthday meal. This establishment has an 'old colonial' air to it with very formal service. Lovely dining room with huge pierced metal ceiling lamps making it very atmospheric.    I would say the menu is more French with a Moroccan twist that Moroccan with a French twist but all the dishes we had were tasty and beautifully presented. Compared to other restaurants in Marrakech the rices are upmarket but I guess these are in line with the level of establishment.    Had a very pleasant evening and a good dining experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A lovely place but a limited menu
Review_Text: Les Jardins is a lovely place with beautiful gardens and very good rooms. The downside is the situation in the far south of the Medina which meant long walks to find somewhere else to eat since the menu at the hotel was very limited. It was the same dinner menu for a week and with only three starters and four mains and with low quality one needed to go out for dinner.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff S wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Staff was very helpful ambiance was great room was good location for those who prefer medina authenticity over Four Seasons type location - new medina. No complaints at all........thoroughly enjoyed....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: hospitality reception and the environment of the hotel is nice quiet and clean just feel like at home you could get a good sleep quality. And it‚Äôs convenient as well if you want to go around the city~nice view
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Very relaxing and beautiful environment with all the amenities you could possibly imagine. Tasteful decoration everywhere. Beautiful garden and roof top terrace with multiple areas for relaxing and free towels. Spa is impeccable. Very friendly and understanding staff with a personal feeling to the service and above that fair prices. The restaurant however is the most outstanding I have ever experienced. I had 3 meals every day during my 1 week stay and had absolutely no complaints whatsoever. Michelin should pay this restaurant a visit! Over all it has been absolutely exquisit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Wonderful! All the charm of a riad with the facilities of a larger hotel
Review_Text: This is a lovely place to stay small enough to feel friendly and cosy but large enough to have a swimming pool and gardens. Great restaurant with amazing food. Very relaxing place to stay. Lovely staff are very welcoming and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina lies at the southern end of the oldest part (Kasbah) of the Medina (old city) of Marrakech. A simple brisk 15 minute walk all on the flat through busy streets alive with locals and tourists alike (the former on foot bicycles scooters donkey carts horse drawn carriages and in cars) gets you to the Jamaa el Fna the Medina‚Äôs mesmeric main square. (A longer hours walk got us to the rightly much vaunted Jardins Majorelle).    The hotel a former minors royal palace is clean and well presented if not luxurious with always a warm and welcoming and polite ‚ÄòBonjour‚Äô/‚ÄòBonsoir‚Äô from the friendly staff. For Marrakech the USP compared to a more traditional Riad is the mature garden and outdoor pool which provide a peaceful oasis of calm especially welcome after the assault on the senses engendered in walking through the souks.    Our afternoon snack and evening meal were fabulously tasty and well-presented. ‚ÄòVegetables on toast‚Äô elevated to another level of freshness and delicate taste. Our tagines (beef and seafood) were well-cooked hearty and enjoyable. Prices were above average hotel-level. Breakfast was buffet style with an egg-station mix of pastries dried fruits local dish (e.g. eggs Marocaine lentils and sausages etc.) breads cold meats and cheeses etc.    The room we chose had a private sun-terrace and despite it being in November in between light showers we enjoyed a few hours relaxing in 21degrees or so of warming watery sunshine mainly in the afternoons.    The bathroom was all-in-one clean and tidy without being ‚Äòsuper-glossy‚Äô. (A slightly cracked toilet seat was replaced with a new soft-close replacement before we had reported it).    Unlike all the restaurants we visited the hotel served wine and beer both to a good standard.    We arranged a tour guide for half a day through the hotel which was a good call in so far as the visits we made to the Saadiens Tombs and Bahia Palace as neither attractions had any explanations which our guide was able to compensate for knowledgable and engagingly. Less good were the rug and herbaliste stops where the expectation (and a degree of pressure in the former) to buy felt uncomfortable.    All in all we thoroughly enjoyed our stay - well looked after and within comfortable walking distance of the crazy Jamaa el Fna souks restaurants and main attractions.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed 5 nights - really an excellent experience! Staff always friendly and helpful - from initial welcome to helping arrange taxis (at desired time and pre-agreed sensible price). Very good location - very easy to find (important at night after being out). Easy walk from hotel through medina streets to the main sights. In my opinion far better to be in media rather than in large hotels farther away. Rooms well designed and maintained. Ate at hotel restaurant one evening and it was the best meal of the visit. Hotel designed in Morocco riad style with great atmosphere. After 4 days of heavy sightseeing spent last day relaxing around hotel - so peaceful and calm. Highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice and cosy but be careful of your personal belongings
Review_Text: I recently stayed in the Riad of Les Jardines de la Medina together with my family for 4 nights. We all highly enjoyed the time in this beautiful place and the cosy atmosphere you would not expect in this area of the Medina.    Unfortunately after we have left this hotel to continue our journey through Morocco we noticed that several personal belongings in our luggage are missing. First we thought that we may have forgotten some of these items already at home but after a while we started to realize that these items have been all with us during our stay in Marrakesh and apparently must have been removed during our stay from our rooms in the Les Jardins de la Medina. Although these items (male and female clothes as well as baby clothes and toys) were luckily not very expensive (roughly EUR 120 in total) we are very disappointed about this situation as this never happened to us on any other journey before and we also would have not expected this to happen in a hotel like the Les Jardins de la Medina.    Back home we have informed both our travel agency as well as the hotel about this situation. Not surprisingly the hotel management replied that the started to search for your missing items but could not find them. Now 3 weeks later there have not been any news. I therefore suppose our items will never appear again and can deem as been stolen.    Like I said at the beginning we really liked our stay in this hotel and would have recommended the Les Jardin de la Medina to our friends and families as well as to our travel agency without any restrictions. But sadly in the light of the aforementioned experiences we have serious doubts of doing so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jacqui G wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Last stop on a long vacation
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay in Les Jardins We were tired after a long six week vacation and the room had everything we loved a great bathroom a hair dryer that worked and a big comfy bed The hotel has a beautiful garden and pool and is surrounded by the Medina A bit of an oasis after a hectic day out  the Staff were great and very friendly We enjoyed talking with Nadia at breakfast  The resident tortoise almost came home with me in Australia!  Can‚Äôt wait to visit again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful hotel within the medina walls. when you enter you feel relaxed and away from the hubub. Close to the Souks and the main tourist desitnations. Rooms are well appointed and there is a swimming pool
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: High price for not superior service and facilities
Review_Text: Superior price for not superior service and facilities - would not recommend this hotel for the charged price. - no room service although requested- great idea for perfumed pillows but no / late actually doing so- minibar war not cooling despite request to repair ("it is slowly cooling down") but charging superior minibar prices- located near medina but in a really poor and partly intimidating area - waiter broke the cork of the wine bottle forgot pen mixed-up meals generally not a superior / professional service- small room for that price- first was offered to change room next day if available but never again heard from that again- generally charging much too much for not superior 5-star-class services and for old not well maintained facilities / rooms
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Riad in heart of Medina
Review_Text: Gorgeous Riad and we had such a nice time. I was on a trip with my sister and wanted a riad with an outdoor pool a spa and within walking distance to the souk. This ticked all the boxes and was a beautiful oasis with a great restaurant and lovely rooms. We had a hammam and massage in the spa which was bliss and really enjoyed a dinner and the breakfast each morning. The location is great as it‚Äôs a gentle 15 minute walk to the souk. On the way you pass a huge emporium with literally thousands of rugs so we were able to buy lots of stuff there and easily carry it back. I‚Äôd definitely return and recommend no complaints!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: MM Sandhurst wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Romantic Stay in a beautiful Riad within the Medina
Review_Text: We were really impressed with the riad once we had entered from the street. The reception area is cool and welcoming and it then opens out into a beautiful large garden full of palms and fruit trees at the centre of which was a heated swimming pool.The rooms surround the central garden and we were upgraded to a sunny room overlooking the pool. It had its own side terrace with table and chairs then a stairway to a private roof-terrace. The double bed was enormous and comfortable and the bathroom was immaculate and well laid out. There was a large walk-in shower area. Sheets and towels were changed daily unless you indicated that you did not require a change just a remake - very green.We stayed on a B&B basis. Breakfast was a comprehensive buffet with an egg chef to prepare omelettes etc. We had one lunch in and two dinners in our 5 day stay. The food quality was excellent predominantly authentic Moroccan dishes. many of the were very sweet to our taste and we didn't encounter any spicy dishes which we were expecting. Food service was exemplary.Service from Reception was also of the highest quality - nothing too much trouble to arrange.Our only minor niggle was very low water pressure from our bathroom sink (which was partly repaired after reporting it) and a slow-draining shower trap (Room 107).If we came to Marrakech again we would definitely return to this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We really enjoyed our stay. The riad was beautiful we wished we stayed more than two nights. Friendly and helpful staff that dealt with our many questions and requests from three adults two teenagers and two little ones. Good food in the restaurant with a cozy fire to take out the November chill. Spa treatment was also a plus.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a wonderful place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The grounds are spacious and attractive with lots of places to sit and relax. The pool is a nice temperature. Our room was very cosy and well appointed - it was nice to have a coffee maker. Best of all is the food - beautifully presented and full of flavour. Staff are smart helpful and very friendly. I would also recommend the hammam - I felt revitalised after the 50 minute session!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nice Rooms just had smelled a bit musty and street view was ab bit loud in the evening good Location selection of Beakfast could be better  very good Restaurant with excellent service. But Overall a good Hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel was fantasticthe staff lovely and very helpful nothing was ever too much trouble.The accommodation was superb the gardens delightful and it was an absolute pleasure to stay in this oasis of calm in Marrakesh.We would highly recommend Les Jardins de la Medina .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is an amazing place with friendly staff. Selection of delicious vegetarian dishes and a therapeutic peaceful place to unwind. Extremely quiet with a very nice pool. Would surely visit again.The hotel rooms are lovely and you will hear the Birds Chirping and Singing

We've spent 4 nights at this wonderful hotel in the Medina. You'd never expect such a peaceful green beautiful and quite place in the Medina. Hotel staff extremely friendly and helpful service and food great especially the breakfast nice big and clean pool all in all paradise on Earth. Definitely worth a stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Yvonne C wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Title: Another lovely holiday in this little bit of paradise
Review_Text: Thank you for another lovely holiday at Les Jardins de la M√©dina. It is lovely to arrive and just feel so relaxed. The room as usual was lovely with an amazingly big bathroom. The outside seating area was a little dark due to the weather but I am sure would be a cool haven from the hot sun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A fabulous place to stay in Marrakech. We found Bar and restaurant staff were mostly quite reluctant to help. Apart from that a wonderful hotel and retreat in the midst of the frenzy that is Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a charming oasis well located a short distance from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. The food is good though you can eat more reasonably in town of course. I would highly recommend a 2 or 3 night stay here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I highly recommend les jardins de la Medina. :) food excellent staff very kind beautiful little garden.The SPA is perfect after a trip in the desert and again staff very kind. the location is very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Wonderful place to stay.We so enjoyed our time with you and all the staff that made us feel so welcome. I hope others will take advantage when visiting Morocco. We are pleased to give this our highest recommendation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Only reason I am giving 4 stars is because of the issues with wifi. Wifi was extremely slow basically like having no wifi at all. Beside the issue with wifi the hotel was great. Service was awesome and i absoloutely loved the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We very much enjoyed our stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. The rooms and grounds are lovely; the gardens in particular are wonderfully soothing and restorative after a day surrounded by the bustle of the city. Service was attentive and gracious. We enjoyed the location in the Kasbah -- a bit of a walk to the center of action (15 minutes or so) but in exchange we were able to stay in a location accessible by car. Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: friendly and helpful staff great location  nice pool and sun bathing area set in lovely garden would stay at this hotel again breakfast was good and had lunch in garden a couple of time which was also good
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A wonderful oasis in crazy Marrakech. Beautiful surroundings with a lovely pool - even a small gym under a canopy in the gardens. Helpful staff and a delicious and extensive breakfast. Great spa. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: James D wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Fantastic and friendly feel of Marrakech
Review_Text: What a great place. Rooms are great staff so friendly and a heavenly garden in the hustle and bustle of the city and only a short walk from the main market through the small streets of the city. Just loved it!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carol C wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: A perfect place for romance and to let go of life's stresses. Stunning surroundings with lots of peaceful places to just relax read or snooze. Staff are friendly food is great quality and rooms are both charming and very comfortable. Was greeted with lovely display of rose petals every day and the room was kept immaculately clean and fresh. Special mention for Hanna? who looked after us so well during our stay. There are however a few suggestions I would like to make. Firstly replace the dusty fake flowers on the dining tables with real ones. Secondly change the menu more often. Finally have more sunloungers and towels at busy times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison F wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful sanctuary in the bustling heart of Marrakesh
Review_Text: The staff are friendly and attentive. The hotel has lots of sweet little features. We even found a tiny tortoise in the garden by the pool! It is based in the wall of the old town in an interesting street. Felt safe walking around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for a few nights back in September 2016. Lovely grounds nice rooms and good breakfast. Really good for price paid. We did have an invasion of ants in our room but that was because someone had dropped a sweet under the bed which must have been missed by cleaners! We sorted it out so nothing to worry about. Really good staff and security. Taxi into main area for restaurants / markets wasn‚Äôt much or far.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Susan G wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful property with a few service issues
Review_Text: This is a beautiful property with a stunning pool area and garden. However there are a few service issues.    A transport from the airport was included in the price of our room and they asked for our flight information on booking. However on arrival to Marrakesh there was no one at the airport with a sign saying "Les Jardins de la Medina" as promised. It took several calls to the hotel (quite expensive on my international plan) to get this straightened out and finally a driver from another tour company came to collect us. Upon arrival at the hotel there was no apology just a little shrug and comment that it was a "communication problem".    Just a warning that while many photos of the rooms show that they have outdoor terraces and balconies ours did not even though we had booked one of the more expensive rooms. It was large but when we asked about a room with an outdoor space we were told that they did not have one in the same category as the one we had booked. We had further issues with the room when there was an unusually heavy rainstorm that evening. Water was pouring in through the ceiling above the windows and under the door flooding our entire room. We called the front desk and they sent a woman from the housekeeping who did some cursory sweeping and mopping and then left while the water was still pouring in the room. We had to get all the bath towels and clean up the mess ourselves and try to stop the flow of water under the door. Then we called to the front desk again to request more towels. The same housekeeper came back with a bad attitude scolding us for using so many towels. We talked to the manager about the incident the following day. She just shrugged and said "What can we do? It's an old building". It's not their fault that it rained but really we shouldn't have to be mopping the floor ourselves in a hotel of this level.    Earlier in the day this same housekeeper and come into our room without knocking while I was in the bathroom. I thought my husband had come into the room and called out several times. She didn't answer and I was quite startled to walk out of the bathroom half-dressed and find her in the room doing the turn-down service (at only 3 in the afternoon). I expressed a little shock that she had not knocked and asked her to come back a little later. She had a bad attitude and left never finishing the turn-down service. In fact the turn-down was never done again for the 3 days that we were there even though at check-in they make a big show of having you smell 3 different scents and telling you that your sheets will be sprayed each night with the one you prefer.    They did really try with a little manager's reception one night were were there. Free drinks and appetizers were served in the beautiful garden with live music. They noticed that it was my husband's birthday and surprised us with singing and a plate of desert which was a nice gesture. However after we ate in the restaurant that night my husband became sick and that kind of ruined the last day of our vacation.    Also this hotel is a good 25 minute walk from the Djemaa el Fna the main square. It is quiet and peacefully located but if you want to be closer to the action this is not the place for you.    So in conclusion the property is beautiful. You should ask specifically for a room with an outdoor seating area. The management could work on being a little more courteous to guests when issues arise. Also I think is is wise to be careful of what food (particularly meat) you eat throughout Morocco even when the restaurant seems to be quite upscale and the restaurant at Les Jardins is no exception.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne-Marie C wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: Great Hotel and most of the staff very friendly.
Review_Text: I would have given this hotel an excellent however we had a couple of small issues as below therefore I would rate it as good not very good but definitely not average;  1. The room smelt of sewage on and off - Seemed to be ok if the air-conditioning and fan was turned off.  2. I Had a brand new black bottle of Channel Noir that went down to half a bottle in a couple of days and chunks of chocolate were taken from our room - In future I will always put my good perfume in the safe.    We did bring these issues up with reception within a couple of days of our stay but nothing was actually done. On checkout we were greeted with a bill for daily taxes for about ¬£50 for three of us. I queried this with the receptionist as we had not been made aware of this charge when we checking in. He was very rude and when showed us the small text on the holiday voucher it was suggested that we did know about this fee an that we were lying. The lady receptionist with him was very understanding and when my husband brought up the few above matters we had complained about she decided to get the manager. The manager was very understanding and upset that nothing had been sorted out with our room as she was well aware of the issues and offered us small gifts and an upgrade if we ever returned she also got the male recepitionst to apologise. Please note that he was not the normal receptionist through out our stay and the other 2 regular receptionists (one male & female) were both lovely and helpful including the rest of the hotel staff.    My husbands mum also came on holiday with us and her room was a wow factor and she had no problems at all so maybe we were just unlucky and we would consider going back. The food in the restaurant was amazing especially the Lamb chops in-fact we loved all the Riads in Marrakesh and we are looking forwards to returning in the future.

Review_Date: Kara R wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for a few nights back and forth between Barcelona.  A sweet driver met us at the airport and took us to the hotel. The staff that checked us in was lovely....and we arrived at 2 in the morning!I loved our room!! It was spacious with a sitting area king-size bed and a huge bathroom. The decor was authentic and beautiful!  The pool and grounds are gorgeous. The air is filled with the scent of orange blossom and the sounds of birds and water. SO lush!! Breakfast is simple and fresh. I loved all the figs dates and apricots. My husband loved the omlettes. The front desk arranged for a guide and he was so patient and kind! He took us around everywhere and was so knowledgable! Dinner was delicious. The atmosphere is amazing the staff lovely!!  I dream of going back!! So happy I chose Les Jardins de la Medina!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anna N wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: The atmosphere and setting was lovely. Myself and my boyfriend are really not picky eaters we would eat anything. I ordered the mozzarella and tamotoe for starter (my favourite kind of starter) it was horrendous. Mozzarella was like water and had a really bad taste of it didn't taste like mozzarella at all. Waiter never even asked how my meal was when he could blantly see I didn't eat it. I informed him it wasn't nice and he didn't seem to care.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It is nested in a beautiful garden of cactus and tropical plants. The pool is nice and it really feels like an oasis. Breakfast choice is good and the staff is very friendly. It is right in the Medina but not too complicated to find.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynn D wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My two daughters and I stayed in this hotel for 3 nights beginning on August 5th. The hotel is lovely. Beautiful gardens and pool. During our stay we had a series of events which if handled better by the hotel staff would have been chalked up to bad luck but turned into something much more.  Day 1 - The drain in the shower backed up flooding the entire bedroom. We through down towels and called maintenance.  Day 2 - We arrived back from our day in the Medina to find our room full of workers with ladders in the ceiling door wide open etc. Had we been given prior notice no big deal. The surprise was a bit unsettling. Later that afternoon the power went out in 6 rooms for several hours. Need I mention that it is HOT in Marrakesh in the summer. But things happen.  Day 3 - i asked reception to book a dinner reservation for us. They said that they would. Went out for the day and returned to find that our room smelled of sewage. The smell was coming from the shower drain. I called for maintenance and they sent a lovely young lady with perfume. I explained that this would not fix the problem. They finally sent for the maintenance guy. Meanwhile we prepared for dinner. Reception called a cap and we set off for our restaurant only to arrive and find that the place had closed the week before. Returning to the hotel I inquired about our reservation request. They checked their records and it clearly stated that they had called and discovered the place had closed. Would have been nice to know before we set off in our taxi. We then asked reception for a recommendation. They asked if we wanted Moroccan food and we said no. They gave us an address and we set off waling through the Medina only to find that it was a Moroccan restaurant.  Day 4 - check out. We were leaving Marrakesh for a 1 night stay in the Atlas mountains. We were to return the following night to the same hotel. I explained that if we did return that I wanted a new room and a refund so that we could obtain different lodging. The manager took no responsibility for anything. No of the issues were related to poor maintenance of the hotel and the 6 room power outage was "caused by the city". Entire hotel maybe but not 6 rooms.  We did not return to this hotel and our guide is still working with his agency to get our funds refunded. Beyond this it was difficult to get waiters at both the pool and the restaurant. It is a shame because the grounds are beautiful. But it is lipstick on a pig.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed for 4nights with 2 teenage boys had 2 rooms. Such a lovely hotel couldn‚Äôt fault anything.....calmlovely rooms delicious breakfast lovely pool area and roof terrace. Even had the football World Cup on in the library!! All the staff were very helpful and friendly. So nice to come back to after a day in the Medina.  Thank you for a lovely holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: John P wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: This is a terrific hotel built around a gorgeous garden with generous accommodation mine even had a delightful rooftop terrace. The place is very quiet and the major noise came from the call of birds in the garden each morning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Les jardins de la medina is an amazing hotel with pool a great restaurant helpful staff and nice rooms. The location is great as it is in walking distance of the main market and some good restaurants (ask for recommendations at the reception) The food was very good (breakfast buffet ans sit-down restaurant in the evening).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Our Marrakesh stop off on our Moroccan adventure
Review_Text: We throughly enjoyed our stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. Fantastic location delicious food friendly staff and wonderful pool. Only thing which let is down were the rooms. We had 2 garden side rooms and unlike the rest of the hotel we felt they lacked any character. Plus you only get 2 coffee capsules (one of which is decaf) 1 each of a range of teabags and 2 milk capsules between 2 people. So you can't even both have a decent cup of coffee. Why penny pinch on something so small but which can make a big difference?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: we stayed 2 nights at Easter and it was an absolute pleasure from beginning to the end. The riad has a wonderful garden and swimming pool which was a delight after a day of walking and siteseeing!  In the garden there is also an open air gym.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My wife & I stayed for a week in one on the solarium rooms. Which offered a private terrace and the room was stunning. The hotel is tastefully done throughout with an authentic old school Moroccan theme. I have to say all the staff were exceptional and made our stay that extra bit special. Nothing ever seemed too much trouble so for that we are both very thankful for. The main language spoken is French but most of staff cpuld speak English very well & those who couldn't sealed assistance so trouble there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michelle F wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I spent a week in Marrakech at this hotel. I felt at ease from the moment I arrived and was offered a welcome drink and a seat in the lush garden. Being surrounded by the greenery made me feel calm and there were chairs/ loungers to relax on in the garden.    The staff were wonderful very hospitable and attentive to our needs. The rooms were spacious and had everything we needed. An iron and ironing board were swiftly provided to us when requested.    The selection of food at breakfast was adequate. There wasn‚Äôt much change in items during the week however this wasn‚Äôt a problem because it tasted great and I looked forward to eating it the next day. We tried lunch dinner and poolside dining also and all meals were great. Fabulous food that was beautifully presented. One night we ate around the pool and listened to performers which was a nice change to the regular dinner.    We ended the week with a couples treatment and it was thoroughly relaxing. It started with a hammam and finished with a body massage. Keep hydrated as the overall experience lasts around three hours! We were due to check-out on this day and were provided with a complimentary room for the afternoon to relax before our flight in the evening. Many thanks to the staff for arranging this.    I would recommend this hotel for a short break it‚Äôs a ten-to-fifteen minute walk to some attractions. It‚Äôs perfect for a longer break also as it is just enough of a way outside the main hustle and bustle to truly feel like you‚Äôre on holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Cannot praise it enough! Did not want to leave!
Review_Text: Honestly from pick up in Casablanca to smiles of Smail on check in I really felt like I was at home. My husband and I had not seen eachother for months and it was our first break away from the kids in years... and we are beyond glad we chose this beautiful Riad with its amazing staff and stunning grounds. Our Sultana room with the balcony was perfect the hairdryer was absolutely fantastic (important) and the atmosphere was relaxed and calm. The food at the restaurant was so good we rarely ate out and the location was walking distance to most tourist attractions. The hammam was so relaxing I wish I‚Äôd done a few more through the week!    I wish Australia wasn‚Äôt so far away because I would definitely call this home away from home but with all the luxuries. Try the lamb tagine and the dessert plate... it was spectacular. I could go on... but you should try it all for yourself.    Thank you Jardins de la Medina... you have my loyalty and if we ever make it back to Marrakech (inshallah) I will be back to see you all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Delightful hotel, gardens and pool area
Review_Text: We had lunch here. It was a very pleasant and civilised break from the hustle and bustle of the market. Cold wine and bear. The Tagine of beef with apricots and prunes was very good as was the Tetouane's chicken tagine.    You can loose several hours relaxing taking in the sun and being treated royally.

Review_Date: John J wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: There is not enough room to detail all the great things about this hotel! We knew we were in for a great experience when we pulled up to the door at midnight after a long flight from the US and lost luggage from the airline and were greeted by a smiling and friendly concierge and bellman who got us quickly checked in and situated. The room was beautiful with a porch attached where we had morning coffee and a private rooftop deck that overlooked the Medina. The grounds were meticulously kept with lush vegetation a beautiful outdoor patio for dining and a great pool. Others have said this and we agree the hotel is like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle of the Medina. It was only a 10 minute walk to the central square and then on into the markets so the hotel is perfectly located. But the best part of the hotel was the staff. Wonderful wonderful people! The concierges helped us with reservations recommendations day trips and transportation and all of their suggestions were spot on. Late afternoons by the pool were great as the staff brought us different snacks as we drank our wine and AIT (our favorite) even made me a special home remedy when I told him I wasn‚Äôt feeling well. Every person we encountered from the hotel was pleasant helpful and genuinely delightful to deal with. Early in our stay the hotel arranged for a taxi for us from that point on our taxi driver Noureddine made it his personal mission to take care of us. He would take us to restaurants and excursions and made sure that he was right there to take us back when we finished.
