He also acted as our informal tour guide and provided some great restaurant recommendations. A great ambassador for the hotel and the City! This hotel and its people made our trip to Marrakech a delight and we will absolutely stay here again the next time we are in Marrakech! Jack and Karen Jurasits
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ashley B wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: A great hotel inside the medina with stunning gardens excellent pool area comfortable rooms friendly staff and good quality cooking. A hit overall with us.  Staff occassionally slow to attend especially at breakfast and pool area gets a little crowded but minor quibbles in an otherwise excellent break!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad was absolutely lovely and so beautiful and peaceful inside. The staff were lovely the service was excellent and the cleanliness of the  Riad was perfect and about a 15 minute walk to the market square.    We had a lovely time staying here and would definitely recommend it to anyone taking a trip to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a surprise to enter an oasis from the dusty bustle of the Kasba...  We were welcomed in the garden with refreshing tea and sweets the reception staff were friendly and efficient in checking us in and managing reservation cabs guides and directions.  The restaurant breakfast and lunch were very good although the service left something to be desired.  Our room a Sultans Suite was large with beautiful terrace and welcome basket with towels hats and a hammock for our terrace. The room itself as well the entire Riad is in need of a refurbishment or at least some refreshing. Every chair in the garden was covered in bird poop often difficult to find a clean perch. The pool was delightful but limited chairs made finding a spot difficult.  The spa was a treat we enjoyed both the hammam and the massage the masseuse‚Äôs were lovely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A beautiful hidden gem in the heart of the city
Review_Text: The room was perfect staff exceptionally friendly and always on hand to assist when needed the gardens and pool oozed relaxation and were kept to a very high standard. The rssident tortoises were an added bonus. The food was lovely and authentic. Location is in the medina and only a 15 minute walk to the main square. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Staff friendly and couldn't do enough. All rooms seemed to be different with character. Pool area lovely. It was Ramadam when we visited and the restaurant didn't serve food until 8:30pm after the staff had broken thier fast the menu was reduced but there was a good selection and was good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of peace in the sparkle of Medina
Review_Text: Nice place with a good level of services and is an excellent location to move by walking anyway inside the Medina.  Whole staff has been very kind and available.  A special mention for the high quality of the restaurant where I had dinner more times after my first dinner.  I suggest this accomodation if you want to enjoy the magic atmosphere of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had been to JDLM a few years previously and it didn‚Äôt fail to deliver a second time.    If you didn‚Äôt know it was there you would miss this oasis in the outskirts to city. Once checked in we offered a welcome mint tea while the team did the final touches to the room.    The room was comfortable and the amenities clean and appropriate for the standard of the hotel. Warning not the hotel‚Äôs fault but when throwing open the windows remember the mosquitoes. We had a garden room so could walk straight out towards the pool (heated) which had a small patio area which was perfect for those early evening drinks that the team were more than happy to bring to your room.    The break was more to relax that go discovering (we did some of the latter) so we took full advantage of the hotel.    Simply the food is awesome. As a fully accredited carnivore I was spoilt for choice and to be honest my wife who leans to a less protein intense diet was more than happy with the selection. The teams who manage the breakfasts lunch and dinner servings are brilliant courteous and efficient. Good food served by an organised team in very pleasant surroundings just made experience what we needed and had hoped for...fantastic.    A brilliant and welcomed break taken to the next level by team JDLM. Many many thanks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barry K wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Trip with friends to Marrakech and stayed at this little gem of a hotel. In the old town it was a little oasis of tranquility embedded with the hustle and bustle of the town.    The contrast between being used inside and outside is amazing. Lovely grounds rooms terraces set around a lovely pool. It is said this little palace was once owned/built for a prince and you can well imagine that.    Staff were fab some of the most hospital I have met in all my travels around the globe. Really personable and nothing was too much. I am really grateful to them for making or stay so special. Good buffet for breakfast and good quality lunches and dinners at a reasonable price.    Hotel is 15 min walk from the main square and souk and there is plenty to see along the way. Locals go about there daily business and lives and hardly seem to notice the tourist who tend to stick out in the crowds. Some of the traffic (motor bikes) can be a little crazy but generally safe.    I wouldn‚Äôt hesitate to return to this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have been in Marrakesh many time but it was the first time for us to stay at les Jardin de la M√©dina and it will not be the last - it was indeed a good experience. The room staff pool and the food at the restaurant was a pleasure. The hotel location is not perfect but we just took taxis. The bed was big but a bit to the hard side. We are looking forward coming back.

Review_Date: Barbara W wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Beautiful grounds gardens and hotel with three pools plenty of garden and poolside seating with all you can eat breakfast lunch and dinners. A separate restaurant is on the premises offering the utmost in cuisine. This hotel is adult only and is walled for privacy and security and includes a full bar both inside and poolside with entertainment and outside restaurant and bar for poolside eating. Great rooms with views and terrace. All inclusive accommodations if desired which include events. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay the staff was very helpful fun and fluent in English as well as Arabic. I highly recommend this resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John T wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Great hotel in middle of Marrakesh. Food good with a varied selection. Courtyard with pool good for relaxing after hectic trip around the city. Staff very friendly and helpful. Roof top sun area with view over roof tops
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Hotel is a quaint sanctuary! We came to Marrakech totally defeated and down about our Trip to Morocco due to some unfortunate events in Fes.  As soon as we stepped into the Hotel we were greeted by two friendly gentlemen (which was a breath of fresh Air to us at that point). We were seated outside during check in where we got to choose our Rooms scent and were poured a cup of Delicious Mint Tea.  Once we received our Hotel tour we were helped to our Room which was Bright and inviting. The room was spacious and Clean.  We enjoyed our breakfast every morning. We had dinner at the Hotel one night and it was amazing. I had the best Couscous I have ever eaten in my life there. Not to mention the Delicious Rosewater icecream I had for Dessert. The one thing I regret is that I missed the opportunity to swim in the heated Pool :/ But if I ever re visit Morocco it will be for sure in this Hotel I felt Safe and slept like a Baby...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Rosa M wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: An oasis in the middle of the chaos of the Medina. Big comfortable rooms. The staff did their best to serve but I think more staff and better training is required. The dining area is just gorgeous. Either in amongst the garden or inside. Drinks are also served in the garden. Great location. Would stay here again.

Review_Date: ian H wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Fabulous boutique hotel that try‚Äôs hard to please and succeeds in every way! Fantastic room with roof terrace all amenities great bed clean fully functioning - in every way perfect. Great pool nice and warm; lovely courtyard setting; wonderful staff; great food; nice entertainment on our second night; nothing too much trouble. Short walk to centre of town yet calm and quiet of an evening  If you‚Äôre in Marrakech stay here!  Those who follow my posts know this hotel must be exceptional to receive such praise....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Delighted with choice of Riad. Most attractive setting. Walk through reception into outside eating area pool and beautiful garden. Rooms large and full of character. Lovely rooftop relaxing area with fabulous sofas and some sun beds. Restaurant exceeded expectations even though menu never changed. One minus perpetual music totally unnecessary the birds did a better job!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Eileen H wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Excellent simple lunch seated prawns with perfumed rice with a smear of perfect mild curry sauce was a delight with a bottle of Eclipse rose followed by desert and coffee for ¬£50 in five star surroundings was bliss.  Staff extremely professional

Review_Date: anita b wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Lovely hotel set around lareg tree shaded courtyard. Beautiful large pool. Very nice updated rooms and bathrooms. Good tv and internet. Great breakfast and restaurant. Wonderful service. Amazing value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ruedi S wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: This hotel does everything right from the greeting to the hotel facility (a serious of older houses in the medina) to the food and service. All rooms are different but they are all spacious with comfortable bathrooms. The courtyard filled with exotic trees plants and a nice swimming pool is the oasis I wrote in the title. Everywhere are little seating places there is a roomy rooftop area with lounge chairs and a view of the High Atlas mountains on a clear day. Breakfast is excellent so are lunch and dinner selections.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed 5 days in the Hotel - wonderful located room (No 120) with Terrasse on first floor by the pool. Always helpful and nice staff. Meals at the restaurant of high quality and in time served. Exceptional Spa. Garden and pool area are very relaxing and well maintained. Hotel area is cleaned every day early in the morning. Very quiet at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Victoria J wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: This is my 5th trip to Marrakesh but my first at this hotel. I cannot recommend enough. The rooms the pool the attention to detail are all outstanding. In its crazy majestic Marrakesh way this is an oasis of calm. The restaurant food is some of the best I have tasted in a very long time. Ensure you eat here even if you do not stay! Waking up listening to the birds sing knowing the madness is 5 minutes away. The Concerige is brilliant and we felt looked after from the moment we opened the regal doors. Book without hesitation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Heather J wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: This charming little hotel impressed us from the very beginning. Very friendly and smiling staff greeted us at the reception. From there we were escorted into a lovely garden oasis where we welcomed with mint tea and pastries and were asked to choose the scent (1 of 4 options) for our room. So lovely! The restaurant was cozy and the food was delicious. The staff provided excellent service while still maintaining a personal charm. I would stay here again when I return to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: A Z wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived until the moment we left the personal touch was exceptional. The hotel itself was an oasis of green and tranquility. Yes there was sound of the call to prayer from the mosque but that‚Äôs real life and was a lovely reminder that you were in Marrakech. What was a surprise was the wake up call of birdsong as we were in the M√©dina. Our room was perfect with flower petals and scented oils. The ambience of the restaurant was just right with an extremely high level of service without losing that personal charm. A thoroughly enjoyable stay: so much so we have already booked our return. A charming and authentic hotel where customer happiness is a top priority. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautiful experience from check-in to check-out. Wonderful service ambiance and location. Great room terrific breakfast space and food pleasant staff. Hope to come back some day. Cute little store. Nice pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Siddharth J wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Little oasis hidden in the heart of the old city
Review_Text: I was pleasantly surprised by this little gem of a place staff are very friendly the rooms are very clean it has a pool for those who are looking for the typical hotel but still want that riad feel! There‚Äôs a bit for everyone here! I recommend getting a room overlooking the garden no better way to wake up than with orange trees and birds chirping at your door step.    They have a licensed public taxi driver outside the hotel most times make sure to haggle for the price!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It was the right decision to stay here...step outside right into the heart of Marrakech kasbah life and step back in again to a different world. Lovely staff who were helpful at all times and tolerated my school level French. Good food for breakfast...highlight being "guess the tagine of the day"!! I can only imagine as the patio is fully opened up for summer it would be even more gorgeous. A stroll amongst the oranges  watching the resident tortoises and sparrows flying around rhe lush gardens on the way to a private hammam session couldn't have been lovelier.  The room was incredible with our own little roof terrace and the biggest bed to sink into after a day of walking in the bustle of the city.  Yes of course it's way more expensive than 'out there on the street' but worth every penny.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nisha G wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: Having returned last week after a weeks stay at Les Jardins de la Medina I felt a positive review was in order.    It‚Äôs location on the edge of the kasbah and just 10 minutes walk from the sook was ideal. It really is a tropical calming wonder when you walk in from the street and the staff are without exception welcoming and attentive. They can not do enough for you and the welcome party held every Friday evening with free drinks and nibbles was a nice touch!    Whilst it can get busy by the pool and not all loungers are in the sun I found the roof terrace to be the perfect escape. Quiet and a sun trap!    The rooms are spacious and always kept spotless. I would like to have had free tea and coffee in the room considering this is not a cheap place to stay but that is a small criticism. The breakfast was varied enough and filling but I felt the lunch and dinner menus were slightly limited and if we had choose to eat in more often or were staying longer then this may have been a problem. Most days we ate out and there is plenty of choice for this in and around the kasbah.    Overall this is a great riad relaxing clean and with great facilities. I would definitely consider staying here again if I return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Chris F wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: Great hotel which could be even better
Review_Text: We very much enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff are always friendly and helpful. We stayed for 10 nights so had a good opportunity to assess the facilities. Our room was comfortable and clean. We preferred a room which was not on the ground floor as it is more private and we felt safer. The hotel make a big thing at the welcome about choosing an oil to be used in the room. The reality is a little disappointing as the aroma soon disappeared after it was used in the evenings. Better to give some oil for the guests to use themselves. The dining room is impressive and the dinner menu was fine. But we did not feel that it was a ‚Äòfive star‚Äô breakfast which was a bit disappointing with a lack of choice. Outside of the hotel in the medina you could get any type of fresh fruit juice which was not expensive. For some reason the hotel could only offer fresh orange juice and we felt that they should offer more choice. My final gripe is about the arrangements for tea and coffee which you could make in your room. Whilst tea bags were available each day the coffee was less forthcoming. Each room has a capsule coffee maker and you get given three ‚Äòfree‚Äô coffees (one of which is decaf). If you want more coffee you have to pay about 250 dirhams for each capsule/cup. Even then the machine only makes a very small cup. Considering that most guests only seem to stay for two or three nights I don‚Äôt suppose most people care but we were there for longer and a consideration would have been nice. Alternatively the hotel could have provided instant coffee sachets at little cost. Maybe the primarily ‚ÄòFrench‚Äô clientele would disapprove. Anyway we ended making our own coffee at cost!  However I would be happy to recommend the hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech. Coming back to the hotel is bliss after the cacophony and fumes in the medina! It‚Äôs a grand place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice stay removed from the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: We really liked this hotel. It‚Äôs in the Kasbah area and about a 15 minute walk from the central souks making it the perfect location. It felt like a nice retreat after a busy day in the M√©dina. We enjoyed the breakfast and it was a nice setting for a drink in the evening. The staff was fantastic. Would highly recommend if you want something more than a traditional riad and don‚Äôt want to spend a ton of money on one of the big luxury hotels. Les Jardins de la M√©dina was the perfect balance! Overall wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzan H wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We have just returned from a few days in Marrakech and feel so lucky we picked Les Jardins de la Medina as our base. So much so we would definitely stay there again and are dreaming of a return visit.  It is true that the location is at the edge of the Medina but the Kasbah area is historic and we were happy to head back there every day after exploring further afield.  The lush gardens of the hotel surrounding the pool and filling the inner courtyard make it a perfect place to find a quiet private spot no matter how many people are around.  The pool is lovely and our room overlooking it was exactly what we wanted. I was glad to find we had our own private terrace and access to the roof for sunbathing although the weather for our last 2 days meant we couldn't make the best use of those facilities but we can't blame the hotel for that.  The staff were very welcoming and helpful at all times. When we returned from being caught in the rain one young man made a point of lighting the fire in the bar area and insisting we move to two chairs he placed in front of it so we could dry off as we drank our mint tea. Bless him.  Breakfast was gorgeous - so much choice plentiful and fresh the coffee was excellent too. In fact the food at the hotel was the best we had the whole time we were in Marrakech - we may book half or full board next time we go!  We decided to have one last lunch just before leaving for our plane home and the monkfish kebab and Paris Brest desert were absolutely delicious.  The beauty of Marrakech is that you have no idea what is hidden behind any high wall or ornate door and I am sure there are many many delightful places tucked out of sight across the Medina but I got a real thrill everytime we stepped from the street into the welcoming reception of Les Jardins de la Medina and then through into the tropical oasis courtyard beyond.  Looking forward to my next visit already.

Review_Title: Average riad at periphery of medina
Review_Text: Large property with a gift shop at front entrance. In my opinion an average property without any of the "wow" of some riad's.  Service: We made a request to Hannan and she without checking or any concern for customer satisfaction simply said NO. In my opinion not good customer service.  Room: Very average small room. Lots of noise transfer. Poor lighting. Wifi sometimes difficult to connect.  Summary: I would not recommend. In my opinion there are other better choices that offer more authentic settings and rooms and much better customer care.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor sleep, not the best location, over priced
Review_Text: As mentioned in subject. Sleep was poor because of relentless noise from guests and staff the windows are single glasing and not appropriate for a ‚Äúsupposedly high class hotel‚Äù. The location was ok but the area wasn‚Äôt the nicest. The services and food was very overpriced considering that they were average by any standards. Wouldn‚Äôt recommend this hotel considering the price you pay. I‚Äôm disappointed to say.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful retreat in the heart of the city
Review_Text: This is our second time at this riad and it didn't disappoint. The room (Superior) was huge and distincively decorated the building is cool and gracious and the gardens a delight as the plants and palms create a lush surrounding to the pool. The restaurant is excellent and the staff unfailingly polite and attentive. We visited a better known (and more expensive) hotel to see the gardens. and vastly preferred our own!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: This is a conveniently located beautiful and tranquil hotel to stay in with a very high standard of food. The breakfast by the pool is lovely with an attention to detail in the options provided. It‚Äôs actually one of the most pleasant hotel stays that I‚Äôve had and I hope to go back in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Best hotel ever! As soon as I checked intea was served with the traditional Moroccan pastries. The room was so clean with rose petals spread on the bed and in bathroom. They also gave me choices of scent for my pillows. The place smells like paradise in the middle of bustling morocco.

Review_Title: A bit of paradise within the busy Medina.....
Review_Text: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this beautiful property hidden behind a beautiful door in the Medina. Had a delicious dinner in their restaurant one night but due to our busy sight-seeing schedule we were not able to enjoy the pool spa or sun deck area overlooking the Medina roof-tops. Woke up every morning to the sound of birds singing outside our window. The staff was friendly and very accommodating to our needs and requests. If you are looking to stay within the Medina I would highly recommend this beautiful property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Penelope S wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: This hotel remains one of my all time favourites. There is something special about the atmosphere the exotic scents the wood fires evening music fountain the traditional lighting that make a stay extremely relaxing and comfortable. Beds are a dream. A true oasis of calm in the noisy dusty Medina. Small enough to feel intimate large enough to have a good restaurant and a lovely pool and garden. Since we were there in 2017 some redecoration and upgrading of common areas has taken place and it looks as if a new spa area is being created. If you are going ask the hotel to book Fast Track at the airport both ways. Its well worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John H wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Lovely to stay within the Medina in a small hotel full of the traditional feel of Morocco. The service and staff were excellent and we really enjoyed our weeks stay. It was good to enjoy a bottle of very good Moroccan wine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The restaurant is a really nice garden with several terraces. Very nice and swift service and nice food. Had a good lunch. The minced chicken was very nice and my husband got an extra large portion of tangine. Did not try desert but should have :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Les jardins de la Medina is a beautiful small hotel in the heart of the Medina. The staff were amazing and friendly. Food fantastic (if a little slow in the evenings). They organised tours and taxis for us. The room and communal areas are stunning with great attention to detail I will definitely be back. Thank you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a very good Hotel. The food is excellent. The bedroom was comfortable and clean. The weather was not good when we were in Marrakech but that was no fault of The Hotel. The staff are at all times attentive and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Classy and relaxing stay in great location
Review_Text: Have just got back from a brilliant stay at Les Jardins. Atmospheric old riad with a fabulous garden and pool right in the heart of the Kasbah. Very helpful and friendly staff beautiful rooms. I would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a four night stay in this enchanting and delightful place. It is well situated and is beautiful with a lovely garden around the pool. The service and food were excellent. Most of all the staff are wonderful helpful and welcoming. The design and decor is gorgeous and the management is first rate. Highly recommended for a very pleasant stay in the heart of the mayhem and wonder that is Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Richard W wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: An oasis of calm amidst the craziness of Marrakech
Review_Text: Took the Mrs here for a big birthday. We'd never been before and were very happy that we had the tranquility of this fantastic hotel to fall back on after the delights of the Medina.    Marrakech was a crazy delight but this place was great. Lovely staff stunning location beautiful food all at a very reasonable price.    Just what was needed.    Thank you and I'm sure we will book again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: A memorable trip. We expected high quality and got it in all respects but we would like to single out the staff for particular praise. In addition this form gives no opportunity to comment on the restaurant which was excellent. The weather during our 5 day stay was not what we had hoped for but the hotel more than made up for it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alan P wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: The hotel itself is really lovely with beautiful gardens excellent rooms and restaurant. What really sets it apart however is the helpfulness friendliness and professionalism of all the staff without exception.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sue B wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Great stay in true Morroccan style
Review_Text: We stayed in January and the hotel It is perfectly placed to explore the Medina. We had a lovely time. All the staff were great and the food in restaurant was divine. It is a great hotel with lovely facilities. We had a solarium room with a private terrace which was useful for sitting in the sun on cool days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: awake to sounds of the birds singing looking onto the lush gardens
Review_Text: would have been lovely and idyllic unfortunately our morning alarm was the sound of the angle grinder drilling and banging.! As the hotel are adding more rooms on the rooftop to maximize there product. Sadly we were only off peak unimportant guests and do not even merit being told of these works the noise dust or inconvenience to our morning lie In or sun worship on the rooftop.  To continue these works saturday and sunday mornings i thought was a bit too much and my enquiries at reception met with Gallic shrugs in that imperious french manner as if it was of little consequence. No apology no complimentary drink .!  This i think is a great shame to ruin anyones stay  as the whole courtyard with the orange trees in the garden surrounding the pool is beautiful and relaxing. The restaurant with the fires blazing is lovely on a cool winter night and the food on offer is excellent.  Also they seem to have changed all the beds to errr... an extremely firm model with little give.  My conclusion is this hotel need to up it's game to get back to the level of somewhere like the Masion Arabe with it's impeccable level of service cleanliness and soft luxury bedding.............. sorry
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina for a winter break to Marrakech.This was our second trip to the city and whilst the hotel we previously stayed at was great we made the decision to stay here for something a little different and were not disappointed. Really great room with plenty of space and great views from the balcony over the garden/swimming pool. I do not think I have every stayed in such a huge bed and it was a nice touch to have a choice of perfume for the pillows every night. Staff were friendly and provided excellent customer service in all aspects of the hotel/restaurant. We decided to take the half board option and therefore ate in the hotel each evening menu provided a wide choice but did not change during our 5 night stay (the only fault found during our stay). The reception held by the directors was a nice touch and showed a real interest in their guests
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel in a great location. Bathroom was a bit tired with slightly dirty walls and loose or broken tap fittings. However the Food and general hotel cleanliness was of a very high standard. Heated pool even in winter was a great way to relax.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephen D wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: From the very beginning of our short stay we were made to feel very welcome indeed. We were shown around the gardens that are so beautifully maintained and form the centrepiece of the courtyard area. Our room facilities were explained to us we were very taken with the rose petal welcome and both the temperature and aroma of the room. The room had real character with its raised bedroom area and authentic decoration the heated bathroom floor was an additional welcome luxury. The concierge and his team couldn't have been more helpful how nice it was too to meet the management team in an informal drinks and canopes evening event. There was a guitarist and violinist playing on the Thursday evening we were there - they were great! Also the music played as background to meals etc was exactly right (for us anyway!).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our first time to Marrakech a little apprehensive having read so much and clearly to much about this wonderful city and its people. When we relaxed and discovered that with common sense there is nothing to worry about and so much to enjoy. This city is an assault on your senses and must be enjoyed to the fullest. We will come back.. The hotel was wonderful a haven away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff service and willingness to help cannot be praised high enough it was they that truly helped us to enjoy our time. But..... we had some niggles electric points in our room were a little worrying to say the least and the heating was not working properly in our room on the first night an electric fire was offered none of this affected our enjoyment. Final tip make friends with a taxi driver they are invaluable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very attentive to details upon check in the welcome drinks and the choice of smellies to put on your pillows are a plus. Les Jardins is a twenty minutes away from the main square but easily walkable. I definitely will come back again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Kashif C wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: The entrance is simple and unassuming but inside there‚Äôs a large garden in the courtyard which includes a nice sized pool and even an outdoor (covered) exercise room.  The staff was generally helpful although it depends a bit on who you speak to. The rooms are well equipped and comfortable. The location is in the Medina making it very accessible by foot to the main market and many of the historical attractions. The only issue we had was in understanding the hotel bill. It wasn‚Äôt structured the same as the booking confirmation we received online when booking direct.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Hotel with great character and charm
Review_Text: We stayed at the Jardins de la Medina for 5 nights and enjoyed it thoroughly. Very stylish and calm with the garden and pool and with staff who made the hotel feel like a home from home. An oasis to come back to after a day out particularly after navigating the souks. The restaurant is also excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As you step inside from the busy street you are instantly in paradise. Quiet tranquil and just lovely in everyway. The service feels very personalised and the little touches such as bar snacks and rose petals in the room really add to this. The restaurant and bar are both lovely if a little expensive although the ambience is worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely stylish boutique hotel hidden away from the busy Hubble of the Kasbah. Friendly staff and good service. If your looking for a peaceful haven this is the place would highly recommend for a weekend break
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: An N wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Lovely riad with beautifull garden and friendliest staff.  Restaurant was generally good but the butter in plastic containers was a bit of a dissappointment but that is a personal denote.  Because I am very allergic to dust an extra floor wiping would have improved my score on cleanliness but it is a problem in most hotels
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited in December. Pretty cold in the evenings and the mornings. But nice during the day.    Airport - you need to fill out a landing card. Took us nearly 2 hours to leave the airport and everyone has to get their suitcase x-rayed before leaving the airport...    We were met by the lovely Omar. He explained a bit about Marrakesh and advised us on things to do. The journey was in a nice spacious mini-van and took around 15 minutes to get to the Medina.    Very warm welcome on arrival and while the front desk sorted our rooms etc. we were given lovely Moroccan tea and a refreshing face towel.    Our room was at the back of the hotel but was easily accessible by the walk ways and there is also an elevator.    Rooms are spacious well-maintained and well-equipped. We asked for an extra radiator and covers and they were delivered within 10 minutes.    Really nice outdoor area heated pool and gardens. There is also an outside gym!!  Everywhere is spotlessly clean.    We had a wonderful hammam and scrub with the lovely Ghizlane. I would definitely recommend it!! My brother also enjoyed him haircut and shave.    There are lots to see and do near the Medina. Lots of local shops etc.  Do try one of their local patties. DELICIOUS.  A  About 10 minutes‚Äô walk from the Medina is a wonderful artisanal shop. If you want to avoid the crowds of the main square it is worth a visti.    The famous square is a short taxi ride away or around 25 by foot. Worth a visit. Go early! Worth a visit at night too!    Just across the street is the Clock Cafe - go there for some lunch or just a drink. Try the almond milkshake! SOOOOOOOO GOOD. They have a beautiful terrace and great food. We also did some henna there and a great cooking class.    Now to the Medina itself. The staff are amazing and the food is great. Cannot praise them enough.    Breakfast: Lots of choice and fresh orange juice. Chef will make you some eggs too.    Lunch: Great variety too. Try the house cocktail. Soooo good.    Dinner: We were half board. Food was amazing. Real compliments to the chef and her team.  Starter - tempura prawns - yum. Avocado - yum.  Main - veal curry - delicious. Tagina - soo good. Lamb chops - delicious.  Dessert - All amazing.    Really nice place to stay and great location. Worth a visit.    A few people I would like to thanks for amazing customer service and for their kindness towards myself and my family.    Yahya - such a friendly guy and works so hard. Made us laugh every day. Such a great team member.    Said  Ait Mubarak  Amina  Fatima  Abdul Ali  Amin (bartender)  Ghizlane (spa)    Thank you for making our holiday as wonderful as it was!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lucie W wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Exquisite Luxury hidden in the Medina
Review_Text: After 11 days of Morocco; the excitement the madness the haggling the rip-offs and occasional accommodation scam and time spent in Marrakech Essaouira and Taghazout we did a fair amount of research and decided to stay here for our last night before flying back to London.    Les Jardins de la Medina is exquisite luxury a quiet perfect cluster of beautiful buildings hidden inside a busy M√©dina. Thank you to the staff who are wonderful friendly and helpful. Dinner & breakfast were delicious. This stay was a perfect and peaceful end to our time in Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ali M wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is sublime! It‚Äôs a little corner of heaven in the Medina. We enjoyed a delicious buffet lunch on New Year‚Äôs Day - it was the perfect start to 2018. It was incredibly good value for money and of a very high standard. We also treated ourselves to Hammans and massages which were the best we had in Marrakech. I would definitely return and recommend to all visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: James K wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here as a family of 4 for 5 nights post Christmas and it was great. The rooms are spacious and attractive the maids do a great job. The garden courtyard is also well maintained with lots of mature trees and shrubs.  The restaurant is situated in an atmospheric room and the food is of consistently high quality to the point where we actually chose to dine in more than we had intended.  The staff are all helpful and friendly.  The location inside the Medina is pretty good and you certainly get a real Moroccan feel in the street outside.  For my money I would much prefer to stay i a Riad like this than in a big new hotel outside the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Christmas holiday at the Jardins de la Medina
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at the Jardins de la Medina The staff were very friendly the solarium room was just lovely and the food was delicious. The hotel is situated in the Kasbah part of the Medina and was easily accessible to the main areas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Riccardo T wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: You need to stay in a place like this if you want to enjoy Marrakech
Review_Text: Positive experience (despite we were disappointed about morocco overall). Clean nice room good meals classy quiet good location (if you want to stay in the medina!). On the negatives not all the members of the staff are well trained/kind. If you are in Marrakech you want to stay in a place like this. Excellent price/quality ratio.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Ou trip was excellent the Rhiad was fantastic nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The food was very good and the surrounding garden and pool was an absolute delight especially in the evening when it was all lit up.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Review for Restaurant and not the Hotel
Review_Text: We just went there for a dinner and didn't stay at the property. Upscale restaurant and prices to suit their clientele. A bit too warm with too many wood fireplaces. Very good service though a bit slow. They were able to pack our food to go since our son started feeling queasy (he eventually got very sick from something that he must have eaten the previous day or earlier that morning?).    The taste was OK - nothing good. The WiFi just didn't work for us. They gave a password and require you to share your email address with them but still didn't work for us. Then their credit card machine didn't work and we had to scrape through our dirhams.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We celebrated our anniversary and stayed here. The hotel is just wonderful. Well decorated clean room and first class service. The environment is so restful and an oasis in the medina. I appreciated that they were trying to conserve energy and water and the little things like choosing your room fragrance for your pillows etc just made the stay special. The Hamam was lovely and thank you for the gift!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great hotel close to all the action
Review_Text: This is a fabulous hideaway right on the edge of the Medina. Once you go through the entrance you will be amazed at the setting beautiful gardens and so tranquil given the hustle and bustle in the street outside. Only 36 rooms and ours was very comfortable and well looked after. The staff were friendly and attentive. Restaurant very good as were the spa treatments.  Recommended and we‚Äôd certainly go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful stay at a lovely Riad
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed recently for three nights to celebrate my 40th birthday and this is possibly one of our favourite hotels we have stayed in.    The building itself is charming with lots of interesting details the gardens are stunning and the staff friendly and attentive.    I‚Äôd highly recommend this quiet oasis in the heart of the bustling city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for a week in early December. First impression: smallish foyer but then we were whisked the into the gorgeous Bar / Restaurant area where there was a roaring fire as it was evening and starting to turn cold. We were offered tea and pastries on arrival. It's a beautiful Restaurant / Bar area which reminded me of Tuscany in so many ways: the roaring fire the terracotta floors the fabulous wooden ceiling. We had dinner there a number of times and the food was top class and reasonably priced. Service was very good. Breakfast was also excellent. The fresh orange juice is simply unbelievable. This hotel is near enough to the Souks to be able to walk there but far enough away not to be bothered by noise. We slept very well. The staff were friendly professional and very helpful. Everything was spotlessly clean the rooms were comfortable. We had a fire in ours which we took advantage of on a number of occasions. The gardens are beautiful as is the heated pool. I had a massage which was excellent for a very reasonable price. I did this late in the stay if I had done it earlier I would have booked more!! They had a guitarist every night in the bar area and on one occasion a couple of great musicians in the restaurant which we really really enjoyed. On another occasion they had cocktails with a magician who was great. Basically: we will be back. Well done to all the staff and thank you for a lovely stay. Everyone is cheerful and the good vibes of the hotel and the town are reason enough for a holiday. A wonderful introduction to Marrekech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudio A wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: If you are planning to get to know the Medina the Kasbah and the Souks I can't think of a better place to stay...It is right inside the Medina and yet unlike many other riads it has a beautiful and large inner garden. Established trees a heated 10mt swimming pool a beautiful and excellent restaurant with lovely and cheerful waiters great breakfasts..... The restaurant has an outdoor sitting area some of the rooms have a "split level" layout i.e. room (with fireplace)terrace & bathroom on one level large private terrace on the level above. It is all very private and quiet and yet withing walking distance of the main square (Jemaa el-Fnaa) and 15/20min from the airport. A Merci de tout coeur to the most helpful Smail Battahi (the Chef R√©ception) and all the personnel of the hotel and restaurant. And of course bravo et merci to the charming hotel director Christian Vesin. Au plaisir de vous revoir bient√¥t!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ali Moghtaderi wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Title: Very Great but with Few Problems!
Review_Text: We stayed here in the last days of October for a holiday. Les Jardins de la Medina is a 5 star hotel which provide real hotel services in a old traditional riad. You can stay in the heart of the medina and you can see real life of Marrakech people.    Our room was decorated very well and it was really good it has good beds and beautiful terrace but I think some things must be changed:    1- In a 5 star hotel famous toiletry amenities is a must. But here hotel's house keeping just fill shampoo shower gel and body milk in the glass bottles and you won't know what you are using.    2- Room's TV is very ordinary and there are not very choices    3- Hotel in-room coffee was not updated daily and when we asked for more they said it is done just once for your stay. It was a good brand coffee (illy) but I can't accept that a hotel with price of 220 euro per night don't update little thing like coffee.    Les Jardins de la Medina has a very beautiful pool in the center of Garden that is always busy and hotel's guests enjoyed it very much.    The staff helped us very kindly and tried to answer my questions and requests in the best way.    This hotel welcomed us very great fantastic and unique that I never see similar before. I don't write about the details because I want that you will be surprised like me!    Finally breakfast items are very few for a 5 star hotel all of them are delicious but you even can not find cream banana and nutella!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sherrill L wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel with the intamacy of a Riad exceptional service fabulous oasis gardens and a Restuarant up there with my favourite. The staff make this hotel so great from the moment you arrive they make you feel welcome and considered.  Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner my daughter (15 months) and I came away for a week to celebrate my partners birthday and escape winter in U.K for a week. Everything was perfect! Service food staff were so kind to baby!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Top location with very friendly management
Review_Text: we stayed there for 2 nights and it couldn`t have been any better. Big thank you to the friendly and always supportive stuff and management. I nice hideaway we highly recomment! Try the restaurant for dinner they serve a very good Harira...the best we had in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: While we enjoyed the security of this property and the excellent customer service...The staff is amazing! The hotel needs to update the menus...add more choices and provide menus for eating between breakfast/lunch/dinner. There is no outside food permitted on the premises and no alternatives offered...for purchase. Also the stray cats wandering around the courtyard and the one that wandered up to our door in the middle of the night was a major disturbance and made us uncomfortable. I have severe cat allergies and walked around on edge every day in fear that I would end up in the hospital.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nanna B wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Lovely! (But with space for some small improvements)
Review_Text: I really enjoyed our stay. I had one smaller bad experience in the restaurant one evening where it was diffucult to get to order and when the order suddenly came it could not live up to the price at all. I would reccomend to eat out of the Hotel but will sure recomend the hotel on a overall experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: cho J wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: This hotel is our favorite place in Marrakech. It is central absolutely gorgeous with impeccable service.  Our room was really great with access to a private rooftop (and an exterior shower which proved to be extremely useful!).  The pool is charming and beautiful.  The food at the hotel's restaurant was delicious as well although you will surely want to explore other restaurants in Marrakech as the Moroccan food is a real treasure.    Highly recommended !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice place for your First Marrakesh experience.
Review_Text: Nice check-in experience and tasteful authentic spotless rooms. Good breakfast choice and plenty of options to relax at either the pool or on the roof terrace. Dinner menu is a little bit limited but all very well prepared.    Some service delays and a bit of confusion around reservations is all that stops a five star rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The rugs in the room needed cleaning/replacing.  The wardrobes required attention.  There was an unpleasant odour which came into the room periodically.  The staff throughout the hotel were excellent!!  The food was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jeffrey p wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: A professionally run hotel set in gardens yet in the middle of the medina. The private owner ensures that the highest standards are maintained of both accommodation and food while the design is so well done that one can find nooks where one is alone giving the feeling that it is ones own private residence
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: elizabeth e wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: An Oasis!!! We stayed in Marrakech for 3 days before and 2 days after a Sahara tour. I found the Riads charming when researching and booked one for the 3 days. It was interesting but too quiet the pool was not used and it was just quirky. I felt like a house guest that the riad kept tabs on. After being exhausted from the heat and dirt of the desert we splurged and stayed at Les Jardins...seriously it seemed like walking into an oasis compared to the hustle and bustle of the city. It has everything you expect. We had a gorgeous romantic room with a terrace and dined at the restaurant. Breakfast was delicious especially the Moroccan pancakes with honey and almond syrup and fresh oj. The best thing about this place (compared to riads) is the large pool and gardens. We were tired of sightseeing so we lounged around in the sun and our room. However the location is within the medina and very walkable to Bahia palace and jma el fnaa square. I would recommend having the experience of a riad but come here before heading home to relax and recharge. Worth the money to have the comforts of home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Good solid reliable hotel. Good breakfasts and staff excellent but one was a bit sulky.  Pool area was good given it was a an old building and built for shade and coolness. Mini bar which can be expensive was very reasonable. On the whole a great experience and would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Pontius P wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: A memorable stay - for all the right reasons!
Review_Text: Together with another couple my wife and I stayed here for a week early in October for our first visit to Morocco. From the moment we arrived the reception and indeed all the staff were at all times welcoming helpful and friendly. I hope it is ok to single out the diligent and charming Yahya(sp?) in particular. Our room was spacious pristine and very well prepared each day with thoughtful touches such as fresh water rose petals on the bed etc being very well received. Al fresco Breakfast each morning was excellent and the evening meals we had in the restaurant or indeed mostly outside by the pool were superb without exception. All in all a 10/10 experience. We would stay again at Les Jardins without question. Thank you for your part in making our visit to Marrakech so enjoyable and memorable. W&R V.

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: A haven of relaxed hospitality in the city
Review_Text: This hotel is a lovely riad built around a central courtyard with garden at the southern end of the old Medina of Marrakech. The staff were all friendly welcoming and attentive. The garden is pleasantly cool and relaxing and there is a good sized swimming pool. The bedroom on the ground floor was spacious very comfortable and beautifully furnished. Nice touches included a complementary bottle of wine and complementary daily newspapers. WiFi was good throughout the hotel. Food was excellent and dining in the garden was a memorable experience. Overall this was a lovely hotel and I would recommend it as a haven of relaxed hospitality in the city of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A place of calm in the busy city. Beautiful gardens. Be sure to include the tower in your visit - it offers a high view of all Marrakesh. Even if you are not the type - watch the video on the aqueducts - it is fascinating!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gary W wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: My wife and I spent a short mid week break here and it was divine. We stayed in a mini suite which had ample space a large garden facing balcony and was well equipped and very quite considering the close proximity to the centre of the town. The pools were nice albeit the large patio pool was rather cold but the roof top pool was lovely. It was disappointing to find out that you had to pay 200DH to use the indoor pool and that should really be included.  Restaurants and cafe very good. Breakfast was plentiful in the surrounding gardens.  Rooms well kept with abundance of fresh roses each day.  Highly recommend this little oasis on a short break. It's a delight to come back to after a day in the bustle of the souks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dominique A wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Hidden away as most Riads in Marrakech this very nice quiet hotel is hidden in the Kasbah area of Marrakech away from the tourists. A real delight. A central oasis with a lovely swimming pool makes it very special to chill out after a day of sightseeing. Breakfast is very good lunch too. A hammam and massage is the cherry on the cake!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steven R wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: We first went to Les Jardins in 2011 on returning to Marrakech we could not stay anywhere else. Once again the welcome was warm and friendly. The check in process was easy and swift. The pool and courtyard area are a true Oasis from the hustle and bustle outside. Our Room had been decorated with Rose Petals and had candles burning a fantastic sight for 2 weary travellers. Since we were celebrating our 2nd Wedding anniversary the Hotel made an extra special effort glasses of Champagne a Hammam voucher and a Dinner voucher fantastic. Staff are all very friendly and helpful on odd occasions at Breakfast one had to try and find somebody but this did not detract from a wonderful stay and experience. Would we stay here again and recommend it you bet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Greg F wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Thank you for a very relaxing two days and you are an excellent base for touring the Medina. The only downside was the very squeaky door below room 129. Try lubricating it with olive oil !! very good staff and atmosphere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Gorgeous hotel in a brilliant location. An oasis in the bustle of the Medina. We stayed as a family of 5 for 5 nights for my 50th birthday. The staff were very helpful food excellent and the overall ambience was lovely. Will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had dinner here after walking around the medina. The garden was lovely very quaint and French feeling. Dinner was good though the portions were not that big. The service was polite. They were quite short staffed though so slowed up after the main course.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel Within Walking Distance of Everything.
Review_Text: The hotel is behind high walls which shut out the noise and bustle of the surrounding streets. The welcome was gracious and the staff were helpful. Our Sultana Suite was very comfortable and well appointed. Breakfast was good. We had one lunch and one dinner both of which were excellent with a good choice of Moroccan food. The pool area was lovely with lots of natural shade and the pool was immaculate. A feature of the hotel was the choice of places to relax including roof terraces a bar area and among the trees. The only things stopping this from being an excellent review were a small number of cleaning issues in the room slow service at lunch and a concierge service which was not as good as I would expect in this standard of hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Would highly recommend a visit to this stunning Riad in the centre of the old town. Pure luxury traditional spa and beautiful gardens a little hidden oasis. Although the restaurant menu is limited they are happy to make you something on request. Will be going again very soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The reviews on Les Jardins de la Medina are somewhat misleading. The Riad is quirky to say the least!  The first impressions are good beautiful oasis away from the madness of the Kasbah.  I‚Äôd like to highlight though that there is massive room for improvement in terms of customer service.    There was a complimentary drinks party held by the management during our stay. For some reason we never received an invitation and only found out about it ten minutes prior to it commencing. One assumes this is due to the fact we were two unaccompanied women. This was also noticeable when we either sat in the bar area or during meals. If there was a male present staff were far more attentive. We also pay the final account!    Food generally good although rather expensive. Prawn tempura 120MAD for four prawns!  On one occasion I was served a kitchen sponge along with my spring rolls! No apology given or discount just an explanation. Coffee accidentally poured over me at breakfast. No apologies for this either. Staff need to work on the observational skills and dexterity.    The room was adequate beds are comfortable. Pillows too soft but that‚Äôs probably more a personal issue. Cleaning could be improved.  Received a part used toilet roll one evening from a member of staff. Shower gel was not replenished and other bathroom items also not restocked. Maybe stock control is an issue? Towels are too small and generally poor quality.    Obviously there is a problem with drainage in this Riad. Perhaps a plumber required rather than choosing a room scent to mask the smell.    Advertising a gym is somewhat misleading. Three pieces of equipment in the garden!    Lack of information given on checking in. We were not told anything about times meals were served. No information given regarding check out time. Information regarding local tourist attractions and a map would be extremely useful.    Not on my recommended list!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Stanley. W. wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Nice location in the heart of the old town. Service was good very friendly and helpful during the stay. Will definitely come back next time in town. We had honeymoon in Marrakech and this hotel was definitely added value for our honeymoon. They had setup the room nicely with romantic elements we really appreciate it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brenda L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Rooms were quiet...and you could open the French door at night and enjoy the fresh air...the staff were very friendly and accommodating...I definitely would recommend a stay at this riad....the pool was well maintained and heated....remember it can be be cool at night ..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elise D wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Hidden gem right in the Medina
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at the Jardin de la Medina and had a wonderful stay. It's located only 15 minutes walk from the Jemaa el-Fna square within a nice area. It is perfect to escape from the busy and crowded city whenever you want. The staff was extremely nice and helpful. The room was well decorated with Moroccan style and very spacious. We had dinner once which was delightful. We also enjoyed a full hour hammam which was extremely nice and relaxing. The pool is pretty big compared to other riads which makes the difference. We had such a great stay and would totally recommend this place. We would definitely go back if we get the chance to travel to Marrakech again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Faizel L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: This hotel was simply wonderful in every aspect - from the warm welcome of the friendly staff the serene gardens that you can have a quiet moment in and the restaurant with its delicious menu to the tastefully decorated and spacious bedroom suite - everything was wonderful. Strongly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place to stay to see Marrakech
Review_Text: Great Spot in the Medina. Service very good but at the usual laid back Moroccan pace!! Great value for money. Would definitely recommend for anyone wanting to stay in the Medina and in a larger Riad/Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very professional and courteous staff providing a flawless service in a lovely setting. Although in the middle of the bustling kasbah still within reach of cabs should you wish to use them.  Garden very good sized pool and well appointed rooms make it an experience to repeat for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Adam F wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: nice place but not the most accommodating
Review_Text: The grounds are really nice and the staff is friendly until you complaint about anything. The AC was broken in our room the first 2 nights. They switched us out to a new room for the 2nd night while they repaired the AC but failed to mention there was a massive street party happening literally outside our windows. Very loud drumming till 4AM. When we tried to switch rooms again because of the noise they told us they had no more rooms avail and that we could go back to our room with no AC which we decided to do because it was so loud. They assured they‚Äôd move us off the street the following day. When I called the following evening to switch my room they said the hotel was sold out again and that they never promised us a new room. For such an expensive hotel I‚Äôm disappointed in what I paid for.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bruce H wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: All the amenities of a hotel with the charm of a riad. Compared to other riads the central courtyard is open and airy with palm trees terraces shady spots to relax and a good sized pool.    The riad has a good restaurant a bar with a terrace where you can relax on an evening but is also within walking distance of the old town should you want to explore.    The staff were very helpful and friendly and there is a good concierge service who are happy to book restaurants and organise trips many of which we found to be cheaper than the same trip found online.    The riad also has a spa offering hammam massages facials etc. We had a massage twice and found it to be very relaxing.    Couldn't fault our suite which was very comfortable and spacious.    One thing to mention is that we think it is less suitable for families with small children as most guests are couples and older groups looking for a quiet relaxing break.    We would thoroughly recommend this riad to anyone else. Our lasting memory is of walking through the doors from a hot and dusty medina to the cool courtyard and a wonderful smell of orange blossom.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Henry B wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: This is a world of its own in the busy medina and very conveniently situated.  The gardens are peaceful and relaxing with a plunge pool and outside dining tables.  The room we had above the old library was roomy and luxurious with lots of character.  Food was good and service friendly practical and helpful.  Also has an in house hammam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lucy R wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: A peaceful oasis away from the hubbub of the city
Review_Text: The layout of the hotel is amazing. The gorgeous pool in the centre the gardens to relax in and the rooms around the outside. It felt like all the rooms were hidden away in privacy and as you walked around you stumbled across courtyards balconys and a roof terrace. Blissful! The only reason I didn't give this hotel 5 is because I think the restaurant needs work. The service was very slow on a number of occasions we had a problem with the wine (we ordered a bottled and they poured it themselves and took the bottle away - not unusual - but then they tried to charge us for 6 glasses) and I think it is expensive for what you get.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vanessa B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina offers a first class and tranquil base from which to visit Marrakech. It is well situated in the Medina  nevertheless it is very quiet offers excellent food and service. There is a good sized pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David G wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We has a great week in Les Jardin de la Medina. It's a wonderful place to stay. Very relaxing great facilities and excellent staff. They provide a five star service in a relaxed and friendly environment.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carla C wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We were satisfied with our stay at the hotel. The hotel staff made us feel very welcome they were all very helpful & friendly all the time.  The food was delicious & service was great! I would highly recommend this hotel to all!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My daughter and granddaughter had a really happy time; lovely hotel and garden; Friendly and helpful staff; Cookery demonstration good and food delicious. Swimming pool good although difficult to get in and out - a rail would have been helpful. Only disappointment was hamman which should have been hotter.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Located in the Kasbah this hotel is built around a lovely tropical garden and is an oasis of calm and comfort. Our room (114 I think) was enormous. There are both a pool and restaurant here. Best of all the hotel was very accommodating in arranging a guide for us and making some restaurant/taxi reservations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was staying in this Riad for 4 nights. It is a really beautiful place with friendly staff. Good Location you can walk easily to the medina. It has a really good restaurant with delicious Moroccan and international food. Nice quiet pool for those who want to relax under the sun and besides a nice garden. It has an almost big room with a terrace. Room service was good. Certainly I enjoyed staying there and my cousin will also visit the hotel next month.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Hello thank you very much for the beautiful holiday in your hotel.  It was very nice. Everything excellent.  I want come in another time again. It was like a paradise.    The breakfast and the food was delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Oscar M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Nice situation inside the Medina near of everything. Wonderfull atmosphere nice swimming pool and amenities. The service is the best from the Reception Restaurant SPA and room services. Very very clean and safe. It was a great surprise! The music at evening is wonderful as the Breakfast. You must make an Hammam on the SPA. If I come back to Marrakech will not choose other than this Hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Unwelcome to anyone not actually a guest.
Review_Text: Ok so my partner and I were visiting the area and staying in a riad nearby. We read some lovely reviews of this hotel and wanted to check out the facilities for next years BIG DAY. to which we will be returning to the area with over 20 guests as a wedding party. we stayed in the area to check out the many 5* hotels in the area for this occasion. We turned up one day to have lunch and use the facilites at the resort. We were a little surprised to held in reception while they checked the pool availabliity as there was literally NO one at the pool. we were expecting to have lunch to use the facilities and this was fine. we were happy to pay for this. and initially all was fine a beautiful looking hotel with lovely gardens like an oasis in the middle of the hustle and bustle. we thought we had found the place we would be returning to. we enjoyed lunch and the use of the pool. We did feel a little uneasy only by the glares we received from a few of the staff...im guessing as we were day visitors. anyway we decided to return the next day as we enjoyed ourselves and wanted to check now on availability for next year. ....to our surprise we were met by a very stuck up and rude woman on the front desk who looked at us like trash. we were then told we could not use the facilites again and they were full??? strange. again pool area empty.! she said we could have lunch but nothing more. we felt very looked down upon and unwelcome. Im so glad we went back this time and met this awful woman or we may of booked here and been let down next year. The staff i found far to stuck up and and we never returned. we have since found an amazing oasis just a short distance away called Tigmazi i would recommend anyone to use that hotel instead...and there spa is amazing!! staff were amazing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was such a relief to step through the doors of this hotel after a hot hectic day exploring Marrakech and relax in the garden next to the pool. The hotel does a great job balancing history and modern comfort. The room was simple but nice there's so much space on the property to hang out without feeling like you're on top of other guests. I also liked that it was within walking distance of everything we wanted to do so we didn't have to take a cab the whole time we were there. Just know it's a good 15-20 minute walk up to the main square. This only became a problem when we were trying to carry two carpets with us back from the medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alicia I wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: I stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina with my boyfriend for 5 nights and it is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.    The hotel is quite small (only 36 rooms) and has a very boutique feel to it. We stayed in one of the 'patio' rooms which was spacious and immaculately kept throughout our stay. The bed was enormous and very comfortable. The hotel staff also decorated the room with rose petals daily making it a very couple orientated hotel.    The pool was beautiful and very serene. Plenty of shade provided by the palm trees surrounding the pool but also spots of sun. There are also various secluded spots around the hotel if you wanted more privacy.    The hotel is located about a 20 minute walk from the Medina and is away from the madness of the Souks. Taxis are reasonably priced if you want to go further afield and the hotel staff were very helpful in booking these.    Overall we had a wonderful stay and would thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sabine H wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: "Les Jardins de la Medina" is located down-town of Marrakech in the Kasbah district close to the Royal Palace and just a few minutes walk to the famous Djema el Fna square and its colorful markets. It‚Äôs a magic place hidden behind walls 3000 sqm gardens with orange olive and jacaranda trees. Les Jardins de la Medina combines the comfort of a modern hotel with the refinement of traditional architecture of the 19th century. There is a restaurant featuring Moroccan and international cuisine bar swimming pool relaxation room with WiFi a fully equipped wellness center beauty salon traditional barber shop fitness area Hamam. We had a wonderful Moroccan dinner party at the pool spent hours in the Haman at the pool and in the garden. Its quiet and relaxing!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: GOCIU B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: My experience was one of the most beautiful. Starting with the staff continue with the food. I told them that here I tried for the first time most of the ingredients. I recommend with all my heart the hotel. You will be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had a great 3 night stay at the hotel  Everything was exactly how the web site describes it.  If I had to pass any negative comments there are 2 tiny tiny ones:  1. The used Towels around the swimming pool were not cleared away giving the impression that beds were being used when in fact they wasnt.  2. My wife and I found that they had a roof terrace where you could sit and enjoy the Sun going down  it would have been nice if the staff had given us a short tour of the Hotel on our arrival.  As i say these are 2 minor points something that can be sorted very quicly  they would not styop me going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jenny M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We had a fantastic weekend... great location and very good service. The room was spotless and the little touches really made it. The driver we had was fantastic.    Food wasn't amazing but was like an oasis in the madness outside
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tudor V wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: If You want to have a great Holiday in medina - old Marrakech  this ryad is really fantastic. Old morrocan traditional style building very clean rooms great personnel and service  food is impecable. Great place to relax and to taste the Best of Morroco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Louise C wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Myself and my friend had a hammam in this hotel which was lovely we then enjoyed the pool and had had a Moroccan salad and a mozzarella and tomato salad. Both of us had food poisoning from this we were vomiting and had diarrhoea that night and for days afterwards. I informed the hotel of this but did not receive any response from them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We absolutely loved this hotel. It was the perfect oasis to escape the seeming chaos. The service was very accommodating and friendly. Good central location - you can get to many of the main areas of interst for about $5.00 USD.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely friendly staff. Beautifully fitted bedroom with lovely balcony over the gardens. Food very good lunched here everyday best chicken Tajine I had during my stay. Service relaxed but efficient. Massages excellent. Wifi good. Pool lovely. Fresh water in the room daily . Highly recommend this Rihad you will not be dissapointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Roberta D wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: The internet service is complicated. You receive a new password every 2 days.  The breakfast service was always running late and it was slow. The breakfast is supposed to start at 7am but the buffet and the tables would be ready around 7:30/7:40am.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve V wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: We stayed 5 nights in this beautiful rIAD our room was comfortable secluded and shady with a balcony and huge bathroom. The Riad situated in a good location and within easy walking distance of all the main attractions historical sites and restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil C wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Beautiful Gardens. Hard to believe it exist so close to the mad rush of Marrakech Medina, Souqs etc
