Review_Text: Spent a lovely morning here and even though popular and busy it was so peaceful and calm compared to the rush of the souqs on previous day. Well worth a visit. Stopped and just sat in shade and watched the world go by. Had a drink in the cafe and but got some lunch in a restaurant just 2 mins walk outside the gardens at Pause Gourmand which was very good.    Tip for taxi in case you need one. We took a taxi from our Riad in .Medina and paid 30 MAD to get there. To get a return back my tip is do not waste your time with the Taxi drivers at the garden entrance. The taxi drivers there started with 100 MAD to go back. I am fine for this to be the standard negotiating start price but three times I agree a price of 40 MAD as I was happy to accept they pay for some parking while they wait but each time the driver dumped us as we walked to car his while he tried a different customer alking put of gardnens.    So we just walked away to the T junction and picked up a taxi on road who had just dropped off custom rs. I got it for 40 MAD but could probably have push d harder but it was very hot and wanted to get going. We still had to haggle for price up front and once I walked away thIs taxi called me back and agreed my "dernier prix" of 40 MAD.

Fabulous little oasis in the medina but step off the street into the hotel and you are in another world. Garden and pool lovely to have proper outside space but still so central and within walking distance of everything. Staff delightful and I can not recommend my cookery lesson with the chef highly enough!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julia B wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Excellent hotel in the very city center
Review_Text: In the very city center we found this calm oasis with excellent services and especiallx food. The patio is dominated by a huge garden and a lovely big swimming pool in the middle. If you wouldn't know better you would never believe that behind the doors you are in the center of marrakech. It is the perfect place to take a breath relax and enjoy. I will definitely return to this hotel at my next stay in marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: On arrival you are taken by complete surprise as you enter a beautiful garden /oasis which is the centre of the hotel . The staff are very helpful .Our room was beautiful and over looked the swimming pool and garden . The food was exceptional
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Angelroth C wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Very nice place.  A french direction but not a snobbish one.  The Staff is just perfect. You can ask them everything.  The gargen is beautiful.  You have a royal room.  Outside you are directly in the Kasbah. You can park your car not far away from the hotel.  You will meet nice people around the swimming pool...  Go there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Todd C wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: This charming riad/hotel in the Kasbah could not have been any more comfortable and turned out to be a wonderful choice in Marrakech. The strongest point was certainly the warm friendliness of the staff but the tasty food in the restaurant also deserves compliments. Moroccan hospitality will never change! Leaving on an early flight this morning and the hotel geacefully arranged a pre-dawn breakfast for us and transportation to the airport. I surely plan to return to the Jardins de la Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Debi B wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: A beautiful oasis in a amazing city
Review_Text: I was going to stay at another riad for the first part of my trip and they closed a few days before I arrived. Les Jardins de la Medina was able to accomadate us and I am so thankful! I will be back for sure and recommend this amazing place to anyone going to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: entrance through a small door from the dust n heat of the street into a oasisgreen trees cool air peace n quite  found the best hotel staff cant do enough for you rooms are large and comfy  good pool roof top lounges DINNER BY THE CHEF IS TO DIE FOR beer n wine sold here  ¬£5.00 taxi or 20 min walk to the big market square
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Filipa M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Calm and relaxing hotel to stay in Marrakesh.  15 min walk from Jemaa el Fna. Taxis reach the door which is a plus ( not all the Hotels in the Medina are accessible by car).  This Hotel combines the beauty of a Riad with a bigger swimming pool so you can have the best experience at your stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina was a lovely place to stay. Located in a great spot walking distance to the square. Rooms pool food and gardens were all above expectations and was very well priced. I would stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Jan C wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Me and my girlfriend were looking for a pool in Marrakech to cool down from the burning sun. We found out that 'Les Jardins de la medina' could be a good place. We asked the staff if we could use the pool if we had lunch there. This wasn't a problem and they friendly showed us our table next to the pool. A beautiful  quite place between the trees and birds. After lunch we enjoyed the beautiful pool and hot sun while the staff made sure we had everything we needed. Great place!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautiful hotel a little oasis of calm in a bustling Medina. We were in a Sultane room which was very roomy quiet and beautifully decorated. The pool was lovely and much needed in the heat. The food in the restaurant was delicious- my only negative was the service in the bar/restaurant very slow at times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sharon M wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: Fabulous oasis of calm and luxury
Review_Text: Beautiful surroundings immaculate well equipped rooms superb service good food wonderful hammam and spa experience pool and gardens a delight well located can't recommend highly enough. We loved being in these lovely surroundings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Mark D wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: This is a great Riad in great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a cocktail party on our day of arrival including selected drinks and finger food as well as entertainment. Rooms also quite large and well equipped. Pool fantastic on hot Summer days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The place was lovely. The room beautiful. The air-conditioning was a disaster. The fan was way too slow to be effective. Everything else was very good. The staff were so very halpful. We hope to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From reading previous reviews it is possibly a clich√© to say that this hotel is the epitome of peace and quiet away from the hustle bustle and heat of Marrakech.  The welcome is warm and friendly and the accommodation luxurious and spacious.  Room service is attentive with an evening turndown.  The restaurant and pool area is an oasis and a relaxing place to sit.  Breakfast has a reasonable choice and service is good  The dinner menu is varied and the food excellent.  There is also a good drinks and wine list.  The one slight negative was that service was a little slow in the evenings both for drinks and dinner although Ramadam may have been an influencing factor.  During the day there is the opportunity to relax by the pool although the extent of the foliage does mean that there can be a surplus of shade.  For trips excursions and taxis reception provides a comprehensive and helpful service.  Overall the staff accommodation and grounds make this a gem of a hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Situated in the heart of Marrakesh this simply stunning riad defines tranquility. Each room is unique with beautiful decor with personal touches including rose petals and choice of pillow scents with spectacular views of the city. With attentive staff and tantalising food our stay will be pleasurably remembered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My wife and I with our two daughters have stayed at Le Jardins de la Medina three nights to celebrate our 35th anniversary. It was just amazing. We are privilege to travel a little everywhere in Europe Asia and North America and this was one of the best hotels where we have staying. The secret: an elegant unpretentious cozy familiar extremely clean highly friendly lovely and beautiful hotel.  The garden full of perfumes is the main living room with an extremely nice not large pool to refresh from the Morocco heat. Both rooms were beautiful having my wife and I a room with a traditional wood ceiling. So beautiful.  Breakfast was also a great experience. No words to describe such a great stay in the best of Morocco famous hospitality.  Our congratulations to the management always asking is everything is fine and all the nice staff. Just hope to return soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We have visited Marrakesh 6 times now stayed in all the best hotels this hotel did not disappoint. Very good location away from the centre but only 10 mins in a taxi. The hotel  Is gorgeous very pretty set in a very lovely garden with wildlife all around. Our room was clean and very big.Breakfast was excellent. The only downfall that we experienced was the service around the pool... no one comes round offering to take drink orders and it took 40 mins after I went to the bar to bring me a plate of fruit and 2 drinks apart from this everything was very very good. We would come back excellent value for money. Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tommaso A wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina are a great choice in Marrakech. They offer all you might need to rest after a long day in the souqs or a long walk to admire the city's highlights. The room was great spacious and with fantastic beds. You also have a private small terrace and a full sized open shower. The garden is peaceful and the center pool is clean and refreshing never too crowded. But even the sun has its dark spots and breakfast service has room for improvement. All in all I'd absolutely come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A hotel that treated us like old friends and with the utmost professionalism at the same time. Nothing was too much trouble and all delivered with a friendly and genuine care. The setting the rooms the food the staff - all were fabulous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely riad  great breakfasts and very friendly waitstaff helped me out with my Arabic!  However I would be careful what room I booked. We backed onto side street which was very noisy so could not have windows open at night which was unfortunate as our air conditioning did not work - despite having " been looked at". This made the nights uncomfortably warm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nancy O wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: The friendly staff; the gorgeous gardens and the lovely rooms make this place a treasure! We were sad to leave (after six days) and will recommend Les Jardins to all friends traveling to Marrakech. DO be sure to take advantage of the first-rate massages offered by Iman.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Terry S wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We arrived relatively late in the evening but still received a very warm welcome and were told not to panic about dinner they would serve us when we were ready. This calm and gentle welcome was just the start of an amazing five days at this fantastic Hotel.    We dined on two evenings and one luncheon at the Hotel unheard of for us as normally the food is either mediocre or very expensive. The food was fabulous beautifully presented fresh tasty interesting and very good value.    We'd like to single out members of staff but there isn't space as they were all fabulous attentive but discreet and not overbearing friendly but professional. Our French is not great but that didn't cause a problem. Most front of house staff speak excellent English and if they don't understand some complex request they aren't afraid to get someone else who does speak perfect English.    The room was beautiful the Hotel beautiful the gardens beautiful alright I'm using the same words over and over but I just can't rate the whole experience high enough.    True it is not really cheap probably certainly not for Marrakech but compared to British prices this is a five star top London Hotel for a Motel price!    The location is at the Southern end of the Kasbah so not that central but only a fifteen minute walk on the flat to the main square. However that does mean that when you return from the mad hustle and bustle of Marrakech to the calm quiet tranquillity of the gorgeous gardens you really appreciate the peace.    We've stayed in some lovely Hotels and some of the top ones but this place exceeds all and we will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great choice to stay in the Medina
Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and everything is of good taste and charming. We stay at the Sultane room which was amazing. A very nice room with a small balcony and a living room. The bed is wonderful. Very nice sleep we have there. In the check in you choose a flavour for your room smell. Nice touch!  The breakfast is served at the hotel restaurant with a nice space in the garden. Lot of variety of fruits breads and eggs.  The pool is nice and the gardens of the hotel have a lot of spots where you can relax or read a book.  We also have a very nice dinner at the restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stefania Bravi wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: I went at Les Jardins de la Medina in April with my boyfriend and it was fantastic. Our room was big really nice and clean. You have to try also the restaurant one of the best in Marrakech for us and the SPA. We had a relaxing massage. A special thanks to Amina and all the staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is our fourth visit to Les Jardins de la Medina. It has never disappointed and was as excellent on this trip as it was on our first 20 years ago. Sevice rooms food and ambiance all delightful. we will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We loved our stay here . Waking up to the bird chorus in the morning in the beautiful garden was a heavenly delight. Our room was perfect with little porch and terrace . It is friendly and the staff lovely and helpful . The breakfasts were wonderful . I am a pure vegetarian so having savoury breakfast of different veg  beans tomatoes cheese and fresh fruit juices was excellent . We were fortunate to get a good deal for 3 days otherwise probably too expensive for us but I really hope we can return . It was our 10 th anniversay treat  very romantic and so enjoyed relaxing and reading around the lovely pool . I loved the fresh roses everywhere and choice of perfume for your room . They clean and tidy the room at least twice a day !! There is a bar and good restaurant too. Being in the Kasbah was a bit more relaxed than in the medina . Cafe Cloak is just around the corner for veg choices etc and is fun . The only thing I didnt like was the false grass by pool and terrace . Please get rid of it ! Anyway thanks for the lovely stay we thoroughly enjoyed it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeanette B wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: Five days here and you feel rejuvenated and refreshed. Everything was wonderful from the rose petals on the bed and on the towels to the quiet terraces great restaurant and excellent discreet service
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary F wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: A haven of tranquility within the bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights in this beautiful hotel our room was comfortable secluded and shady with a balcony and huge bathroom. A nice touch was that they scented it with amber after giving us a choice of 4 scents and this added to the relaxing atmosphere. There are lots of quirky seating areas to avoid the heat and a roof top terrace for sun lovers. The swimming pool is a little small for exercise but nice to sit around and order snacks or drinks. The restaurant food is good but a bit limited after 3 days. You can walk to the souk and main tourist areas but you need to be careful of the many scooters bikes and other traffic which hurtles around. It was a relief to walk back through the door to the peace and tranquility of the riad and enjoy a massage in the spa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Like a oriental fantasy beautiful architecture fantastic garden complete with pool and turtles. Very friendly staff marvelous breakfast with a lot to choose from. I can do nothing but recommend this riad that must be one of the best in the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Gary L wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed one night prior to departure having stayed the previous week in another riad in Marrakech and in the Atlas mountains.  Very attractive gardens and surroundings and the deluxe room was excellent with a complimentary bottle of wine (although the shower drainage was blocked).  Overall this is more of a westernised riad and a halfway house between a normal hotel and traditional riad and probably suitable for those who want to be gently introduced to the Moroccan culture.    The only disappointment was the dinner which was a fixed price four course set menu so no choice and you paid the same whether you had one or four courses. The menu was relatively expensive.The courses were skimpy to say the least and relatively unappetising. The dining room staff were surly and slow and seemed to be arguing amongst themselves at times. One could not help but think that things were not happy in the background. Even if the staff have disagreements it is unprofessional to let the clients see them.  Having said this by contrast the front of house staff and management were very friendly and helpful..  The breakfast and lunch the following day were good. So maybe the dinner chef had an off day.    The hotel was very accommodating as the check out was 12.00 mid-day and the taxi pickup for the airport was at 7.30pm. We stayed around the pool at the hotel and had shower and changing facilities for when we finally left.  Because we like to experience more of the traditional culture we would probably stay in a traditional riad next time. However this would suit those who like a more western feel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I bought a cheap Easyjet holiday to Marrakech - flights and 3 nights at the Riad Africa for 2 people for approx ¬£430! And although everything was fine and the hotel was clean it just wasn't beautiful and in Marrakech you need beauty. Marrakech is a fascinating place but let's be honest the beauty is all to be found behind closed doors behind high walls. You need to know where it is and when you find it it takes your breath away but if you don't now where you're going and just wander Marrakech aimlessly you won't t come away and say it's beautiful.    And so we moved to the Jardins de la Medina and had beauty aplenty. It was a little further away from the Djemaa el Fna than Riad Africa had been and it was just that bit more pleasant in the surrounding streets. But the hotel itself is simply gorgeous. A total refuge from the madness in the city beyond. The pool is gorgeous; there is a beautiful roof top terrace from which you can see the Atlas mountains. The food was fantastic. I think that it is very important to have this type of refuge while in Marrakech. It's kind of crazy out there and it made all the difference to my view of the city that I had this luxury and beauty to retreat to after hours walking around in the medina.    We had a beautiful room with two terraces; one just outside our room and a second up some stone steps with a hammock. Just blissful. I would come back here in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Grace F wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Perfect location, beautiful hotel and excellent service
Review_Text: The location is perfect to enjoy all the cultural visits Marrakesh has to offer. The room was comfortable with a great bathroom. The service was excellent. The hotel grounds are beautiful. I look forward to visiting this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: david m wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful quiet garden impeccable roomy bedrooms and bathrooms excellent food and service. I am not sure what else I can say: there was really nothing to criticise and I would very happily return there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a great hotel! The staff are very professional and efficient. The hotel is set in beautiful grounds - trees everywhere lovely pool birds singing. We had a garden room with a terrace which was worth paying extra for. Breakfast is excellent - a lot of choice and tasty food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris A wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Willy's Sixtieth at Les Jardins de la Medina - Marrakech - Morocco
Review_Text: My wife & I celebrated our friend Willy's sixtieth birthday together with his his wife three children & three other couples for three days - April 8th through 11th 2017 - at les Jardins de la Medina. The hotel its interior gardens & friendly staff afforded us a most enjoyable & rewarding experience. We would certainly recommend the Jardins de la Medina !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sophie R wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: Peaceful hotel in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: On arrival we were greeted with Moroccan mint tea and were asked to choose from one of four fragrances for our room. Little touches like this continued throughout our stay and really made our trip special. Both dinner at the hotel and breakfast was excellent lots of choice and beautifully presented. The hotel offers a welcome slice of peace and tranquility in the busy city of Marrakech and is a must-visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: James L wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: This hotel is an old Riad built for a prince many years ago but even with modernisation it has maintained many of the old features.  The rooms were spacious we had a garden room with a little court yard sitting area which was shaded and just off the bedroom and a further sun area up some steps with a view over the whole Riad. We did not try the pool as the weather was a little cool when when the sun was out it was very pleasant on our roof.  The staff were fabulous couldn't have been more helpful. All of them were multi lingual so communication was not a problem. We had maid service to the room twice a day the latter visit was for a bed turn down and emptying the bins and the like.  Their was plenty to explore within the Riad with little knooks and crannies here and there. We were given a guided tour on out first day to orientate ourselves.  The Riad is about 30 minutes walk from the main square and it is all easy going as Marrkech is on the flat.  The breakfast and dining area was lovely with the ability to sit under an awning for breakfast and inside in the evening. When hotter an outside option is available as the tables were in place.  The Riad has 36 rooms around three sides of the building and didn't seem to be crowded even though all the rooms were occupied.  My only gripe is that the evening meal took to long in coming and I have no idea why as earlier in our stay the place ran like clockwork and we were not allowed to stay looking at empty plates for long. Toward the end of our stay the service in this part of the building needed to sharpen up.  Would I go again yes I would and my wife agrees but we would try and go a little later in the year say about late April to May. We would not want to go in the high summer as last year the temperatures rose to 45 pulse degrees Celsius and that's just too hot!  The Riad was quiet inside the high walls so road noise was not a problem.  A nice touch was that we were asked to chose a scent for our pillows out of choice of four. The room also had a incense burner in the bathroom which gave the room a fabulous smell which was not overpowering. It was the usual tea light candle variety.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A most delightful Riad in the Medina situated in a good location and within easy walking distance of all the main attractions historical sites and restaurants. As soon as you step inside you feel transported into a very special place away from all the hustle and bustle of the Imperial city. The excellent service and friendly staff ensured a most relaxing time. Thank you for a wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. As we were celebrating a 'big' birthday the hotel very kindly upgraded us to the most stunning room with our own private terrace area free bottle of red wine and Moroccan 'nibbles'.  The hotel itself is amazing and a pure piece of heaven away from the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech. It was a delight to return to this sanctuary of chirping birds scent of jasmine and gentle sound of the fountain after the chaos of the main centre. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. Nothing is too much trouble for them. The ladies on the reception (sorry but I don't know their names!) were particularly helpful and very professional.  The hotel even has a few tortoises which wander up and down the garden area...watch out for the smaller one as he gets about and is particularly speedy!!  Thank you all at Les Jardins for our amazing stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The most hidden beautiful boutique hotel in Marrakech.  Amazing staff and truly 5*  Can't wait to go again!  I have visited this hotel three times and each time it improves  There was a beautiful cocktail party with an amazing magician this time.  This is a place of beauty and tranquility and exceptional service all round.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: For us this was a great holiday the staff are always so friendly and helpful the room was bright and clean. The Riad itself is quite close to the centre of town a little walk but not a problem as we felt very safe there even walking back late at night.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent the first weekend in March in this beautiful place and were blown away by the whole experience. Staff was really friendly and the whole place was so peaceful and relaxing. Hotel is really central and rather a little secret that you wouldn't expect from the outside a magical place to have a rest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Situated in the Kasbah the entrance is doorway set into the wall of a narrow street. Entering into a reception area you are given a warm welcome. Formalities over we were ushered into the bar area and supplied with small cups of milk and dates mint tea followed shortly. One lovely touch was the choosing of the linen spritz.    The bar and restaurant looks out onto a beautiful lush garden area which really is an oasis. There is a heated swimming pool with plenty of loungers. Our room was big and airy with a small balcony.    The bathroom was huge laid out beautifully with rose petals scattered on the towels with an excellent shower    The restaurant is divided into a more formal area and a more relaxed garden/conservatory area. The lunch menu has a good selection of dishes the pear pine nut and chicken tagine was wonderful    The more formal men of the evening has a combination of Moroccan dishes and international choices. The one evening meal we had was good but more expensive than other restaurants of a similar standard.    The service in the bar and restaurant was polite professional and very attentive.    Housekeeping was of a high quality as was the maintenance of the garden areas.    Breakfast buffet included a delicious selection of fruits fresh orange juice and a hot station if you want eggs pancakes or omelette.    There was is a beauty centre (try the argon oil pedicure blissful).    The WIFI was excellent and available everywhere in the hotel.    The hotel arranged for a guide for a tour through the Medina and souk together with taxis.    It was a relaxing atmosphere sphere and really good value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mel B wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Very nice hotel a little quirky in a good way. Calm and peaceful atmosphere and nice pool area for a city hotel. Restaurant was good but very pricey compared to others around. However there were no other quality restaurants on the doorstep. Clockwork Cafe is 1 minute walk good food but as the name suggests more cafe like. Kasbah Cafe was 5 mins away. If you're looking for restaurant style food its a good 10/15 minutes walk or go to one of the other nearby Riads.    The walk to the main square is around 15 minutes (Mosque 10 mins) and the road you walk up can be a bit intimidating at first if you walk up in the evening but once you get used to it its all ok and nothing to worry about. Mind out for cars and bikes which zoom around. Its only partly touristy with a lot of genuine local shops.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Corvus corax wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: I'm not crazy about this place. We booked for dinner on our first night in Marrakech on this visit (we've been often before though not to this restaurant/hotel). When booking we received a stern but fair response that if we were going to be late we must tell them. This would have been fair enough if they were expecting us. Despite our booking we got no sense that they were. Rather we had to order a drink at the bar and then were forgotten. Forty minutes later we had to find a waitress to ask for a table. We were seated then forgotten again.    We had one course each only. I ordered a dish of potatoes layered with cod. It was edible just but amazingly it contained neither potatoes nor cod. The carbs instead were supplied by a kind of pancake which was OK if a little cold except that it tasted as though it was cooked in oil that was turning rancid. The fish - there WAS some fish unlike the phantom potato - was a white fish probably freshwater. It was certainly not cod (I eat a lot of fish and know my gadoids). I think it was probably catfish - in the U.K. often called River Cobbler - or tilapia. I should have sent it back but I was famished and by then it was late.    We chose some good wine and my companion was reasonably happy - only reasonably mind - with her food.    Would I go again? For a drink maybe. Not for dinner. Service was poor food worse than poor and the menu a downright lie.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew W wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We came for dinner only as we were staying further into the Medina. That said the meal was fantastic as was the service. The saffron ice cream over orange marinated carrots was eye popping and my raz el hanout was the perfect celebratory meal.    More than that we were waited on hand and foot with service that was warm friendly and personal without being intrusive. Knowing it was our honeymoon the staff arranged a special table by the fire with a candelabra and a bottle of wine. A really fantastic night at what were incredibly reasonable prices for the quality of the food. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely relaxing setting. Pretentious pushy macho staff. Lunch menu √† la carte (no prix fixe (?)) pricy but decent food. Wines to be avoided unless you're ready to spend ‚Ç¨9/glass of 15cl. Local Beer ‚Ç¨650.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michal M wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: a small hotel in the old city of Marrakech within a few walking minutes of the Royal Palace and the colourful markets.  We had a standard room which is very spacious and includes a balcony overlooking the riad - the internal courtyard which is lush with greenery and shields you from others giving you privacy.  Excellent and attentive service (most of the time and slow at times) friendly staff will make reservations for you at their restaurant or others outside. We loved it
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This lovely restaurant was recommended by the hotel we were staying in. Situated in the Medina amidst the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh we were surprised to find this restaurant hidden away behind a large wooden door. On arrival we were warmly welcomed at reception and taken through to a delightful dining room. The service was very good and the food excellent. We had a mixture of food from traditional Moroccan to Thai and French it was all delicious....  A small but good selection of wine was available.  Overall the prices were reasonable considering the quality of the food.  After dinner we wondered around the hotel grounds which had outside heaters and ground floor rooms overlooking the pool and very pretty gardens.  I would highly recommend this restaurant to anyone visiting Marrakesh. It will certainly be at the top of the list for our next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: This was my second time staying at Les Jardins de la Medina. We absolutely love it. The rooms are comfortable spacious and varied. It doesn't matter which floor you are on you always have a fabulous view of the garden. The service is excellent and the staff are friendly and helpful. The food in the restaurant is very good but they could do with a proper cocktail list. The pool is lovely and gardens have secret places to sit privately and read. You can walk to everything you want to see in the medina. I would highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Chris V wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: We were wandering around the Medina with nothing particular in mind and came upon this place. We were a bit dubious bexause all that was visible was a door and a menu. The sign on the door said to press the buzzer and push. Once inside it really is like finding an oasis.    We thought at first that it was just a restaurant then realised that it was also a hotel.    We had one of the best meals that we havwe had for a long time. It was one of those meals were evry mouthful was bliss and you just did not want it to end.    Amongst the palm tree and garden is a beautiful pool gym and spa.    After our meal we chilled by the pool and had a look around. The ambience is fantastic and the staff are very friendly and the service is impeccable.    I would highly recommend this restaurant and I am sure that the hotel is just as good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful Riad calm and quiet in a busstling city. Perfect location for exploring Marrakech. Food was excellent we had most meals in hotel during a weeks stay. Love the rooftop terrace with views of Atlas Mountains. Hope to be back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jackie K wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Title: An outstanding boutique hotel in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: Returning to Les Jardins de la Medina was like coming home! We had first stayed at this charming boutique hotel some years ago and as soon as we walked through the door we were welcomed by the friendly staff who recognised us straight away. Les Jardins de la Medina is an exceptional riad-style hotel set amongst one of the largest private gardens in the old town. Orange and lemon trees singing birds a heated pool an amazing bar and restaurant friendly and attentive staff not to forget our fabulous stay in the romantic Sultana suite complete with its own small private courtyard garden. Located in the Kasbah an interesting but less hurried part of the medina we had come celebrate my husband's birthday and this proved to be the perfect venue for us! We will be back again soon we hope!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Canceled my reservation 3 days before Arrival
Review_Text: Unfortunately I wouldn't know if this place is nice because they canceled my reservation just three days before I would arrive and after I had already begun my travels. I made sure to book this reservation months before since it was a popular time to travel and many places were fully booked. Once I received the notification I had to frantically look for another place. Strangely when I was looking for a new place Les Jardins de la Medina showed as having availability. I went with another place that ended up being wonderful but I would advise caution when booking here as their reservation system seems to be not very organized.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: James H wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: A beautiful riad with an unspoilt character and a peaceful garden where it is very pleasant just to do nothing. Helpful staff a good restaurant and a spacious and comfortable room.A hotel with great charm.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A relaxing oasis in the Medina
Review_Text: Spent an amazing 5 days here on a last minute getaway. First time in Morocco so decided to have a little treat in case Marrakech was as crazy as some reviews made out. On arrival there is just a door onto a street as many riads in the Medina are but once you get through it is as if you are transported to another world. You a warmly welcomed with a sweet milk some pastries hot towel and your first taste of mint tea. As our flight arrived so early our room was not ready but we were allowed into another room to get changed and relax at the pool with all our belongings moved into our actual room once ready. We had a solarium room with a private balcony and room terrace - if you like to sunbathe this is the perfect room as with the pool being in the centre of the complex it was in the shade by mid-afternoon but with the roof terrace there was an extra couple of hours of sun to catch. The gardens are lush and it really feels like an oasis and the pool is a large treat. We needed a twin room (which any of the rooms can be converted into) although the housekeeper often put the beds back together. Breakfast contained a great selection of pastries and other items including amazing orange juice and interesting other fresh juices. We also had dinner one night and the food was delicious. All the staff were fantastic with just the right level of friendly attentivness. Location wise you're a 15 - 20 min walk to the main square (Jeema-al-Fna) and close by many of the other sights. You will get lost on multiple occasions and hassled by people trying to show you for money or sell you stuff. It can be helpful to have a walking tour to help orientate you although be warned you end up being taken in a number of "markets". But no matter how crazy it is outside the hotel it all seems to melt away once you get through the door. Overall the hotel made the trip perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: You would even know there was a city going on outside.
Review_Text: My wife and I spent Christmas here and have only postive things to say. It was in fact our honeymoon and the attention given to us was first class. Everything was so wonderfully presented and prepared for us. We made made to very very special and very welcome.  The staff at the front of the ouse were extremely efficient and acomodating and the room themselves had a very magical feel.  The restaurant was very goodand the staff excellent and dilligent; including the table enteratinment in the form a a stealthy magician.  I would recommend the hotel as a romantic spot in the heart of the hustle and bustle of the very animated city. You would even know there was a city going on outside.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A small paradise in the hearth of the Medina with a highly professional and friendly staff. In addition the facilities are modern but with an authentic style. The luxuriant garden is so peaceful and the rooftop solarium provides you with an amazing view of this enchanting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: December 2016 - Great Hotel, Close to Medina
Review_Text: It is a great hotel in the thick of things. The food was simply superb. Rooms were spacious. The people were great. Breakfast was a veritable spread and included local items to sample. Dinner choices were great and the service was extraordinary. The location is great as it is walking distance to the Souks. From the outside it does not look like much but open the door to experience great luxury in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: It is an hotel that serves lunchs and dinners at its terrasse. It is in an extrem of la Medina but it is a ideal option to relax with the sound of birds and at the shadow of the trees. We tasted the fish of the day (saint Pedro) and it was really good.  It's not expensive and thay have several options of wines.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sabina S wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Title: superbe oasis de paix, excellent service
Review_Text: We enjoyed the excellent service and welcoming attitude of staff. Food and wine wee also excellent and the garden is really lovely. We went back for a second visit before leaving Marrakesh... and just hope we'll be able to return soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Splendid old riad with all modern amenities
Review_Text: There are certainly many less expensive places to stay in Marrakech than Les Jardins de la Medina but this place is splendid and spotless clean. Located in the old Medina about a 10 to 15 minutes walk to the Jemaa El Fna ( ÿ¨ÿßŸÖÿπ ÿßŸÑŸÅŸÜÿßÿ° ).  Beautiful inner court with tall palm trees nice greenery birds a swimming pool (never got to enjoy it though...). Excellent breakfast with great choices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Visited at end of November. Got v cheap deal with British Airways Holidays. Location just 15 mins by taxi from the airport (15 Euros). This does however mean that when you are enjoying the beautiful gardens you can hear airplane noise. Lots of building work going on next door which I couldn't hear from my room but was v loud in other parts of the building ie the hammam. Food was limited but good and the wine local and interesting but pricey. The bulding set around a lovely shaded courtyard with a central pool were a wonderful oasis from the craziness that is the Kasbah and Medina. Everything is within walking distance. I took a walking guide on the first day which was v interesting and hassle free. However venturing out after that you must be prepared for hawkers motorbike kids and the ever present groups of men on street corners. Being a woman on your own this could prove a bit overwhelming but I live in London and it was no worse than Oxford St at Xmas. Everyone is trying to make a dollar out of you. Tourism is the second largest income for Morocco - so try to be understanding.    The service in general at the hotel was quite poor. The reception staff distracted and a bit surly. There was a discounted offer at the Hammam between 10 and 3pm. The times got changed during my visit and although I wasn't informed reception tried to insist I pay the higer price. I stood my ground and was eventually reluctantly offered an extra 20 mins massage.Waiting staff at breakfast and dinner were disinterested and disappeared very quickly so it was not possible to order after dinner drinks. Had I not visited at a quiet time and on a special deal I would feel much more cheated. There are numerous Riad in Marrakech so I don't think you need to tolerate the poor service at Les Jardins
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: An oasis in a busy area
Review_Text: The hotel is lovely with beautiful gardens. Lots of places to sit in the garden . It is really a little oasis in the hustle a bussle of the old Kasbar. The room we had was large well furnished and warm but no balcony. The hotel loves roses! There were red rose petals all over the place and put on the bed and bathroom every day. It was a nice touch to get the sweets on arrival and roses but these were not replaced during the week! The roses looked very tired! There is water in the room.    We were there a week and our biggest disappointment was the food given this was advertised as a gourmet restaurant with a cookery school. . Breakfast was adequate but limited  tea and coffee terrible. There are eggs on offer but these were tasteless and it took about three requests to get boiled eggs one morning However the service was very friendly if a bit erratic ! We only ate in the restaurant for one evening and hoping for something special. We ate well in Marrakech and I am sorry but we agreed that this meal was the worst we had. Mediocre at best. At over double what would be paid outside the hotel we did not eat there again.  I had a massage in the hotel spa which was quite good and the price I would expect to pay in the UK.  Just a few bits of advice  Expect to pay the hotel an extra 57 D (about ¬£5 ) a day for taxes  Watch out for charges on the bill for mini bar items you haven't had!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lien H wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: I stayed at Les Jardins during my recent trip to Marrakech. Upon arrival we were told our room only could accommodate two when we had three people with us. When I booked it on Orbitz I paid for a room that fits four knowing my boyfriend was coming last minute. Fatiha(sp?) was nice to accommodate us and got us a room with three beds. Originally the extra charge for another person is 90 euros per day but she only charged us 50 euros. I thought it was still pricey considering I originally paid for a room that fits four and we only ate their free breakfast one day.    Overall we enjoyed our stay. The staff was nice and the courtyard was well kept. I loved all the orange trees there. There was also a pool but it was too cool this time of year to go swimming. The restaurant on site is quite expensive and the food is still the same as what we can get outside the hotel for much cheaper. I did find their peppermint tea to be one of the best we had. The flavors were infused and flavorful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Yvonne C wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Title: Another amazing holiday in this beautiful hotel
Review_Text: We had our fourth stay in this hotel in November and I love it. Although we had two days rain that did not spoil anything. We even asked for the same room and this was accommodated. The staff are lovely and always make you feel welcome. This is the first time we have been there when it was cold and the log fires in the reasturant added to the charm! We had a lovely hammam and body massage on one of the rainy days. The food was up to its usual high standard with amazing staff. The welcome evening was lovely. What else can you say except we will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful Oasis of calm on the Edge of the Medina
Review_Text: What a wonderful hotel this is! You arrive through the tiny narrow dusty streets in the Kasbah district of the old city and step out in front of a wooden door in the red walls...it opens and you step through into the beautifully decorated lobby. One of our guides mentioned that the hotel once used to be a palace now converted into this tranquil hotel. (It's beautiful...so whether it's true or not I believed him) There are just 36 rooms set around gardens and a pool. There's a hammam on site and a spa. The restaurant is also one of the top restaurants for fine dining in the city. The food is a good mix of options spanning the more traditional Moroccan fayre to French gastro takes on the local food. It was a delicious experience although I should probably save my comments for a separate review on the restaurant.    Our room was large and airy and perfectly set up for the weary traveller; bottled water rose petals everywhere all manner of hotel toiletries and amenities. It even boasted its own little terrace. You can also sit up on the higher levels enjoy a drink and look out towards the Altas mountains.    We took a hammam and massage and it was such a wonderful experience. I think I'm a hammam convert and would love to find somewhere at home where I could do this regularly.    I really loved this hotel...having done a significant amount of travel and hotel living over the past 3 months this place came as a blessed relief from the large chains. BUT the piece d'resistance comes from the service you get at this place...nothing is too much trouble I felt valued I felt special and I would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: K A R S wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: What a beautiful hotel and special experience! We didn't really know what to expect driving up to the hotel its very busy and hectic as marrakech can be. As soon as you walk through the door you are immediately greeted by a huge predominantly red room its gorgeous and quiet!?!?! The staff was very friendly for the most part them seemed to be juggling many things but still were polite. The room is very beautiful and very authentic. It was spacious and quiet and looking out onto to pool. The internet worked well too! Marrakech is an amazing city with some much vibe. Every few hours the mosque has one of their people give a prayer to the entire city it's incredibly magical. Anyways you will see choose this hotel you won't be disappointed. Don't bother with any of the treatments at the spa though they are cheap but you really get what you pay for. Probably the worst massage I've had in my life. The hammam was great though! The breakfast was good too looked forward to it every morning!    Would definitely stay here again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We love Les Jardins de la Medina so much that we've stayed there three times and recommended it to our friends who have also loved it. It is a tranquil haven in the midst of the busy medina. We enjoy going there to completely relax and there are plenty of places within the hotel to chill including a beautiful pool hidden seating areas within the lush vegetation of the enormous courtyard roof terrace with shaded day beds hamman and beauty treatments. All of which we tried and loved. The food is lovely and the staff are so accommodating and helpful. Our room was amazing spacious with a great private terrace and there were really thoughtful extras provided like lovely straw sunhats for us all to use whilst staying there. We will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Elizabeth G wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Tranquility in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: I didn't know what we were in for as we walked through the Medina to find our accommodations. What a surprise and delight. The gardens nature pool and accommodations were perfect. We also had breakfast and dinner at the hotel and they didn't disappoint. My only wish is that we had more time to enjoy the grounds / pool area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A wonderful oasis amid the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: We stayed for a couple of nights in mid October - and wished we could have stayed longer. Stepping through the front door takes you from the sights sounds and smells of the kasbah to the tranquil oasis of calm. We had a solarium room which had its own sun terrace - with a couple of sun beds on it. We really liked this as towards the late afternoon the sun disappears from the pool area and we could watch the sun go down. Also great for star gazing after dinner. The pool area and gardens are lovely - keep an eye out for the tortoises! The food and staff were also great. Highly recommend this lovely hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Second visit to Marrakech but took my parents and sister this time. Small but beautiful traditional looking hotel. On arrival they greeted us with lovely dates and other Moroccan traditional snacks. The staff and manager were all so friendly. My wife and I were given a free upgrade without asking! Our bedroom was so spacious with a lovely garden view and a private terrace above! They left dried fruits and fresh fruits in our room. My family really likes their room too.  Beautiful gardens in the courtyard with birds singing and tortoises walking around. We all really enjoyed our breakfast- fresh eggs Moroccan pancakes and the most delicious fresh orange juice- and plenty of other foods! It was all buffet but they would happily come and serve us- which my elderly parents were really happy with.  Location was perfect too very near the square and most other places we wanted to visit. Would definitely stay here again!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Helen RM wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We visited this hotel to use the swimming pool. We were informed that the condition of using the pool was to have lunch.  We had lunch which was delicious and had a few hours laying by the pool and swimming. Lovely place and lovely staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A small door opens to a charming oasis right in the heart of Marrakech. Great staff a great location lovely terraces and gardens and a great restaurant. Just a pleasure to come back to after a busy day touring around!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Pillows and blankets were wrong - uncomfortable sleeping.  The chairs and sun loungers in the garden were dirty every day. There was reconstruction - painting and hammering during our breakfast in the morning ....  The hotel is nice but does not have a rating of 5 stars!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A luxurious oasis in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: Its the attention to little details that make this hotel a must visit. The rooms are exquisite  you must get one with a private roof terrace  ( room 122 is out of this world) open fireplace free bottle of wine. Tortoises patrolling the gardens around the pool. The crazy magician entertaining at supper. Not sure id stay anywhere else now ive found this place. The best of Marrakech.    Staff are more than helpful.    (walking distance to everything u want to see and very close to complexe artisanal which is a must visit for serious shoppers. Has crafts from all over Maroc and gives you the guide price for heading into the souk. Plain babouche dhr50 embroidered dhr60-75 curtain ties - dont pay more than dhr100-150 per pair. Play the merchants at their own game. )
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our third visit this year this time with my 84 year old mother who is well travelled but had never been to Morocco. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff from arranging a ground floor room for her to the gift of orange blossom candles as we left.  As always delicious food beautiful setting and welcoming faces from the taxi driver who does the airport run to the lute player at meal times and everyone who keeps the hotel and pool spotlessly clean and smelling divine! We will be back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My husband and I contracted horrific food poisoning whilst staying at the hotel - we're almost certain from my lunch and his breakfast. 2 weeks on and we've still not completely recovered. Despite mentioning several times to the hotel staff that we were unwell no attempt was made to check on us or to assist with our recovery. After not getting any better after 5 days we ended up having to cut our holiday short and fly home early. Despite ruining the rest of our holiday we didn't ask for anything from the hotel other than to remove the lunch which we're sure made me ill from our bill - something we thought was more than reasonable. We didn't ask for any other reduction in the price of our miserable stay. This request was met with complete hostility and after a call to the manager they reluctantly agreed to remove the lunch food (but not the drinks...) from the bill - a small victory for them I suppose!    Anyway don't stay here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of peace and tranquility
Review_Text: Once you pass through the door of the hotel you enter another world far removed from the hustle and bustle of the city. The welcome we received was lovely and despite our late arrival we were able to enjoy a lovely meal in the restaurant. Our room was beautiful with a terrace over looking the pool. It was very well equipped and serviced during breakfast and again during the evening.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of calm, walking distance to Jemaa el Fnaa and Souks
Review_Text: There are so many good things about this place: walking distance (and really easy) to the souks and main square of the old city the cooking classes the service the music in the garden at breakfast... basically everything is top notch except the hammam. Don't bother with that (not very enjoyable not great service gracelessly delivered). Otherwise this riad is an all-round hit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful, intimate hotel in the Medina
Review_Text: Can't add much to other rave reviews about this Riad. Beautiful rooms and gardens. Excellent attentive service. Very friendly staff. Nice rooftop seating area with shower to cool you should the pool area become too busy. Pleasant little welcoming extras in the room like a plate of sweets sun hats and basket daily/nightly replenished supply of bottled water. Very comfortable beds. Even several television channels in English.  Restaurant was good - Morrocan wines available there were surprisingly good. There was a nice reception and tasting on the Wednesday night - Not certain if that's a weekly event.  As others have mentioned and some complained about there are many small birds flitting about at breakfast looking for crumbs - Important to make sure the covers are seated properly over the bread baskets! Staff clean the seats around the pool every night but certain ones do become soiled again by next mid-day. Given a choice as to whether we would prefer the hotel with or without the birds my wife and I would definitely choose "with" - Seems to add to the charm of the place.  There are exercise machines but only three a rowing machine stationary bike and stairmaster.  Location is in a very quiet area of the Medina the southern tip of the Kasbah. About a 20 minute walk to the Jemaa el fna. We walked there daily - Always seemed to be a much further walk back than heading out. Later in the week we stayed we would take a tuk-tuk back to the hotel - within the medina much faster to take a tuk-tuk than a regular cab. Note that cost at night is double.  Walking in the area at pretty much any hour seems safe - Always lots of people about. Only thing we were sometimes anxious about was the possibility of getting run over by one of the multitude of mopeds flying around. Exhaust fumes from those stinky things we won't miss.  Would like to add some advice for people who have never travelled to Marrakech before though. Have the hotel arrange for your pickup at the airport! Many of the airport taxi drivers would seem to be crooks getting you into their cabs for an agreed-upon price and then trying to extort a higher price. Have read that cab to Medina should be 100-150 dirham - Hotel-arranged probably in the 200 dirham range - Airport cabbies try to extort as much as 400 dirham - It's only a couple of miles from the airport to the Jemaa el fna. Better to pay the extra for hotel-arranged transportation than have to deal with aggressive negotiation with a cabbie as your first experience in Marrakech after a possibly-long flight in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Susan W wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Lovely hotel in the Kasbah neighborhood of Marrakesh.
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a wonderful intimate hotel in the Kasbah neighborhood in the southern part of the Medina. The managers are very helpful the household staff is gracious and the restaurant is terrific. The included breakfast is bountiful and the dinner we had one evening is top notch. If you are looking for a little larger place than the traditional Riad Les Jardins is lovely with a large pool and garden.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Nicola C wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: A beautiful Riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: My family and I have just spent 3 nights at this wonderful Riad. It really is a haven away from the hustle and bustle of the souks. We were welcomed on arrival with a lovely drink and some dates before being shown to our stunning bedrooms. Our rooms were towards the back of the Riad and were huge quiet and beautifully decorated. The Riad itself is very well cared for and lovingly appointed. Although it was sometimes difficult to get a sunbed the pool was gorgeous and tranquil perfect to relax in after a day walking round the city a 10 minute walk away. Dinner in the restaurant was superb I'd definitely recommend the lambshank tangia a local specialty. My only disappointment was that I didn't get to use the spa or hammam both of which had great reviews as they were fully booked for the entire 3 days. Book in advance if you don't want to miss out. For me though this is the perfect excuse to return to this little gem in the not too distant future!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Susan G wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardin De Las Medina for three nights left our bags and traveled in the desert and came back for one more night and then stayed again on our last night in Marrakech. Each time we felt as if we were coming home. The riad a former residence of a member of royalty is simply designed in that clean and perfect Arabic style and all the rooms face the lush gardens and pool. The staff makes each guest feel so welcomed and cared about. I actually felt sad on our last day to say good bye. They helped us with everything renting a car keeping our bags airport transfer. Everything we needed they supplied with a smile. Our room with a comfortable bed lovely bathroom and balcony or patio was delightful. We slept so well. We woke to have Moroccan breakfast outside near the pool and twice we were there for weekly cocktail hour with wine appetizers music and magicians out by the pool. We also had dinner there twice or three times and they serve well-prepared Moroccan food and also cocktails and fine Moroccan wines. If Morocco were not so far from California we would return frequently to this wonderful riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian D wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Arrived at the Riad late on a Saturday night we were booked in for a week's stay. Hotel is impressive and the rooms were excellent but it stops there... Tried the pool once but it was dirty with lots of bits of black stuff in it... Breakfast is adequate but has birds running over it constantly which is not hygienic.... And trying to find a chair to sit on without bird poo on it was a nightmare... Service is terrible lots of busy people running around but not doing anything this could do with a refresh of organisation.... We tried lunch once and while OK the cost was high and there are much better places to eat locally considerably cheaper..... Now dinner has a static menu and both things I ordered one was the lamb tangia needed to have been cooked longer I got much better not too far away at half the price as well as beer and wine at a much lower cost.... Overall I think this was a great place in the past but has gone down hill and much higher quality places to stay close by. It was annoying to have building work going on during our stay too without any warning. I would finalise this by stating it's over priced needs better organisation and a good clean!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fred S wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Stayed with my family in early September 16 for 3 days. Once you step through the door from what seems like an average narrow street you realise you in for a treat. Like most Riyads the structure has a central fountain and in this case a pool as well surrounded by a surprising number of trees. The place has been rightly described as an oasis as it is 5-8 degrees cooler than the outside thanks to the design which includes the water trees high ceilings and long corridors which somehow let the cool air circulate and hot air escape. The place feels retro stylish with grand ceilings arches and corridors. The rooms feel luxiourous and welcoming. There are fine touches including small pieces of furniture as if each room has been personalised. There was a warm welcome and staff were attentive knowledgable and relaxed which contributed to the ambience. Breakfast buffet was excellent with a wide choice though one has to share it with cheeky little birds who have made the garden their home. There was a problem as during our stay the hotel had to carry out repairs on the kitchen. However they made alternative arrangements including providing us with transport to a restaurant of our choice as well as complimentary entry to the local water park which would have probably cost us a 100 pounds. This was our first visit ti Marrakesh and whilst it is beautiful and exotic it can get hot busy and noisy with an overdose of hawkers  beggars and stray cats.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Caroline K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: A peace of tranquil heaven within the hustle and bustle of the completely unspoilt Kasbah. This Riad offers exceptional service with a French colonial chic twist. We ate here on the first evening and it was excellent. Reasonably priced too. A buffet style breakfast is available and is great al fresco shared with the local wildlife and tortoises at the pool! Orange and lime trees coupled with amazing jasmine plants produce lovely scents and much needed shade from the sun. We were upgraded on arrival and had our own patio and sun terrace. Room provisions were excellent and all you would expect and more from a 5 star hotel. We didn't try the hammam or fitness suite but they have a well stocked library of books available to borrow. Close to the royal palaces Cafe Clock and the Kasbah itself this is an excellent place to base yourself whilst exploring Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I loved many things about this place and will plan a second visit without hesitation. The gardens are well tended and amongst the plants there were plenty of semi-private seating spaces.The swimming pool is very well maintained and the bedrooms spacious the staff were all superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Came here to celebrate my 30th birthday and have a lovely stay.    We were upgraded on arrival and the room was stunning. It was spacious and clean with lots of thoughtful touches such as scented candles to name one.    The pool area was never too busy and the gardens were gorgeous.    Restaurant was lovely a bit pricey perhaps but we were happy to pay the price for the quality of food and to eat in beautiful surroundings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andres E wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: Very nice hotel inside the Medina with incredible service. One of the few hotels with gardens and pool inside the Medina. Staff are extremely frindly and accomodating always wnating to go the extra mile for an ejoyable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: When you need to escape the Medina jump in a cab and head here...Accom is available but they also offer use of the swimming pool on a casual basis. Set under a canopy of trees its a lovely cool green setting - but the star is the restaurant. Great service and fabulous food. [I had a salad billed as 'spinach and lemon' as a starter which turned out to be a de-constructed dish - amazing flavours! Do try Moroccon wine too - they do a mean Rose and the reds were surprisingly good too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jom J wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: We ate here on a recent trip to Marrakech encouraged by good reviews and the fact that it waxs a stones throw from our own Riad - after a long day exploring on foot we felt we wanted to eat somewhere near.  We were welcomed by friendly staff and sat with a cocktail while choosing our food. The main dishes where not huge but tasted amazing and though pricey were good value. The desserts were not as good value and I would not recommend. Our biggest problem came with the wine they didn't have the bottle of rose we requested and offered us another showing it to us on the wine list - when the bill came we were pretty certain we had been charged more than double of what we expected to for the wine - maybe we had looked incorrectly when shown on the menu.  Unfortunately the following day both myself and my husband were not to well - we don't think it was the good but the misters that were spraying to cool the air & also where we were sat directly under.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deborah L wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: I moved here from another hotel in Marrakech (which was terrible). This was a complete haven Very warm welcome room was fantastic pool was lovely and relaxing food was great staff were excellent. The walk to the square was about 15 minutes or a taxi ride which was equivalent to about ¬£5. Staff brought out snacks to the pool on occasion - melon etc. which was a nice touch
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: We spent a few nights in this hotel with my wife and have really enjoyed it The service was excellent people were very welcoming and trying to make you feel at home. The room was large clean and beautifully decorated in traditional style - or at least it looked traditional enough for me. Little details like fruits and sweets in the room reinforced the overall impression. The restaurant is very nice not cheap but worth it as the food is diverse elaborate and full of flavour. The swimming pool is not huge but enough to enjoy the sun in the quiet environment.The location is very convenient to explore the Medina part of Marrakech. The only improvement suggestion would be the gym which was very small and felt slightly neglected but maybe it's already been fixed as we visited a few months ago. To summarise a fantastic place which I would recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were wandering in the Kasbah looking for a good place to eat and discovered the restaurant in Les Jardins de la Medina - a lovely oasis to relax in and enjoy a delicious meal. We sat outside under a canopy of stars. The service was excellent and so were the food & wine. Certainly worth a visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As it was mine and my boyfriend's first time in Marrakech we were unsure of what to expect especially as we went during Ramadan. We were not disappointed with the service and facilities provided by the hotel and staff. As a young couple of 22 and 23 we felt very welcomed and comfortable throughout the duration of our stay. A beautiful interesting hotel with personalised touches throughout. Would definitely recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jason C wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: This was my first experience / trip to Marrekech so there is no bar to measure by. With that said the Riad was well run the staff were very friendly and helpful. The tour companies / people they use were amazing. They were fluid with our itinerary which is always a good thing.    Thank you!! Our group truly enjoyed our time there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Truly one of the most amazing places I have ever stayed an oasis of beauty charm and comfort 15 minutes from Essaouira. Excellent value for money amazing food ambience staff - nothing is too much trouble for this wonderful team of people.........and if you go at the end of the season as we did you may get an upgrade! we stayed in the Royal Suite and really felt like Princesses.  With big thanks to all the staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Its all about the door in the wall! Once through it you realise you are in a very special place. The staff open fires tiled floors pool and gardens are a delight. We loved the different levels of the roof terraces. Our room was on the ground floor & lovely.  The climate was in the 70's in November so perfect for sitting in the sun during the day & in front of the open fire in the bar at night.  The hotel is very close to the Medina good restaurants & the airport
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: 3rd visit , stepping through the door is still breathtaking!
Review_Text: Visited with family for our 3rd stay and this time for a 4 night stay. The hotel pool and tropical gardens are immaculately maintained and the staff welcoming and friendly without being intrusive. As we visited during Ramadan I think this must have had an impact on occupancy because there were few guests by the pool or in the restaurant by the end of our stay but this made no difference to the service provided by the staff.  Love Les Sens de Marrakech toiletries which are used throughout the hotel so luxurious and beautifully scented - bought some to take home from the hotel shop. Tried lunch by the pool a couple of times which we've not done before and can thoroughly recommend the Royal Prawn Tempura -large lightly crumbed butterfly prawns and the grilled meats with french fries. The amazing greenery gives a cooling micro-climate so if you want to sit away from direct sun under the trees you can do so all day.  Although we ate out one evening we enjoyed dinner on the other nights with a good choice and price range of main courses and at nightime the gardens take on a magical appearance. And of course we all loved seeing the tortoises roaming the gardens! Looking forward to the 4th visit already.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: My first experience of Marrakesh and a wonderful place to stay for 4 nights.  We were welcomed at reception by a lovely lady who took our details and then led us to the terrace for a refreshing drink. We were then taken to our room and left to relax.  We had booked half board as thought it was good value for money but after a couple of nights we realised that the options on the menu were fairly restrictive. On the whole the food was very good.  The staff were absolutely fantastic no matter where you went. Considering our visit was during Ramadan I extremely impressed by the professionalism of the staff throughout the day.  I found the prices of drinks very expensive and almost on par with London but then again it is a 5 star hotel.  I was very disappointed with the gym as had prepared myself to use the gym in the afternoons. However some old cardio machines in a run down covered area just wasn't worth using and wasn't even sure if they would function properly.  Lovely quiet pool area but agree with other comments about people eating lunch having access to the pool area. We were fortunate that we were there in a quiet period but when lunch guests arrived it became quite intrusive.  I would visit again but maybe have a look at another hotel first to see if the facilities were something I was looking for.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Frederick G wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is truly lovely. The gardens are a true Eden in the middle of Marrakesh. The staff are amazing. Very helpful and friendly. The accommodations and rooms are beautiful. In addition the food is fantastic. A wonderful spot to spend a few days. No complaints at all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Coming from a riad with a very warm welcome and personal touch. This hotel lacked as many bigger hotels a friendly welcome.    Because of its pool and garden it's not cheap and according to us slightly overpriced. We wouldn't book it again because everybody who comes to lunch can also lay the entire day by the pool and enjoy the garden. That's the policy of almost every hotel with pool in Marrakech. We didn't have dinner or drinks in the hotel because of its high prices (higher than in Belgium)    The garden and pool are very nice and very welcoming on a hot day.    Breakfast was also okay but not breathtaking. Paying so much a night I expected something more than just bread eggs and pastries (which you also get in an cheaper riad)    Overall an okay experience just had high expectations for paying 145‚Ç¨ a night!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Terence P wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: I stayed in a Sultana room with a private garden terrace which was beautiful. In the morning I simply had to open the French doors of the beautiful room into my own garden and step onto a sun lounger. I was at the end of a week's trip around Morocco so was content to relax. At lunchtime I would take lunch in the restaurant by the pool which served delicious food and wine with very good but relaxed service.    This place is an oasis in the medina with beautiful gardens and a quiet small hotel atmosphere - the best I have stayed at in Morocco. It's not cheap - but I was pleased with the experience for the money and will return.

Review_Date: Jennifer C wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: our favorite oasis ever in the heart of Marrakech
