Review_Text: We've now stayed at this hotel twice and I'm reluctant to review it only because it feels like a well-kept secret! Gorgeous pool breakfast in the gardens every morning bright and cheerful staff and decor... It always feels like the perfect rest after a stimulating day in the medina. Impossibly beautiful and quiet behind its nondescript medina exterior when you first walk into the courtyard with all of the birds chirping turtles meandering in the gardens and take in the lusciousness of it all it blows you away. The service too from the mint tea welcome to picking the scent on your pillow at night is attentive and the rooms (ours had a gorgeous big terrace where we sipped our coffee in the morning) are spacious and inviting. We will certainly return anytime we need a long weekend in paradise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility after the bustle of the medina
Review_Text: This is a small extremely welcoming hotel with staff that are very friendly and helpful. It has delightful gardens a full-sized swimming pool inviting roof terrace and a mass of birds. Very comfortable bed and bathrooms. We stayed 2 nights this visit and chose the hotel over a riad this trip as one of our group was less than mobile and needed a place where he could relax in comfort while we went off shopping for our villa all day. In the evening we ate in the hotel as again walking anywhere was out of the question. The menu offered a good selection of modern and traditional Moroccan food. Although I love the intimacy of riads this hotel was not huge only 36 rooms and still provided a warm and personal service. The jacaranda tree was in full blossom and looked spectacular albeit you had to be aware of the blossoms dropping into your food or drink!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We were able to book a great deal for a garden room during the shoulder season in late Feb/early Mar that included a fruit/champagne offering and a hamman couples treatment. The room with the small patio and the rooftop loungers was beautiful quiet and well-appointed and having a large and refreshing garden within the medina was a tremendous bonus! We also had dinner one night as part of the package and enjoyed the mix of traditional Moroccan and French-influenced food. The breakfast was very plentiful and delicious and the hamman treatment really enjoyable. Overall we were really pleased with the location the food and drink selection the helpfulness of the staff and the ease of getting to the airport at the end of our stay. In addition the package deal made it a great value.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location a tranquil retreat amongst the hustle and bustle. Jemma El Fnaa is only a brisk walk away. The beautiful garden surrounding the pool is a rare gem in a hectic city. The food was probably the highlight and likely due to the mostly French guests. The service was impeccable. Although not low cost for someone on a budget the value for money was outstanding. A comfortable yet authentic experience. The reason I created a Trip Advisor account!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic gardens, lovely staff a real gem of a place
Review_Text: My husband booked this as a surprise for my birthday we stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina which is an authentic Riad within the Medina at the end of May 2016 for four days. We upgraded our room which was huge complete with a huge en suite bathroom. The room was sprinkled with rose petals there was a bottle of wine pastries fruit and water on our arrival - very romantic. The decor is very traditional all old terracotta tiles dark shutters outside private garden areas with water features etc. Our room had a lovely peaceful balcony overlooking the amazingly lush tropical style gardens. The pool area is so tranquil The staff were friendly and efficient with all aspects from drinks food service to concierge services.It was my birthday whilst we visited and they put candles all around the room with rose petals in a heart formation and flowers. We had a hamam treatment followed by a massage this was superb. Also during our stay we ate out at two restaurants and had two meals in the hotel both meals were of a very high standard. We can't recommend this place enough would definitely go back and since our return have spoken to other people who have visited and also gave the place high praise.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: very helpful staff, beautiful garden, nice rooms
Review_Text: I enjoyed very much to stay in this hotel .the staff is very nice and helpful the garden is like paradise. the rooms are nice and wide and breakfast is ok.the location is good.i would come again to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely little hotel in good location
Review_Text: We were so glad we stayed in a Riad and not a commercial hotel. It was great to be in the Medina but hidden in a little tranquil oasis behind closed doors. The rooms were stylish and comfortable. We had supper in the hotel one night and the food and wine menu was excellent. We stayed in April and the weather was just warming up so we didn't experience any issues with the air-conditioning as other travellers have mentioned. For breakfast our party asked for eggs both mornings and they were happy to serve us. Small point the courtesy room isn't great try to extend your room stay if you need to on departure. Overall I'm not sure I would rate this hotel quite 5* UK standard equivalent. However we really enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andrew C wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: We stayed at the hotel last week for 6 days. The air conditioning did not work and the room became unbearably hot at night time. They told us they would fix it but never did.    The breakfast and lunch menu was very limited.    Most importantly one of our party had an upset tummy from a chicken dish and when we told them they could not care less. They never followed it up to see if we were okay.    Lastly the lady on the front desk was very miserable and was not very welcoming.    The area around the hotel is not very pleasant to walk round and taxi's struggle to get in and out of the area.    If I go to Marrakesh again I will stay in another hotel outside the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Mik S wrote a review May 2016
Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel, Not Worth the Price.
Review_Text: Stayed here for 6 nights the hotel is beautiful kept very well and quiet like a small oasis. However we were not told when booking that the air conditioning is only turned on in the summer and we were given a small portable unit which did not cool the room down when we had asked reception they said it was usually hot and they would turn it on. After a day or so of it not being on we went to reception to tell them it was not working to which we got an 'ok' from the receptionist the air con was never turned on and the room was very hot to sleep in. When you're paying that much money for a room you would expect working air conditioning. Secondly on the second to last day 3 of us had a Caesar Salad and we all got bad stomachs afterwards which had ruined what we had planned for our last day we told them at the restaurant to which they did not seem bothered. Again the service what a lot worse than what should be expected for a hotel of this standard.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alfred V wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: This gorgeous hotel is situated in the far corner of the Medina. It has a large pool surrounded by excellent gardens that give both peace and quiet as well as privacy. Rooms are on different floors: the hotel is quite large. A nice roof terrace for sunbathing too.    It also has a great kitchen team! (and the best cocktails)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Milan P wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: Location, cosiness, quality of sleep ... all in here
Review_Text: This riad located in Medina offers great escapes from madness of Marrakesh for a reasonable price. We enjoyed two amazing nights with great sleep and service hospitality is here at the centre of attention. I would recommend taking couple of nights at riad of this type with ultra luxury hotel of the local 5* hotels (Royal Mansour La Sultana) to fill on for the rest of the stay and/or even with some really nice properties in Palmaraie (feels more resort like yet with some great restaurants).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Very nice but not worth it outside the high season
Review_Text: Location is good the hotel is a 10 min walk to the Medina. The main attraction of the hotel is the lovely garden with heated swimming pool. There are quite a few loungers here as well as on the big roof top terrasse.    The outer wall used to be the medina wall they kept the holes in the wall so the birds could nest there. The staff will tell you the story when they show you around. There are resident tortoises that wander around the gardens and visit the patios in front of the rooms.    There's lots of shade from the trees around the pool so the hotel is a very good choice in the hot as hell summer months when it's hard to make do without a pool. However for a mid-March trip we came away feeling that it was way overpriced. 300‚Ç¨ a night is big money for Marrakech and it just didn't live up to our expectations of the 4/5star cost. We reserved a garden room with a small exterior patio. Room was very nice if a little smaller than we expected very clean with ambiance touches which we appreciated.    Breakfast was included again nice - traditional dishes as well as cereals cheeses pastries. You need to ask if you want specific hot items such as eggs the information isn't freely given. There was relaxed traditional music in the morning at breakfast and the evening at aperitifs.  The restaurant is very good for lunch and dinner. You can eat outside if the weather is warm enough.    Service can be patchy around the pool you're better off finding a waiter and ordering than waiting. Oh and watch out for the birds they sit in the branches of the trees over some of the sun loungers and fire on the unsuspecting :-)    Other than that:  - noise : little to no sound proofing you can hear way too much from inside your room  - spa : lovely lady doing the treatment but the treatment itself felt approximate - sploshing of water and slapping on of creams.  - rooms : there are roof top rooms with extra large patios with a view over the garden. Even more expensive than our room they didn't seem worth it. Otherwise there are the cheapest rooms with a seating area in the interior (riad) areas.Given the price difference it seemed better to splurge for a garden room with an outdoor seating area. These garden rooms extend all the way down to the end of the garden to the old library. I'd ask for a room towards the back as there's less noise
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mary T wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Oh my goodness how I wish me and my dad could return here. Waking up every morning to the delicate sound of birds and the scent of orange blossom made for a perfect four days. The beds were extremely comfortable the staff were wonderful the facilities including a small gym outside pool and lounging area and a service of various relaxation methods (the 30 minute massage would be HIGHLY recommended!). Not to mention the free-roaming tortoises which I found extremely charming. The staff were very efficient and gave us information about the best places to visit and booked us taxis etc and they were especially when we arrived very late at night. A very cultural experience i found especially with the choice of perfume they sprayed on your pillow (ah the little things in life!). Very flexible eating times beautiful weather and efficient staff make for one good holiday! Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Les Jardins is the perfect place to stay in Marrakech. It is 10 minutes walk from the centre and only a few minutes walk from the saadian tombs yet so peaceful you would think you are in the countryside. The hotel is set in tropical gardens the pool is warm. The hotel never seems to be crowded.    The staff couldn't be nicer and the rooms are gorgeous. I can't wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lesley D wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: What a wonderful hotel. The staff were very attentive and always helpful. Our room (114) was spacious and luxurious with an excellent monsoon shower. The gardens were full of palm trees orange trees and tortoises! The swimming pool was lovely with plenty of loungers and other nooks to lie in and catch the sun. The food in the restaurant was first class. Just a short walk from all the sights and excitement of the city. What more could you ask for?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Love this place, sadly got a bad room
Review_Text: My husband and I have been to Marrakech twice and both times had a wonderful stay at Les Jardins. It is a beautiful property with a great restaurant gorgeous pool and friendly staff. We could not recommend it enough.  Only one gripe don't stay in room 129 which we got this time. It is a nice enough room but it is sadly has a big bay window situated right over the staff working area as well as the bins. The bay window is situated to the left of the bed and to the right of the bed is another window which is to the courtyard so if you have managed to fall asleep while the staff finish of cleaning the kitchen you will be sure to be woken up by late nighters and if you are a late night person and need to sleep in you will be woken up by the cleaners who congregate by the linen cupboard which also outside your room.  We have stayed in two other rooms that were fabulous so don't let this deter you just make sure you don't get this room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen T wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: Our best meal of the week in Marrakech. Lovely staff relaxed friendly atmosphere delicious creative food. Wish we could have stayed for dessert but our taxi was waiting to take us home!!Will definitely return next time we are in town for a meal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stepped in for lunch and it's like a different world from the lively medina into this beautiful oasis. We enjoyed a glass of wine in the garden before lunch in the restaurant. Service is perfect and so is the food. If we get a chance to come back to Marrakesh we would also choose this place as the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited just for the day to use the pool and have lunch. It's unusual to find a pool for swimming so close to the town centre. The hotel and gardens were beautiful and lunch was delicious- I'd definitely recommend a visit! We would like to come back to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Superb Hotel inside old Marrakech Walls
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel very friendly staff amazing rooms super high quality amenities lovely roof seatings free internet all over the hotel. Food not great breakfast is basic.    The garden is beautiful. Bird feeders are everywhere and you can enjoy the birds. Palm trees & the garden is very relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Dan G wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Text: The door of this hotel is wonderful: step out and you are in a quiet but magical part of old Marrakech and having explored for a while step back into a quiet leafy cool paradise.  Attentive and friendly staff clean comfy rooms good food and a pool to dip in to wash off the dust of the souk - a great place to stay in a wonderful vibrant city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Steve C wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Our first visit to Marrakech and very happy to have chosen this Riad in the southern part of the Medina. Ideally positioned for both the new city and the old town and souks of the Medina.  The hotel is peaceful and pretty and the room ideal for a short break. The staff were friendly spoke good english and always ready to help. We used the SPA once for a message which was nice. Food was very good and the atmosphere chilled.  All in all a very nice stay at the Les Jardines de la Medina and we would certainly return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Louise c wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This is our second visit to this hotel and yet again it's wonderful. Amazing rooms delicious breakfasts and brilliant staff. Love this place and would recommend to all travelling to Marrakech. The suites are luxurious ours had a view of koutoubia mosque.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely, boutique garden hotel away from the maddening crowds
Review_Text: Splurge on a superior room. Well worth it. We had a rooftop terrace with chaise lounges and a hammock. Room had a working fireplace and was very well appointed. Go for the fragrance of orange blossoms the sumptuous breakfasts but mostly the lovely people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful hotel close to the centre
Review_Text: This was an amazing first visit for my husband and I. The hotel was spotlessly clean staff friendly and would help with any requests breakfast was great (but endless as the staff never were in any rush to let you go) and the spa was wonderful. A calm quiet oasis which was well within walking distance of the main square La Mammounia Hotel and the palaces. We walked pretty much everywhere ! Would definitely return as I really have no complaints at all - it was perfect !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Glorious, peaceful stay at the Jardins de la Medina.
Review_Text: My mother and I stayed for three nights at the end of February and had the most wonderful and relaxing time. The excellent friendly and subtle service begins as soon as you walk in from the street. Glorious gardens complimentary mint tea and dates lovely scents panoramic views from the sun terrace lovely authentic meals and generally great and friendly service. Some lovely additions such as choosing the scent for your pillow and scattered rose petals.    A few things to note were slightly strange timings around when lunch is and isn't available - e.g. sandwiches from 3pm..? I had been worried from some reviews that the pool is very shady and there are indeed some tall trees surrounding. However it is perfectly easy to follow the sun around and the majority of the pool was in the sun with the upstairs sun terrace perfect for evening basking.    We also sampled the hammam - with the welcome ritual offered at the time of our booking. It was fabulous.    I highly recommend the Jardins and will definitely be staying again. Thank you very much!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We booked a Solarium room and it was wonderful. The hotel is excellent and the staff are very helpful. The food is excellent. The location of the hotel is ideal for the old city. Ideal for a short break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina provides lovely rooms in a lush garden setting. Stepping through the entrance is an escape from the chaos of the medina streets. This well-run hotel easily can meet any of your wants - from their excellent restaurant to their soothing spa. I would happily stay here again.

Review_Title: Calming oasis in the middle of Marrakech's noise and bustle
Review_Text: Beautiful gardens spacious and comfortable room old-fashioned charm good restaurant and friendly helpful staff made this a very pleasant stay. Although located in the old town it's still a good walk to the central square and the souks. For this reason I've said the hotel isn't centrally located. Taxis however are not expensive. Service in the restaurant and bar is quite slow but always with a smile.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really enjoyed this comfortable hotel. It is not a crisp Four Seasons but rather like home - just a bit "shabby chic" but comfortable and welcoming. If you are looking for a hotel where you can comfortably escape from the world this is it.  Our room was large and had a semi-private patio. it was stashed into a corner which sounds negative - not so. To get to it you walked through the delightful hotel garden (with turtles wandering about) by fruit-baring orange trees and by the attractive swimming pool.  We arrived after a long drive from Fes so decided to "settle" for dinner at the hotel - and dinner turned out to be the best meal yet on our trip. If you eat here be sure to order the Moroccan salads. The female chef adds a spin of her own on these salads that is simply delicious. (We especially enjoyed the tomatoes poached in cinnamon and a touch of sugar).  Each morning a small basket was hung on our door knob holding a newspaper.  There was a big basket in the room when we arrived with two beach towels and a sun hat to best enjoy the pool.  There was a bottle of wine and a decorative tagine filled with Moroccan sweets on the coffee table.  Writing this review makes me sad that I'm back in Chicago and not still there!

Review_Date: Penelope S wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: This luxurious riad provides a wonderful calm secluded tranquil retreat in a hectic city. In the Kasbah far enough from the chaos of D'Jemm al Fnaa while still being in the Medina this is a perfect place to stay. Our room was large well appointed good towels and robes comfy seating. The bed was large but the pillows were not so another time I would be tempted to bring my own. The best things about the hotel are the garden strongly scented with orange blossom the rooftop solarium the staff and the bar/restaurant. On chill evenings a fire was lit making the bar very cosy. Another night it was warm enough to have our aperos on the patio. Breakfast was a feast especially the pastries and eggs were available "sur command". Overall we felt very much at home very comfortable and in these troubled times we live in safe. We will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steffen C wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: A very nice hotel with outstanding service and a wonderful garden. The location is very convenient. The welcome was wonderful and the staff is outstanding. We also liked the spa and its outstanding aran oil massage! Great luxury hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I can't recommend this Riad more highly. It is a very slick and professionally run hotel. We were met at the airport then a lovely welcome with hot towels and mint tea and choice of scents for our pillows! We had a garden side room which was one of the cheaper ones but still large a big comfy bed with a separate sitting area and terrace. Lots of nice touches such as turn down service with next days weather forecast a basket with straw hats and fans and scented candles and scented oil burner not to mention lots of rose petals! We ate in the hotel every evening there was a good choice of Morrocan and other dishes and reasonably priced local wines. We enjoyed the log fires and live Morrocan music. The dining room staff were excellent. Breakfast was very good and well served. Lunch was served on a lovely shady terrace. The pool area gardens and roof top terrace all immaculate. The pool was heated and large enough to swim lengths. The hotel was an old palace and built in the traditional style around a courtyard with lush gardens full of orange trees and birds. Very quiet and restful. It is situated within the Kasbah area of the Medina which is the southern end so it was a bit of a walk to the square but very interesting and we felt safe. It was our first visit to Marrakech and we absolutely loved everything. We took things slowly and visited most of the sights going out in the mornings and relaxing by the pool later. We were there at the end of Feb and weather was lovely and sunny but cool in evenings. So much to see and experience in the Medina. We would definitely return and stay at les Jardins de la Medina. Only negatives were slightly lumpy pillows and they had run out of maps. Not much information on the sights as apparently the tour companies like to push their own tours but we were independent travellers. Can't think why more people don't go as is only just over 3 hours flight good quality hotels easy airport transfer and lovely winter sun and culture to soak up as well what more can you ask for. Can't wait to return. Thank you to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We came to stay here in November 2014 and we're ready to go and visit again. What an amazing hotel. It really is a hidden gem in the middle of Marrekesh. I only realised recently that i hadn't written a review for Les Jardins and yet I keep recommending it to friends. We were picked up by a hotel driver (who waited an hour and a half as our plane was delayed and thought nothing of it) and he dropped us at a lovely wooden door in the old city. The welcome was wonderful and we were given a tour of the beautiful grounds. The garden is lovely and the roof terrace is beautiful we spent about 3 days solidly up there drink tea and gin & tonics. The only time i wasn't up there was when i was having a lovely massage.    Pros  - We stayed in the lowest priced room and it was AMAZING. We had a garden terrace fresh flowers and a beautiful marble bath and the biggest bed I've ever seen. Next time we're going for a rood terrace :)  - The cooking course - BOOK THIS it's awesome!!!!  - The roof terrace  - The resturant  - The staff : they were all amazing every one of them.  - The introduction to the hotel  - The facilities: there's a pool and they have a dvd library at reception if you'd like it.    Cons  - None....it was wonderful!!    I would defintley recommed booking the cooking course it was the best thing we did so much fun and we got to sit and eat it by the pool. The walk to the Madina was a fun experience (the roads are quite epic and difficult to cross but good fun). We had some lovely mint tea in the square and a wander around the shops.    People will try and take advantage of you as you're walking through the streets (Just make sure that you're clear if you don't want to follow someone who wants to show you the next shop in the souk.) but that is not true at this hotel they don't push anything onto you and they don't ask for tips which is lovely - they just ask you to leave anything you'd like at the end to go amongst all the staff. It was a lovely experience and I think to date is our favorite hotel we've stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful find this place is. Tucked away in a crazy street in the Kasbah you find a door that has this hidden treasure behind it. A wonderful restaurant serving more than the slightly tedious tagines... of course tagines are available ( its just after a while or indeed after one).... you need something else!. The restaurant has an amazing huge walled garden and is stunning. I would suggest finding this place because its really special and the staff are wonderful. Its a great place for lunch or dinner. Veal curry delicious!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: The Lady D Travels wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: I stayed at this hotel with a friend in January for five nights and enjoyed every minute of it. Tucked away on one of the small streets just inside the Old Town this is an absolute gem. It's a pleasant surprise of tranquility surrounded by lush greenery. Les Jardins de la Medina is in the perfect place to explore Marrakech and the staff are so friendly helpful. They went out of their way to make everything enjoyable. Expect spotlessly clean rooms superbly comfortable beds (brand new luxury mattresses and crisp bedding) -- you'll be met on arrival with the best hospitality - tea of course - and also an opportunity to select a personalised scent for your room! A wonderful breakfast with soothing live music. The food is tasty and each day you are treated to freshly-made pastries. The spa is exceptional too. We went every day for an Argan oil massage. Plenty of terraces to relax in the sun or shade and sip champagne. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A Tranquil Haven in the Kasbah
Review_Text: Spent four nights here in January Our room 123 overlooked the palm trees and the well maintained pool.The hotel was run by very helpful staff who looked after are every needs.Breakfast was buffet style assisted by friendly staff  and on one day asked if we would like omelettes . Another review mentioned the breakfast being an odd affair but I disagree because the food was of excellent quality and plentiful accompanied by a pleasant lute player (a nice touch to start your day). I didn't mention to the hotel that during the night we could hear an intermittent buzzing noise .which sounded like a water heater.? This was a little annoying but would not stop me staying here again.....All in all a high standard hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is much larger than a typical riad with beautiful lush gardens and a good sized swimming pool nestling in extensive grounds. I stayed for two nights and loved this tranquil haven in the Kasbah area of the medina. It is about 20 minutes' walk from the main square and as others have said in a quieter and less touristy part of town. The rooms are huge and the staff charming. Touches such as allowing you to choose the scent which housekeeping sprays on your bed linen are a nice idea. Breakfast was kind of an odd buffet affair very white carb/sugar centric and less enjoyable than traditional breakfasts served in other riads. Eating at the restaurant for dinner however was an altogether different experience and throughly recommended.    My only negative comment was a massage at the spa - which was pretty poor and certainly not of the standard found even in the local public hammam. However this aside if you are looking for something more than a regular riad but don't want to stay in a chain hotel then give this a try. You won't be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Todd B wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: We spent four nights here in December and the property in indeed quite lovely. But we found our room even though it was quite spacious to be a bit past its prime. If it were an option I would rate our stay as good but Trip Advisor doesn't offer that.    Pros: lovely interior lush gardens highlighted by large pool; friendly staff; spacious room; large private terrace; friendly staff; good location inside the Medina but away from the bustle; generous breakfast buffet (the hostess remembered our preferences every morning and delivered them without being asked)  Cons: heater didn't work so we were given portable space heater; lumpy pillows; dark shower; very slow WiFi; fitness room is hard to access and only offers three older cardio machines
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Henk R wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: This is an extremely well run small hotel with very friendly and dedicated staff.'  Special attention is given to every detail.  Have travelled all over the world for 40 years but this hotel is certainly on my list of top three hotels.  Can not think of anything to improve.  The location is also ideal .  In a short walk you are everywhere and taxis are available at a very low rate.  Service amenities location and food are all top.  Can recommend for 100%
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An Oasis in the Southern Medina
Review_Text: holidaying with my parents both in their 70's couldn't have been more enjoyable. The welcome of the staff the location the quality of the food and drink made this the perfect haven over Xmas and NY - oh and of course the Riad it self.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Morihiko Y wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We booked two nights through an agency (hotelbeds - DON'T use them!!!) but due to their mix-up our booking had not been recognized by the hotel and we found ourselves without a room for the first night. However the management were very helpful and booked the Riad next door for us (Villa Makassar - equally excellent) and offered us a free upgrade at their hotel for the second night. The rooms were clean and spacious and the breakfast was the best we had in Morocco. Needless to say staff were extremely friendly warm and welcoming. Would definitely recommend staying here and we would do the same next time back in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: DrCC P wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Stayed here for a pre-Christmas break. The hotel is in a great location in the heart of the Medina. It is tucked away so you almost don't notice it but when you walk through the doors a sense of calm envelops you. We were upgraded to a room with a small sitting room and French doors out to a patio in front of orange trees and exotic blooms. The room had all the key things a safe kettle and coffee machine (all essential after a day in the souks). The bar is very comfortable and has a lovely fire in the evening. The pool is small but very relaxing and there is a lovely roof terrace to catch the afternoon sun (with views of the Atlas Mountains). The staff are very helpful and the hotel puts on a cocktail party on Fridays which is a good chance to catch up with other guests. The restaurant seemed a little expensive (but that is when compared with the very cheap street food).. Breakfast was a real experience .. They keep bringing food so pace yourself! I can't recommend this hotel enough.... Lovely.

Review_Date: Nic R wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We just got back from a 3 night stay here in Marrakech and couldn't have been happier at this hotel. The service from the second you walk in the door is top-notch. The rooms are all different; all three of ours were wonderful in their own way. The gardens on the property are impeccable and the pool looked lovely although we didn't have time to enjoy it unfortunately. The hotel is about a 15-minute walk from the main square in the old city in a fairly busy part of town called the Old Imperial Quarters. It's very busy but very safe. Lots of locals always around which we enjoyed. You step inside the hotel and the noise and craziness of Marrakech just disappears. The breakfast in the mornings is wonderful also with fantastic service. And you MUST dine in the retardant one evening. It is beautiful and the food is incredible. My only complaints would be the mattresses were a bit too firm my liking and the WiFi connection is a bit slow and inconsistent. But I enjoyed being cut-off from the outside world for a few days so I didn't mind that too much.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is our second stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. We rebooked as we enjoyed our first stay here so much. Les Jardins is an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the souks and busy streets of Marrakech. As soon as you walk in you are welcomed by the very friendly staff and you relax. Upon arrival we were welcomed with some mint tea and dates while our passports were checked then we choose a scent for our room orange blossom.    The large heated swimming pool is set amongst the tropical gardens with banana and orange trees and create a calming atmosphere after a busy day trawling the souks.    The bedrooms are very tastefully decorated and spacious with little touches such as rose petals scattered in the bathroom. This time we had a shower which was one of the best in any hotel we have stayed at previously.    There is a lovely bar with an open fire where we enjoyed pre-dinner Mojitos and then had a delicious meal of lamb and veal tagines.    Breakfast is also a veritable feast with a selection of pastries breads fruits yoghurt cheese meats smoked salmon merguez sausages and freshly cooked omelette.    We will always return to Les Jardins if we return to Marrakech as we risk being disappointed if we stay anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Complete luxury.    The grounds are fantastic. There's a lovely pool here with plenty of sun loungers. Staff who are excellently trained and attentive.    The trees the Restaurant the rooms everything is perfect.    The food is 5/5. I had the vegetable rolls for starter and then a lamb tagine. It was excellent.    The staff were lovely so friendly and helpful and they had live music in the form of a man playing the Sitar which really made the afternoon.    Like a few places I've been in Marrakech this place is perfect and you cannot fault anything (not that you should be trying).    Fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Peaceful gardens Russian Doll-like inside the Kasbah within the Medina of the Royal City of frenetic Marrakesh. Outside: lush planting towering palms comfortable garden terrace with the birds and small shop. Inside: dining room and small bar area with open fire (and sometimes also the birds). Staff told us it 'This is your home''; they meant it and it was. A real treat
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yvonne C wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful Paradise, spoilt a little by other guests smoking
Review_Text: This is our second visit to this beautiful hotel. The rooms are lovely staff are very friendly food is great and the gardens are fantastic. I love this little paradise in the middle of Marrakech. Last time we came there were few guests that smoked. This time we cannot get away from them. Although smoking is not permitted in the rooms guests smoke round the pool on the terraces and even in the dining area! We have tried sitting on our own room terrace to have it wafting up from below. This haven has been spoilt by other guests. There needs to be a designated smoking area and the rest of this haven a smoke free zone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What an absolutely fantastic hotel. We have travelled to a lot of places and stayed in some fairly posh venues over the years but in none of them have we found a staff team who were so universally nice hospitable friendly and happy as this crew. And to top it all when we got to the airport on our way home to London at the end of the week and discovered we'd left a phone behind the general manager Luc Fougeres showed how he leads this hospitality from the front by saying "No worries I'm in London next week I'll bring it back for you."    Typed on my repatriated phone. Thanks Luc and team.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked Les Jardins for our honeymoon and overall had a wonderful stay. The hotel upgraded us on arrival to a lovely room with a private gated sun terrace. The room was beautifully decorated and very comfortable. The hotel grounds are well kept and beautiful. Terrace on the roof was lovely and had great views across the city and to the atlas mountains.    The hotel is in the Kasbah area of the city which felt very authentic less touristy and was a very interesting area to walk around. It is close to the Saadian tombs and the Mellah (Jewish) quarter.    Although this is a big riad we didn't really feel on top of the other guests although this could have been because our room was quite secluded.    The only negative was the breakfast which we felt could be improved in terms of presentation variety and quality of the coffee. However this would not stop us returning to the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins has large and well equipped rooms but retains it's original authenticity and combines this with lush planting in an immaculately maintained courtyard there are myriad little corners to lose yourself in whether tiny courts with fountains loungers beneath the towering palms the loggia or rooftop sofas. The pool is long enough and deep enough to swim in which is unusual in the medina but the most remarkable aspect of this riad are the staff. Upon entering the unassuming doorway you are immediately made relaxed and welcome - your bags discretely taken lead to the sunny courtyard and presented with cold towels and a selection of Moroccan refreshments. From the front desk who welcome you "home" with genuine warmth after your pursuits in the city through porters chamber maids and waiting staff who have permanent yet not sickly smiles all manage to combine efficiency with courtesy and warmth - a rare trick indeed. With a hammam and massage centre also on site this place can truly melt away tensions whether from hard days at work or haggling in the souks. We wholeheartdly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emily H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: You would have to be mad not to rate this as excellent
Review_Text: Gorgeous! Amazing service! lovely warm pool! Beautiful room! Amazing food! Helpful staff.  I am pregnant and wasn't feeling well and was sick all over the floor. The staff dealt with this swiftly and with dignity and the next day I had several members of staff asking if I was ok- very sweet.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Nice comfortable hotel with friendly staff. The rooms are spaciousmodern bathrooms with a good shower or bath whichever you prefer. Large choice for breakfast big swimming pool great spa hammam massages... Within easy walking distance of the Medina and places of interest. Yet peaceful as the rooms overlook the gardens and swimming pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: A beautiful oasis in the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: Not only is this hotel beautiful it is also run very efficiently. The staff could not be more polite or helpful. We enjoyed an amazing 10 days in Marrakech and after every footsore day were delighted to return to this characterful green and relaxing oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everyday was almost perfect. The food in the restaurant truly exquisite Moroccan cuisine. A real oasis in the heart of all the action. Would book again tomorrow. Can recommend to anyone. Only slight downfall was only one key per room. I shared with my mother who went to bed earlier and my brother shared a room with his kids etc. which made it a little inconvenient. Although I have to mention this I still wholeheartedly would recommend in a second. 5 out of 5
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Paulette H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Unexpected extras in a great location
Review_Text: We were at the end of a month long trip through Spain Portugal and Morocco and had stayed in some pretty fabulous places but this one was by far the best. From the first moment we stepped into this oasis of calm and tranquility the staff was there with little details that made it special. We expected mint tea and a cold refreshing cloth on our arrival but not the milk and dates and certainly not the staff member asking us if which scent we would like spritzed on our pillow at night. (We chose verbena). Our towels were sprinkled with fresh rose petals and fresh pastries left in a mini-tagine in our room. If you chose to relax around the pool a small refreshing glass of fruit pur√©e would arrive sometime mid-afternoon. This is not the place for lively families as it clearly states that the pool area is quiet the better to hear the birds in the trees all around you. Some evenings there was a free cocktail function and live traditional music. It was so nice to meet some of our fellow travellers. The restaurant food was a mix of traditional Moroccan and International dishes. We mostly chose Moroccan dishes and were never disappointed. It was our first time in Marrakesh but won't be our last if only to come back here and be pampered.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sophie H wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: A lovely hotel full of character
Review_Text: My sister and I stayed here for 4 nights in early October and loved it. The twin room was very nicely done and in great condition the restaurant lovely and the staff warm helpful and friendly. The spa and pool were good. The gardens are very nice giving a very tranquil feel to the place. Look out for all the tortoise wandering around!    Shopping tip: go around the souks to see what you like ( we found it impossible to find the shops recommended by the hotel) but buy from the govt run co-operative 5 minutes from the hotel near the Saadien tombs. The price is fixed at a reasonable level and apart from a small commission the profit all goes back to the female artisans. A good tip from the hotel receptionist.    Tours - try Complete Tours we had a super guide called Lassan (a Berber) who drove us through the Atlas Mountains to Ourika we would really recommend him.    Hammam Ziani is good for a more traditional hammam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was really unexpected - an unauspicious doorway off a side street leading into a wonderful garden and surrounding rooms. Wonderful welcome very comfortable rooms great restaurant and friendly staff. The central pool had a lot of shade to relax in while there were areas for full sun if preferred. Close enough to walk to the main square but away from the madding crowd and quiet - we are definitely planning a return visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tayllit A wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: An oasis of peace in the heart of the medina
Review_Text: A wonderful discovery in the heart of the medina. Everything was perfect from the comfort of the rooms to the kindness of the staff. The Ryad is conveniently located however it might be complicated to park if you have a car. The staff is very professional and accommodating and makes sure that you don't hassle with parking issues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: My second visit and just as excellent as the first
Review_Text: I went back to Les Jardins de la Medina after I stayed there in June I had no hesitation in making it my first choice and again I wasn't disappointed. I cannot rate the hotel high enough. The facilities are excellent staff cannot do enough for you and the location is great and ideal for all sights within walking distance or short (low cost) cab ride away. It's so tranquil with a relaxing ambience throughout the hotel. The food is spot on breakfast is plentiful and a healthy start to the day.    I will be going back again and I'm hoping it won't be to long before I do.    Thank you to all the staff at the hotel for making my stay so enjoyable again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, gardens and accommodation with fantastic staff! Highly recommend.
Review_Text: Our whole experience at this beautiful hotel was five star!! The rooms the restaurant the location the staff the food the pool and the stunning gardens just could nt be faulted. A real find and so well located right on the edge of the Medina. Will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: If you're looking for somewhere to stay in the Medina you'll notice that a lot of them are very highly rated and often described as 'an oasis in the Medina' or similar. For my wife and I this made it very difficult to pick a place - they couldn't ALL be good? As it turns out this is more a reflection on the madness of the Medina than the individual Riad - I think people were just happy to get out of the chaos and put their feet up! Which is no bad thing of course but it doesn't answer the question: how to pick a legitimately excellent place to stay? I'll make it easy for you: stay at Les Jardins de la Medina.    My wife and I wanted to be in the Medina but not in the center of it all. This hotel is in the Kasbah area. I've heard it described as being a bit shady but I can't think why. Walking the immediate streets there were few tourists and it was mostly local. Maybe that's why people didn't like it but for us it was welcome. It felt more authentic and not the tourist trap that many of the central areas were. People left us alone and went about their business even at night. One disadvantage was that taxis didn't really know where the hotel was but they all knew the main street connecting to it: Rue de Kasbah. From there it's a very short walk.    The hotel itself: wonderful. it's a giant Riad and very luxurious. Rooms were amazing the facilities were top notch and all the rest of it. Look through the other reviews and no doubt you'll read that a lot so I won't go into it.    But beyond all that the one aspect that made our stay so memorable was the friendliness tirelessness and helpfulness of the staff. They went out of their way to make our stay as comfortable as possible it was fantastic. From Youssef* at the front desk to Fatima in the restaurant and pool area to Yacine and the others they were just great. One evening we got back quite late and just wanted a small dinner of some bread and cheese. Here in the North East of the US I don't think any hotel would've accommodated such a simple (but off menu) request. They brought us cheese and bread to the room at no charge as well as some small pastries. When we were leaving we had some ceramics that needed to be wrapped and one of the staff (I don't remember your name sir I'm sorry) went out and got some bubble wrap and wrapped the item at no cost.    Overall I can't stress enough how lovely our stay here was. If you do end up staying here know that you're staying in a truly top class hotel. Please tip the staff and please treat them like the good human beings they are. A big thank you to the staff at Les Jardins de la Medina!    *To Youssef at the front desk: I watched John Wick on your recommendation and you were right it is a lot of fun. Thanks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is really quite wonderful there is a lovely garden which is so peaceful when you come in from the street. Our room was on the first floor and had two terrasses one on the same level as the room  which was always in the shade and one on the roof which was in the sun. It was great to have breakfast on the terraces in front of the room with the air full of aromas from the trees and flowers in the garden. The room was quite simple but it had all the essentials .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Grace A wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Excellent service staff are so helpful and willing to do anything the grounds are absolutely stunning theres a resident tortoise who might pop by if you're by the pool the rooms are like mini apartments and you even get to choose a scent to have sprayed on your pillow petals left in the bathroom and candles lit make the room smell amazing! you even get little pastries left in your room with the weather forecast for the next day when you return from dinner! Mini bar prices are pretty much the same as they would be in Tesco! ¬£1ish for haribo or Pringles! Not bad considering some hotels require you to take out a mortgage for a mars bar. Check in is at 3pm but sitting by the fountain is so relaxing it didn't even feel like we had to wait long! Would definitely stay here again and recommend  !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Manuel B wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: My girldfriend an I visited Maroc for the first time. We stayed five days in Agadir and closed our short vacation with two nights in Marrakech. By arriving in this wonderful hotel our vacation actually started. We entered the "jardin" and felt like in another world.    The welcome was absolutely perfect and warm. Our room which was a smaller one had so much charm and perfectness. The little details made it the best hotel stay we have ever enjoyed. Absolutely perfect!    We booked our next stay right away next year!    Thanks to the brilliant people who make this experience possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Calm in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: This is a beautifully renovated palace which is now a small but luxurious hotel. It is in the Kasbah area of Marrakech about a 10 minute walk south of the Saadian tombs and 20 minutes from Jemma el Fna. The immediate area around the hotel is not particularly tourist-y compared to the areas around the Square but has some excellent local cafes nearby (Cafe Clock Cafe Kasbah). It is the perfect place to escape the often busy pace of the city and relax.    The hotel is beautifully decorated if a little aged in places (peeling paintwork outside for example). The gardens are lovely with lots of private areas where you can sit in the sun or the shade. The pool and surrounding area are nice and the hotel staff bring complimentary cold flannels and fresh fruit during the afternoon. There is a beautiful shared roof terrace as well. We did agree with one previous reviewer about the breakfast which wasn't quite five star but the Moroccan crepes and pancakes with honey were delicious and the staff do go out of their way to accommodate you. The turn down service with perfume and Moroccan pastries with tomorrow's weather forecast was excellent.    We also took advantage of the hotel spa having an amazing hammam and massage afternoon as well as a morning in the cookery school. We were taught the fundamentals of Moroccan cooking and then ate our creations for lunch which was a brilliant experience.    We stayed in a "les solariums" room which was on the first floor with a small shaded patio next to a staircase leading to a private roof terrace with a shower and two sunchairs under an umbrella - all very nice.    The staff couldn't have been more helpful. From the concierges to the waiting staff and the cleaners everyone was friendly and did everything they could to help. Overall a wonderful experience!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne H wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: An oasis in the excitement of Marrakech
Review_Text: Beautiful spacious rooms unfailingly attentive service and delicious food. A totally relaxing and calming few days. Taxi booked to and from the airport went very smoothly and advice from the reception desk was really helpful . Almost impossible to find any fault : our third stay here in 10 years and it remains just as lovely  Anne  Chelmsford UK
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Can't speak highly enough of this lovely stylish hotel. The food is great and reasonably priced with a good wine selection. We ended up eating in much more than we had planned as it was so good and much more relaxing than eating out. The pool and gardens are excellent and the old 'palais' building has been renovated with great taste. What really made our stay special however was the friendly and attentive service and the little touches like iced flannels and complimentary fruit smoothies etc brought to us around the pool.  I would mention that the immediate area is a bit run down but on the plus side it is a local part of town that's therefore not so touristy and all the better for it.  A friendly relaxing oasis amidst the noise and chaos of the streets.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: a lovely small hotel in the medina.. a short drive from the hustle of the city.
Review_Text: hotel was lovely and gives you a moroccan experience. the staff was helpful and open spaces lovely. rooms were a bit tired but comfortable and clean . and the air conditioner was the only negative experience and didn't function many times during our stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and the rooms and services are exceptional. The welcome complete with fresh hibiscus juice and Moroccan pastries was particularly nice and the hotel is very well priced for what it offers. The only downside was breakfast which whilst nice was not 5* and was significantly worse than in our Medina where we stayed for the rest of our trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rebeca S wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: stunning oasis right in the medina!
Review_Text: We went to have a lunch pool day and we found the perfect option! little paradise inside the noisy Marrakesh Medina relax refreshing garden tasty fresh meal with many different choices romantic ambiance quiet staff super smiley and friendly...we just could not have choose better! Every single little detail has a luxury touch definetely to don't miss if you're in town and next time for sure we'll stay at the hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Most romantic hotel set in beautiful gardens
Review_Text: I stayed here for 3 nights at the end of June with my husband. I chose the hotel for its gardens knowing it would be very hot. I wanted to come back at the end of the day to a little oasis and it didn't disappoint.  Prior to visiting the hotel I emailed them to advise them it was our wedding anniversary and as a result they upgraded us to a garden room which was a room on the first floor with a balcony overlooking the gardens. The room was a good size with a bottle of water and complimentary pastries. There were toiletries in the bathroom which were all sold in the hotel and smelt divine! The bed was turned down every evening and a new bottle of water in your room with a pastry. The pillows however were a little hard.  Although our flight arrived early in the morning they still arranged for us to get into our room earlier after enjoying a glass of hibiscus juice and some pastries sat by the fountain in the courtyard.  All the staff were so friendly in the hotel. The front of house manager and the general manager all took time to introduce themselves.  The pool area was surrounded by plants which also provided some welcome shade. The breakfast had a very good choice with a chef waiting to make you fresh pancakes. You could also have a more traditional breakfast which was delicious.  We dined in the hotel restaurant with our fiends one evening and the food was fantastic including the Moroccan wines. We had previously dined at a top restaurant in marrakesh but the food at this hotel was much better.  Considering it was Ramadan whilst we were staying in marrakesh the staff still did everything they could to ensure you enjoyed your stay. There was a limited service in the restaurant and bar for an hour about 7.15 and although we were sat in the bar area just enjoying the surroundings they still took the time to share their food and bring us a bowl of Moroccan soup.  The hotel was at the south end of the medina and you can walk everywhere from here although after a hot day in the souks we would get a taxi which was very cheap less than ¬£5. We would also walk beck to our medina at night and the streets were very busy and you always felt very safe.  I loved this hotel and can't wait to back again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison W wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We were initially disappointed by the room we were given but on request we were upgraded to a room with a garden view and a private balcony. The staff were lovely polite and couldn't do enough for us even though it was Ramadan and very hot so it must have been very difficult for them serving the restaurant and bar while fasting. All told it was a fabulous relaxing break and we were sad to leave. We loved this hotel and it couldn't have been more tranquil. Highly recommended.  Alison
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Understated luxury all the little added touches First class..
Review_Text: For. A mother wife employeecarer to sit still anywhere is nearly i possible..to relax is unheard of and would require weeks away.BUT this place I was so at peace and felt calm and rested as soon as I arrived the little touches.. Otho h is to much trouble.  Have stayed in 5 star establishments that could take a lesson form Les Jardins Well done!! so peaceful planning my return. Must have is the Hamman.wow üòÄüòÄüòÄ  Lunch was first class and like you serve espresso! Thank you for giving me the rest I needed and all the areas you find walking round that ooze calm and places tosit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Peter R wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We have just returned from a great holiday in Morocco where we stayed in three locations the first one being this stunning Riad within the old walled city. It is located about 15 mins walk from Jemma El Fna so an easy walk to the square and the souks and restaurants. Local Petite Taxis were easily available and quite reasonable for example it was only 50 Dirham to go to the Majorelle Gardens. Be sure to agree the price before going as we had one driver who tried to charge 100 to bring us back. He soon agreed to the 50 rate when my wife started to climb out of his car! We had a lovely large ground floor garden room with a small lounge attached which gave us easy access to the pool and restaurant area. The pool although small was a lovely area with good quality mattress sun beds and large towels.The bathroom was impeccable with all the toiletries you would expect in a top hotel. Each night the staff would come in to prepare your room and spray the pillows with a scent we had chosen on arrival. The food in the restaurant was top class and they had a good selection of local wines ( the Medaillion was as good as any good Bordeaux ). Staff were very attentive and would appear at the pool with little complimentary glasses of "Amuse Bouche" every now and then. The restaurant has a very interesting way of keeping clients cool they have a water spray system which cools but does not make you wet. We also stayed in Kazbah Angour ( would not recommend this hotel ) near the Atlas Mountains and the L'Heure Bleu in Essaouria which was fantastic. Please see see separate reports for each of these plus the Majorelle Gardens which are a definite "must do " if you visit Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The Calm away from the madness
Review_Text: This place is a total contrast from the madness that is the centre of Marrakech. It's so calm and peaceful. We've just returned after staying for 5 nights. The weather was very hot but there are shady areas in the gardens if you want to stay out of the sun.    You can walk to the main square or reception will call you a taxi. Make sure you agree the price before you get in.    We ate in the restaurant every night and all of the food was delicious. Breakfast in the morning was great with a wide choice. Lunch is also good the salad of the day is delicious.    Our room was lovely and spacious and very clean. The rose petals were a nice touch as was the bottle of water each day.    We had a great stay but I'm not sure if this is a five star it's definitely a very good four star.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: What lies behind the wooden door?
Review_Text: As you drive down the narrow lane and stop at the wooden door entrance you wonder if you have come to the right place. The door opens and a smiling member of staff takes your luggage and you enter into the cool reception area and then after giving over you passports you are shown to a seat adjacent the outside dining area and given a glass of mint tea and a chilled towel. The reception member of staff then joins you and explains meal times etc and then asks you to select a perfume that will be sprayed in your room at night when the maid comes to turn down the bed. We were then led to the room by another member of staff who explained everything about how things worked. The room was large with a king size bed 2 chairs coffee table a log fire (definitely not needed at this time) a bottle of water (replaced daily) and a bowl of Morrocan sweets. There is a kettle and sachets of flouvered teas no coffee and a mini bar. The bathroom has a shower over the bath and good quality toiletries.  On the first night we ate in the restaurant and the staff and food were excellent. Breakfast is a buffet with something for everyone. There is a great selection of quality teas. Be aware as you are eating outside the bird life will drink your juice from your glass if you leave it unattended and the sparrows sit on the bread basket and nibble the end of the bread sticks so I would advise you to take of a few centimetres off the end of the bread before eating it. this of course could be avoided if paper lids were on the glasses and instead of napkins over the bread a large muslin cover would stop the birds. Birds are not the only wild life as the Riad tortoises wander around the area. Towels are laid out on the sunbeds around the pool and if more are needed they can be found just beyond the pool. There are other places to relax on the terraces on the 3rd floor roof where you also get great sun set views.  In the afternoons at the pool a member of staff brought around a small refreshment (smoothy or ice cream) a lovely welcome touch.  When the maid comes to turn down the bed not only does she do that and tidy the room but she leaves 2 sweets and a weather forecast for the following day. The gardens in the Riad are well maintained and among them are small areas where you can sit in seclusion. Adjacent the spa there is a small exercise area.  You can exchange currency at reception. On the Wednesday evening the management invited guests to the bar bar for drinks and nibbles and live music from a very happy musician. Staff from the spa were also in attendance giving neck and shoulder massages.  The Riad is only a 20 minute walk to Jemaa-El- Fna square. (Leaving the hotel turn left left againbe aware of the traffic it can be quite manic keep walking passing the Mosque on the right and the merc taxi station cross the road walking slightly to your left and then take the first right this leads you onto the square.After visiting this area it is great to return to the Riad for peace and Quiet.  A shower room is available if you have a late flight and are not able to extend your checkout time.  I have only 1 negative comment and that is I personally do not think that dogs should be allowed in the restaurant  We would most definitely return to this superb establishment

Fabulous hotel located on the edge of the Medina you arrive in the hustle and bustle of street life walk through its wooden door into a total oasis of luxury and comfort. Comfortable bed in our lovely room with its own private seculded terrace our room was decorated with rose petals and complimentary moroccan sweets really lovely romantic touches.  The food in the restaurant is delicious no complaints from any of my family staying here and the pool tranquil and surrounded by tropical trees and vegetation total paradise at the end of a day away from the crazy medina and souks outside.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We had the Sultanes Room which has a large terrace overlooking the grounds. The room was comfortable spacious with the decor in keeping with the surroundings (but with modern amenities). The hotel doesn't look much when you approach however when your inside you walk into another world.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Penny L wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: Spent 3 nights at this lovely Riad hidden away down a side street. Beautiful garden with plenty of space to relax by the pool. Great views from the roof terrace. Had a little seating area outside our very comfortable 2nd floor deluxe room. Enjoyed dinner at the restaurant two evenings and breakfast outside on the terrace. Also invited to drinks and canap√©s one evening in the garden. Hotel staff were very friendly arranged a taxi for us one evening and the room was serviced well while we were out. Would have loved to spend more time at the hotel to enjoy the garden but we were too busy enjoying Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margita - Glee of Life wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: You would never know this beautiful hotel and THAT garden were behind the heavy wooden door in the Medina.    We received a very warm welcome of lovely Moroccan tea cakes and dates.    Our room was the garden suite which was excellent. Opulent luxurious with private outside terrace and loungers. There was a fruit basket fresh flowers refreshments (even Nespresso maker!) cakes and a basket with pool towels straw hats and maps which was a lovely touch.    Lunch was absolutely delicious best food I have had in Marrakech during our 4 day stay!    Absolutely picture postcard garden. Tropical. Exciting. Staying here is like living in a bird sanctuary surrounded by palms banana and orange trees birds chirping away and tortoises strolling through the grounds!    We had a delicious goat cheese salad for starters chicken tagine with olives (yum) and selection of mixed platter for main. The dessert was a selection of fresh mint vanilla and chocolate ice cream and pineapple raspberry and mango sorbet. Without a fail the best desert I have ever tasted. I still dream about it; yep it was that good! The food was really outstanding many congratulations to the chef.    Breakfast was an excellent selection of continental and traditional delights. Coffee tea fresh juices were on tap and fresh pastries were simply delicious. Cheeky sparrows were trying to steal food off the breakfast tables!    There are few roof terraces with chairs and loungers where you can kick back and relax.    On day of our departure the hotel manager Luc held Saturday night drinks with free wine and snacks complete with traditional music which I enjoyed very much. It was a great opportunity to meet other guests too.    Very helpful and attentive staff immaculate rooms outstanding food great ambience and the most beautiful tropical garden you could hope for having on your doorstep! I sincerely recommend this 5 star hotel.    A big thank you to all the lovely staff who looked after us you made our last day in Marrakech truly unforgettable. Shukran.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Linda F wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: A very comfortable place to stay
Review_Text: The gardens which surround the pool are beautiful and well-kept. The restaurant is attractive. The dinner we had there fell short of what we had thought it would be after seeing the grounds and our rooms but the buffet breakfasts were more than satisfactory.  The rooms are sophisticated and well-furnished. Our room had an extra sitting room -- we had two! -- but our friends' room right above us did not have one. Our reservations were for rooms overlooking the gardens. Instead our windows looked over an alleyway and into a residential neighborhood. Outside of our room was a patio with two small tables and several chairs which looked over the gardens. Our friends came down a flight of stairs to use the patio. We had been told it was our patio but another guest seemed to think it was the perfect place to smoke. Fortunately she arrived just a day before we were to leave.  All the rooms on the second and third floors were reached from stairways. The layouts were interesting but there was no elevator at least on our side of the medina. The sun deck on our side of the building was on the fourth floor. The sun deck which we visited late in the afternoon had not been cleared of used plates.  There was a problem with the prepayment of our reservation. We had sent in a credit card number seven months before our arrival but when we checked out we were told we hadn't paid. I could not remember if I had seen the charge on my credit card bill. We were told we should call when we got home if indeed the charge had gone through. The manager said the card had been rejected. Turns out the card had to be cancelled due to an unauthorized charge by a stranger a week before we were to leave on our trip. That was seven months after having made the reservation. The same thing happened to us in a hotel in Rabat our first stop!  We will now think of Morocco as the place that doesn't collect their payment until the last minute.  I cut my hand while putting a new roll of toilet paper on its holder. There was a screw sticking out that was invisible to the eye. The staff was responsive in that they sent someone to look at it but they did not cover the sharp end of the screw or replace it.  There is a small boutique near the dining room that has some nice little gifts.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 days arriving very late at night but receiced a wonderful warm welcome! The hotel is stunningly beautiful and such a surprise as so u expected from the heavy Wooden entrance door.  We arrived in the middle of a heatwave 104 degrees but the hotel & room were wonderful and cool the pool a real oasis!  The food both dinner and breakfast was incredible lots of fresh fish and fruit and nothing was too much trouble!  I would return in a heartbeat! Definately thinking of planning a 'girlie' trip here as felt so safe and cared for.  One tip we would recommend is that you ask concierge to organise transport from the airport as the hotel is well-known but tucked away. We were in the hotel within 25mins of leaving the airport. Fabulous!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at this riad and enjoyed every minute of our stay. I like how the territory is organised- it feels like you have lots of space for your own rooms are also quite far from each other and you do not feel like in aquarium as in other riads. The garden is amazing - lots of greens and flowers signing birds. The restaurant had one of the best food we tried in morocco though we dinned in more expensive restaurants. I and husband really enjoyed SPA package for couples such a pleasure!  The terrace on the roof is nice as well. The service is on very higher level and everyone is extremely friendly and ready to help. Highly recommend to have dinner in its restaurant and to try their SPA.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: a speck in time wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: It is great place to relax and enjoy good food after sensory overload in Marakesh medina. Tables are nicely placed among the plants appetizers were great especially moroccoan hot salads. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A picture post card garden around the pool private little nooks. We had a garden room with an outside terrace. With the doors open you could hear nothing but the birds lots of birds in the trees. Very close to the medina and shopping in a crazy market square and the souks crowded and noisy but fun. The room was very cleanwell appointed and a sitting room also open to the garden. The staff smiling and friendly roses on the table. TV was very small but we were not there to watch TV.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A tranquil luxury in the heart of the Kasbah. I sincerely recommend this five-star riad. Excellent staff immaculately clean rooms an elegant hotel with a paradise-like garden... stayed 4 nights traveled in and around Marrakech. Always easily found taxi in front of the hotel very attentive Concierge. Breakfast tasty and sufficient. Had dinner once which was delicious as well..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Lillies L wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Lovely lovely service non intrusive but everything you need. Fantastic room. Beautiful food (the best we had during our stay). Excellent spa treatments. We stayed 2 nights and I wanted to stay longer I was so relaxed. My favourite thing about the hotel was the quiet pool area with the sounds of birds all about you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Julie W wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Peace away from the bustle of the Medina
Review_Text: You would never know this wonderful hotel and garden were behind that door in the Medina. We had a suite which was excellent with all things we could need. The staff were friendly and helpful. My highlight was the cheeky sparrows sneaking food off the breakfast tables. Downside was the cost of the restaurant which didn't seem logical on their markup cost. I resent having to pay ¬£4 for a single small cup of coffee.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a large riad cum hotel on the edge of the old city. It has an advantage over many riads of being accessible by vehicles so the taxi can pick up and drop off at the door.  Our ground floor room was spacious with a separate seating area and large comfortable bed. The bathroom was small but functional and beautifully decorated in the local style. Nice little little touches of bowl of local sweets in the room. The large bottle of complimentary water was also replenished each day.  We booked half board as there are not many restaurants nearby. The food was very good but after four nights the menu had not changed and the choices were becoming limiting. There was a good choice of western and local food for breakfast.  The pool area had plenty of shade to hide from the sun whilst the rooftop terrace would be great for sun lovers.  The staff were helpful and the hotel arranged a driver to take us to the Atlas Mountains. Although he didn't speak english and our french was very limited he was a great guide and the trip was the highlight of the holiday.  A great hotel which I would stay at again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Amelia L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful riad in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed here for a few nights as part of our family holiday whilst visiting Marrakech and we are so glad we chose to stay here. This riad offers brilliant customer service delicious food and beautiful rooms with gardens and terraces surrounding the pool below. We are already looking forward to staying again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights in this Riad in March 2015 it was recommended by Giorgina from the Riad le Clos des Arts. Fantastic place our room was quite spacious and nicely decorated.
