Every evening our pillows were sprayed with a lovely scent ;-)  Very helpful and attentive staff. Christiane the accommodation manager was excellent always eager to assist. She too noticed we had our birthdays immediately offered us a glass of bubbly.  Breakfast was excellent a nice spread. Both continental and the Moroccan.  All in all we had a superb time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We did not stay at this riad unfortunately and only stumbled upon it as we were staying next door. We visited for dinner and the outlook and staff were so accommodating. Loved the ambience of the place and will be staying here if we ever return to Marrakesh. It was quiet and a very small riad with a lovely pool terrace area for drinks and relaxing away from the chaos of the streets of Marrakesh. Very impressive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian H wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: staying at this hotel is like living in a bird sanctuary the rooms are surrounded by palms and orange trees which attract many birds.  It is wonderful to wake up to the bird sounds and the smell of orange blossom wonderful.  The room we stayed at was on the first floor and had a separate roof balcony with beds to lay out on in the sunshine the Pool is situated amongst the palms and there are many small alcoves where you can sit in privacy.  The staff were first class nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is an estimated 20 minute walk to the souks and the main square where you can barter for your souvenirs of Marrakesh.  A great hotel excellent food and first class service I am sure you would enjoy your stay as we have.  B.Harrod. Marlow U.K.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We dined here but did not stay so cannot comment on the accommodation. The restaurant is so dear fulfil food chooses excellent and beautifully presented. I cannot fault the staff who are So professional and make then visit extra special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This was our third visit to Marrakech but the first to this hotel which is relatively small (36 rooms I think). It is a lovely place to stay. Like so many Marrakech hotels it is found down an unassuming alley the front door opens into a haven of peace and relaxation. It is within walking distance of most sights (the main square being 20-30mins depending how distracted you are by the sights sounds and smells). We had a 'solarium' room which includes its own private sun terrace. In our view this would be essential if you want some sunbathing . It seemed to us that some rooms on the ground floor would never get any sun.The pool is small but very nice pick your sunbed carefully if you want sun/shade. Be careful not to stand on the tortoises which amble about the grounds!  The breakfast buffet was nice if not exceptional. The dinner menu was also good we ate there twice out of our six days which is about right if you don't want it to become repetitive. The spa was limited but the hammam was a nice change.  Reception were helpful in arranging a driver for us to go to the coast for a day (2 1/2hrs drive) recommended if you are in Marrakech for more than a few days.  We would most definitely stay in this hotel again if/when we return to Marrakech. However I would agree with another very recent post in that service at breakfast lunch and dinner can be a bit muddled and inconsistent. Menus not given drink orders not taken coffee not replenished at breakfast cutlery not replaced long gaps between courses etc etc. Little things but annoying and easy to change with some good direction from a restaurant manager.  So a nice hotel in a good location and a great base for central Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Agree it is an oasis in a busy city. Is a walk to the square but glad it was out of centre. Food is expensive we ate out most nights however food was good quality. Roof terrace quiet and relaxing. Barber shave was great although not the best I have had. Staff friendly and welcoming. There are alot of these riads and may try another if we come again. Good hotel but not exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I had a wonderful holiday in Marrakech - 5 nights at Les Jardins de Medina. We had a superior room every day we had fresh rose petals on the bed and in the bathroom. The little Moroccan treats everywhere. The staff were excellent - friendly polite  happy to help you in any way. The food was out of this world - many congratulations to the chef. Lieing by the pool or in one of the many nooks and crannies in the oasis that is the centre of the hotel was wonderful. The hotel sultana hamman - again wonderful as was the shave that my husband had - more than a shave as it lasted 40 minutes. I thoroughly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kristine Helen F wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Amazing place from which to explore Marrakech in style. Our room was perfect and comfortable and decorated with rose petals when we arrived. Had dinner in the hotel restaurant which was a sublime experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Greg F wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: First time to Marrakech and Jardins de la Medina was recommended by our travel agent given our 5* hotel type exoectations.    Through a door at the far end of the Kasbah area of the old walled city of Marrakech sits an Oasis of superb ambiance and quiet with excellent facilities that are not that of a run of a mill hotel no matter how good but 'more personal' which was truly a new experience for us.    Given the weather was not too kind there was a limitation of sitting area's with access to the bar. However that was a small issue given weather impact.    Good all round facilities with alternatives to sitting by the pool with sun decks out of the way available.    Only minor critical view was service in the restaurant. Good but not up to the high standards of the rest of the experience with staff needing to concentrate on what are not a significant number of guests. Found at breakfast specifically needing to chase for refills as an example.    In saying that a wonderful place to stay and a first and very enjoyable experience in Marrakech. A point to consider the Riad is out of the way and you do need to walk a way to get to the centre or use taxi's however that is also why we chose Jardins de la Medina as it sits outside the considerable bussle of the vibrent old city centre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Outstanding hotel, calm, lush, great service, all at a price
Review_Text: There is little to say against the Jardins de la Medina a luscious haven of green and calm offering lovely rooms a great restaurant and a wonderful part of the Marrakech experience. It does not come cheap but if your budget does not stretch to the Mammounia (we preferred the Jardins anyway) and you want to stay in rather than outside of the city then this is a highy recommended venue.    As with many Marrakech hotels it is a little hard to find and hides its precious jewels behind a sturdy gate. All staff were unfailingly helpful and some exceptional in their sensitivity of what westerners want (ie being on hand but not too pushy - plenty of that elsewhere in the city!). The reception were able to sort out any issue and problem and always with a smile.    There is a lovely pool (not large but beautifully set) in the gardens which themselves are heavy with the scent of fruit trees and full of chirping birdlife. Most rooms are 'patio' rooms meaning direct access into the gardens. These however are not so private because of the garden walkways so if you can pay extra for a 'garden' room perversely on the upper floor but with its own private balcony.    Rooms are a delight and beautifully fitted out. Wireless internet works reasonably well there is air-con and a ceiling fan tea-making facilities and a flat screen TV (with BBC World). Rooms are cleaned meticulously and with care.    The breakfast is a vast spread of international and Moroccan delights with fresh fruit juice to begin with and the possibility of ordering eggs and a huge variety of teas as well. The hotel has its resident musician who can be heard strumming away from time to time.    The restaurant also serves a delicious dinner though prices are towards the top end of the market with wines especially pricy. Main courses 180 dirhams (18 euro) for Moroccan and 250 dirhams (25 euro) for international. Wines start (local) at 300 dirhams (30 euro).    We had a hire car from the airport booked much more cheaply in advance from the UK. This is not for the faint hearted - you have to drive inside the walls - but the hotel once you have found it will put the car in its garage for free which is useful. The hotel supplied a useless map of how to drive to the hotel itself. Luckily we had the sense to ignore it.    The only downside of the hotel is its location at the southern end of the old city. This means very easy access from the airport and to destinations outside Marrakech but it is a good 20 minutes' walk to the main square and there is only one way to get there so this can be a bit tedious especially if you decide to take dinner outside the hotel - there are not that many options. But the magnificent Saadian Tombs are only 10 minutes away and the southern palaces 10-15. We would have liked to be 5 minutes closer to the action but you can't have everything.    Nearby eating places - Le Makassar (next door but pricy) Les Borjs de la Kasbah (less than 5 minutes excellent) and Cafe Clock for lighter fare (5 minutes).    To be highly recommended but have your walking shoes handy! To note that 4 days in Marrakech itself is ample to see all of the main sights. You may fancy a day or two in the Atlas Mountains and/or in Essaouira to get away from the hassle.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick P wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We thought Les Jardins de la Medina quite wonderful. We stayed for a few days this week and found the decor ambiance cuisine and service to be outstanding. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the staff charming. A sublime hotel in a wonderful city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: A wonderful place to stay in the Marrakech medina true peace and tranquility after sightseeing in the heart of the medina. Beautiful rooms excellent food delightful gardens and pool and most importantly friendly and attentive staff. Recommended for your stay in Marrakech. John and Sue March 2015
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Les Jardin de la Medina - a great break
Review_Text: We are very familiar with Marrakech and decided to spend our eldest daughter's 21st birthday relaxing and having heard great things about Les Jardin de la Medina - we thought it the perfect pace to stay. It was. We had a lovely time - relaxing as soon as we got there with great surroundings and perfect service - nothing was a problem. It is an oasis with 5 star service.  The staff were great friendly and so happy to help - although it is difficult to mention everyone - special thanks to Rabbi Amina and our lovely Mr 21 with the haircut !!! (I forget his name but he was wonderful). They made such an effort to look after us and we would like to thank them all.  We will be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: liliane d wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We spent a week in this lovely ryad. Ideal place to relax in the mad atmosphere of the kasbah.  The staff was efficient and polite. We would have appreciated a few suggestions on where to go outside of Marrakesh from the reception but it did not matter. The cuisine was one of the best in town and a bit cheaper than other top ryad that we tried as well.    We were staying in a room "cote jardin" ground floor on the gardens. It was more of a suite than a room large and well equiped. We enjoyed having our tea in the afternoon on our little patio.    The hotel is about half an hour walk from the centre the narrow road leading to the main square was quite difficult to navigate because of mopeds and cars. So we ended up taking lots of taxis (very cheap).    We would recommend this ryad to all our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I have been to Marrakech before but stayed at one of the large all inclusive hotels on the Palmerie. While we enjoyed the holiday we decided to look for a smaller more intimate hotel for a short weekend break. Les Jardins de la Madina met all our wishes and more. Just stepping through the door from the bustling streets to be met with the tranquil old world charm of this oasis of a hotel was wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernadette A wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Just returned Imad and all of the staff at the hotel were wonderful. Food and wine amazing. Wonerful trip to the Atlas mountains (take some crayons and paper for the Berber children) Staff made our anniversary a special day. Loved the gardens and pool areas lots of places to sit outside. Highly Recommend you go there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing hotel with superb staff and food
Review_Text: We loved our stay such a relaxing hotel helped by the time of year as it was reletively quiet. Great staff who did all they could to help with anything we needed. The food was excellent would definitely recommend for dinner even if you don't stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas D wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Second time my wife and I stay at this riad. Cant say that this is the best riad in town but close.  A bit expensive but not compared to what you get  Quiet peaceful and a lovely restaurant.  And the staff is kind polite but not servile. That the way it should be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul W wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: My wife and I have just returned from a memorable five days in Marrakech. We stayed at this lovely hotel. From the moment we arrived at the door we were amazed and delighted at the beautiful palace that awaited us. We enjoyed a welcome Moroccan tea and cakes and then shown to our lovely room which had its own private terrace with two sunbeds. The restaurant was excellent with some super Moroccan dishes and we enjoyed three dinners as well as excellent breakfasts every day. A perfect place to set out to see the amazing sights of Marrakech and the Berber trail up into the Atlas mountains. All the staff were always helpful and attentive and my wife was most surprised when they remembered her birthday specially at their cocktail weekly party.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: There is a very good reason this hotel is No 1 it is an outstanding under stated placegreat rooms excellent hotels top service . Plenty of other correspondents have written about it so here are some additional thoughts. The Hamman bath is very expensive fine if you just want to stay in the hotel but five minutes walk away is an excellent place at half the cost. We also bought a trip to the Atlas Mountains just up the Kasbah ( same street as hotel)  it was excellent and less than half the price something similar was sold by the hotel. Just up the road is a fixed price Emporium that sells all the tourist stuff. Check out the prices there we ore you head off into the souk to start bargaining..    Word of warning - one of the tricks of the unofficial guides that latch on to you is to say " remember me from working at the hotel" . They don't. Strangely the first day in Morroco we had a so called guide who took us to some decent places and only wanted price of a packet of cigarettes. He is the one that saved us from spending a fortune in the hotel Hamman bath.    Very enjoyable was the hotel's Friday night cocktail party complete with traditional music snacks and free wine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I agree with previous reviewers. It is a lovely hotel and a good location within walking distance of the centre of Marrakech. Just make sure you don't get room 123. It looks beautiful but is situated above what is probably the heating /filtering system for the swimming pool. It goes on and off 24 hours a day like a plane taking off every few minutes and is later joined by what sounds like high pitched dental equipment. We stuck it for two nights but asked for a change after a completely sleepless night. This was given with no fuss.

Perfect stay and hope to go back quickly.  Very good location if you want to see Marrakech.  What always strikes me is the calm in the hotel although outside it is hectic.  Everybody is very friendly and food is one of the best in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was our first and last stop of our vacation in morocco. We were lucky to be greated and bid farewell by the Jardins. The reception lounge dinning and rooms were all very nice and charming in a traditional manner.  Very happy with both of our stays.    Make sure to be nice to the bar tender Said. He is very kind and generous with the wine.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in a delightful setting.
Review_Text: We spent an idyllic four nights in this quiet and exceptionally friendly hotel. I guess it could be called a riad in that it is entered through a door in wall in the kasba wall but once you are through the very attractive reception area you find yourself iextremely tastyiful garden with a large swimming pool.    We had a lovely room with a private patio and spacious bathroom on the ground floor. We were staying on a b and b basis and we absolutely loved the breakfast. Every sort of fruit was available eggs anywichway assortments of bread fresh preserves and extremely tasty local dishes.    A big thank you to all the staff who were so wonderfully friendly and helpful.

Review_Title: Beautiful oasis within the bustling town
Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights in January. Felt very spoilt for the moment we arrived. We were thrilled to be given upgraded rooms and our room was exceptionally beautiful (137) with a large secluded patio area and a huge room including open fireplace. Service was excellent and we enjoyed a few of the hotels extras such as a cookery class trip to the Atlas Mountains and the Hamman spa. We loved the calmness of the hotel when we returned from the hustle and bustle of the medina but also appreciated the closeness of the hotel to centre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had 3 nights in Les Jardins and know that they will stay in our memory for ever. The hotel was a delight.Our rooms were spacious and luxurious; the food was 5 star - as was the service. Loved the pool and the proximity of the hotel to the heart of Marrakech. Would recommend without reservation - indeed already have!    Chris & Janis Hughes
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and couldn't fault it in anyway. The hotel itself is deceiving from the outside as it only has a single door for an entrance within a wall down a side street.  But it's like walking through into Aladdin's Cave. We were greeted by the most friendliest of staff in the large reception room and taken through into the gorgeous gardenshown a seat and was offered Moroccan Mint tea and a selection of figs and dates to rest us from our journey.  We were then showed round the hotel and up to our room where our bags had already been delivered. Our room was on the second floor up a couple of flights of stairs and we weren't disappointed. There was a large seating area with an open fireplace and shuttered windows a huge bed and double doors onto a balcony. Also double doors into a lovely bathroom with over shower and a separate loo.  The staff were courteous and helpful at all times and along with some winter sunshine our stay was wonderful.

Stayed for 4 nights in garden room huge room beautifully furnished and just unusual morrocan and lovely. The hotel is an absolute oasis lovely breakfast. Food in restaurant superb although service a bit erratic (very odd head waiter!). About 15/20 minutes to main square and once back after a long day of haggling the rooftop areas and pool are to die for. Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I have returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at this beautiful hotel. Upon arrival we were welcomed with refreshing mint tea and candied figs and dates and then very generously upgraded from a garden room to a sultan suite. I can't find enough superlatives to describe it. There was a log fire spacious terrace pool bag containing towels straw sunhats fans and a portable hammock. We were able to select a fragrance for an oil burner to scent our room complimentary fruit wine and pastries were also included.    The hotel itself is stunning. Every corner thoughtfully adorned and plenty of quiet spaces to rest your mind body and soul. The in-house hamam is super-cute.    Every member of staff is professional warm and friendly. A truly memorable stay. I wouldn't stay anywhere else in Marrakech.Manymany thanks to Les Jardins.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven of tranquility in Marrakech
Review_Text: I am going to keep this brief as i feel others have already said what i want to say.    This is a superb peaceful Riad in the Kasbah of Marrakech. The staff are very friendly welcoming and offer superb service. the food in the restaurant and Hammam are of a high standard. We loved our room (114)- the rain shower is probably the best hotel shower I have ever benn under!    It takes about 30 minutes to walk to Jemma el Fnaa but it is an easy walk and we never needed taxis- even to get to the Jardins de Majorelle.    If I return to Marrakech i would certainly consider staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: "A place where you just feel good"
Review_Text: Beautiful and very comfortable rooms excellent service and very tasteful cuisine. Staff is very professional and friendly and facilities are of a very high standard hotel. A place definitely to come back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Susan G wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: A magical property in a secret garden
Review_Text: We had a wonderful week's stay in January when it was warmth enough to sit out on the top roof terrace (many levels and niches for many different people so you can feel on your own) with the Atlas mountains as a backdrop. The staff were constantly friendly warm and helpful. A great kitchen: we ate dinner there 6/7 times and the one time we went elsewhere it was nowhere near as good and more expensive too. Would definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: January trip to Marrakech for 50th year celebration
Review_Text: six of us stayed for 4 days in January. Friendly professional staff in a fantastic building and gardens. The 3 rooms were all very different to each other but equally stunning. We had a cookery class and the hotel arranged trip to the atlas mountains and taxi to camel rides all without a hitch. Square is a 15 minute walk and the hotel is a great oasis from what can be quite a manic atmosphere. Food was excellent
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: derek m wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Stayed for a week in January from the greeting on arrival to the goodbye when leaving the experience was excellent. The facilities and accommodation are of a very high standard and the staff were very helpful would have no problem recommending the hotel to others
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Laura P wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Excellent hotel, I would go back
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de La Medina in December 2014. We stayed for 3 nights then went on a tour and came back for another night. There were 6 of us so we had 3 rooms. The location is excellent as it is not noisy yet you can walk to many tourist attractions. The hotel has a lovely garden week kept and with interesting plants. The rooms are well appointed with a Moroccon style but a contemporary touch as well. The rooms were clean and spacious and all of them a bit different and very stylish. The breakfast has a nice selection of food and is served in a lovely veranda overlooking the gardens. The only reasons I am not giving it 5 stars are that the 'gym' is just 3 -4 machines in a tent in the garden and the wi-fi didn't work well. Also it s not worth booking the more expensive rooms with access to the garden.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sally M wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: Enter from the bustle of the city into paradise  An enchanting place  Service amazing  Staff couldn't do enough  Especially charming Rabi the sommelier  Food wonderful  Would recommend this to anyone who is looking for something unique  authentic and different to the usual .  Gardens are enchanting  Will return to this wonderful find
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Elizabeth V wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: This is our second trip to Marrackech....  We returned to this charming hotel because It is unique and magic .....  The staff who works there is very nice professional and make you feel at home.  The room was romantic and always perfumed with the marvelous scents of Marrackech.  We love the peace and tranquility of this place...  We will return very soon
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: An oasis in Marrakech. Wonderful rooms and gardens with a great pool too. One of those rare finds. Not cheap but worth it especially if you need a break from the heat dust and the city. And only a short walk to the centre and all the key buildings. Quite magical when you first walk through the unassuming entrance from the streets into the gardens and the poolside.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: An experience for a lifetime!  An amazing location with nice employee really genuine people everything maked me and my boyfriend feel welcomed all the time.  We stayed for 4 days. The restaurant has very good food and good services. The room was daily refreshed and cleaned really nothing to complain about.    The only problem -but I would say could be a local problem not necessarily their services- is the internet which is very slow. But in the end was super we both needed some time without any internet. Detox :)    I would recommend the place anytime actually already did to some of my friends. Hope to have the chance again to go there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is a perfect oasis in the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. Cannot recommend the service rooms food and spa highly enough. We had lousy weather (not a regular occurrence) but the hotel management communication was excellent and helpful. Our expectations were exceeded on every count.  Will definitely return in sunnier months.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The hotel really is an oasis in Marrakech.  It's a short walk to the Tombs and onto the main medina area.  The staff are very friendly.  The rooms are excellent and the pool is unique in the hotels of this city. And with the fire in the bar area it's a perfect place to relax.  The food is good breakfast especially is brilliant.  I'd go back in an instant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Was a great and pleasant surprise staff excellent polite and helpful  Great location room overlooking the garden with patio and separate sitting room Food at breakfast was amazing but the evening was more local so had some difficulty with bones skin etc if you like it rustic it's for you Would definitely come back as a B A package it was a good price
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve N wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We visited for a romantic getaway after a stressful few months. From our arrival to our departure we were in paradise!  Even if you haven't been to Marrakech (as we hadn't) you'll know that it's noisy and busy so you'll need somewhere relaxing to stay while you're there and you will not go wrong with Les Jardins de la Medina.  The staff are gracious and their service is friendly and discreet. We spent some whole days without leaving the hotel although both of us are normally quite active when we go away. This time we didn't want to leave our gorgeous surroundings.  Special mention must go to the fantastic buffet breakfast which includes the usual European hotel items (fruit cereal yougurt pastries etc.) but the hot dishes and Morrocan pancakes are out of this world!  We ordered room service breakfasts twice and turned breakfast into brunch. There's no rush and nobody comes back after twenty minutes to clear it all away again. We ordered dinner from the restaurant and had it delivered to the room on one occasion and would recommend doing this as we were able to sit outside and enjoy the night scents of the garden.  One small word of warning: check the prices on the mini bar before opening anything especially if your tastes extend to 20cl bottles of champagne....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janet W wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Couldn't fault this lovely oasis of cool green peacefulness in the very hot temperatures that we had during our stay. All the staff were friendly and efficient. The room a delight with our own little garden haven to sit out in under the lime trees. Even had fresh limes falling on our patio to put in our water. There was even a free-range tortoise that came to visit. The food was very good too. Would recommend it to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This little hotel is located in the southern part of Marrakech‚Äôs Medina. It‚Äôs a bit remote but all major attractions are in walking distance. We‚Äôve booked a Sultan room and were quite happy with it: Big with excellent king size bed small own terrace a bathroom with all comfort we expect. The garden is well kept exotic and a true refuge from the loud and hectic Medina. Nice pool Internet complimentary but sometimes instable. Best was the breakfast which was exactly to our liking. Friendly and supportive staff.  Room for improvement: More comfortable chairs on the terrace would be good. We strongly disliked that we received a letter with an empty envelop at the end of our stay where the management asked us to tip the staff. Firstly we always tip service people who are doing an above average job directly. Secondly we paid 350 ‚Ç¨ per night and think that paying staff appropriately is up to the management.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Oliver P wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: There‚Äôs absolutely nothing to fault about this hotel ‚Äì it‚Äôs perfect. The service is very attentive and personal the rooms are immaculate and spacious the food is excellent and there is a great selection of amenities (from the obvious like a pool to the less usual like cookery courses and a barber!). Essentially ‚Äì this is on a par with any top hotel you‚Äôll find globally.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Fabulous hotel within walking distance of everything you would wish to visit in Marrakech. Accommodation was perfect for myself son and daughter. The room was large and well equipped. Restaurant food was delicious staff outstanding and lovely relaxing swimming pool. would definitely visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An Oasis in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is pure class it is a little piece of heaven inside the medina of Marrakech.  The gardens are immaculate rooms cozy and with lots of flavor it is really cute and has lots of class.    The location inside the medina is OK but not great it is at least a 15-20 minute walk to the main plaza and the Kotoubia Mosque.    Only real complaint is that service in the restaurant is very slow on the other hand food is nice and tasty.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: A much enjoyed 4 night stay in a garden room. From collection at the airport welcome at the hotel great meals and service and beautiful gardens with pool everything was spot on. Lovely room with quiet effective a/c and good wifi everywhere. A couple of families of indulgent parents and noisy young boys threatened the peace and a takeover of the pool but they were happily an exception as all other children were very well behaved (ie beware UK half term).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: federica z wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: The best of our staying in Marrakech: big room excellent service amazing atmosphere. Definetely it worrhs the visit. Really Recomened: if we had to come back for sure will be choosing this hotel again.

Spent a long weekend in hotel as a romantic weekend away from the family! Was what I would have wished for and more! Staff at hotel were great personable friendly and always keen to help. Waiting staff were really good and without doubt make the dining experience such a relaxing one! It was our first trip to Marrakech and had it not been for this fact we would have stayed just in the hotel as it was such a oasis of calm and loveliness! When we did venture out it was central and in a area to explore the sights easily.    Hotel room was gorgeous (we had superior room) and had so many lovely little extras. House keeping was amazing our room was tidied frequently in fact house keeping deserve a medal!    Would definitely recommend hotel. Location great staff amazing rooms gorgeous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful! An oasis of calm and luxury right in the medina.
Review_Text: We stayed for 10 nights on our first trip to Marrakech and could not have wanted anything more from this excellent hotel.    The location is perfect just 10 mins walk from the busy Kasbah and 20mins walk to the main square Jamaa El Fna but the hotel itself is in a quiet street - just the balance you want!    All of the staff at the hotel are so friendly and welcoming and they can't do enough for you. When we arrived we were welcomed with drinks and some nibbles and had the option to choose which fragrance we wanted for our pillows!! Then we were shown to our room a superior double which was on the ground floor. We had a huge bed separate lounge area small patio and a gorgeous bathroom - strewn with rose petals. We thought the rose petals were just for our arrival but they weren't - new ones arrived everyday when our room was cleaned!    We ate out in Marrakech a lot but we did also dine at the hotel a few nights and the food was exceptional. From the traditional lamb Tajine to a red Thai stirfry the food was delicious and a good selection of local and french wines too.    As we were staying for 10 nights we had plenty of time to explore Marrakech but also to simply relax at the hotel and we spent a few days lying by the pool. The bar staff were always happy to bring across a cocktail or two in the afternoon! They would also bring round cold face towels or a mini fruit smoothie - little touches that make you feel like you really are enjoying a luxurious break!    We loved it and I would definitely recommend this hotel!

Review_Title: Hard to find, worth the effort
Review_Text: A true oasis in the midst of the Medina. If you're arriving by car be sure to have a map; don't rely upon a GPS. From the chaos of the Medina you enter the hotel by way of an innocuous wooden door and enter the lap of luxury and relaxation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a wonderful peaceful haven which you enter off a busy street. The riad has been beautifully refurbished to provide maximum comfort for the guests. The service was excellent with all staff members doing their utmost to ensure we had a pleasant stay. We had a garden room with our own table and chairs but there are various chairs (and even a hammock) to relax in dotted around the lush gardens. The gardens are beautifully maintained with orange banana date and other trees and flowers providing glorious shade from the searing heat. The place is luxurious but not stuffy so you relax as soon as you arrive and are given a welcome hibiscus drink and some dried fruit.  The restaurant provides good quality food but if there was a slight criticism I would make it would be that breakfast became a bit monotonous.  Location wise it is at the southern end of the Medina but the walk to the centre (La Place) is very interesting and not too long.  All in all the riad is an ideal place to stay within easy reach of many local attractions and some good restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Very good indeed; comfortable; exceptionally friendly staff; beautiful gardens and quiet sun terrace on roof allowing escape from occasionally crowded pool area. Service excellent. Location some way away from centre of medina but quite walkable.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel but not worth cost as it's in need of renovation
Review_Text: We enjoyed our stay at this hotel and the very friendly polite and professional staff were all perfect. The Solarium room was big clean and well equipt and the sun terrace was great for a nice private space to lie out in. The pool area and pool are nice to relax and lovely gardens run through the hotel. Breakfast was mostly very good- the service and selection great and freshly cooked items nice but most of the bread products were stale each day.  The negatives relative to other accomodation it's quite expensive and for this you would expect a lot which it largely delivered but things like beer or Coke being UK prices when litteraly next door they are a tenth of the price is a little annoying - your not staying in a London hotel.  My biggest complaint is that the whole palce needs renovating or at least a lick of paint I simply couldn't recommend a hotel that costs this much when door frames walls terrace walls woodwork all has peeling flakey paint it's simply not worth the money.  You wouldn't regret staying here you may just come away feeling a little over-charged.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy C wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: A very luxurious four night stay. Our solarium room was well laid out had every amenity we could have wished for; and the upstairs private roof terrace was excellent for lying out late at night under a warm sky. The hotel is at the far south of the Medina so it's quite a walk to the very centre but it was a walk I always enjoyed through the busy and colourful shopping street. It highlighted the contrast between the hustle and bustle outside and the serenity of the riad itself with its very welcoming pool to relax beside in the heat of the afternoon. The staff were very welcoming and they encouraged us to stay on by the pool and provided us with a small dressing room with shower after we had checked out on the day of our departure. Thoroughly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Suzanne R wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: Lovely stay at Le jardin de la Medina
Review_Text: Lovely hotel. Excellent food & service. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay - the staff were really helpful from our arrival until our departure. The pool and it's surroundings were really beautiful and our room was spacious with lovely outside area and private terrace for sunbathing! Recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment of my arrival the hotel staff was helpful and friendly. They greeted me with a cool beverage and an assortment of dried fruits then showed me to a well-designed comfortable room. The hotel restaurant was excellent and the front desk staff were great with helpful information on things to do. I would definitely stay there again if I return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: The right mix of Moroccan comfort, pool and service
Review_Text: I was here for a four night break and was looking for somewhere with a pool (forecast was for 40 degrees) which ruled out many of the riads but I did not want an out of town chain resort. This was a good mix of Moroccan style and amenities while still being reasonably central. Very pleasant and helpful staff with good drivers (did day trip to mountains). Very nice garden setting and good food and service in the restaurant (which has water-mist cooling on the terrace). A relaxing stay and I would definitely stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A beautiful hotel with a disabled access room, service at reception needs improvement
Review_Text: When looking for a hotel in Marrakech with a wheelchair accessible room we were faced with limited options. When I found Les Jardins de la Medina I was thrilled.  We opted for an airport transfer and even though I requested a car a van was sent to collect us. As I am in a wheelchair it was very difficult for me to get into the van but with the help of a very nice driver and my husband we managed.  On arrival to the hotel the reception area seemed quite disorganised and sent us to the bar where we were served a very pleasant welcome drink and some dried fruit/nut snacks. We did not get access to our room till 3:30pm and only after enquiring with the reception area (who seemed quite put out by the enquiry). The wheelchair access room is well set out but needs a bar on the wall near the toilet in addition to the pull down bar. The shower has a low tiled seat (as per photo) which had limited use for me.  After settling in we went back to reception to see if they could help us organise a day trip. Given my need for a wheelchair we were hoping they might help suggest an appropriate tour. To our disappointment the gentleman at reception had no interest nor provided any help.  There was a smell coming from the drain in our room but on reporting this to reception they did rectify this quickly.  I booked a facial in the spa and I cannot speak more highly of both the treatment and the lovely beautician who was more than happy to help in any way she could.  We ate in the restaurant on 2 occassions and on both occassions it was fantastic - in fact in both occassions I had the chicken and pear tagine because it was so good!! The desserts were also fabulous.  We did request a late check out from reception as there is no disabled toilet at the hotel outside of the room but were told this was not possible. Check out was 12pm we were hoping to keep the room till 2pm as we were leaving for the airport at that time. Check in was 3pm so we were hoping they would try to help us out - but they didn't. Even the manager would not budge and when we suggest we had been delayed in check in by 30 minutes she said she would check the footage they had. It was not a pleasant experience and given the cost and rating of this hotel confirmed that the administrative side of the hotel needed improvement.  The hotel was responsive to the need for a car to transfer us back to the airport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Small hotel in the Kasbah district. Lush grounds tranquil pool area and lovely room and shower. Rooms beautifully scented every day and rose petals scattered. Turn down service left pastries each night. The staff were really friendly. It was an easy walk to most things and a cheap taxi ride to the new city clubs and bars. Only downside was that we were not there long enough. Would definitely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Wonderful 4 nights every member of the hotel team was incredibly helpful in any and all ways. It is a place of peace and calm after the hustle and bustle of the souks and markets. Highly recommended and I hope I will be able to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I spent the last week of June in Les Jardins de la Medina with my boyfriend and we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. From the moment you step through the door you leave the hustle bustle of Marrakech behind and enter into calm and gentile surroundings. The staff were lovely - so kind and welcoming. Our room was incredibly spacious with a large bed and seating area. We spent a great deal of time relaxing by the pool which was surrounded by greenery. There were a number of extra perks including a small drinks party by the pool one evening. The breakfast was absolutely fantastic and we made the most of all the different options. I wish the hotel the very best of luck and I hope to return for a future visit. I have already recommended the hotel to friends and family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rachel B wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: Beautiful oasis in the Medina. We were upgraded to a room with private sitting patio and roof! Beds and showers were heavenly. Breakfast was leisurely and so many options. The last place we stayed in Morocco and it was a treat!

Review_Date: Ben L wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: This riad was at one end of the Medina within walking distance to several places of interest; and a cab ride to the center of town and the souks. We had a very spacious room on the ground level with two french doors opening out to the lush gardens and a separate sitting room where we had our breakfast. There is a central walkway outside which can get a bit busy and noisy at times - so you might want to request a room on an upper level if you want absolute quiet. The workout area is outdoors but the equipment is a bit tired. The staff (especially Youssef) was warm and friendly; they even had staff serve complimentary refreshments poolside at times and someone to clean your sunglasses! We had most of our meals here - great selection and service -- the indoor/outdoor dining areas had a romantic ambience. Make sure you try their tagines and coconut shrimp. Overall - a lovely sanctuary to come back to after your daily adventures in magical Marrakech. I highly recommend getting a local Berber guide to take you around to see the real Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Anne A wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights in June. The rooms were of a high standard very clean comfortable and spacious. The breakfast was plentiful buffet style with good choice. We also had 2 high quality meals here. Between us we had several spa treatments and I had a Hamman which was excellent. Good size pool with comfortable sunbeds in lovely gardens. Is situated in the Kasbah area which is a quiet area and not too far to walk to the main attractions or the reception staff will arrange a taxi for you. The reception staff were extremely helpful with restaurant reservations  advice and contacting airline when our flight was delayed. All staff were very friendly helpful as was the manager also who introduced himself to us. Would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This place is just on the outskirts of the riad and was a beautiful retreat behind a big palace like door. The place is just stunning near a pool with beautiful gardens lighting and a guy playing Moroccan music. The atmosphere and the staff were beyond brilliant. The food was melt in your mouth I can strongly recommend the lamb shank tanjia a lamb casserole cooked in a jar for hours and brought out to your plate and tipped out infront of you.  The only thing is the price a little on the expensive side but you really do pay for what you get. Excellent quality perfect evening. We went back for our final nights dinner we loved it so much!

What a truly amazing break we had at Les Jardin de la Medina. The hotel and its gardens were relaxing and beautiful. All area were clean and tidy and the staff were friendly and helpful and really made our stay. The room and bathroom was spacious and elegant with a fantastic terrace. The food was amazing and we ate there for breakfast then lunch one day and evening dinner another could not fault it at all. The roof terrace is a beautifully decorated and relaxing place to enjoy an evening glass of wine. I would whole heartily recommend this riad and hope to visit again someday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: It is true what they say about this hotel it really is an oasis in the medina! Our stay was perfect. The rooms were lovely the restaurant and service fantastic. I cannot fault anything. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wie had such a lovely time in Les Jardins de la Koutoubia. Even though the hotel is right in the heart of the Medina inside there's no sign of the hussle of nearby " la place". The hotel combines old with the new and stays true to its Morrocan roots. The suits are perfect. If there are too many kids by the pool in the yard one can escape to the pool on the roof with. a view to the Koutoubia mosque next door. Breakfast is great with crepe station omelette station and the wonderful Marrakesh orange juice. The hotel's three restaurants are all great. The entrec√¥te of the French restaurant is wonderful. The Morrocan place's speciality is the tangine with prunes and almonds.And the Indian restaurant on the roof has guests from all over town and a view which is hard to beat. I can recommend Le Jardins De La Koutoubia wholeheartedly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauren S wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We chose Marrakech as a week on the beach wasn't for us - we like adventures and exploring. This hotel catered to our every need and we truly had the most memorable experience. The staff were attentive and remembered our drink preferences and generally kept our favourite table for us. The room was beautifully decorated with rose petals and candles and the reception staff and poter were beyond helpful kind attentive and nothing was too much trouble. I would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our group stayed here for four nights.  Just lovely!  The ambience and service on every level was great.  Beautiful gardensgreat pool.  A real oasis and very reasonably priced.  Go the bit extra and upgrade your room to one with a verandha.  Big recommendation!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Alan M wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: This is a great hotel with lovely gardens in the middle of the medina. The gardens and pool are great rooms lovely and the food from the restaurant top notch.  Most things have been said by others so here are my tips:  Airport  we flew British Airways on the afternoon flight that arrived with 6 other flights causing absolute chaos in a small airport that is only designed for one at a time. The result was over 1000 people queuing in the heat for over 2 hours to get through. If you arrive at this time make sure that you have plenty of water. better still catch the morning flight easy jet too and there is very little activity and you wont experience this.  Heat  Beware the heat is intense at this time of the year. 2 years ago we came at this time but went up into the mountains where there was a breeze inside the Medina there is no air and temperatures well into the 40's it can be totally exhausting.  The Medina  If you are visiting in the heat do visit one of the many restaurants surrounding the main sqauer for a drink and to see the sunset. Drinks are not expensive and there was always a breeze and plenty to see. Shopping is great and whilst you do get hassled if you say no politely you are left alone. My advice is to say that you are staying for several more days and will come back to their shop.  The hotel  Great place staff are all polite and helpfull food in the restaurant is great and I would recommend a Solarium room providing you with a private terrace above your room for sunbathing and having an evening drink looking at the stars and a bit of a breeze!! The pool is lovely however if you want the sun you need to realise that most of the sunbeds are in shade and around the pool can get crowded becasue people are let in on a day pass to have luch and use the pool facilities- hence recommend the solarium room. Hammam and Spa treatments were good value and on the whole very good. My partner was a bit taken aback when a bucket of water was suddenly thrown over her without warning in the Hammam and another guest told us that this happened to her too. The massage that I had was excellent in itself the room was nice and it was cool just dont expect the same sort of sophistication that you get in the Far East or Dubai - no drinks afterwards etc. As I have already mentioned the food in the restaurant is excellent and the terrace area where the tables are set up has a great ambience. Our only criticism was other guests smoking whilst you are eating this was a real problem as some of the tables are very close together and on one night we were absolutely surrounded by French and Germans smoking throughout dinner all the more oppresive in the searing heat. When we checked out and mentioned it on our questionnaire we were told that the management are looking to ban smoking in both the rooms and the restaurant.  To summarise we had a great four nights here and you wont go far wrong staying here. make sure that you visit at a time where you can stand the heat and be prepared to allow time for your drinks and order to arrive it will be a bit slow but will happen!!! Enjoy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jordan S wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at les jardins for the first 3 nights of our honeymoon in late June. Upon our arrival we were greeted with a welcome drink and snacks and the service from there until the very end did not disappoint.  The grounds are absolutely gorgeous feeling like a beautiful oasis in the middle of the busy noisy kasbah section of the medina.  The riad is located steps away from the royal palace and a 20 minute walk or a very short taxi ride (which is extremely cheap) from the main jmaa el fna square.  The rooms are big and beautiful the grounds are peaceful and quiet and the located excellent. We couldn't recommend this place enough!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Oasis of peace, beautiful gardens, great staff!....and good wifi
Review_Text: Tranquil and beautiful gardens very attentive and kind staff. Lovely room with balcony.    From the moment we arrived staff were very helpful. We were met with a dish of dried fruits and a drink and then shown around. Beforehand I had let the hotel know that my daughter was allergic to gluten and with our very first lunch they brought out freshly baked corn bread. From that moment we knew thay had paid attention to detail. The restaurant is one of the most beautriful in Marrakech among the olive and orange trees and at the side of the pool (lit gently at night). We really enjoyed our lunches here but felt the dinner menu could have been 'refreshed' - a shame as we would have eaten here more often.  The hotel is near the palaces and the tomb but about 15 minutes walk from the centre. Be careful not to ask the way as you often get sent the wrong way so that you have to 'pay' to find your way back!    The first 3 days were very peaceful and the pool was a great place to relax after hot and dusty Marrakech. On the last day a family with 3 young children checked in - they were noisy and splashing around a lot so I was pleasantly surpriosed that one of the rewstauant staff asked them to be quiet. To be honest a family with young children would be better to book elsewhere where there is a separate pool or more to do for children. This hotel was more suited to couples - or in our case a mother and daughter experiencing a new country and some shopping.    Finally a thank you to all the kind and attentive staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: we found ourselves at Les Jardins in an oasis. The service was excellent. Rooms were large beautifully decorated and comfortable. This is within the walls of the Medina near old square. But inside the hotel you were secluded from the heat and the noise of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: As we entered the Derb in which this hotel is situated my partner was feeling that we had made a mistake in booking a hotel right in the middle of the Kasbah where it is noisy and full of people passing in both directions on both sides of the narrow alleyway on bicycles and cars. However we needn't have worried. As soon as we stepped through the narrow entrance to this hotel we were greeted with peaceful surroundings courteous staff and a stunningly beautiful hotel. An oasis in the Medina.  After being shown to a comfortable area of the open courtyard and given a cooling drink we were asked to choose which of three beautiful smelling herbs we would like to be left in our room each day after cleaning!  All of the staff performed their duties with a smile and were always there to help. The restaurant staff spoke both French and English and the food was delicious and well presented. Should you care to partake in a salad lunch around the lovely pool don't be surprised to see one of the many tortoises join you in participation of a sample of tasty lettuce.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A little piece of heaven, Truly an oasis of calm and luxury.
Review_Text: Without doubt Les Jardins de la Medina is one of the best places we have ever stayed at. The location was perfect for exploring the old town and within a short walking distance of the main square. La Place. To be fair though it would have been easy to have just stayed within the walls of the Medina. Every member of staff here was professional welcoming and provided a top class service where nothing was too much trouble our room on the first floor was just amazing with the largest double bed you could imagine You could even choose the perfume you wanted your pillows sprayed ( i chose the orange blossom) The gardens were just glorious with many secluded seating areas a fabulous pool. The food was to die for breakfasts lunch and dinner a truly gourmet chef. Also please make sure you take advantage of the spa as the Hammam was truly special as well. There is no question in our minds that we will return. Thank you one and all for making our first visit to Morocco truly memorable. much love and good fortune to you all x
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: hotel location was on the old medina or old town so it was hard to get to but once we got there the facility was nice. Our room was suppose to be a king bed but they combined 2 twin beds to make it a king which was not so comfy but the room was overall really nice. pool in the middle of the garden they have in the hotel was very nice. we had some issues checking in b/c of some misunderstanding b/c we thought we can have up to 4 people in one room but they wanted to charge extra per person b/c they only allow 2 persons per room but the staff was understanding and they made some exceptions for us so that was nice of them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We stayed here first week in June a haven in the Kasbah area which is in walking distance of the main square.We relaxed very quickly herethe service was perfectvery friendly staff who especially treated us by the pool in the afternoons with commentary smoothiea cold facecloth to cool you down from the heat and even cleaned our glasses for us.We were overwhelmed by this lovely hotel and highly recommend to anyone who wants to stay in the fasinating and so different city of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We so enjoyed our stay here last week for four nights with our 16 year old daughter. It was within 15 minutes walking distance of the centre of Marrakech to the Jeema el Fna market place yet was an absolute oasis of calm away from the madness and hassle of the city. The gardens are beautifully maintained around a lovely swimming pool. It was really relaxing and much needed after a day in the souks!  The breakfast offered an extensive choice of local and international foods. Husband enjoyed omelettes made to order and daughter loved the little speciality pancakes. After busy days out we also enjoyed an evening meal on the terrace beside the garden and pool. The staff are attentive and friendly but not intrusive.  Our standard room was very spacious and offered two rooms for the three of us.The settee in the lounge area became a standard sized bed for our daughter. It was all impeccably clean comfortable and beautifully presented. We had a lovely balcony terrace overlooking the gardens with chairs and a hammock.  Would strongly recommend this for your stay in Marrakech.  Nb. Eating in the night market is a fun experience and a good introduction to Marrakech if you arrive late afternoon/evening. The orange juice is fantastic - make sure you have it in a plastic cup rather than a glass one for hygiene purposes.  We also enjoyed a day in the Atlas mountains/visiting a traditional Berber village/camel ride/waterfalls organised by the hotel.  The 'Henna cafe' is a lovely place for lunch and a rest if you want a temporary tatoo that is safe and organic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We bought a day pass to spend by the pool (approx. ¬£10) and to get away from the scorching sun. It was the best decision we could have made. This hotel is like an oasis in the middle of the busy Medina. We did not expect it to be so peaceful when we walked through the door. We sunbathed by the pool and walked through the beautiful gardens to get some shade. We also tried the fresh fruit cocktails and the lunch. The food was the best we've had whilst in Morocco. We had some refreshing cold melon soup fish and moroccan salad. We went up to the roof terrace in the afternoon and lay around on the large sunbeds. The staff were very attentive (perhaps a little too much) and looked after us very well. Our day at this hotel was the perfect ending for our holiday. I wish we could have stayed there forever!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laurel C wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay in this lovely hotel. Quite surprising from the road to find such a treat. A beautiful hotel the staff were so accomodating and the food was very good. Our solarium bedroom was fantastic - spacious and the terrace an extra treat. Highly recommended for a trip to this interesting city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carole P wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Superb boutique hotel with unique garden
Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in this hotel as a couple plus 3 months old baby in february and were delighted by our stay. We love food and we have chosen the hotel also for the restaurant and we were not disappointed: it is delicious! The hotel is reasonnably baby friendly the rooms are beautiful the spa is good and very convenient if you want a treat while your partner has a little nap...we did not try the pool as we were there during winter but the hotel was still worth it not to mention the very friendly staff. Will definitely recommend it to all our friends being on a short romantic break or on a family week end.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A Relaxing Option in the Busy Medina
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our corner room on the top floor of this beautiful property with its sumptuous breakfast. I couldn't agree more with all the comments about its charm but I want to point out for my fellow US travelers that the cigarette smoke in common areas is a surprise. No it's not surprising that international travelers smoke but it is surprising to be so aware of the smell given the non-smoking requirements for public properties in the US. So on our return to this property from a 2-day jaunt in the mountains we then had a room outside one of the courtyards that unfortunately had a strong smell of smoke. Having gotten that comment out of the way the service is fantastic at this hotel and we really enjoyed the pool and gardens after working our way through the Medina and its craziness. Surprisingly it also was very quiet and relaxing a real contrast to the street outside. There are a number of lovely service touches such as the cold juice drink and towel at arrival the sweets in the room rose petals in the bath. Excellent ideas!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dorothy C wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Les Jardin de la Medina Marrakech
Review_Text: Standing outside in the road knocking on a plain wooden door one has no idea of the beautiful hotel and grounds within.  The staff from the owners down work exceptionally hard to please the guests and are all very friendly and helpful.  We stayed on the ground floor and had a large beautifully furnished bedroom with a separate seating area a terrace and a large modern bathroom. Everything was spotless.  Breakfasts cater for every taste and food is well presented.  The pool and sitting areas are very relaxing. The gardens are full of amazing plants all sorts of birds tortoises and even chameleons!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Charming service from all the staff. Excellent food in the candle lit dining area near the pool. Relaxing atmosphere make sure you visit the roof terraces for views to the Atlas mountains. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Canadian G wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Kid friendly and very good food
Review_Text: This hotel is great for kids and family in fact it was the first hotel we had stayed at in our two week adventure with other families. The general manager actually mentioned he was going to bring his small dog in so that our daughter could play with him (and we really wish we had taken him up on that). Our room (a suite) was great and I believe it was the only one with it's own little private patio area with lounge chairs. After a week and a half of Morocco food we were so happy with the international foods offered here (not that Moroccan food isn't excellent). The Thai dishes we had were the best we have ever had which is saying a lot considering the multicultural food in Toronto. The hotel is located in the heart of the city and the service was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: andrew r wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Just returned from a three night stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. The hotel was excellent and in a great location. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The rooms were well appointed and spotlessly clean. The hotel is set in lovely gardens with a great pool which was ideal to relax by after a busy morning sight seeing. The food was excellent and compared very favourably with other meals we had at other riads. Would certainly go back and recommend the hotel to any one visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a very successful 4-day stay in Marrakech and a high spot was this excellent hotel. Well situated in the heart of Marrakech this was ideal for taking a stroll and soaking up the atmosphere of the Kasbah district. The rooms were spacious and spotlessly clean and the gardens/pool area were a great place to sit in the sun with the palm trees providing plenty of shade. The main plus point however was the friendly and efficient staff both at reception and in the bar/dining area.. We would certainly return again to this lovely spot..    Maureen and Chris Powell West Wittering Sussex.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is really comfortable and set in lovely gardens. This is without doubt one of the best riads in its range price. We visited other riads (such as the one next door which was great for a meal) and the Maison L'Arabie which is real luxury but still have no complaints re our choice of Le Jardin de la Medina as the staff were very nice friendly and helpful. We had no issues with the room which is old fashioned French style and had everything one would want in a hotel room. Don't expect modern luxury but everything works and its really comfortable and pleasant. Breakfast was more than adequate and dinner was very good albeit from a limited menu and a wee bit pricey. The bar is modest but the outside seating area is excellent and the service as good as anywhere. No complaints at all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: alan b wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Spent 4 nights here end of May. Very comfortable and friendly hotel. Staff all very helpful. Lovely gardens and pool. Takes about 30 mins to walk from hotel to the central square in Marrakesh. Agree with others comments who have liked this hotel. Excellent breakfast served by the pool lovely informal relaxed dinners food all very good. Lots of bottled water provided daily.  Alan and Pauline B
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andre S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Magical enchanting garden & superb culinary experience
Review_Text: All senses are stimulated and coddled  Morrocan wines and Lot of wines by the glass  Superb lunch and dinners (chef is top ! ! !) Lot of different tastes  Attentive polite and friendly staff  Lots of relaxing spots and opportunity's  Fine Hamam experience  Service kindness care taking
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: matt r wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: I can't speak highly enough of this hotel the resort the staff the food the beautiful gardens the spa and not to mention the amazing bedrooms. I would go as far to day you do not need to look any further for the perfect hotel for your stay in Marrakech just amazing. Also located within the old town walls so good for walking to the tourist sites. Beautiful!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel, Lovely Gardens, Good Staff in the Royal Quarter
Review_Text: We stayed as a group for 4 days/3 nights and booked through Naturally Morocco in the UK. I'd stayed in Marrakech before and would normally have booked a small Riad but as a group we needed somewhere larger. The Jardins certainly fitted the bill. It was large enough to accommodate us but situated within the city walls so on-hand for all the sights.    Situated about 15 minutes walk south of the Main Square we were a little off the beaten track but right in the heart of the Royal Quarter and within sight of the Kings Palace.    What we didn't realise when we booked was that the hotel [seemingly] has the largest Riad Garden in the city [check-out Google Maps] as well as a proper swimming pool and lots of secluded nooks for lazing around. You wouldn't guess this from the street. You can certainly get privacy as well as mingle with other guests if you want. A true quiet Oasis in a busy/dusty city.    We ate one night in the hotel and the food was very good. Delicately flavoured local dishes and international for those who wanted that. We drank Moroccan wines with the meal which were errrrrr mixed. Tip: The higher priced ones were definitely an improvement on the cheaper ones. Service was always impeccable.    We benefited from the personal attention of the French owner/manager but it wasn't really necessary because the local staff were up to scratch from early starts and late-night drinks in the bar.    Recommended for a very comfortable stay if you want to be close-ish to the action [15 mins walk] as well as require lovely garden space for a bit of privacy/lazing around and pampering in addition to all the frenetic Souk/touristy stuff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Very well placed to wander the many souks and sights of Marrakech.  Very friendly staff clean and comfortable rooms.  Largest selection of Moroccan wines by the glass - not that any of them were that good but still.  Good local food in the restaurant and the one next door was good(if a tad empty) as well.  Nice pool - heated and empty half of the time.    Highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Once you go through the unassuming door in the heart of the Medina you know you are in a former Royal Palace a beautiful garden with a pool awaits you complete with its own tortoise.The food is some of the best we tasted in Morocco made all the more special by the setting a truly special place. M and C Clarke
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment you step into this hotel it's like being in a different world. It's a little bit of heaven in an amazing city. The service was outstanding from the moment we arrived until we departed from recommending places to visit to assisting with restaurant reservations. Our room with it's own private outside space was a delight. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. The restaurant was the best we visited during our stay. The Spa must be visited. I have recommend the hotel to friends and we will visit again one day for another fabulous stay. Thank you to all the staff and management.

Review_Title: A marvelous romatic hotel hidden behind unassuming doors
Review_Text: We were booked into Les Jardins de la Medina by our tour operator where we stayed three nights. The hotel is marvelous - a unique private setting good restaurant pool and very friendly & helpful staff. Don't let the street access put you off - the hotel is really unique & great.  As it was part of a tour we don't know the room cost.  It is convenient to the medina and central Marrakech. Taxis can get to the door but a short walk to the main street is an eye opener and well worth it. We never used the spa so I know nothing about it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: claire j wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: I stayed with my husband and three children (aged 1310 and 5) for 3 nights at Jardins de la Medina. It really is a gorgeous place to relax and un wind from life and the hectic and fairly stressful streets of Marrakech. Unfortunately our family of 5 were split into 2 rooms (often happens with families of 5). Both rooms were spacious and luxurious. The children loved the gardens roof terrace finding the tortoises and swinging it the hammocks. The pool was a good size and a great temperature.  The reception staff were very warm and welcoming and were happy to arrange anything we wanted. The restaurant staff were friendly but often disorganised and slow. The menu could have had more choices for children or offered larger meals at half size/price (i did ask and they refused ) so eating in the Hotel was costly! Therefore we ventured out and had a some super meals elsewhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I have just returned from a 5 day break at Les Jardins with my 2 teens. This may not sound like the start of a complimentary review but thanks largely to this wonderful establishment we had a very enjoyable stay. We had a room for 3 one of the main reasons I chose this hotel as this is not an easy thing to find and it was absolutely stunning. The room was gorgeous the private patio was a delight as were the tortises that occasionally wandered through the bathroom was positively sumptuous. I may run out of complimentary adjectives before I get to the roof terrace the pool and the restaurant. It is all so beautifully done.    And the food.... we had breakfast and lunch there every day eating outside at the gorgeous poolside terrace. Dinner only on the first night and the couscous was great. Lunch was very very good with a menu that offered something for everyone and made it possible to eat there 5 days in a row without getting bored. The tagines were tender flavoursome and spiced to perfection sometimes traditional and sometimes inventive. And I had the best salade nicoise I have ever eaten and I have eaten a fair few in some nice places. The chef is very talented.    This was my second stay in Marrakesh and I much preferred this hotel and this location to the Palmeraie which was where I went last time. Inside the walls of the hotel the gardens are lush and it is peaceful so no need to be miles outside the city. The central position meant we could just walk out the door and we were right in the middle of it all including some good shopping a few nice little cafes and the Tombes Saadiens all within 1-15 minutes walking. And sometimes it was enough just to peer into the street from the roof terrace and watch everyone go by. They also offer to organise day trips to interesting places nearby but we did not take up this option. Next time.    The object of this holiday was to escape London for some sunshine provide a distraction free environment for exam revision see a different part of the world and spend some time in each others' company which doesn't happen when life gets busy at home. I think I might not have been the only one doing this as there were a few family groups there with both young and older children but there were also adult travellers so it never felt like a school holiday camp.    The staff are superb from the Director who is present and attentive down to the young men and women at reception. The hammam is also wonderful. Everyone was pleasant and helpful. This was a real treat because we do not often stay in such luxurious places. There was the risk I would be disappointed. But I am pleased to say it was genuinely one of the nicest holidays I have ever had and I cannot thank everyone at Les Jardins de la Medina enough for making our stay so fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jon A wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: A lovely spot with excellent design touches and very good service
Review_Text: We truly enjoyed this little piece of paradise in the heart of the Medina. The service from the front desk to the restaurant to the cleaning staff was excellent. The Riad is not one the "WoW" architectural finds but has lovely design features throughout. The pool was a delight!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Peaceful Paradise amongst a very busy surrounding
