Review_Text: A beautiful hotel luxurious rooms first-class dinners excellent service ideal for relaxing!  When you are tired after a long walk through the busyMedina of Marrakech and arrive at the hotel you feel as if you are entering the Garden of Eden.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After reading all the reviews on here we booked a table for our first evening meal as we were staying in a riad around the corner.  The hotel is very beautiful and the surroundings are lovely. The food was ok (more of that later)but unfortunately our evening was ruined by bad service. We all ordered our main courses at the table and our order was taken by a lady manager. I actually pointed out the dish I wanted (thai seafood curry)on the menu as I wanted to know if it came with rice and which seafood was in it. When our main dishes arrived I somehow ended up with veal curry with fried bananas!! I obviously pointed out the mistake she was very apologetic and at this stage I was fine and said if she gave me another glass of wine I would forget all about it. 25 mins later I still had an empty glass the rest of my party had finished eating and I was finally bought..........a rack of lamb!!!!! At this point I understandably got quite annoyed actually got hold of another menu and pointed out again what I wanted and that I still had no wine. 25 mins later I finally got the dish I asked for still no wine but after the 3rd time of asking was bought some. Needless to say by this point the evening was completely ruined I ate the dish but didn't enjoy it as I was so annoyed. To add insult to injury we then asked for the bill - they had not taken anything off to compensate so my husband informed them he would not be paying for my food or drink to which they agreed. Needless to say we didn't leave a tip. Interestingly they gave me a feedback form which I completed in detail leaving my number and email address thinking that maybe someone would get back to me to apologise as we were in Marrakech for another 5 days but no. My husband ordered the house special - the Royal Tagine - very disappointing he didn't even finish half.  So in conclusion - I realise based on the reviews here we were probably very unlucky with our experience however I think they are a Morrocan restaurant with Morrocan staff trying to emulate a European restaurant and they are just not up to it - as proved by the incident itself and the lack of follow up. All the subsequent meals out we had at our Riad and in local Morrocan restaurants were fantastic with excellent food because they were doing what they do best and not trying to be something they're not!!!!!! Please look at all my other reviews for restaurants in Marrakesh as they are all excellent!!!  Iand discussed my dish with here
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: If there is a heaven I hope that there also is a Hotel and RESTAURANT Les Jardins de la Medina!  This beautifull hotel is very well situated friendly and polite staff always a smile. 6****** Dubai or Asia hotels can not compete with this heavenly spot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Arthur M wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: This hotel was a wonderful surprise. you enter through a door in a high wall and you are in a different world. The closest USA comparison I can think of might be something in New Orleans around the Garden District or the French Quarter. I had a very large first floor room with French windows opening directly into the courtyard. Nice pool although a little small Beautiful plantings banana trees palms and orange trees everywhere. Good food. Service a little slow but not too bad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina for our last two nights in Morocco after traveling to many sites and towns on a 10 day visit. It was the perfect ending for a wonderful journey. The room was beautiful with a garden view and rooftop terrace. The pool and grounds were just spectacular!  We found the walk to the souks to be easy and about 10 minutes away. We also felt completely safe walking to and from the riad at night. The staff was very courteous and helpful We did eat dinner at the restaurant one evening and enjoyed it very much. The Moroccan wines that we tried were also very nice. The breakfast buffet was plentiful with lots of variety!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David T wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Text: A delightful boutique-style hotel with a good location in Marrakech close to all the sites. Apparently a former palace arranged around a courtyard the courtyard is now a riot of green (trees & plants) & a welcoming swimming pool.    A warm welcome from Youssef at check-in upon arrival & subsequently always received a smile from him during the stay. However Youssef was not the only excellent member of staff; all other staff were professional & friendly.    My bedroom was more than adequate with a lovely view of the palm trees in the courtyard & of the swimming pool.    Food at breakfast & for dinner was good; in was reassuring that in addition to some exquisite Moroccan dishes there was also high quality western food & I would recommend the 'Filet of Beef Rossini'. Indeed the food was of such a high quality that I decided not to eat out during my stay.    There is a pleasant roof top area for sitting or sunbathing with great views of the snow-clad Atlas Mountains; as a keen birdwatcher it was also good to see flamingos & many other species fly past whilst I was relaxing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: Behind a door on a narrow street in the Medina likes a an oasis of garden swimming pool great hotel and excellent service. You can feel the history of the building and every turn you find an interesting courtyard and the roof is a true place to relax and view the Atlas mountains as the sun goes down.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A friend and I stayed here in late March and were totally amazed at what lay behind the door in the Kasbah!! This riad is a beautiful hidden oasis with lush gardens and a lovely pool. Our room on the first floor was delightful with the added bonus of steps leading up to a private sun terrace on the roof! The service was excellent and the staff could not have been more helpful. The square and the souks were only 10 minutes walk and the reception staff were extremely helpful at recommending restaurants ordering taxis etc.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The service was top notch the location was good as it was close to both the Medina/Market as well as the new part of Marrakech. The pool is a nice place to hangout. There is a lot of character to the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Julie T wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Hidden behind high walls giving no clue as to what is to be found on the other side of the Tardis-like door lies this wonderful 30 bedroomed riad. Our room was number 103 located downstairs with a large bathroom and a separate seating area with French doors opening out onto the central courtyard. Our friends were in 102 also very nice but their seating area was consumed by a palm tree growing through it! The hotel staff were lovely and the dinner we had there was superb traditional Morrocan dishes followed by exquisite European desserts. What could be better than that! Be warned though it's certainly not a cheap place to eat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When you are specific in what you want from a hotel it always pays to do the research and take advice from those who have stayed before. I did so before booking Les Jardins and agree with many of the comments about the contrast when stepping from the narrow cobbled street through the front door and into the reception area. Closing the door takes away the noise and moves on to gentle relaxation with a sense of calm when you move past the bar / restaurant and on through into the garden. There is a huge amount of thought and a lot of effort gone into looking after the guests the bedroom we had was spacious and very comfortable the garden and pool are fantastic and the hotel staff are excellent making the atmosphere very relaxing which is just what you need after a day out in the city. We ate in the hotel all but one evening the restaurant and bar have a great ambiance and are very comfortable and the food excellently prepared presented and served. Les Jardins is an excellent choice as a contrast to the hustle and bustle of the city we have really enjoyed our stay and would highly recommend the hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cheryl B wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay. It was a very relaxing experience.The staff at reception were very helpfu and knowledgeable. Food in the restaurant for dinner was delicious. Would definitely recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Graham L wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: A quiet 'oasis' in the heart of bustling Marrakech. Comfortable walking distance to Jemaa el Fna and the Souks. The staff were very friendly and helpful. We had a room with private balcony overlooking the green palms in the courtyard.  I would recommend the hotel to any visitors to Morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A hidden jewel in the Medina
Review_Text: We spent five nights at Les Jardin de la Medina and found this to be a real jewel within the Medina. The unimposing street entrance belies the magnificent hotel within. Inside is a tranquil haven away from the frenzied of Medina. The central courtyard with a beautiful pool is a stunning tropical garden punctuated with interesting nooks and crannies artifacts and places to sit and relax. We arrived at night when it was illuminated. The low rise rooms surrounding the inner garden are laced with warren of intriguing patios water features and ornate staircases. Everywhere you walk you come across an unexpected view of the gardens.    The room we had was a Superior Room which was lovely. It had a Moroccan theme with contemporary overtones. All the windows had lovely inner shutters to keep out the light and heat. The bathroom was small but adequate. Every day and night the towels are changed and the bed prepared. However we did find the sprinkled rose petals bit monotonous after five days! Only one small criticism the tea and coffee in the room are a bit mean. We had just two tea bags a day (one mint and one other) and no coffee. Apparently you need to upgrade to get coffee! The better rooms have Nespresso machines.    The Hotel restaurant is very good but we did have a couple of glitches on table booking and slow service. I guess as it was busy was a good sign. One night we phoned our reservation but when we arrived at the dining room the tables were all taken. Our reservation was definitely in the book however. They tried their best to fit us in initially in front of a log fire! Then we were moved to a cooler part of the restaurant. There were apologies but to be honest maybe a free bottle of wine or something would have gone down well!    All in all you can't go wrong in booking this hotel for your Marrakesh break. We booked through Sovereign who know how to look after you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Trish M wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: This was a perfect and luxurious oasis in a very busy and hectic city. The staff very helpful. We had a room with balcony and solarium overlooking the pool and garden. It was very comfortable. The gardens are beautiful and very peaceful - wonderful to sit and rest weary feet! Food was good and breakfast delicious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner and I stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina for four nights mid February our first time to Marrakech. We felt like going away for some winter sun for my birthday and to somewhere that was a short flight away. On arrival we were greeted with friendly reception staff mint tea and some nibbles so an excellent first impression!    The hotel itself is in the most amazing setting with restaurant and bar area immaculate gardens and pool and roof terraces with views of the Atlas mountains. The staff are extremely hard working and can‚Äôt do enough for you I would like to give Yousef a special mention nothing was too much trouble. On my birthday the staff presented me with a gift which was extremely thoughtful. I had a Sultana Hammam which was thoroughly enjoyable and the therapist was experienced and friendly.    The little touches the hotel provide in the rooms - daily bottles of water pastries chocolates rose petals an invitation to welcome drinks - all went that extra mile for us and we would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: david w wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: My wife and I recently spent 5 days at Les Jardins before going on to Agadir. On arrival we were offered a glass of tea whilst we were waiting for our room to be prepared. Our room was at the further end of the delightful garden and proved to be quite large with a 4-poster bed. The buidings were from a former palace of a royal princess so they were a charming mix. On the upper floor (the solarium) there is a fine view of the city and the spectacular background of the Atlas Mountains. The garden has a heated pool many palm and other trees and at least 2 tortoises! Breakfast was laid out in the restaurant and coffee and squeezed orange juice served at the table. We usually went into the centre of the city for evening meals where there are many restaurants and food stalls in the square. Marraakech is a fascinating bustling city with so much history. We would love to go back some day and would certainly stay at this hotel again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Noisy disappointing room above kitchen / goods entrance
Review_Text: Booked a "Superior Double" for a 4 night stay at end of November. It was spacious.  However the room was on the first floor immediately above the main delivery door to the kitchen through which goods arrived from early morning. It also appeared to be the staff smoking area and general meeting place so we were disturbed very early every morning. The air-con was even noisier and we preferred not to use. On the inside (courtyard ) the bedroom windows opened immediately onto an outside staircase leading to other bedrooms so there was no privacy without closing the shutters. There was no outlook from either set of windows.  The staff were friendly and the small enclosed garden attractive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my husband booked this stay as a valentines getaway and we were absolutely delighted with the hotel. We were greeted at reception by Yousef who looked after us throughout our trip. The hotel itself is beautiful. On arrival we were taken to the bar to have a sit down and were given mint tea and snacks. This was a lovely thought after our journey.  We were promptly checked in and shown the grounds and our room. We booked a comfort room and it was gorgeous clean and spacious and had rose petals everywhere so romantic. The bed was very comfortable.    The food was the best food we have had in a hotel for a while. It could honestly compete with Michelin star restaurants. It was tasty superb presentation and so imaginative. We went half board and honestly it was worth it. The food is of high quality and the restaurant itself has a great atmosphere. We also had various cocktails and wines with our meals and during the stay and they were all gorgeous. The valentines day meal was great as well my husband was given a rose to present to me! We were tempted to try elsewhere but after having the food here we could not go anywhere else because it did not compare. We looked forward to it everyday. The service in the restaurant was also excellent.    On Valentines day we also wanted to go out and a taxi was organised for us. The taxi driver was so good he only took our fare at the end of the night. I have never known so much trust in tourists!    The weather was wonderful and we could sunbathe and get a tan. The terrace is the best place for quietness and is the best sun spot. This also meant we avoided the pool which the kids loved. Although the children do not bother you as it only adds to the wonderful atmosphere.    We also had massages at the spa. These were excellent! We booked a couples massage but unfortunately one of the other ladies was in an accident so my husband had to wait his turn. But this meant I could sleep in the spa treatment room whilst he had his massage done. My body felt great!    When we left we really missed this hotel we had such a wonderful time. We just want to say thank you to all the staff who made this stay special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Esther S wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Oasis in the medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: We spent the first week of February 2014 at the Jardins de la Medina and we are still overwhelmed when thinking of the wonderful hotel with its beautiful garden. The staff from the receptionists to the waitresses and waiters and the roommaid are extremely friendly and helpful the restaurant and the bar have a wonderful and cosy atmosphere and the food is good. Room and bathroom were always very clean and well taken care of and-since it was still pretty cool during the night and in the morning-we appreciated the good central heating The whole riad is furnished and decorated with exquisite taste and full of charming decorations and details.  We made two trips to the mountains and the sea organized by the hotel and the driver did an excellent job taking very good care of us.  If ever we make another trip to Marrakech the Jardins de la Medina is the place to stay and feel at home!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we stepped through the doors on a rather soggy January afternoon the staff made it their business to ensure we had a wonderful stay.    Food was so good that we chose to dine in most evenings as their was so many dishes that sounded too good to miss.    Spa was excellent and the beauty therapists professional and friendly.    It was so good I am booking to go back later this year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Hannah F wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: ** They do not lie when they refer to this hotel as an Oasis. You step of the streets off of a very busy medina in Kasbah and into the quiet tranquil and exotic paradise of the hotel.  When in the hotel you would never guess what laid the otherside of the walls.  I would suggest booking airport transfers prior as Hotel a little hard to get to but being central in the old town definitely a great location only 10 - 15 minutes to the main square and market.  The staff are extremely friendly and welcoming and at your beck and call. They do everything they can to make the stay as pleasent and as relaxing as possible.  In the hotel I would recommend going to the cocktail evening they hold great way to meet other guests. No matter your age. Being 25 and my partner 29 we were probably the youngest couple staying but was still nice to chat to other tourists and hear about there experience in the City and whats good to see and do.  We booked a tour and an excursion through the hotel which are all private.  The Excursion to the mountains was great but our driver didnt speak any English. We were a little irritated as did ask for an English speaking driver. Although ignorant of us not to know another language we did say we didnt speak any french. So the journey to the mountains was in silence and we could not ask any question about the area etc. Having said this on arrival to the mountains we then paid for a further tour of the villages by an English speaking gentleman and he was excellent. I would still recommend this excursion its worth it to go to the Atalas mountains definitely.And our driver did what ever he could even trying to sign to communicate with us. He was extremely friendly.  We booked a Tour of the City with the Hotel and this was AMAZING!! Best day we had.  On arrival in Marrakech we had a bad experience in the town and it made a bit nervouse about going back. We booked the tour so we could be shown around more by a local and experiance the old town fully. Our guide was brilliant. (Mohammed) He used to be a teacher and now is a tour guide. He took us to parts of the town we would never have found ourselves and we got to see an insight into the locals. He took us not only to shops in the market but our the back up the stairs to see how things are made etc. This was well worth the money. You are on your own with the guide not a group tour. But I think this is what makes it sooo much better. Our guide was also very helpful answered all our questions and taught us so much about the city. Afterwoulds we felt so much more confident going around the market and exploring ourselves.  All in all what an AMAZING hotel. I would stay again. Definitely book a city tour. As soon as you get there if you are a bit nervouse or if its a bit of a culture shock. **
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tiffany F wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Tranquil Haven in the heart of the Kasbah
Review_Text: I recently stayed here with 4 friends to celebrate my 40th birthday and loved it. I had originally wanted to book Le Maison Arabe but after visiting there for dinner I am SO glad that I chose Les Jardins de la Medina instead. From the pick up at the airport to arriving at the hotel the staff were friendly welcoming and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel layout and beautiful gardens are stunning the rooms are luxurious spacious and perfectly appointed and the pool and rooftop terraces provide the perfect spaces to relax. I particularly liked all the traditional Moroccan touches such as the beautiful tiling lighting and ornaments. The breakfast/dinner room was beautiful too with a good choice. Would thoroughly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lolba B wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Two days in the most quiet and relaxing place
Review_Text: If you need to rest and cut yourself from the rumble of the world this hotel is the place to go. Although fantastically located right in the middle of the old Kasbah once you pass its doors everyting is calm heavenly serene with the only sound you hear being the birds singing in the amazing garden. The service is absolutely flawless discrete smiling and helpful. The spa is great fantastic service exquisite hammam experience massages and manicure. Beautiful heat swimming pool. My only regret is the international menu of the restaurant when all I dreamt of was tajines and harira. I will go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Piyush Patel wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Title: Wonderful service in a serene location....
Review_Text: We stayed here in January with our three daughters and grandson Kai for 5 nights.It was a nightmare getting to the hotel.. We used navigation ... Try to go through the Medina .. Shortest route.. Use a map much better.from the front end to back end the staff were excellent.. The place had a homely feel to it..our grandson had a wonderful time... Beautiful interior .. With wonderful gardens and a tranquil feel to it... Open the main door and you were in the huddle and bustle of Marrakesh...and only a 10 min straight walk to the main square...breakfast was very good with a good a selection..it's one of those places where you would happily stay again..and you would have to put this down to the wonderful service and location...

Review_Date: Trish H wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: This was our third time at this hotel and it gets better every time. The hospitality is second to none from the moment you walk off the narrow streets until you leave. Youssef and the reception staff are there to answer any queries the bar and waiting staff make you feel very special and the ladies who do the rooms are exceptional not to mention all the other staff who do a fantastic job behind the scenes. Room was gorgeous food excellent and this time I tried the hammam which I had not done before but now know what I've been missing. If there was to be any criticism it would be that the wine is a bit expensive but I believe there are heavy taxes and the rest makes up for it. We will return for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. The hotel is gorgeous lush gardens surrounded by well-appointed rooms. And to my surprise they have a gluten-free bread! This was an unexpected and much appreciated option. Excellent breakfast with fresh-squeezed orange juice. I also had a very good full-body massage. I would highly recommend les Jardins de la Medina
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen M wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Please see our full review under the restaurant section!  I don't like giving negative feedback when this hotel has so much going for it.  However as seasoned travellers for whom this was our second visit to this hotel we feel that it would be a shame for them not to reflect on the little things that let them down.  In brief.. (As the full review is in the wrong section) ....great location beautiful gardens (better than the ones we paid to visit!) lovely rooms some helpful and pleasant staff.... But....for some strange reason the female staff front desk and breakfast service lacked that desire to do more than be functional. Examples in other review but the place feels soulless and without energy. I didn't feel welcomed or special. Yet Morrocco is a warm and welcoming country. The taxi driver who drove us around in his battered little taxi took the time to draw us a map deliver us safely to and from restaurants tell us about the local area and current events call restaurants to arrange pick up...... When we visited another Riad?. Maison Arabe we felt more welcome in the 2 hours that we spent there than 3 days at Jardins de la Medina. Everyone from front of house to the barman and waiters couldn't do enough. A stark contrast to here where service isn't bad... Just lacking in warmth and going the extra mile. I hope they look at this as its such a lovely place although others seem to have had a different experience so perhaps it depends on the staff?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Catherine B wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: Les Jardins Medina    My wife and I stayed at the Les Jardins de la Medina in January. The hotel and grounds are very impressive. The garden is beautiful and actually the largest private garden in the medina. Once you enter the hotel ground it feels like stepping into another world. The breakfast was very good. The staff were very helpful and polite. The owners even took the time to meet the guests on a cocktail evening. Our room was very pretty and clean. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Marrakech. All in all a fantastic and memorable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is where I would like to live every winter.  On arrival we found that we had been generously upgraded to a solarium room and absolutely everything around us was just beautiful the tiles the moroccan rugs the colours the textures. Our room on one side opened onto a private sun terrace that had stairs that led to another private sun terrace that included a parachute silk hammock. French windows on another side opened onto an orange tree and wonderful garden view. The very clean room was scattered with scented rose petals and tea lights.The shower room was wonderful with Sens de Marrakech toiletries and a well lit vanity mirror. The dining room had a wonderful log fire. The food was also very good. The staff were professional friendly and had a great sense of humour. The only thing I didn't like was the painting on the lift and next to it .(but I am an artist and so am very fussy about paintings) What they need is someone like me to stay in winter and paint them some paintings (it's worth a try!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My 2 daughters and I went to Marrakesh for a week. It was our first time in Morocco and we had an amazing time. The location of the hotel was fantastic we were able to walk everywhere easily. The staff were extremely helpful and welcoming the room was clean and spacious and the hotel facilities were great. The hotel food was scrumptious and the breakfast in particular was lovely. Overall we couldn't have asked for more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Really a very nice Riad in the medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: We spent a very nice week in this really wonderful Riad in the Kasbah quarter of the Medina in Marrakech. The staff was really friendly and helpful and the service were excellent. The Riad complex was very cultivated and our stay were very restorative.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just back from a lovely short break in Marrakech - first time for us in Morrocco.    A riad full of character and a great welcome. Lovely staff and food and a quiet location - yet easy to get to all the main sights. A real sanctuary in a hectic city.    Youssef on the front desk was extremely helpful and the hotel gave our friend a birthday gift as she was celebrating a significant birthday - they are really kind and thoughtful.    We didn't swim in the pool but we enjoyed the sunny roof terrace and the spa treatments.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful and quiet haven in the Medina
Review_Text: My wife and I were happy to stay at this well maintained beautiful hotel with friendly staff and excellent service. It is only a short walk from the central square the Jemma El Fnaa with its bewildering display of Moroccan 'savoir vivre' i.e. snake charmers monkey artists food stalls and everything imaginable for sale in the souks. The contrast between the quiet and beauty of 'Les Jardins' and world outside its walls is astounding.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: very nice. very well maintained great friendliness and professionalism of the staff.  Rooms very comfortable and well maintained. a 10-minute walk from the central square well located.  prestigious hotel.  highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sanju G wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: My family had three rooms and celebrated an amazing New Year at the hotel.There was a lovely selection of both Moroccan and International food at breakfast. The restaurant also had a very nice repertoire of excellent local and Continental fare. The rooms were very clean and comfortable and the bathrooms had excellent toiletries. The housekeeping did an outstanding job and ALL of the staff were friendly helpful and professional. We will hopefully visit Marrakech and stay there again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Great hospitality for a perfect stay
Review_Text: We booked this hotel as part of a BA package and were not expecting too much. However Les Jardins was clean comfortable and spacious with all the facilities you'd expect from a hotel while retaining the charm of a riad. The food was excellent - lots of choice of choice for breakfast too and the gardens outdoor areas and large (for a riad) pool are a major bonus especially if you've visiting in hot weather.    Above all the staff were unfailingly friendly and helpful from the lovely breakfast manager to the bearlike doorman. They made our stay here easy. The hotel is on the edge of the medina in the relatively untouristy Kasbah district which adds to the interest when walking into town.    A couple of very minor suggestions for management:  1. We waited for quite after arrival before being shown to the room. It's nice to be welcomed with tea but after a long journey you want to clean up and get settled in first.  2. The dinner menu was excellent ‚Äì great Moroccan dishes well executed. It would be great to have a few smaller lighter dishes on the dinner menu too for those too full after lunch or who have overdosed on Tagine.    These are only tiny points ‚Äì overall a great place and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Everything great the service was very nice. Everyone eager to please. I did not like the birds that would enter the indoor breakfast/restaurant area and I did see a cockroach in the restaurant and was quite disappointed by that. The manager reassured me that they do regular pesticide control.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The place is quite lovely. Room 122 has a very nice private terrace. The negative aspect was related as to how one employer handled a specific situation which was not according to the minimum standards of a good hotel. The manager - self introduced as Swiss - did not handled the case correctly either. Maybe because she was misinformed by her own employee or maybee because of her own inability - which is also quite probable. Such small incident - in addition to others as a poor heated room (air conditioned was appently out of order) and too much dust in the room - shadowed what had promised to be a wonderful stay. The result is that I will not return and advise my friends to go there. La Sultana - although a different register (more luxurious) - remains my favourite. The General Manager Mr. Luc from Les Jardins de la Medina seemed to be a competent and nice person. Also Mr. Youssef from the reception is a very helpful person. But unfortunately they are not always there. Too bad that he is assisted by a swiss women who is not sensible to the guest comfort and respect (eg also a room call at 11.30 am reminding that we have to leave the room at 12.00 is of clear lack of sensitivity and disrespect !). However with some improve in the management - maybe in the future (!) - this address could regain interest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: It a good hotel in the  Middle of the Medina it is charming but not luxurious  the restaurant and breakfast are excellent people very kind. The room and bathrooms are simple. It is ok but it is very expensive for what it is.  Good for those who likes old style but if you like modern hotels you can find much better outside the medina.

Great hotel - staffed with very friendly and helpful staff. Rooms great although found the bed a bit hard. Restaurant really good offering both moroccan and international cuisine.  Need to make gym equipment better as some doesn't work.  Overall really enjoyable stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: David C wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: We came for a week and wished we could stay longer. A slightly unfortunate start with a smoking room that seemed to be on the way somewhere for other guests but the room was quickly changed the next day to a very comfortable one with every conceivable delight - a lovely shower room ensuite and a very comfortable bed.  We breakfasted each day on a comfortable patio on fresh fruit omelettes and delicious bread. We had thought we would go out for the other meals but the service and food seduced us to stay in and we were not disappointed. All the staff were very helpful arranging a tour of the souks and a trip into the Atlas mountains.  Overall it was all just as we wanted and we both had a good rest the people are delightful and the service excellent. to be thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm and beauty
Review_Text: We booked via a package with British Airways with a fair bit of checking out hotel options via TripAdvisor so we were reasonably confident that the hotel would be good. As we drove down the narrow street we did have some concerns then we entered the world of the riad via the big wooden door. What a wonderful oasis in a noisy chaotic and old city. The gardens are charming our room on the ground floor opened onto the garden and by heading up onto the roof terraces we had views across those gardens and the city. Staff are very attentive and friendly breakfast was good and evening meals also.    As for Marrakech it is certainly somewhere different. We enjoyed it greatly but four days was probably enough even with a day out in the High Atlas mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here with our child in a Sultane room for a few nights. Everyone at the hotel was lovely and helpful. The grounds were immaculate. The pool was warm the chairs comfortable the sun terrace glorious. We had our fireplace lit every evening and had drinks on our balcony. Breakfast is included and is delicious and plentiful. We also tried lunch and dinner in the restaurant - both very good as well. The servers were delightful and eager to please - always happy and smiling. Youssef at the front desk was terrific and helpful as was Luc the manager. The garden is lovely - birds singing. The room was large and comfortable and beautifully decorated with huge ceilings and large windows opening onto a private garden with chairs and a hammock. We even loved the toiletries in the room. My only complaint was the pillows. But I find this issue at a lot of hotels. I can't understand why you would have such a wonderful luxurious room and such uncomfortable pillows. Please get some nice fluffy down pillows - and convince the owners of other lovely hotels to do the same!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This trip was an 80th birthday celebration and we couldn't have made a better choice. We had every comfort a wonderful super-size bed an armchair each in the bedroom an easy to use wet room an adjoining balcony and a private sun terrace on the top floor overlooking the tropical garden beneath. The complimentary water every day was a thoughtful extra plus an espresso coffee machine and an electric kettle in the room.. We had intended eating out but the food and the friendly waiter service persuaded us to stay put for our meals of which there was always a good choice. An added convenience for the disabled or elderly was a lift to each floor. The temperature in November was averaging 28 degrees which made the swimming pool a popular destination for the swimming enthusiasts. Staff on reception were very helpful in engaging taxis changing money and giving local advice and maps. Take note that the distance to the Square is about 2 miles and we found we needed a taxi which we were advised by reception would be 40d. For those staying longer than a few days choose a room on the upper floors for the sun and a solarium room for the sun plus a private rooftop sunbathing area. Also do try the cooking experience - great fun!  Our charming Hotel Director Luc Fourgere gave a cocktail party for guests whilst we were there and was regularly available to chat to guests and make suggestions of places to visit. We will never forget this holiday and it would be top of our list of places to return to in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aiko P wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: My wife and me stayed at the Les Jardins de la Medina from the 16-23rd of November and the hotel and grounds are very impressive. The garden is beautiful and actually the largest private garden in the medina. Once you enter the hotel ground it feels like stepping into another world. The breakfast was very good. The staff were very helpful and polite. The owners even took the time to meet the guests on a cocktail evening. Our room was very pretty and clean. I would definitely stay here again on my next visit to Marrakech. All in all a fantastic and memorable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Superb hotel with wonderful staff to cater for your every need. Once you step inside the door it is a haven of peace and tranquility after the noise and bustle of the old city. We had a comfort room which was a very good size with a view over the garden. The food was excellent - in fact we opted to eat in the hotel most evenings rather than walk into town. My one negative comment would be the birds that flew around in the breakfast room sometimes landing on any food that was uncovered - some guests cut bread and then left the bread uncovered which was a magnet for the birds. Despite this I would highly recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again. The level of service was second to none and the staff were without exception happy and friendly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Excellent hotel with very well trained stafff
Review_Text: Les Jaronda de la Medina is a beautiful oasis of calm in Marrakech. We were looking for somewhere to relax but conveneient enough to enjoy the city. Les jardins was perfect - rooms lovely the garden and pool stunning and the staff unfailingly helpful. Highly recommended indeed!    (one small hint for travellers is that the transfer from the airport can be pricey - you may want to uae a cheaper local taxi instead as long as you agree the price before starting your taxi ride)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kim W wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Very highly recommended - fabulous and luxurious Riad
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed at this wonderful Riad for six days in October 2013. The accommodation was superb and the staff attended to your every need. I would certainly recommend this Riad to anyone visiting Marrakech. Once through the door you leave the chaotic excitement of Marrakech behind and enter a serene and luxurious paradise. Every member of staff was attentive and friendly and nothing was too much trouble. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit and stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. The cookery school is certainly not to be missed. I would not hesitate to recommend this Riad and would definitely stay there again. Thank you for a truly memorable holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Sharon R wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: I booked a easy jet package at this hotel and was a bit worried as I had a 'comfort room' and thought it might be a poky box room unlike the ones pictured. It was lovely...rose petals on the floor and bed and pastries in a dish. Very clean large room comfortable and as good as many I have been in. The staff were all helpful and friendly. I have to say the pool is very shaded so doesnt get warm...which might be ok when temperatures are high but during my stay it was about 26 degress and the pool was too cold. The breakfasts were very good (need a faster toaster!)...and we did have one meal in the restuarant which was quite pricey but very good...a gourmand desert for two (made up of 4 different deserts) was chocoholic heaven.  The hotel is about a 20 minute walk to the main square and souks...which doesnt sound a lot but if you do it a few times is still quite a stretch after walking around the medina and souks....and a little bit intimidating in the evening walking back to through the alleyways...although I was assured there would be not trouble. If you are older or have any trouble walking far you need to think about taxis from the hotel. I would stay here again without hesitation...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christian C wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: We stayed here while in Marrakech. We had a suite. The room had a very large terrace and a spacious modern room. It was very quiet and felt very private. The common spaces are very nice as well and the garden provides a peaceful retreat from the craziness of Marrakech's medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great Riad in the southern part of the Old City and next to the Kasbah. Enter the front door leaving the hustle-bustle behind you and you are in for a treat.  Excellent accommodation fantastic food (and service)....can highly recommend !  Went half board but still experienced a couple of lunches and a dinner outside of the accommodation..........and wish I had just stayed put........the food at the Les Jardins de le Medina is fabulous !  Try a massage here too or the hammam.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Aine V wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We loved our stay at this hotel you really do feel like your sleeping in a jungle paradise. Perfect location in the quiter area of the medina. More than helpful staff they really couldn't have been nicer. We had dinner in the hotel one night and it was the best of our holiday. Come here if you like to be woken by the sound of birds singing and a general feeling of content!

Review_Date: Geoff S wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: Great personal service from all staff especially at Reception where staff were knowledgable and quick to provide any assistance required. The rooms were well appointed and we had the benefit of a covered balcony and a roof terrace. The restaurant was perfect with a well balanced menu for both lunch and dinner featuring local specialities with a French influence. The tropical gardens and pool provided a fantastic haven from the constant bustle of the Medina just outside the front door. Take a French phrasebook to get the best out of a stay in Marrakech!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent loads of time researching riads in marrakech and had this recommended to me. I'm so pleased it was as I think it must be one of the best in the medina. Hidden away down a narrow road in the Kasbah area of the old city you can have no idea what lies behind an ancient carved doorway. The staff speak English perfectly and are so helpful and polite. The gardens are amazing - the largest in the medina and full of palm trees bougainvillea and so many delightful birds. The pool is a good size and there are plenty of outside sitting and relaxing areas. We loved the rooftop space - big comfy white sofas and loungers including a hammock! The restaurant is lovely - although a little pricey it compares well with other riad restaurants. The spinach salad is excellent and the grilled fish good too. Lovely red and Gris (morrocan rose) wines too. We chose a solarium room which comes with its own private roof top space. Worth the extra for the privacy I think. Would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a wonderful hotel with extremely high standards. The rooms are exceptionally lovely food is great and service lovely. It was very relaxing until our last morning when the owner from France arrived and then the calm relaxing feel to the place became a little more intense. The staff are getting it right by being there for your every need but in a very calm manner. If you are looking for luxury in a very central location this is the perfect hotel.

Review_Date: Lucy A wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: We have just returned from a wonderful 5 night stay at Les Jardins and I want to go right back! The Riad is just lovely - so unexpected in its location within the medina. The chirping birds are so cute and make you feel like you're in a real tranquil oasis. We ate the restaurant where the food was very tasty and well presented; we used the spa which was wonderful but the gym facilities could be improved. Lovely personal touches of fresh pastries brought to your room every night being invited for complimentary drinks on Friday night and brunch on Sunday was unexpected and really special. The staff can't do enough for you and so friendly. I would recommend in a heartbeat and would come back in a second.

Review_Date: Jim T wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: This establishment is the epitome of luxury and nothing is too much trouble for the staff. You enter an oasis of calm and tranquillity through the door and instantly relax. You feel totally at home in the luxurious surroundings wonderful gardens and our favourite the lovely roof lounge.  The restaurant food will put many five star places to shame with excellent choice and quality and of course wonderful service. After the hectic atmosphere of Marrakech Les jardins is the perfect contrast
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A delightful sanctuary in the midst of the hubbub of the medina
Review_Text: We were thrilled with our choice of Les Jardins ‚Äì it is an elegant and welcoming place from which to explore Marrakech ‚Äì and an easy walk to the main square. The food was excellent the gardens beautiful and the rooms were comfortable and stylish. The reception staff were always available and genuinely happy to deal with a variety of requests even arranging last minute ballooning. We chose the hotel partly because of the cookery school and spa and found both of those excellent as well. This is a great choice for a weekend away with friends and highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spend a beautiful moment there! We had a very good lunch and the win was excellent !  There is plenty of choice of food maroccan but also international. The atmosphere is very peaceful and everyone was so nice and friendly ! The hammam was one of the best i tried! and of course the garden is beautiful. I definitely recommend this place to spend few days in Marrakech!

Review_Date: Eleanor S wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: This is our second time to stay at Les Jardins and I would say the experience and hospitality was excellent. The staff remembered us from last year and once again looked after us so well. This is a wonderful place to stay: an oasis of tranquility once you step into the lovely entrance and walked towards the garden pool and dining room. The bedroom was spacious clean and very comfortable. The food was delicious and we had dinner in the hotel every night.  Loved every moment of the holiday and both and myself plan to return. A great place to relax and unwind.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joseph W wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Welcome oasis in a hectic city
Review_Text: We flew into Marrakech and were left at the end of our street by the taxi. It's only a minute walk down to the hotel but we were a little surprised by the chaos going on right outside of the hotel. Once we walked inside we were shocked. Beautiful serene and quiet. We had to wait about an hour for our room to be ready but no big deal. We enjoyed lunch and were excited about our latest adventure. The room we were given was huge. We had our own private terrace a sitting area king size bed and very large bathroom. Breakfast was plentiful and well managed. The staff was attentive yet not overbearing. Overall we were extremely pleased.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had truly a great experience and excellent days in Marakesh...Les Jardins was big contributor to those excellent days...Great staff and very hospitable environment...location was also big help...it is in the middle of all historic part of the city and walking distance to many historic attractions...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful oasis in the middle of a busy Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed here 3 nights for an anniversary. Very special place read loads of reviews but settled n this hotel. So glad we did was just a beautiful welcoming attentive but not overbearing place to stay. Nothing was too much trouble and they made lovely little touches to our room. Toiletries in the room are gorgeous the pool is chilly but once in a welcome cool off and great size for a swim unlike the plunge pools at raids. It took us about 20-25 minutes to walk to the main square mainly because of the various distractions along the way. Found it hard to leave the hotel on the first day was so relaxing! Amazing breakfast an abundance of food and the owners were extremely welcoming with a cocktail/wine evening first night. No pressure or talk just a easygoing welcome drink where you can meet other guests/staff if you choose to do so. Food was beautiful though pricey but we ate once there and the other two nights the amazing street food - def worth doing.  100% recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Diana H wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: This is a beautiful restful place to stay in Marrakech. It is located in the Kasbah and a 20 minute walk to Jemaa el-Fnaa the main square of Marrakesh. We stayed 4 nights. After exploring the busy streets and souks it is a real delight to step back into this Riad with it's lovely garden and pool area to relax in. Our room which was on the first floor was very nicely furnished kept beautifully clean everyday and we also had a small terrace which looked out over the pool/garden area. The staff were always friendly and helpful and the restaurant excellent. We would recommend visitors try the traditional Morrocan breakfast it's delicious.  The Riad staff are very helpful at arranging guides excursions money exchange taxis drivers etc. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel staff arranged for us on our first day an English speaking guide to escort us around. He took us through all the little alleyways local shortcuts and back streets which were very interesting telling us of the history of where we were walking which was great. Without our guides local road knowledge we could have got hopelessly lost in the maze which is the Kasbah if we had wandered around there alone. After that day though we stuck to the main roads and had no problems getting around. The locals are very helpful though it helps if you speak French
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for five nights with my wife who has always wanted to stay in a riad. You enter the hotel through a doorway off a narrow street into reception then on into the lovely garden and pool area. We had a room on the 1st floor which was enormous with 2 seating areas and a large bathroom with superb toiletries. Service and food were very good a little expensive but proportional to eating in decent restaurants. The hotel is just inside the city walls and to reach the centre you have to walk about twenty minutes through the Kasbah which we did several times even late at night and felt very safe. You could get a taxi but you would miss out an experience which was like walking through a film set.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Angela H wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: My daughter and I stayed here for 3 nights and it is absolutely beautiful. You enter the reception area from a little street and walk into what can only be described as 'The secret garden'. The setting is outstanding with fabulous gardens. The food was excellent if a tad expensive similar to European prices. Our room was lovely cleaned twice a day and above the room up a little stair case we had our own private terrace. It is a little paradise.    The choice of food for breakfast was excellent . The only criticism I could make was the breakfast service. You had to ask several times for tea or coffee the tables were often not re set if you came down a little later and staff didn't clear your dishes very quickly. I did mention this to the manager who was most professional and offered my daughter and I a free massage. Having said this the dinner staff were excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This hotel or riad is in the south of the Medina. On arrival you pass through narrow busy streets where locals are going about their daily business. You then pass through Le Jardin de la Medina's door and are transported into an oasis of calm. With excellent service and a friendliness the riad has a lovely pool area as well as a traditional feel with elements of luxury added. We used the hotel as a base for a week and they arranged drivers and local guides who took us to the Atlas Mountains. All quietly and efficiently organised. We were located about a 25 minutes walk to the main square which was always an interesting journey! From here you sawZreal life; people shopping children playing and we enjoyed the sounds and smells of Morocco. We had a fabulous time in the hotel and in the country. I'd fully recommend it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights here and what a wonderful start to our holiday. The riad is situated just inside the medina walls so was a perfect location to explore the city. We were given a warm welcome on arrival with fruit juice and a tray of dried fruits - the dates were the best I have ever eaten! Our room a solarium room was beautiful with stairs from the patio to our own private sun terrace. The staff could not do enough for you - service was excellent. Breakfast was a relaxed affair with an excellent choice of pastries fruit etc in addition to our own 'tagine' of pastries. Dinner was superb if a little expensive - more akin to UK prices. The pool area is lovely and there is also a sun terrace. A little bit of heaven in a chaotic city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martin H wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Just spent 4 wonderful nights at Les Jardins de Medina. I've been to Marrakech a number of times and this was by far the best place I've staid. The amenities of a large hotel combined with the intimacy of a small Riad. Excellent team of staff with right mix of efficiency and friendliness. We had both lunch and dinner here and each was excellent. We also thought breakfast was good. More choice than you would get in most riads with cooked to order egg dishes and a good selection of pastries etc. All in all a great place to stay.

Review_Date: Lyn Mc wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Myself and 9 friends stayed for 3 wonderful nights.  Everything was perfect the staff were outstanding the food was excellent and the atmosphere luxuriant.  I have to say for me the gentleman cleaning my sun glasses whilst I lazed on my sun lounger was the highlight. I felt like the Princess who once lived in this lovely Palace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: The hotel was a wonderful oasis amidst the heat and bustle of Marrakech. Once you stepped through the door you felt safe and could relax. The food was very good in fact some was excellent - the dinner was the best I had whilst in Marrakech but the menu description did not do justice to the dish that was served. A simple starter you might think described as 'Spinach and preserved lemons' does not conjour up the delicious spinach and lemon mix three part course that was produced! loved the Moroccan salad that was served with its interesting component parts. Breakfast was a little lacklustre and service did not seem inspired. Bedroom was beautifully clean and well serviced only complaint was that there was no extractor fan in the bathroom but discovering a small window which could be opened reduced this problem. The pool was surrounded by a lush garden - very necessary with the high temperature experienced at the end of August. Have read comments about hotel taxi to airport - I was charged about ¬£16 which wasn't bad I thought but then I'm used to London fares!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Aretusa O wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: We wanted to stay inside The Medina Then this Riad It's great! It's near to the new and touristic neighborhoods (shopping mall restaurants and nightclubs) and in The Medina though. The restaurant It's very good there isn't air conditioning though. The pool area is very nice. Perfect for relax time. The service is good and friendly. The room is very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What more is there to add to all the excellent reviews! Spent four nights here and everything was lovely just as I had hoped. Great staff lovely gardens so relaxing. Lots of choice at breakfast lunch and dinner also excellent in our opinion.  Highly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Gitte K wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Title: Wonderful stay at Les Jardins de la Medina
Review_Text: Excellent hotel. Central location yet wonderful tranquil atmosphere. Lovely rooms very clean with attention to detail. Staff very friendly and service minded. Can strongly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Graham E wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: I was a solo traveler and spent an idillic week in this Oasis within the Medina. Great location 10 minute walk from the madness of the Djemaa el-fna Sq. staff were very friendly without being intrusive. I would recommend.    Graham Cheltenham
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Mary S wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Title: Peace and elegance hidden within the Kasbah
Review_Text: After getting a little lost in the kasbah (my cab let me out several streets away) I was relieved when the staff buzzed me in and all of the noise and dirt of the street just disappeared. I stayed two nights and was upgraded to a Sultana room (115) which was spacious quiet and well-appointed in a mix of Moroccan and Western decor. Outside temperatures were 100+ degrees F/39 C so I greatly appreciated the shaded room and patio quiet air conditioning and rainfall shower. I also enjoyed the peace and beauty of the gardens my soaking tub in-room espresso and lovely Moroccan sweets and fruit that came with my room. (Suggestion: Peel the fruit.) The bed was very comfortable. The restaurant is relatively expensive as hotel restaurants usually are but sometimes it's good to just stay in and I had nothing but well-made food from the restaurant (a delicious seafood tagine intensely-flavored harira lovely berber omelette and freshly-made batbouts from the breakfast buffet).. At the end of a hectic two-week trip I found this a lovely civilized place to relax and move more slowly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Hoa-an B wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: LOCATION  South end within the medina roughly 10 minutes walk from the main square Jeema el Fna. Because of its location inside the old town some may call the immediate surroundings authentic some may just call it dirty and crammed. You have to walk through some back streets to get to the hotel.    GOOD  Beautiful lush garden and lovely pool. It's definitely a nice and tranquil escape from the city outside. The rooms are well appointed and there's a lush rustic charm in the interior design rather than opulent luxury. You definitely feel like you are in a Moroccan riad with character and not another large international hotel. You also get free N'espresso and bottled water in the room. Personable service and the front of hour staff are very friendly and helpful particularly with restaurant recommendations.    BAD  The in-house restaurant. Terrible breakfast with limited food selection. Some of the food on display seemed to have been out for a long time and the pastry was dry. If you are used to the larger hotels' breakfast be prepared to lower your expectations. Our lunch didn't really improve either so we ended up not eating there again. The rustic charm in the rooms can easily be seen as tired by some. The aircon in both rooms that we had were noisy and one of them broke down in the middle of one night. Finally the hotel charged 350 MAD (¬£26) for airport transfer for a journey that last precisely 6:30 minutes from door to door in a dirty and tired-looking Hyundai. Seriously?!    SUMMARY  I stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina with my partner and my parents for a long weekend 11-14 July 2013. I have also stayed here before in 2007. Both my stays are good and the riad can be recommended but it needs to improve its breakfast offering and quality as well as the airport transfer before I can give it my full endorsement.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A Tranquil Haven in the Medina
Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. Beautiful gardens clean rooms fantastic pool area helpful and attentive staff and lots of added extras make this hotel truly special. We were offered an upgrade upon arrival which after a particularly stressful day of travelling was hugely appreciated. Marrakech can be somewhat overwhelming at times so having this peaceful hotel to retire to in the evenings was heavenly. We also ate in the restaurant and it turned out to be one of the best meals we had all week.    The attention to detail in this hotel is incredible. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Marrakech and can't recommend it highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lynne P wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: We wanted a romantic retreat to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary and my birthday. Most of the boxes were ticked - but a long wait for our room upon arrival and some plumbing issues which resulted in two changes of room did spoil things a little. The hotel over-compensated for this with gifts and hospitality for both our 'special celebration' complete with Oud player and my birthday - champagne cake and waiters singing to me in Arabic! We really enjoyed the cookery course which was just the two of us the chef and a member of the waiting team to translate and help. The pool area is lovely and relaxed yet strangely crowded on the Sunday we were there - think that there were people visiting residents. In particular the location excellent if you are sightseers as you can brave most of the main attractions on foot or they are a short taxi ride away. Hotel staff are kind and attentive but like everybody in Marrakech it seems prepared to hustle when it suits them and will say 'two minutes' when they really mean 20!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ruth C wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I visited Les Jardins de la Medina for a "lunch and pool" afternoon during our stay in Marrakech and by the end of that day were wishing we had booked to stay for the whole trip!  Les Jardins is simply magnificent.  In the midst of the hot and busy Medina stepping through the front door sees guests discover a sumptuous secret garden. The service is attentive and efficient- with the owners themselves even warmly inviting my boyfriend and I to the weekly guest's cocktail party.  A worthy mention also goes to the restaurant at Les Jardins which is utterly superb. Our lunch there was easily the best meal we had in Marrakech despite us also visiting a number of the other top rated restaurants the city has to offer.  All in all Les Jardins de la Medina is an experience not to be missed- we will certainly be booking in for our next trip to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having travelled most of the world and having stayed in many of the best and perhaps some of the worst hotels I can truly say this is one of the best. It is luxurious elegant refined and manages to create a laid back atmosphere. The work both front of house and behind the scenes creates an hotel worthy of any visit to Marrakech. The staff are charming helpful and totally unobtrusive. The rooms gardens and the beautifully prepared excellent food and drinks are exceptional and are presented in a delightful manner. Clearly it is an oasis of peace and tranquillity in the midst of a fascinating and very bustling city. I enjoyed my stay every bit as much as my earlier stays in La Mamounia which is not to detract from the latter but simply to highlight the standard of this very special place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: An oasis in a beautiful bustling city.
Review_Text: We had a fantastic 6 days spent in Marrakech and it couldn't have been more perfect. After a busy day exploring there is no more than you could wish for at les jardins de la medina. With it being our first trip to Morocco we were a little unsure of what to expect - however that feeling immediately dissipated upon arrival. The Staff were excellent but Youssef stood out with his recommendations for restaurants and excursions out into the Atlas Mountains. You have to stay here!

Review_Title: An Oasis in the middle of the Kasbah!
Review_Text: This hotel was excellent! Clean with a great garden great rooms. The pool area was always busy but lounge chairs were accessible.One night we had a cocktail party for all the guests with complimentary drinks. Very Nice.  The staff were knowledgeable and attentive of our every need. You were given a tour of the grounds upon arrival. Also a nice array of dates nuts and mint tea. Check in time is 2:00 pm .  They have a fixed menu lunch  and dinner but there is also ala carte choices. Prices on the high side. The presentation and quality of the food was excellent. Portions were adequate but on small side it was so good you wish you had that extra bite. All the while you are listening to great tranquil music and birds chirping.  The wifi is adequate not very accessible from your room. .the rom we stayed in w as large and airygreat linens and a nice rose petal strewened bathroom. We will go back. The property is about a 15 minute walking distance to the square el fina .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our home from home in Marrakech.
Review_Text: When in Marrakech this is the only hotel we would stay at. It is wonderfully situated in the heart of the old city and yet it is a haven of peace and tranquillity. Guests are made to feel most welcome by the staff who cannot do enough for you. The rooms are well appointed clean and quiet. In our two visits this year we had rooms on the ground floor which opened onto the garden. The garden is well kept and contains a pool. The pool area is maybe a bit on the small side and does get a bit crowded at times. The restaurant serves excellent food expensive maybe but a bit special. They have a really good chef.    Seek out this hotel and you will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen M wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We stayed here last August having read all of the reviews and were not disappointed. Finding it by car was not something I would recommend. Our sat nab was hopeless and although we were in the medina the small streets are not car friendly so next time we might leave the car and hire it later! The hotel was a hidden oasis in a dusty street... Rooms and pool area fabulous and dinner was lovely although eating out in the main square is an experience not to be missed. We will certainly stay again if in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: paul s wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: The solarium Rooms gave a great private terrace and are ideal when you are travelling as a couple. Service is outstanding Rooms are cleaned twice a day and there is constantly someone changing the towels by the Pool. Delicious breakfast dinner good but rather expensive for Marrakech.

Review_Date: Rachel G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: First class stay in every way...
Review_Text: We booked Les Jardins mainly based on previous trip advisor reviews. We wanted something that had a good size pool great location and five star feel with authentic morrocan feel. I'm pleased to say the hotel meet our expectations and beyond.    The staff are friendly and very knowledgable. Perfect location 15min walk to the main square. Excellent food breakfast is included and is fit for a king! We dined in the restaurant and were extremely pleased with the quality of food and service. We enjoyed sightseeing in the mornings before it got too hot then would enjoy relaxing by the pool till early evening. A tip if hungry by the poolside order club sandwiches. They're not on the menu but delicious!! I highly recommend great mini break....

Review_Title: Excellent boutique hotel in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Beautiful garden good sized pool excellent rooms and friendly service.  The hotel is within easy walking distance of Place Jamaa El Fna and the hustle and bustle of the souks.  Short transfer from the airport maybe 10-15 mins and once behind the front door of the hotel is a haven of calm away from the busy streets of Marrakech.  Staff very helpful and friendly rooms clean and well presented over-looking the gardens which offer plenty of shade when temperatures are soaring.  Food is good and can be enjoyed seated adjacent to the pool in the evenings.  Would definitely recommend this hotel and would certainly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We couldn't find fault with this oasis of tranquility . Superb service  friendly staff  great food and a perfect start to our married life .  We have travelled extensively and this is in the top 3 hotels that we have had the pleasure to stay in . Would highly recommend it to any one
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: evajones a wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We came here for our honeymoon and loved the place! Its authentic modern and just absolutely peaceful. The lush garden is amazing and invites you to spend some time outside even in the august heat! Friendly service quiet neighborhood and amazing interior. The only thing we didnt like was the gourmet-style dinner we tried. You may :) Breakfast was good though!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: An Oasis of calm from the bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We loved this hotel! Location is just a bit away from the main areas of Marrakech but honestly that's no bad thing. Gardens are lovely pool - small but nice restaurant very good our room small but well appointed. BUT I had the best service from the reception staff who really went the extra mile in getting me a charger from my camera battery in under 2 hours (having asked at 7.30 pm on a Friday with no real hope of getting one that night). They exceeded expectations and were superb. Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really lovely and spacious hotel with a friendly and helpfully staff. We stayed here 7 days with family 7 people and 4 rooms (all different and pretty with fresh rose petals everywhere so beautiful !). Excellent food and excellent "Moroccan diner". Thank you for all !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a really lovely hotel. location excellent. just a 20 minute walk to the Fna Square. Staff are friendly and really helpful. Our bedroom was so pretty. Rose petals everywhere! just lovely. The food was excellent. Just one tiny problem (and i'm not sure how they could fix this) there's only a small amount of sunbeds in the sun so there's a bit of a scramble to bag yourself a bed. I had to move to find a sunny spot and then back to my bed in the shade. However i did find a rooftop terrace with more beds in direct sunlight so all was ok. i don't know how they manage though when the hotel is full. Otherwise a truly lovely place. i would return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 6 nights for our 'Babymoon' and had a great holiday. We were looking for a relaxing holiday with some shopping good food and culture thrown in and we found it. Overall we loved the hotel and its team of friendly staff and would recommend it to our friends however it wasn't completely perfect which is why I would give it either 4 or 4.5 instead of 5 stars.    Location:    Convenient but not central. The Jemaa-el-Fna Square is about a 20min walk away or a 50dh cab ride. In fact everything is about a 50-60dh cab ride away.    Room:    Nice and comfortable but not great. This is a riad so the rooms have a lot of character and charm however the shower screen in our bathroom was too small so after every shower the floor would be flooded. I found the bed too hard for my liking and the pillows too soft so I did not sleep as well as I would have liked. My heavily pregnant wife didn't seem to mind it so maybe it was just me. Some rooms have outdoor space but ours didn't. I would try and get one with a verandah if you can.    Amenities:    The pool is the big selling point here. Reserve a bed early by dropping one of the provided sun hats before having breakfast and laze the morning away in one of the largest private gardens in the Medina. It really is an oasis.    Restaurant:    Great food but European prices.    Staff:    Very friendly and helpful and who speak perfect English for those of us with rusty French and no Arabic. Don't bother asking for restaurant recommendations though as they will refer to the 'Best Restaurants in Marrakech' book and will be expensive for what you get.    Breakfast:    A good selection of western and local fare as well as eggs cooked to order.    Conclusion:    Overall we enjoyed our stay and would recommend it to our friends. We relaxed shopped explored and looked forward to returning out this oasis in the Medina every day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Coming from the noisy streets of old town marrakech this peaceful place just makes it. Pool and garden that refresh you truly.. Very beautiful place with fantastic rooms the rooftop terrace in the room.. and genuinely friendly service thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: PJ Phillips wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: We spent 5 days in this lovely hotel. The staff were really nice friendly and helpful.  The suite was great and the food was 5 star.  The grounds were very tidy loads of little nooks to go and hide away.  The manager is a real character and totally adds a special touch to the over all ambience.  His dog Amy is a little character of her own too.  A real oasis - highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is within walking distance of the souks and real life of the Medina but is a haven of calm disturbed only by birdsong. The gardens around the pool are like a real oasis. The staff are helpful and attentive. My young daughter wanted a crystal stone and the Director went out and bought one for her. Our room (Sultana) was a wonderful cool suite with a small and very private sunny terrace. I could certainly find no reason to stay anywhere else on a return trip. A big thank you to all the wonderful staff of Les Jardins.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Edith S wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: very nice riad in the kasbah of Marrakech
