Review_Text: Very nice riad  quiet in the hectic centre of Marrakech. Very beautiful garden and swimming pool. Service is very good. On walking distance from all the attractions of Marrakech. Very nice rooms. Restaurant is top. Very good welness on the top floor.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Excellent hotel within the medina. The gardens provide a lush oasis to retreat to after visits to the busy medina and souks. The pool is beautiful and the rooms are luxurious.  The staff can be quite loud as they arrive for duties and do not seem concerned at all about waking you with loud voices and noisy duties.  The restaurant was very nice. The dinner menu is a bit limited if you plan on eating at the hotel more than once.  The breakfast table was busy with birds eating the uncovered pastries.  The four hand massage is highly recommended.  The roof deck is delightful but has an awful sewer like odor that sometimes blows over the space.  The professional staff is delightful and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Julie P wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: Les Jardins de le Medina. Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel on recommendation of a friend. We absolutely loved it. We had been nervous about taking a trip to Marrakech as crowded noisy environments are not usually on our list to visit however this hotel allowed us the chance to experience the buzz of Marrakesh whilst having a calm sanctuary to return to. We had a super room with a small balcony overlooking the gardens. The staff were attentive and courteous. What more could you ask for in a hotel?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Graham N wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Text: This Riad - Les Jardins de la Medina - is an oasis of beauty and tranquility within the Medina walls. A variety of bedrooms - ours with a small balcony and roof terrace was very comfortable and well appointed. The gardens are beautiful and there is also a pool for those wishing to swim or to soak up the sun. Food - lunch good but dinner was disappointing. Also the red wine was served at ice cold temperatures! This Riad is well placed - it is about a 15/20 minute walk to the souks and the main square - Jemaa-el-Fna Square. It was our second visit to this Riad and we would return as we are always optimistic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: garth t wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: Marrakech Les Jardins de le Medina. 19th Feb to 22nd Feb 2013.
Review_Text: Super hotel attentive staff. Although it's "next door" to the souk the hotel is quiet and ideally  situated for touring the souk on foot..  The hotel has a lovely heated sunny swimming pool set in a beautiful garden dotted about with mature trees.  Well appointed warm bedrooms. TV has BBC ! and 2.    Log fires in the bar and restaurant at night. and a welcoming log fire in the restaurant for breakfast.  French and Moroccan cooking is good.  Small torch an asset as lighting in garden at night is dim.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We discovered the Jardins de la Koutoubia via the internet and friends reviews as often on Trip Advisor were a mixed bag although overall good so we had to make up our own mind.  I would say it's a diamond in the rough. This former playground for the royals has the most amazing gardens. Some trees date back to the 19th century so does the house it's the first thing that strikes you once you pass the door from the buzzy and busy streets of the surrounding Medina.  IF you want a Medina experience and IF you can't afford some of those very pricey riads/guests houses(price=better???) that have grown by the million in the red city then go for this one. Manage your expectations that's all. The food goes from simple to elaborate no need to hunt for food in the neighborhood from classic French to Moroccan and Thai all in the safe hands of a lady Chef. The drink list ranging from soft coffee and wines is of excellent value for money and at least you don't feel being piggy bagged like most tourist traps in this city eg. Chassagne-Montrachet for a mere 68Euros or Petit Chablis for 45 Euros Moroccan wines are also sold at a very decent price so you can have fun and explore. Great value for money overall.  Service is friendly and smart the restaurant is charming the views from the roof top terraces are great. The owners/hoteliers Michel and Luc are great hosts if you happen to meet them and they can tell you the History of the place and take great care of their guests and the property keep it up. Long live les Jardins de la Medina. I told you...a diamond in the rough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I just spent one night at Jardins de la Medina. This little piece of heaven nestled in the old and charming medina of Marrakech is just a stunning property. Great lush gardens beautiful pool and warm and professionnal staff. The rooms are spacious and some of them benefit from a nice solarium which is great to enjoy total privacy while sunbathing. I particurlaly loved the bathroom and its shower in dark tadelakt and also the beds that are extremly smooth and confortable. Food is also excellent. I will definitely come back!

Review_Date: Richard H wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Absolutely sumptuous. beautifully styled and a fabulous service all round. Exquisite gardens around the pool and a fabulous roof terrace. An oasis of calm in the mad and dusty medina. Amazing breakfasts that mean you don't need lunch! However this level of service and style come at a price a coruscatingly expensive one! Worth the blow out though. lovely staff too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in. We received a warm welcome on arrival and throughout our stay the service was friendly helpful and unobtrusive. There is a peaceful ambience pervading every part of the hotel and it is very easy to feel completely at home. The food is fantastic too! We stayed for only four nights and were sorry that we did not have time to sample the beauty centre or the hammam. We found it very difficult to leave and we only managed to do so by promising ourselves a return visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent 4 wonderful days in this Riad - probably the most beautiful hotel we have stayed in. We stayed in a Solarium room which had a small balcony and - the best bit - a private solarium up a flight of stairs which catches the sun all day. Ideal at this time of year when the rest of the hotel is designed to cope with intense sunshine. The garden is really lovely with seating areas dotted about. We enjoyed the buffet breakfast and ate 3 excellent meals in the evening. True the service can be a bit hap hazard - we saw a number of occasions when the waiter clearly didn't know who they were supposed to be bringing a plate of food to! But it was generally warm and friendly. The pool is heated - again a bonus at this time of year. The Riad is well south of the main square but we enjoyed the walk and the variety of interesting places to visit. This was our second trip to Marrakech and hopefully won't be our last.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at this beautiful property in January. Due to the snow storm in Paris we arrived very late in the evening and quite hungry. The staff made use feel so welcome and prepared a wonderful meal for us. We were the only ones in the restaurant and sat in front of the roaring fire on a crisp night. The food at the hotel was tremendous the service five star and a beautiful room we booked a Sultane room. During the day we saw the sights shopped and took in the beauty of Marrakech. We looked forward to going back to the hotel and relaxing in the peace and tranquility of this property. We did dine at other highly recommended restaurants but the hotel restaurant was as good if not better than the best restaurants in Marrakech. I highly recommend this property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Les Jardins ticks all the boxes
Review_Text: This is a hotel of great character and comfort located in the Kasbah area. Situated on an unobtrusive street the old wooden front door gives little clue as to the elegant and sophisticated establishment within. This hotel is really a great refuge (and antidote) to the hurley-burley and often full-on nature of Marrakech street life outside. The gardens filling the central courtyard are luxuriant. The dining room is large with an antique atmosphere and with a background aroma of woodsmoke and spices. Meals are served with a sense of style & occasion by the atentive staff. My wife son and I shared a well-appointed room for our stay which was quite big enough for the double plus extra bed. The room was located off a small and intimate courtyard with table chairs and bubbling fountain (turned off at night). TV channels included BBC (so you can compare the rotten British weather with that outside). Don't forget to try the comfy chairs and settees up on the roof terrace listen to the doves watch the storks flying overhead and enjoy views over to the Koutoubia Mosque tower on one side and the distant Atlas mountains on the other. Or the pool in hot weather. We didn't try it but there is lots of pampering on offer (massage spa treatments etc). If we decided to return to Marrakech les Jardins de la Medina would be our first choice. You will hear the Muezzins' call (which adds to the atmosphere I guess) and rooms nearest the outside streets may pick up the occasional moped and voices out- of-hours (not many cars use the streets which are too narrow for anything bigger than a people carrier). I should add that all the staff work constantly to keep this hotel on the top line and are very courteous and helpful. English is spoken by the Reception staff and a little by the dining room staff but French is the main European language spoken.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: What a wonderful place to stay on a visit to Marrakech! An oasis of peace and calm away from all the rush and dust of the city but the 20mins walk to the square is fascinating it seemed safe and you see people selling their wares we didn't feel we were hassled. On our arrival we had a very warm welcome lovely mint tea and dried fruits sitting in the sun infront of the very beautiful garden and lots of onfo. My large room was on the ground floor with a small sitting room through an alcove with a mini bar a door to the bath & shower basin and toilet area. Doors opened from the room onto a garden/paved area. looking towards some exercise machines and the pool. Room was always spotlessly clean plenty of towels that seemed new with rose petals strewn over them (every day)! V. comfy bed. Super rooftop terrace with loungers a view of the Atlas mountains beyond. Buffet breakfast had fresh fruit and juice meats smoked salmon bread pastries you could order an omelette. Relaxing with pre dinner drinks infront of the log fire then delicious dinner. I had a couple of wonderful massages! So much more to rave about ... for me it was magical!! I was able to change English ¬£s into Dirhams at the reception desk.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Your every need catered for - nothing is too much.
Review_Text: We stayed as a couple for 4 nights in February. We booked through the hotel in advance for taxi collection from the airport which ran like clockwork and was much appreciated. I also booked an Orange Blossom massage which was lovely. The reception staff were outstanding - nothing was too much for them. They helped with negotiating for taxis booking restaurants and giving hints for the obligatory trip to the souks. The welcome tea and fruits were much appreciated as was the cocktail party on our final night which gave us a chance to talk to the other guests.    There are three types of room at this hotel: Superior Solarium and Sultana. We had decided to splash out on a Sultana room which had a large private terrace (room 115). The only problem here was that it was in permanent shade. This is probably welcome in the summer months but in February we would have preferred more sunshine so in hindsight we should have booked a solarium room. We had one day of torrential rain and the terrace never dried out after that - in fact my husband was sitting at the outside table one day when a torrent of water was thrown down from the suite above. In essence we never managed to use the terrace preferring instead to either sit by the pool or on the top terrace to catch some much needed sunshine. The room came with a huge bathroom with robes and slippers and a nespresso machine with 6 complimentary coffees included and mini bar/frige. There were pastries and fruit waiting for us in the room but these were never replenished during our stay and the same pastries were still there 4 days later. The complimentary daily water was much appreciated.    We ate in the restaurant on two occasions. The food was very good but the service here is a bit intermittent. On the first night we felt that the service was very rushed - no sooner had we finished our starter and the main course was there. In complete contrast to this we had lunch one day and had to wait an hour between starter and main as the waiter had taken down our order wrongly and appeared with two plates of meat which was a problem as vegetarians. Breakfast was plentiful. Eggs as you choose to have them plus lots of fruit yoghurt and breads. It really set us up for the day.    This hotel allows no residents to use the pool area for a fee. As only half of the poolside area is ever in sunshine it did mean that loungers were a bit limited for the guests. It would be an idea if residents were able to have complimentary usage of the Hamman as part of their stay. There is a small shop selling local items which was lovely and the smell of Orange Blossom hand wash is still in my mind.    There is a Hamman on site and a small 'spa'. The hamman we didn't use as the 200 dhs charge for this we felt was rather excessive considering you could only use it for 30 mins. The spa which is situated on the top floor consisted of a couple of massage rooms as far as I could make out but the massage I had was lovely. It would have been helpful to have the full list of treatments available prior to booking.    We had a lovely time. The hotel is great and all the little touches make it an outstanding place to stay. We will definitely be returning.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed for 3 nights recently ‚Äì check in was smooth and we were provided with extensive information about the hotel. From the moment we stepped into the hotel I felt relaxed. We were greeted with mint tea and a tower of dried fruits consisting of dates apricots and sultanas which was a lovely touch whilst our bags were transported to the room. The hotel is small and intimate and true to form of a riad has a beautiful garden inside the walls of the hotel which is instantly relaxing ‚Äì inclusive of baby turtles roaming freely that are said to bring good luck.    Now for the room ‚Äì it was sensational. There seemed to be such awesome attention paid to detail. A wood fire if you wish n-espresso coffee maker roses fruits platters and complimentary bottles of water refreshed daily.  Then there is the bed ‚Äì super comfortable!!! I fell in love with this bed - I could have spent all day there.    Some negatives:  The fitness centre was outside and almost non-existent so if you are keen to work out during your stay ‚Äì bring a work out DVD (as we did) or have a plan up your sleeve.    Day spa was not so hot ‚Äì my husband and I had a couples massage and unfortunately it was the worst massage I have ever had and paid for. My masseuse was getting directions from my husband‚Äôs masseuse whilst I was having my massage.    Restaurant service was also questionable. The food was of excellent quality and delicious however it was let down by the hap hazard service from staff. Plates at breakfast were never cleared away ‚Äì I watched other guests putting plates on the seats next to them as they had no room on their table left as staff walked merrily by not aware that this is something that should be attended too.    We went to the restaurant for dinner once and the service was slow and clunky. At the end of the night we would have been interested in the dessert menu which was not offered we did order coffee but after the protracted time that it took to get it we were exhausted. The restaurant was not busy and there were adequate amounts of staff so there should have been no excuses at all for the poor service.    The staff members seemed as though they were trying hard ‚Äì busily running around the place but were not effective with what they were trying to achieve ‚Äì they need more training.    There also was a severe lack of service by the pool. We spent 2 full Marrakech winter-sun filled days by the pool and each time we would have to try desperately to get the attention of the staff to make an order for food or drinks. This needs to be addressed as it is a let-down for an otherwise really great stay.    We had a great time in Marrakech ‚Äì we spent a lot of time in the riad as it was lovely overall but needs some work for it to be exceptional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Maya V wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: In January 2013 we have spent our citytrip at Les Jardins de la Medina. We stayed for 5 days. Our room was large and spacious. A seperate bathroom and toilet. A terrace. A fire place.  We enjoyed our stay very much. Staff was very friendly. Especially the cooking lessons are very good and nice too :) We have spent a lot of time at the hotel because of the good facilities such as heated swimming pool sun terrace on the roof cooking lessons hammam and very nice lunch and dinners. We will certainly go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: This is where you want to Stay!!
Review_Text: My daughter and I spent 4 days in Marrakech in January and could not have asked for a more beautiful setting. We had a lovely spacious room ( very comfy beds) on the second floor with a large bathroom and sitting area they even have dvd collection so that you can watch a movie in your room.  The grounds are beautiful and even though you are close to the hustle and bustle of the medina and souks once you enter the grounds you feel like you are in your own secret garden.  The food as well was delicious the breakfast buffet had a great selection and we ate twice in the restaurant for dinner which was top notch.  The spa services( we had facials and massages) where a welcome treat after a full day of walking.  I would recommend without hesitation. Shelley
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: jennifer e wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: We really enjoyed our four night stay we were " upgraded " to a beautiful room on the second floor two eighty year old grandmas treated with charm and respect by the staff ! we thought the food was excellent too We would certainly go again Jenny E
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed in Les jardin de la Medina for one week in January for my husband's birthday. The staff and atmosphere were very nice. Good service and helpful for everything that we asked for. They have a very good restaurant too. At the beginning we planned to try different restaurant in marrakech . But we found out from the first dinner that we already have the best in the town. At the end we decided to have all our 7 dinners in our hotel . We are owner of restaurant in norway so we know what Is Good food mean.They served amazing food and the service was excellent. Specially on my husband birthday they prepared the soft cake which my husband used to have for his birthday in norway. The servers even came over with the cake and sang the birthday song for him in front of our table. We will definitely coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ivar L wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: Stayed one week with my wife and overall it was a nice experience. The room (131) was spacious and not too much noise from the street outside. It lacked balcony or terrace but that was not a big problem. Some of the rooms on the ground floor seemed to be smaller and lack of privacy on the small terrace.  We had a bust-up with the manager on arrival because we had no internet connection but that was solved in a remarkable way by putting up a "box" high up in a tree outside our room.  The food and service in the restaurant was so good that we had dinner there all 7 nights - the Morrocan wines were very good also.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nick M wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: This hotel was even better than we had expected and the staff were extrmely helpful. There were lots of nice touches all around the place and the atmosphere and the food were excellent. The breakfast in particular was generous. The bedroom was very comfortable and well warmed (in January.) We enyoyed the gardens the roof terrace and pool. We had to remind ourselves we were there ot go out and do some sightseeing. (The town of Marrakech slightly disappointed us and so it was tempting to stay in the nice confines of the hotel.)    The restaurant was not cheap and so we chose to eat out some times but as we had got what we felt was a good rate for bed and breakfast through the travel company we booked with overall it represented reasonable value.    If pressed to identify shortcomings I would say that the waitresses in the restaurant at breakfast were a little slow to clear dirty plates and the serivce at dinner was leisurely.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Angelina B wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Title: Perfect culinary restaurant in Les Jardins de la Medina
Review_Text: Les jardins de la Medina is a paradise on earth. I have been there last month. I had a greatfull and excellent time. The staff and the atmosphere were very nice. The service was excellent.In particular the food. The food was incredibly delicious. Everything perfectly seasoned and served. It was tasteful and the atmosphere during dinner was pleasant.  I want to make an extra compliment to the Chef Cook for the great presatation of the culinary dishes. I absolutely recommend this hotel and restaurant to you because it's definitely worth it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Firstly I apologise for the following long winded review. I have never written such a poor review and because of that and the fact I was so disappointed I wanted to ensure I explained as fully as possible why this was the case. I was so looking forward to our first trip to Morocco and in particular our stay at Les Jardins de la medina having read all of its great reviews on Tripadvisor. The choice came down to here and La Maison Arabe both seemed to be equally good but in the end it was the inviting pictures of the pool area at Les Jardins that made our decision. Only going for 3 nights we wanted our visit to be really special.  First the good....    The gardens and outdoor areas- these are immaculate and a real oasis of calm away from the chaos that is Marrakech. Although it is true as others have said that there is alot of shade unless you are lucky enough to get one of the the few loungers at the sunny side of the pool. We spent most of our time on the roof terrace which was lovely and quiet although a little ironic as the pool was one of the reasons we chose this hotel.    The cleanliness of the room was superb - it was a good size with a big bed and furnished to a very high standard the rose petals being a lovely finishing touch. The housekeeping staff clearly work very hard. We had a superior room but i found ours room 127 to be a bit too enclosed the only windows opened out to a small shaded high walled courtyard and although a patio set was provided you wouldnt really want to sit out there. The more expensive rooms did have lovely open patio areas however so it comes down to what you are willing to pay.    The choice at breakfast was plentiful with a good selection of breads juices meats cheese pastries moroccan pancakes and fresh fruit.    Sadly all the impressive surroundings and luxury furnishings cannot make up for the poor service and attitude of staff and I am sorry to say that is our overwhelming impression of the front of house service we received at Les Jardins de la Medina.( I should have perhaps had an inkling of their attitude when i on booking I enquired about the costs of a transfer from the airport the cost being double that of a private transfer I ended up booking via Travel republic so be warned!.....)    - On arrival @ 7.30pm instead of being showed to our room for a quick relax and freshen up before dinner as we would have liked ( we had made a reservation from the UK earlier that week for dinner at the hotel for 8.30pm) we were asked to take a seat enjoy a welcome drink and would then shown to our room. There was no tables left in the small bar area so we were placed outside devoid of any atmosphere and finally after a lengthy wait where i thought we had been forgotton about a mint tea and some dried fruits arrived.  Having made our way back to the bar/ restaurant area just after 8.30pm for dinner we were shown to a table not in the main restaurant as we wrongly expected but at the far side of an uninspiring awning which acts as an extension. There were a couple of patio heaters already at other empty tables but we were seated far away from these and it does get pretty cold in the evening in Morocco at this time of year!( hence roaring log fires in the main restaurant!!! )Strangely there were still empty tables in the main restaurant which i found a little odd as a had booked several days before. I asked if we could be nearer a heater and a waitress rather grumpily moved our table nearer to an empty table which had the benefit of a patio heater. After another fairly lengthy wait we were given the menu with no communication or pleasantries. We were unaware when we booked that Friday was a "Moroccan Evening" a fixed three course menu offering limited choices at a cost of around ¬£40 a head before drinks. Neither my husband nor I particularly wanted three courses that evening the choices were not terribly inspiring let alone the surroundings and service thus far and sadly we were totally put off and chose to get up and leave explaining this to the barman on our way out as the waitress had vanished. By this point we could'n't be bothered to venture out for dinner with no knowledge of our surroundings so went to bed somewhat hungry and disappointed.  Next morning the service at breakfast followed somewhat the same pattern. Being a buffet breakfast staff only had to concentrate on offering coffee/tea etc clearing away pots and pleasantries. There is unobtrusive service which is great and what i expected this would be and then there is lack of service and attention. Each of the 3 mornings at breakfast i would have to try and get the attention of the waiting staff or wait for them to reappear from elsewhere to refill my coffee. Used crockery piled up on our table with no one seeming to want to remove them despite the fact there was no space left on the table in the end I had to call someone over and ask them to remove them.  On our final night we had a lovely evening meal in the medina and thought we would return to the hotel for a coffee and dessert. We asked if that would be OK  which it was and sat in the bar area. We waited for a waitress to come with a menu despite there being two bar staff chatting in the empty bar and waited.. she finally brought the menu we waited again...... I finally went up to the bar and asked if i could order with them and was told the waitress would be coming over but they offered to do the coffee now we waited once more ... i had drank all my coffee and we were still waiting.....needless to say we got up and left AGAIN! If the restaurant had been busy and everyone was engaged i could have understood it but that was not the case. By this point I was really quite upset and voiced my concerns to reception who simply handed me a customer comment form to complete. One further note we exchanged currency at the hotel whilst there and when we asked if we could change it back on the morning of our departure we were told abruptly that was not possible and to try the airport. I know currency controls are stringent in Morocco but even if that were the truth her attitude left alot to be desired.    At first I wondered if our constant lack of service was due to having walked out of the restaurant on our first night  then i feared it may be because we were English as the hotel has a large French clientele and staff speak little english ( I can manage a little french) but then i noticed that the staff were much more attentive and pleasant with the elderly "posh" English guests who perhaps are a little less confident travellers and wouldn't dream of complaining and of course guaranteed to give good tips.... so I am very confused!. My husband and I are always happy to pay a premium for quality and service but we are certainly not gullible paying well over the odds for poor service and our stay here left a bad taste in my mouth.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I'll stay here again in a heartbeat
Review_Text: Recently stayed here with my husband and 11-month old and their attention to detail was impeccable. We requested a baby cot and not only did we find it when we arrived we also found they'd put in a bottle warmer and baby bathtub as well. I was instantly sold. I love the tranquilness of the place. Our room had its own patio with stairs which led up to our own sunroof complete with lounge cars. Breakfast was enjoyable and they make omelettes on order too. The only reason I didn't give it the full five stars was because there weren't any electric coffee makers/hot water kettles in the room for coffee and tea. Traveling with an infant those mini kettles always come in handy. Other than that I loved this property. The attentiveness of the staff was exceptional its location in the Kasbah quarter of the Medina was convenient and I'll probably stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Our stay here was a family birthday present for my wife and we thoroughly enjoyed the luxury - a marked contrast to the chaos of the medina and the rather unpromising street entrance to the hotel. Several of our evening meals were enjoyed in the medina's central square - a world away from the quiet and refined atmosphere of the hotel's dining-room.  I made good use of the hotel's rooftop solarium and of the pleasantly heated swimming pool.  The breakfast was excellent with a very wide range of food beautifully presented and we particularly looked forward to the daily special "vitamin juice" with beetroot a favourite.  All the staff were attentive and helpful but my personal award would go to the maids who looked after our room - I don't think I have ever before experienced such a high standard of service.  Add a week of clear blue skies (albeit a bit chilly early and late) and our Marrakech visit could not have been better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: steve c wrote a review Feb 2013
Review_Text: The hotel (it isnt a Riad) is very tranquil and a quiet place to relax from the madness of Marrakech. Take a good look at the photos the whole place is in constant shade. The sun only reaches one side of the swimming pool and not on the pool itself.The only other place for sun is on the roof terrace which is fine but you will have to go down three flights of stairs to order a drink. We had a Sultan room which is the most expensive. we were on the ground floor and had a nice little terrace but no sun. In the morning it would have been nice to sit in the sun with a coffee but it was quite dark although we could see the sun was on the roof. I accept we went at the end of January but it was 28 degrees and the palm trees are so tall i cant see the sun getting through at any time of the year.  The service is very slow and at meal times you do have to go and get someone to serve you as they dont seem to look out for people who need something.  The breakfast is fine providing you dont want anything hot (not an unusual problem with buffet breakfasts)  The hotel is quite small and i would think too small when crowded at other times of the year.  Everything was exceptionally clean and the staff couldnt do enough for you.  We did enjoy our visit but not the hotel for sun lovers which we are.  Very quietpretty central and peaceful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is hotel is BEAUTIFUL -- the rooms are elegant and the gardens are lush and stunning -- you can hardly believe that you are in the middle of the medina. Marrakech can be a little frenetic and this hotel is quite a retreat! We LOVED the heated swimming pool -- it was completely delightful in chilly January.    The service is good just a little formal for my particular tastes. I really think that they should warm things up a bit. I can not put my finger on it but after smiling welcomes in Fez and throughout the country the service here just felt too formal.    The food is good. Dinner was delicious and breakfast had some real high points -- -- I particularly loved the surprise of each morning's freshly pressed juice smoothie -- a deep red beet concoction one day and vibrant green cucumber/kiwi mix the other.    My family much needed the safe oasis this hotel provided. It was actually a perfect transition out of Morocco... I highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a strong touch of Euope in their Moroccan vacation. I do also wish that the hotel was a little closer to the square and souks.... )
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Taher B wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: It was really a very different experience at this place. It is incredible. The staff is like a family that makes you feel home. You will only hear "yes" for any request. Briefly do not hesitate at all to book there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a wonderful two day stay at the hotel. The grounds are stunning and you feel like you are worlds away from the hustle and bustle of the medina. We stayed in the Sultans room as it was our honeymoon and if your budget can afford a splurge this is the perfect place to do it. The room was covered in rose petals and it includesda private terrace. The night we arrived the hotel had welcome drinks and apps for all its guests. What a treat! It was one of the best hotels we stayed at during our trip to Morocco. Hakim from the front desk was amazing and gave us such personal attention. We really appreciated his help throughout our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was a wonderful experience to leave the frenetic world of the old town and enter the peace of this hotel. The rooms food and staff were first class; the staff were not only good at their work but so friendly and helpful. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in the Old Town
Review_Text: A beautiful little hotel at the south end of the Kasbah close to the Royal Palace and Saadian Tombs. The rooms are tastefully decorated very clean and comfotable. The bar restaurant and heated pool are great places to eat drink relax and get away from the hustle and bustle of the old town after those long days out exploring. The food is very good- expect to pay about ¬£35pp for three courses including wine. Though there are good inexpensive alternatives nearby such as the Kasbah Cafe which is only a 5 minute walk away. Overall this hotel is excellent the staff very friendly along with service to match. Only minor negative is the location which is on the outskirts of the old town and many of the attractions however if you don't mind walking then this shouldn't be a concern. It's about a 15 minute walk to the main square or a ¬£1.50 taxi ride. Highly recommended.

The higher end riads of Marrakech are all wonderful. If you are looking to be IN the action get lost in the old town etc stay in a nice raid. This is one of the nicer ones. My only complaint is that on occasion a sewage smell wafted thru the resort. Hard to know where it came from. But it was a little gross but hard to know whether to blame the hotel or not in this region.    In the heat of the summer the pool wasn't very deep so it wasn't very COOL. Was kinda hard to cool off when the pool was 96 degrees.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Annabelle M wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: We couldn't have been more impressed with Les Jardins de la Medina - absolutely beautiful hotel great location beautiful gardens heated swimming pool and the staff were above and beyond fantastic. I can't recommend the hotel highly enough! Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so enjoyable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: Amanda C wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: We visited for 4 days last week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We had a lovely room (No.120) which was spacious with a lovely terrace. The staff were very friendly and helpful. The roof terrace is beautiful and it was lovely to relax on the sofas especially as the weather during our stay was glorious. The grounds are very well maintained and it certainly did feel like paradise once inside the door with the lush green foliage and birds singing in the trees. Although it is a good 20 minute walk to the souks it is a fairly straightforward and interesting journey. If we visit Marrakech again we will definitely return here and will recommend to friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in this Hotel last week upon arrival we were greeted with a tea and some dates and apricots in the little outside area. I think the only way for me to give this Hotel a good review is by doing a pros and cons list as there were so many good but also bad things.  The good things are that the rooms are very clean (cleaned 2 a day) staff is f riendly and helpful and the roof terrace is great with amazing views.  The bad things unfortunately theres a lot more service from the bar is very slow one night we actually waited 25 mins for a cocktail with only one order before ours. The coktails are quite expensive compared to other places and a pack of crisps is 5 Euros the bar doesnt have a big selection also when sat in the bar area in the winter time its quite smoky due to the open fire and on top people smoking inside it stings your eyes if youre not used to it.  Breakfast is not too bad even though dont come too early it says from 7:00 - 10:30 but we came at 7:30 and they were still decorating tables bringing food out and rearanging everything the worse thing was as it was quite cold the gas heaters were only turned on when people started arriving so it wasalways very cold at breakfast and the who we thought might be the morning manager as he was always round breakfast in a suit was even worse because everytime he arrived he started moving tables chairs just making a lot of noise in general which wasnt very nice when your trying to enjoy breakfast. Also scrambled egg was always cold but you can order an omlette if wanted at least thats hot. Selection of fresh fruit was good. The dinner in the Hotel was okay but overrated in my eyes we had dinner in so many other places for less money and better quality but I guess it depends on everyones taste.  If you like sleeping dont stay in 128 its directly over the kitchen and laundry room and gets very noisy from 6 am which is why my mum had to change rooms. I was in 133 the room had no little terrace in fact i couldnt even open my windows because my privacy would have been invaded and when my neighbours came in at 2am the walls are that thin that i thought they were in my room I could hear everything also when i was in the bathroom I could hear everything that happened on the roofterrace including conversations. Allthough the bed was okay I couldnt sleep due to noise from everywhere like doors closing (not one hotel door in this facility closes quietly)  the street the roof terrace my neighbours etc. After the room change my mum moved to 130 which was nice but very damp and cold the heater in bathroom was behind a cupboard so it didnt heat at all and there was a lot of mold which I will include pictures of. Tv was very small but you dont need a tv on holiday it had 2 english channels and one german all the other were french. Also big problem i had was the way to my room was not covered so I got wet everytime I had to walk to my room but at least there was umbrellas in the room.  The Pool area and garden area is a big plus for this Hotel also the roof terrace all in all I think this Hotel has a lot of potential but just needs some more TLC in general.  In my eyes its not a Rhiad its a Hotel and at the moment it doesnt deserve the valuation it has not due too staff but because of facilities and little things it just seems that the staff are trying everything but there seems to be a manager missing that makes sure things are going like they should. One day while in the bar having a drink we got asked to move tables 3 times because they were doing maintenace work now Im a paying guest and want some peace and quiet but all I heard most afternoons was drilling etc. Would I stay again probably not I think there is better places in Marrakech for better value. Again its not the staff but everything else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Tranquil oasis amongst the bustling city streets of Marrakech.
Review_Text: We spent our honeymoon here at the end of November 2012 and cannot recommend this riad highly enough. Admittedly this was our first trip to Marrakech so have little to compare it too but from the moment we arrived the Jardins de la medina felt like the perfect place to stay. All staff were attentive and friendly throughout our stay welcoming us with a drink in the bar and a tour of the gardens while our room was prepared with candles and rose petals (they even serviced the room twice a day). We had a double superior room on the ground floor which was a good size had a large shower/wet room and comfortable lounge space with 14"tv (the sultan rooms have larger tvs). It also opened onto a small private outside seating area which was shaded but pleasant (the solarium rooms all seem to have private 3rd floor outdoor spaces to catch the sun). The communal roof terrace though has 5 sun beds and lots of other seating giving awsome views of the mountains and the city. The location was good with the main square and other attractions within 10-15 mins walk (depending how many people stop you on the way!). The entire complex seems much larger than other riads in this district with substantial gardens and a good sized heated pool. The restaurant is superb although being veggie we were limited to tagines and pasta the location is handy for other nearby restaurants though (try the kasbah cafe down the road for a cheaper alternative menu). In summary this is a beautiful place to stay and were we to return to Marrakech we would stay here again.

Superb all round. Excellent caring service from pick up at airport right through our stay. Lovely bar with log fire for the winter nights and good restaurant. Good spa treatments reasonably priced. My daughter and I thoroughly enjoyed our 4 night stay and I intend returning with my other daughter in Spring!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wonderful! I loved this hotel. Perfectly situated just inside the old city. A quaint and peaceful oasis with lovely gardens and simple elegant spacious clean rooms. The restaurant is lovely but if you are looking for speedy service this is not the place for you. The staff throughout the hotel is friendly and professional. Be forewarned not all taxi drivers in Marrakech know where this riad is located so carry a map and something with the hotel address on it to be helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: We ( 2 adults and 7 year old twins) had a great time traveling to Marrakech for the Thanksgiving Holiday. Hotel was very nice service excellent concierge extremely helpful and with superb knowledge of the city. Pool was great for the kids. Restaurant serves excellent food and staff very (kid-) friendly.

We stayed in this lovely hotel for a week in november 2012 the room was clean and confortable the bathroom was big and nice... The staff was polite even though sometimes i found trouble to communicate in english so i decided to speak in french or spanish; in general they were kind. The breakfast was simple but tasty; the dinner was delicious.... I didnt use the the pool but it seems nice. I think this hotel is very well located in the medina so you can see how some marrocains live and even at first sight la medina seems overwhelming is a really good experience. We were 2 ladies and we felt really safe... I found the mattres really hard for me it wasnt too confy but i think its just a matter of taste the quality of the beed sheets was ok....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: rudy a wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: it has been a very pleasant journey.  hope to go back asap.  i recommend to everyone.  les Jardins de la Medina is small paradise in the centre of Marrakesh.    Youssef and all the staff are simply fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After 7 nights @ this beautiful place - there is really nothing to complain. Although i felt a little lost traveling just by myself as a woman in Marrakesch the staff spoiled me with kindness.  Specially when i spend 2 days in my room with a fever. I got soup with rice tea and they called me many times just to ask how i feel.  The food ( i choose half pension) was great and always nice decorated.  The garden and the rooftop are quite and comfortable .  Their outdoor Gym and Pool are surrounded by enchanting gardens.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A quiet oasis in the middle of a hectic Marrakech!
Review_Text: We arrived first thing in the morning. We were expecting to drop off our bags and go explore. When we arrived at the hotel the staff greeted us and had us go out to the garden and gave us a welcome coffee and pastries. They then came to give us a tour of the beautiful property and told us our room would be ready shortly. The room was beautiful and they offered a huge bottle of water everyday which was a great. They had a very nice cocktail party one night. The gardens and pool are just beautiful! The only reason I gave it 4 stars is that we had a leak in our room on the first night. They sent someone to try to fix it right away. It did not work and we were up all night because of the leak. They did someone the next day to fix it after we told them that it HAD to be fixed. It was fixed this time. Not once did anyone ask us if it was fixed or offered apologies. I do recommend this place!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After 4 days trekking in the Atlas Mountains Les Jardins was bliss. Really cool set-up. Great staff great rooms great food. Perfect oasis in the hullabaloo of the Medina. The cookery course was great fun.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a real Oasis within the mayhem and madness of Marakech. Off a typical Moroccan street full of its wonders of real life large wooden doors open out to a beautiful garden and pool.  However it does come at a price... a packet of crisps costing around 5 Euros.    The food can not be faulted and the staff were all very friendly. I would highly recommend this hotel to the traveller who wants a bit of style..... Just smuggle in your own crisps.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were so pleased when we arrived with the gardens and the look and feel of the hotel - it was understated elegance from the word go. We stayed for 3 nights and will definitely return. The staff were extremely helpful and professional and made you feel that nothing was too much trouble. Our room was beautiful with a balcony overlooking the pool area and there were exotic vegetation to look at from every view. Fortunately we were able to have some treatments whilst at the hotel and found the staff to be knowledgeable professional and extremely nice. The food was exquisite with an amazing amount of choice - especially for breakfast. I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel as a oasis of calm elegance and quietness which makes it a perfect getaway to re-charge your batteries.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Margrit K wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We just loved this place - an unexpected Oasis in the Medina. Luxurious tasteful dreamy and a most charming and efficient staff. Everything was done for yoour pleasure and comfort - nothing left wanting. The huge and most lovely garden/pool area is quite stunning - another big surprise within the Medina.    I am a travel agent and very familiar with all of Morocco - this was my 6th trip ad my first but not last visit to Les Jardins. I recommend it very highly.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We didn't actually stay here but went for lunch on our last day. After the frantic souks this was a relaxing experience that all of us girls completely appreciated - in fact we could quite easily have stayed and shared another bottle of wine!!  The food was brilliant (the portions on the salad starter is huge!) and the service impeccable. My only complaint was that the white wine was not chilled sufficiently and so we had to wait for it to cool down - did not expect that from this quality of hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This is a truly wonderful place impeccably run and tasteful in every detail. The staff is fantastic the food perfect (flavoursome but not heavy - the best we had in Marrakech) and the spa not to be missed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: babak t wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: The pool is not as big as it appears on photos. Sometimes you have to call several times to get a hold of the reception very nice staff though. But it's a beautiful hotel beautiful garden.... It's a perfect size hotel. Some riads although beautiful are very small.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have never been to Marrakesh before and wanted somewhere centrally located in the old city with a pool and good level of accommodation and hopefully good food . The Hotel was excellent in all aspects and we would recommend anyone to stay there . The staff are outstanding in their care of the guests and nothing is too much trouble . The rooms are excellent some having a sofa area  some having an external patio and upstairs "solarium" sunning area. You can also laze around the pool or sun yourself on the roof areas - very relaxing . The Hotel restaurant was outstanding with a wide choice of menu and the quality was consistently good : it is also a very attractive place to eat and relax . A great place !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jane w wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina for 3 nights and were bowled over by it. There is real attention to detail in every aspect of this wonderful find. They layout of the hotel made us feel that we were in a beautiful villa of our own. The customer service was excellent - staff seemed to appear just when you needed them. Our room was delightful very pretty and clean with a lovely bathroom. The food was excellent. In all we were so pleased with the hotel we are booking to go straight back as soon as we can. Well worth being in a hotel so near the centre of things but very quiet once you step through the door. Just perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicholas B wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Quiet hotel within the Medina; inconspicuous entrance belies the spectacular interior. Beautiful gardens swimming pool and roof terrace with lovely views. Easy walk to the main square and Souk. Charming and helpful staff. Sensational food. Our room was spacious and very comfortable. Impossible to fault.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Stayed for 4 nights at this wonderful hotel and it just wasn't long enough. The hotel was everything one could ask for. So peaceful in such a busy city too. ALL the staff were polite courteous and very attentive. Nothing being too much trouble. When we arrived we were sitting awaiting our welcome drink and nibbles (together with a welcome cold flannel) and the manager came up asking if we were being attended to. That same manager showed a low profile presence throughout our stay. He seemed to have a great rappor with his staff who seemed eager to adhere to his very high standards.  Our room was immaculate and the little extras like the basket with the fans the straw hats and the towels were an example of the thoughtfulness gone into making any stay at this hotel so special but yet so relaxing. We are more than keen to revisit Marakesch and Les Jardins will be the hotel we return to. It is in a brilliant location too. Amongst the Moroccon people going about their everyday life.  Oh and the breakfast was superb every item being replenished to keep up the display of a wonderful choice of food. Thanks Les Jardins!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex J wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is an oasis in the busy city of Marrakech. Its within walking distance of the main square and is easy to navigate to and around compared to some other hotels down winding side streets.  The central courtyard is pretty spectacular and perfect for spending relaxing afternoons by the pool. The hotel is in imaculate condition and the rooms are of a really good standard. The staff are very helpful and friendly and overall its hard to find fault with the place.  We had an amazing time while staying there and would thoroughly recommend it to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I cannot fault this hotel in anyway staff from the management Team to the lovely attentive young lady who made sure our room was cleaned to a high standard were faultless. Nothing was too much trouble the waiters in the restaurant were also brilliant ensuring that you always felt you were the only one in the restaurant the food was also of a very high standard. This is paradise and only a 3 hour flight from the UK who could ask for more..
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very romantic and nice place that I would recommend for couples but also for those searching relaxing place not too far from EU. In addition this is not a standard hotel as it was a palace so the feel and athmosphere is sort of special my room was great with patiocheminey plenty of red roses petals everywhere and the magical scent of Moroccan gardens in all bathroom great products. Finally very good service food and facilities in very clean and quiet location in the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: Surprising and wonderful oasis in La Kasbah
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a wonderful boutique hotel in the Kasbah area of Marrakesh. It is located on a quiet side street which is 6 blocks away from the Djemaa el-Fna square. The neighborhood is part of the old city where the people are nice friendly and respectful. We walked back and forth between the hotel and the square palaces and souks with no problem at all.  Back to the hotel itself the staff is friendly and always ready to provide you with even the slightest detail. The bar is very well stocked (unusual in Marrakesh) and the food is very good (although much more expensive than the stalls of the street or squares..). Their breakfast display is fantastic everything was great.  The rooms are very nice excellent air conditioning perfect mattress clean white towels with rose petals on them (a welcome greeting) fantastic shower). Our room was on the second floor with a small terrace and stairs going to the roof of the room where we had another terrace with two recliners (great for sun bathing or star gazing magical )  The swimming pool is fantastic located in the center ofthe gardens.  I truly reccomend this hotel for me a true 5-star at a very reasonable price.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a week in this hotel and found difficult to leave as it was just sensational. The premises of the hotel was just amazing. Food was superb and staff very helpful. We went at the end of August where it was everyday 43 degrees. We were spoiled by the staff on the pool by cold watersmoothies and fruit kebabs free of charge. The sunday buffet was of very high quality and throughout our stay we were really impressed with the high standard of the meals and entertainment provided by the hotel. Pricewise i think its an ok price for Marrakesh. They all overcharge turists anyway so at least we were happy with the service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: chris b wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: hey guys hw r u todayfirstly i want to thanksfull all the staff of the best place in marrakesh.last night it was one of my dreams night while i had my lovelly dinner with my freinds in jardin medina restaurantat the first i couldnt believe that exist a romantic place where u can enjoy ur time as much as possible in front of the swimming pool while u r having ur luch or ur dinner with a high quality of the food and service
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful setting in the heart of one crazy place. Spa needs help though
Review_Text: I will get to the point. We loved the hotel.    I would recommend you book this location. I would give it 5 stars except for the spa with I speak about later.    The grounds were very nice cool and comfortable considering the August heat. The staff was very pleasant and responsive. I believe the meals were reasonable but won't know until I get the credit card bill.  You are greeted with fruits and a drink and get to enjoy them under the mist near a fountain. We . did not have room service so cannot comment on that but the staff were quickly responsive if you called the desk Most of the staff understood english but they do seem to have more French and Arabic ( of course) speakers.    Modern room with good WiFi. Could have just a few more english speaking channels on the TV.  .  A few complaints. The pillows were too hard for me. Some may like them.    THE SPA. My wife went for masasage and the staff talked during the entire session and in Arabic. They did not do a good job with the basics of massage. Not even the full body for an hour. THey did not respect their privacy. The management needs to review things with the spa staff and let them know they need to give high quality service and keep the customer as the priority.    We visited another hotel for a cooking class and the interior was amazing but the grounds were just so so. This spot has very comfortable gardens which make it excellent for lounging by the pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: This hotel is an oasis of calm amidst the Kasbah's bustle with all the modern comfort amenities (WIFI working all the time etc.) so very near to all the major sights and staffed by people wanting to make your stay as pleasant as possible. The three of us stayed for 8 days during Ramadan 2012; because of Ramadan service was (only) slow between 19.30 hours and 20.15 hours each night. Mind you every word of praise I read in the reviews on TripAdvisor from other travellers prior to my booking a few weeks ago is true. I definitely recommend this lovely spot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We chose this hotel on the basis that it was inside the medina had a pool and had more character than the large hotels in Marrakech. We definitely were not disappointed. On arrival we were welcomed by the manager and took a seat in the gardens of the hotel which were stunning whilst being offered dried fruits a refreshing juice and cold flannels. It was a great first impression. The room was lovely great air con a huge bed rose petals in the bathroom a rain shower/bath and a well stocked mini bar. The maid service was excellent and we loved the weather report & morrocan pastries left in our room every evening. The pool was a good size always enough beds in or out of the shade and every so often free water smoothies and cold flannels. Breakfast was good but we were really pleased with the lunch and dinner we ate here several times during our stay. Really great morrocan/European food in a beautiful atmosphere. The hammam and argan oil massage we had as a couple at the same time very relaxing and good value. No need to go elsewhere for this! The hotel staff were so helpful giving us recommendations for restaurants almost every evening and booking them for us and arranging taxis. The square is a 15 minute walk away or a cheap taxi ride if you don't fancy walking. We would definitely stay again and would recommend this hotel to everyone. Thank you LJDLM!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is extremely nice! As you drive up to the hotel down the winding dirty streets of the old town medina you may feel a little nervous. But on entry through the door you are met with an oasis of calm. The reception team will make you feel very welcome and show you around the hotel the restraurant the pool the gym (which you won't want to use!) the various sun spots around the hotel the massage parlor etc. Everyhthing is done in style at this hotel we stayed In a solarium room so middle of the road it had ensuite massive bed tv small sheltered balcony and a massive balcony up some stairs with 2 sun loungers! All very smart and well presented.    All in all the service is ok to good depends who you get and how much they understand your English or pigeon French. I recommend using French but as we were learning it out there it was still pretty shaky. The food is excellent. Although stay away from fish generally in marracech is my advice. The hotel is smallmaround 36 rms and there was no more than 50 people staying when we went (aug) lots of rm by the pool and most people keep themselves to themselves you won't want to leave the hotel! When you do leave be mindful of the souks they are great fun just take some patience with you and don't get to pressured into buying things!    All in all I would recommend this hotel highly for a romantic getaway for young or older couples.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel in the centre of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel is beautiful! I can not recomend it highly enough! It is located through a door in a wall in the hustle of Marrakech and is like escaping to paradise! It is very central in walking distance to all the major sights. Somehow you disappear through the door and cant hear anything from outside! its like a dessert oasis!  The rooms are beautlful clean with large beds great air con and decorated beautifully. Fruit and pastries are provided and there was a private terrace on top of the room with great views over the central swimming pool area.  The staff were really helpful and would recommend and book anything you wanted. The breakfast was good continental style with a reasonable selection. There were other roof terraces around the hotel that anyone could use so make sure you go and explore!  We visited in mid July and it was BOILING! 46 degrees! Apparantly this is the quite time because of the extreme heat. The central square in Marakkech is a real experience! Just make sure you dont pay anymore than 25% of the first price you are told!  Overall an amazing place to visit and absolutly stay at this hotel its brilliant!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Ann H wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: Had a wonderful 4 days here. An Oasis of calm in the midst of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech. You can walk everywhere within the Medina from here but taxi's are cheap and plentiful when required. The Staff and facilities were excellent. Beautiful rooms pool immaculate restaurant food consistently very good. Lovely place to stay and worth the extra cost.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: Wonderful place to stay. It is on the more expensive side for Marrakech accomodation however if you can stretch your budget you won't be disappointed. I've previously lived in Marrakech (for about 7 months) and also made around 13 separate trips since. I've stayed in various hotels and riads to try them out - this one would have to be the best so far. Previously a merchant's palace this place has a large lush garden and an absolutely amazing pool - fantastic after the hustle and bustle of the medina. We stayed in a solarium room with a small private garden and it was a lovely home away from home. We loved the nice little touches mutlicoloured welcoming juice rose petals sprinkled around the bathroom roses or pastries with weather report as part of the turn down service. The only negative was the billing process at the end. The bill wasn't clear for English speaking people and didn't acknowledge our original booking confirmation where we had already paid a deposit. In addition we were charged 10% tax on total bill yet booking confirmation clearly that VAT was included in the final price. Shame as this is the only thing that would stop me from returning to this wonderful oasis. Highly recommend this hotel just leave plenty of time to go through your bill at your own pace.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Peace in the chaos of the Medina
Review_Text: The hotel is on the south of the medina closed to the Royal Palace and a few monuments that you have to see. You can walk everywhere in the Medina we have never felt afraid even in the evening. It is about 20-25 minutes to walk to the famous Place Djemaa el Fna . If you take a taxi you will have to pay between 30 and 50 dirhams.    We have booked the room trough the website of the hotel. It was the cheapest way . The room was on the ground floor with a little terrace a little sittingroom a lovely bathroom with bath and a rainshower.all the walls were in trendy tadelakt ....really beautiful!  The hotel has only 36 rooms and it was not fully booked it was very quiet no screaming children ;). The swimming pool is clean with comfortable chairs  places with enough sun but also enough shadow.    The service is perfect the foodcwas very nice but not cheap.    It was the first time that I was there butvfor sure...not the last time...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Date: Carlos d wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: A nice surprise inside the Kashbah walls. The gardens the terrace bar evey room different the rooftop chillout area friendly staff good restaurant...and at 10 mins walk of the Jemaa el Fnaa. Lovely place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ana E wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Beautiful with nice relaxing atmosphere and very helpful personel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Michael T wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: So glad we chose this hotel as it is a haven right in the heart of the old part of the city. As soon as you walk through the big wooden door you forget all about the madness and the hustle and bustle that is Marrakech. The hotels gardens are wonderful full of singing birds and the odd tortoise strolling around. Eat at the hotel for a wonderful candlelit dining experience by the pool. Breakfast is also great with lots to choose from and lots of yummy cakes and moroccan pastries. We stayed in a solarium room with its own sun terrace which was great and the room was spotlessly cleaned and complimentary bottled water left everyday. The staff here are very attentive and being a small hotel (a large Riad really) the staff remember you and offer you various complimentary snacks during your stay. We stayed for 3 nights and received smoked salmon cucumber soup spicy lamb sausages nuts and watermelon during our time at the hotel. I will definitely return to this hotel next time i visit marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: leon s wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: I have just retuned from a 3 night stay at Les Jardins De La Medina and can not wait to go back!  The hotel is a total oasis in the middle of the Kasbah. You enter through an old wooden door into the cool reception area. From there you are shown into the garden/pool area where you sip your complementary mint tea and local nibbles.  When you are suitably refreshed you are then shown to your room by the bellboy. We booked a solarium room and were not disappointed. The bathroom and bedroom area are top notch! We then explored our balcony and found our stairs leading to our room top terrace with private sun beds! Amazing!  The gardens and pool were a welcome relief from the 46 degree heat.  We ate breakfast and lunch in the hotel where the food was very good. Breakfast is very French and lunch has a Moroccan twist.  10 out of 10!  We would defiantly stay here again!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: denise w wrote a review Jul 2012
Review_Text: Our second visit and once again very successful for a very relaxing week's break. Marrakech is a very exciting city to visit but to be able to return to Les Jarden de la Medina after a hectic hot few hours exploring the surroundings of the Medina is a very welcoming and tranquil experience where all staff are very attentive. We do say that we will return for a short break but I really think that another full week is on the cards. Thank you all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A haven of peace, quiet and beauty
Review_Text: Have travelled to Marrakech a number of times and stayed in smart chic riads. This time though due to the July travel dates I needed somewhere with a pool to relax around during the searing 45 degree heat of the afternoon. Les Jardins de la Medina proved to be a really great option.    Based in the Kasbah area it is a great location for getting lost (intentionally) for a good wander around the small streets and lanes to chat to the locals and get a feel for everyday Marrakshi life. Yes it is a 20 minute walk to the souks in the Medina and the Djeema el Fna but if that's too much then taxis are readily available and they all seemed to know where the hotel was.    The Sultana room I had was spectacular. Wrap round terrace with loungers chairs and a day bed overlooking the pool surrounded by tall palms filled with collared doves blackbirds and sparrows - so a lovely dawn chorus. Massive king sized bed dressing room bathroom with rain shower and excellent aircon.    The restaurant is also really good. We ate at two of the main foodie attractions in the city - Al Fassia and Maison Arabe - and both were good and worth a trip but the restaurant at Les Jardin actually topped them both. The lamb tanjia with potatoes was truly memorable as was the chicken and olive tagine. They also serve quite late so after an evening soaking up the madness of the Djeem el Fna they will happily supply a lovely meal after 10 at night if you want. Breakfast on the pool terrace was also a great start to the day - impressive selection of fresh fruit and the best home made yogurt I have tasted in a while.    The staff and service were excellent. After staying five nights with them the staff know you by name are attentive and very friendly. The concierge desk offered very good recommendations on things to do and places to go and could not have been more helpful.    We also had a half day cookery lesson with one of the restaurant chefs up on the roof terrace which was fun informative and resulted in a really good lunch afterwards.    The gardens are full of palms and well tended plants plus a family of tortoises who walk around at will and seem very contented in their beautiful surroundings. It's difficult not to envy them their home!    For a winter trip to Marrakech then perhaps a chic small riad is a very good option. From April through to October then Les Jardins de la Medina would be my choice now so that I could take advantage of the lovely pool and its surrounding gardens. Actually it will probably be my first choice whatever the time of year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We first found this hotel just over a year ago and were so impressed that we booked again. This time we stayed two nights and three nights with a week in between. Situated within the city walls this is an ideal base for exploring Marrakech on foot. Outside everything is hustle and bustle but behind the hotel walls it is peaceful and calm. The food is of a high standard (better than last year I think) and is well presented and served. At times we did have to wait a bit between courses but what the hell we were on holiday and the Chef is very talented. The pool is set in the middle of the courtyard garden and can get crowded. The staff work very hard the building and garden are always clean and tidy. Rooms are comfortable and clean the linen is spotless. When we return to Marrakech this will be our first choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Armin J wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: beautiful place in whole. Staff was always very helpful interested in our wishes. Could watch the football match Ger vs. Greece during European Championships 2012. Dinner was available to have in the TV-lounge as the match took place during dinner time great deal!!!  Lovingly superior room with a lot of space a nicely decorated bathroom and a balcony overviewing the patin with pool.  Settled in the kasbah area 10-15 min. walk to the place jafna and the souks. Morrocan life starts directly outside the hotel. If you don¬¥t like to stay in the hotel for all meals there are some opportunities near the kasbah mosque.  Hotel √ßan be recommended at all times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jocelyn c wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: I want to thank the staff for such a magical stay in an incredible garden of eden. We stayed for 6 nights.The food was incrediblethe pool spa and staff exceeded our expectations.On the last night the hotel had a cocktail party at the pool with entertainment and dinner.We met the general manager who was really friendly.The accomodation was clean and beautiful.Our room overlooked the garden with our own patio.I would highly recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Petra M wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel in June for 5 nights and we enjoyed it very much. Central location absolutly pieceful very friendly Staff beautifully gardens terraces deliciously food. We are sure to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Rustic Charm, relaxing and excellent service
Review_Text: This really is as good as all the reviews say if you are looking for a quiet peacful hotel to spend quality time both in the rooms and around the grounds you need look no further. Excellent value for money. I could not fault this hotel. If you are a party animal probably not the best hotel for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful place on edge of Medina. 10 min walk into square. Peace and quiet and birdsong.Staff brilliant. Rooms  gardens  pool restaurant - all superb. Wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend to others
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel in May for 3 nights and were delighted with our choice.    The hotel arranged our airport transfers and our tour guide and a driver to take us to the Atlas mountains. They also recommended a restaurant for the night that we didn't dine with them. We were very happy with the service offered and their recommendations.    The hotel is immaculately clean the staff pleasant eager to assist with any queries and very welcoming. The pool garden and restaurant area is fabulous chic comfortable and calming. The food was delicious and imaginative.    We were thrilled with our choice of hotel and after the madness of city it was always heaven to return to. Some travelers have mentioned that the hotel is quite a long way out of the centre but we found it to be a good 10 minute walk only. The peace and quiet there far outweighed a few extra minutes walking we were never disturbed day or night.    Our party of 4 was so happy here and very sorry to leave. I wouldn't hesitate to
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Green, cool, fresh, & calm in Marrakech
Review_Text: Like all oases in the desert you see the greenery first‚Ä¶then you feel the shade and the cool! The Jardins de la Medina greenery cascades into the alleyway around the door that opens into a cool calm fresh space where you are greeted with Moroccan mint tea. Above you towering palms amid tropical plants around the pool and restaurant. Flowering mimosa and bougainvillea full of the chatter of birds surround the paths to your room. Tables and rest areas are tucked away in the garden above a roof terrace ideal for early morning or late evening relaxation. Moroccan-French cuisine endless breakfasts lunch at the pool's edge no noise no hustle no bustle no haggling. Cheerful fun helpful welcoming staff a true Moroccan experience. The only problem is that you have to leave............. !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We first visited Les Jardins de la Medina for the day at the end our trip as the temperature had soared to over 40 and our riad pool was quite small and in use. As soon as we walked through the doors and out to the courtyard we knew we were somewhere special. The day deal is very good or certainly was for us - 350 dirhams including a 3 course lunch. The pool area and gardens are absolutely beautiful and we enjoyed the restaurant as well. The staff cannot do enough for you and from the moment we arrived we didn't want to leave. So much so that we ended up checking in for our final night and after sleeping in the king sized bed and waking up to the sound of the birds changed our flights so we could stay another day!    The location is great for the Kasbah area the palace and the tombs but a taxi ride away from the centre and some of the other sights.
