However having spent 5 days exploring Marrakech on foot Les Jardins de La Medina suited us perfectly. We stayed in a superior room in the main riad (I think it was 134) which also had an outside balcony. It was huge with a small seating area and fire place with rose petals scattered in the bathroom. The second night we were moved to a solarium room which on the other side of the riad and smaller but had both a balcony and a sun terrace ‚Äì a perfect place to see the stars at night. My only disappointment was with the hammam which was quite expensive and felt very rushed and not that pleasurable. However I saw lots of other people going for treatments so it could be a one off.    All in all Les Jardins was a wonderful tranquil oasis and we would return in a heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Location in the southern part of the Medina & inside the Kasbah is perfectly safe for any tourist. Gorgeous hotel huge garden big pool rooms are big (with AC and extremely clean bathrooms perfect) and most have a little terrace some a private sunroof. Staff is more than kind service incredible. Breakfast's included served in-or outside.  Ideal for a long weekend or a week holiday if you want total peace.  Lunch there is nice as well. Menu and dishes are ok not overwhelming.  Go out for dinner and try El Fassia or Fendouk both incredible - even locals go which isn't the case @ other places (too expensive or not good).  The Spa on top floor is one of the best I've ever been to. The massages and facials are 5 star xxl.  I will stay there again in a room w/sundeck.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The arrival was good and we had a drink within minutes of walking through the well hidden entrance. We found the staff cheerful and very helpful. The pool and gradens were lovely and a pleasure to sit in. The room (I think it was number 128) was large with a sitting room but our floor was the kitchen ceiling which meant you didn't get a lie in much after 6am.They sure could clang those pots in the morning! It was the first room on the left with two circular windows on 1st floor which you could see looking from the restaurant. We decided to embrace the early morning call and were always first for breakfast giving us a great choice of the excellent fare offered. We really enjoyed the service here and had a few mornings lie in at the next place on our tour.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: matteo n wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel in the heart of Marrakech. Great staff. Everything was so nice.  Restaurant very very good with international cusine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: johan m wrote a review May 2012
Review_Title: A gem in the heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: Great location nice rooms ours was #122 with great balcony.  Welcome bottle of wine fruits and morrocon sweets.  Bed covered with roses every day!!  Restaurant with great food international cuisine nice flavours!  Staff is very friendly and highly professional always very helpfull.  Small fitness place but sympathicly hidden in the garden. A good place to start your day!!    WE ENJOYED IT EVERY SINGLE MINUTE!!

Review_Date: Elisabeth W wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Arrived home yesterday from this wonderful hotel in Marrakech. Cannot recommend it highly enough - staff were extremely well trained: polite helpful and a pleasure to deal with; the accommodation was wonderful (we upgraded) and was kept spotlessly clean; the food was outstanding and included the best hotel breakfast we've ever had (and we have travelled a lot - the French influence was clear!); the setting was magical in an otherwise noisy and dirty city; and there were facilities for treatments and exercise if you like that sort of thing. Only slight downside was the lack of space around the pool but if you want privacy the beautiful garden has this and there are places to sit amongst the trees. Beware if you don't like birds as they are everywhere even inside the restaurant... Very highly recommended hotel - but don't miss the spectacular city or the Atlas Mountains either!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The place really was an oasis that we so needed. We wish we had found this earlier as we previously had stayed in another place that was still in the 70's.  From the moment that we entered through the doors we felt that we had come home. We were made to feel relaxed and put at ease. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff of the hotel.  If you are looking for a perfect stay this is the place for you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Vienna G wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: The grounds are absolutely gorgeous and the breakfast was delicious not to mention the waiters were really nice. Great place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Fritz K wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: The swimming pool was very nice the service was on the dot though some of the staff didn't speak much english. The food was superb and also the rooms. My favorite part was that from the front you can't tell there's an amazing hotel waiting behind two massive wooden doors.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: we knocked on the large wooden door and walked into a welcoming oasis in the old part of the medina...great welcome at reception beautiful bedroom with lovely bathroom...rose petals scattered on the floor robes and slippers and a lovely little garden patio under the fragrant fruit trees. The service was impeccable. After walking all day thru the beautiful mosaics in the palaces and tombs haggling in the souks and dodging cars and motorcycles the lovely pool and gardens are most relaxing.  We would definitely recommend this Riad....better than the big hotels as you get the same wonderful personalised service in a smaller environment and feel the local style.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Stayed here for seven nights in March. Larger than many Riads so able to offermore facilities. Has a good sized pool (many riads have tiny 'plunge pools';- delightful gardens with peaceful seating areas scattered around. Excellent bar and restaurant. Food good though felt the 'Moroccan Night' dinner was a little disappointing. Excellent postion excellent service - all in all a fabulous hotel - would definitely go back again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: David P wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Our family stayed for 4 nights at Les Jardins. The rooms were perfect with with an outlook over the beautiful gardens and swimming pool. There are great views towards the snowcapped Atlas Mountains from the rooftop terrace too. After a day spent walking around Marrakech and haggling in the Souk the hotel is a very welcoming oasis to which you can return for a swim a drink or both!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Joanna R wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: Blissful stay in the old part of the medina
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights as a couple in the final week of March and were thoroughly impressed. The riad is tucked away on a very busy hectic street and you would never imagine the peaceful oasis behind the heavy wooden door.    We had a room with a roof terrace and sun loungers which was really nice and private away from the main (albeit very nice and really relaxing) pool of the hotel.    Throughout the stay we were impressed by small touches such as complimentary nibbles in our room rose petals all over the bathroom and it was immaculately clean and new-looking.    Would recommend this place ten times over. I would love to go back one day. You will not be disappointed.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect garden of Eden within the old town Medina - Marrakech
Review_Text: Not a hotel but a Riad - a walled house within the old town Medina. what a contrast entering this Garden of Eden coming in from the narrow streets and busy life...    Spacious room a good restaurant swimming pool shadowm palms - and very well maintained. even a little shop inside.    We stayed for a week and enjoyed the Riad the service and theirs facilities...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardins for 3 nights and had an excellent experience. Like most hotels in Marrakech it doesn't look like much from the outside but Les Jardins is magnificent once you step inside. The hotel is built around a large interior courtyard consisting of a large pool a restaurant with patio seating and a garden. The rooms are spacious and extraordinarily well-appointed the food was terrific and the staff was friendly and helpful.    The main thing you notice about Les Jardins is how open it is. The other riads we saw in the medina tended to be very dark and claustrophobic. Les Jardins is the opposite. Being a tourist in Marrakech wears you out during the day - it's hot confusing people are constantly trying to hustle you for money and you get lost every five minutes. It was great to have somewhere so relaxing to come home to. We wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff were fabulous the garden setting beautiful and the restaurant offered delicious food. My room was very spacious and comfortable. I really could have asked for little more than I received at this lovely hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Don B wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: Les Jardines provides a haven away from the general chaos of the Marrakech medina. The gardens are delightful and the swimming pool heated. Scattered throughout the hotel and gardens are bijou seating areas so even after staying for 3 days there was not sufficient time to discover all the quiet semi secluded spots.  Our room was delightful; large well proportioned with a separate seating area and small balcony overlooking the gardens. We were over the hamman downstairs which perhaps explains why there seemed to be under-floor heating?  Our double bed was large comfortable and had a mountains of pillows (a must for me) while the bathroom was small but stylish.  Room maid service in particular was very good coming at least twice a day and departing leaving a shower of rose petals.  We were particularly impressed with the early morning tea service which was quick and free. This is so much appreciated when hotels often charge an silly amount for this core service (the Cirankan Palace in Istanbul once charged us US$23 for two tea bags and hot water ~ I still have the bill).  The breakfast buffet is good quality and is served overlooking the gardens we also enjoyed the popular restaurant for dinner (reviewed elsewhere). Good food at a reasonable price.  The big downside of Les Jardines is the location which is in the extreme SW of the Medina. While close to the palaces and the royal tombs it is still a hike and the main attractions of Marrakech are definitely a taxi ride away unless you like walking and that is not practical in the warmer weather. The narrow streets mean that vehicle access can be slow at times.  Good quality free wifi
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful lunch in a superb surrounding!
Review_Text: We came for lunch at Les Jardins de la Medina whilst in Marrakech. A colleague had stayed at the hotel and had highly recommended the establishment. We sat outside by the poor area which is just gorgeous and so peaceful! The menu is french but the waitress translated everything on the menu for us which was very handy as I'm pretty clueless with French. The food was fantastic (I had the tagine de poulet aux oignons et amandes sucrees which was just delicious!!!); the service was fantastic the staff were very attentive and even from just having lunch we were pretty jealous that we weren't hotel guests too. It was such a gorgeous place in a quiet street (which is very uncommon in Marrakech) but just five minutes from the Tombs. If I go back to Marrakech I would definitely stay here!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our first trip to Marrakesh and the hotel Jardins de la Medina is a good reason to come back. It may not be the absolutely 'authentic' environment some people may be looking for but it is indeed a high quality hotel with excellent service and the ambience is genuine enough for a first-time visitor. People that are rating this hotel lower than excellent are of course entitled to do so but it may be that it is a rating against expectations rather than a objective assessment of the hotels qualities (I experience this quite frequently when reading reviews in Tripadvisor by the way).    Good sized heated pool (the heating certainly not needed in summer but very much so in February) good breakfast and dinner. A nice touch was the Manager's apero which was provided free of charge as a social event one evening (appeared to be a regular thing).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a wonderful getaway.. After just a short flight from the UK. We arrive to sunshine and a friendly driver awaits to take us to the hotel. First impressions don't disappoint. Staff are exceptionally helpful and friendly. We are whisked away by Youssef to enjoy mint tea to a court yard situated by a fountain surrounded by orange trees. After explaining where everything is in the hotel he then goes on to tell us what are the best places to see in Marrakech.  A back scrub and hammam follows in the Spa - bliss after our travelling ! The Spa is completely amazing high ceilings and fabulous features that wouldn't be out of place in a high end spot in Central London.    The hotel suite is also luxurious with lots of extra little touches thrown in. I was very pleasantly surprised.    Overall this was a wonderful weekend away.. the staff went out of their way to make us welcome. Especially Youssef and Jamal. Thank you so much. We hope to see you again some day.  Charlotte and Suzanne.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We stayed at the Les Jardins last June in 100 degree heat and we were so delighted that we had chosen this hotel! As soon as you walk through the wooden door you are welcomed by a cool and contemporary reception. You are taken through to the hotel's restaurant and out into the garden's which are a true paradise in the middle of a crazy bustling city!  The plants and flora are beautiful and there are lots of birds chirping away. You can't hear any noises from outside the hotel it truly is peaceful and relaxing. The pool is lovely and although not that big perfect for dunking in and having a few short strokes. The sunbeads are of top quality and the hotel itself is stunning beautiful architecture and lots of nooks and crannies to explore!  The restaurant serves lovely breakfast and our room was beautiful. Big with large french doors that we could open out onto our own little terrace overlooking the pool heaven! The bed was so comfortable and the shower / bath was of top quality also.  I have absolutely nothing negative to say about this hotel whatsoever. It is now my ambition to try and return as soon as i can.  I am a parent but wouldn't really take my child here only because there isn't much to do for them here (or in this city really!) and its so peaceful as it is i wouldn't want my child to annoy any of the other guests relaxing and soaking up the atmosphere!  Thank you to the Les Jardins for making our stay so very special!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really lovely property immaculately decorated the rooms were toasty warm all the time and they would light a fire if you needed as it was chilly in Feb. The gardens are beautiful and the pool area very relaxed birds tweet its a great sun trap orange trees and palms give you shade. Overall though the staff make it Yossif on reception was just so helpful friendly and kind the bar and restaurant staff really go out of there way to make you feel at home it has the feel of a welcoming country house hotel rather than a Marrakesh riad style hotel! We did visit the spa the Hamman scrub is done in the hotel next door which has the most amazing basement hamman they pretty much switch on the steam for you. The surrounds are just stunning and well worth getting on arrival as we did. Its only 30 mins and really kicks off your holiday. We had other treatments in the Hotel Spa which are more like treatment rooms than a full spa experience but it has to be said the facial and massage we had were pretty top notch.    Overall I would definately stay in this property again and recommend it the only possible negative I can think of is that it is about a 10 minute walk from the main square but its a nice walk and who can ever walk back after all that shopping!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: When we arrived we were dropped off at a door way in a small street looking slightly puzzled until we entered the hotel. Every thing about the hotel was understanded top class service. Although nothing was too much trouble the staff let you enjoy the peaceful surroundings of the hotel. Would recommend it to anybody had a fabuolus time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul B wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Text: An oasis of calm in the hectic bustle of Marakech friendly helpful peaceful and relaxing. Le Jardin is an excellent base slightly removed from the touristy heart of the town which can be overwhelming. The staff are all committed to ensuring guests enjoy their stay. The 'oasis' courtyard and pool are a stunning surprise when you first enter and the excellent accommodation is brilliantly designed to give each room a true feeling of seclusion. It was a truly memorable stay .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a great hotel in a great location. Excellent staff and service. Wonderful garden full of birds and orange trees. Rooms are spacious and well appointed except maybe for the bathrooms which could do with a sprucing up. Disappointment was the restaurant which once again provided excellent attentive service was let down by the uninspiring menu and presentation. Although my food was good (veal stew) the couscous royal did not invite your taste buds. But we found this a feature in most restaurants we ate at - food was ok but presentation uninspiring.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Date: John G wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: Friendly, good quality sanctuary of a hotel
Review_Text: Quite a surprise to arrive at a five star hotel where one is confronted with a brick wall and just a small entry door into what ultimately proved to be the haven beyond! Check in was a relaxing affair with the formalities done whilst sampling local mint tea.The grounds of the hotel are very private with a lovely Islamic style garden which must be a super cool place to be in the heat of a summer's day. January temperatures still reached 25 degrees C in the afternoon so sitting out was a passable thing to do!. We paid the upgrade for a Solarium room which was well worth it. The private roof terrace was a great way to enjoy the afternoon sun after a few hours of exploring the at times very hectic city. Certainly recommend asking the hotel to arrange a taxi to bring you from the airport. This was good value and saved the worry the taxi driver might not find the hotel. We also booked an interesting trip through the hotel to be driven up into the Atlas mountains one day with our own private driver. The food in the hotel restaurant offered good choices and was tasty albeit not that cheap. The breakfasts were wonderful with a variety of choice often lacking in European hotel breakfasts. We would certainly stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Long term lurker first time reviewer...
Review_Text: I've been using tripadvisor for many years and have never been moved to review a property before - but my recent trip here has convinced me to abandon my previous stance.    Just to give a frame of reference - I (unfortunately for me) travel a fair amount with my job and in the past 12 months have spent time in Portugal Spain France Germany the Netherlands the UAE Qatar the US and the Caribbean. I am lucky enough not to have to pay for my accommodation and usually stay in pretty nice places. The trip to Morocco for a change was for pleasure rather than business.    And (clich√© ahead) what a pleasure it was. The hotel is truly lovely - a little oasis of calm amongst the madness of the Medina. Great food good service lovely (and well decorated rooms) peaceful rooftop terrace beautiful pool: in short peace tranquility and full on relaxation. One of the very best places I have ever stayed anywhere in the world.    We spent some time at La Mamounia eating and walking in the gardens - it is bigger but neither as friendly nor as relaxing and intimate as LJDLM.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Riad really is an oasis in a hectic city!  We had arranged for private pick up via the riad which was worth every penny. Check in was smooth hassle free and undertaken with a pot of delicious mint tea and fresh dates!  Dinner was good and breakfasts were plentiful!  Our room was fantastic! We had opted for the solarium room which again was worth the money. Private balcony with rooftop and 2 sun-loungers. It was a perfect place to relax.  All the staff are helpful especially Youssef who was knowledgeable friendly and just an all round good chap!!  The location is good only 15mins away from the main square. Make sure you memorise its location otherwise you will be out of pocket by some of the enterprising young locals who charge for pointing out directions!!  All in all a great Riad.  Thank you  PS Thank you to all the staff for suprising my husband with a birthday gift...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful - but I wouldn't stay here again
Review_Text: we stayed at the les jardins for 4 nights - followed by a 2 night stay in a different riad    Don't get me wrong this hotel is a beautiful lovely oasis (see pics) as stated in all the other reviews - so I shall not repeat what everyone else has said    However I will add you get what you pay for - and this hotel is only a beautiful lovely oasis as the prices are EXPENSIVE    I was disappointed with:  1. the breakfast .. it was limited in the sense that there was no chef to prepare food on the spot and most food was very sweet - there were a lot of cakes dates and other sweets. Dinner/Lunch were also limited in choices and prices were expensive verging on ridiculous for Marrakech standards.. this was probably why the restaurant was empty every night.    2.prices of excursions - the hotel were charging OVER ¬£100 (GBP) for a trip to the cascades which we later booked with a private tour company with a brand new air conditioned Mercedes van for ¬£30. The hotel has the attitude that only the rich stay there - so they will charge rich prices. Possibly this is the case but for us we had saved a long time to stay there so were a bit let down.    3. there was a MASSIVE cockroach in our very beautiful room. - we called reception who sent someone from housekeeping to dispose of it - but I think for hotel of that calibre there shouldn't have been a cockroach in the first place. This also ruined my sleep that night.    4. on our last day the taxi driver outside the hotel took us to our next riad. He dropped us to the top of an alley we paid him and he told us it was just on the right (cars can't go down that road).. it was a 10 minute walk in the opposite direction and on the left!! dragging our suitcases in the heat was not pleasant. I know this is not the hotels fault - but a lot of the taxi drivers outside the hotel had the same attitude - that if you stay at les jardines you are mega rich so we will rip you off.. on top of ripping of tourists anyway    5. contrary to some of the other reviews the hotel is a 20 minute walk to the square - we timed it  6. when we arrived at the hotel and were waiting to check in we were handed an envelope - and told by the staff - if we would like to tip any of the staff to put the money in the envelope - we hadn't even checked in!!    Overall the hotel itself is beautiful but these few little points are just some reasons why I wouldn't stay here again. I think you can get an equally excellent service for half the price elsewhere.... and the pool was cold even though it says it was heated!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Back for a second time to try out the New Years Eve package.  I can honestly say that we had our most entertaining evening ever!  The entertainment had acrobats belly dancers singers  fire-eaters and jugglers. There was even a cameL and Donkey nativity theme!  Hope to go back next year! The food was good too!  Well done monsieur Fougere!

Review_Date: Rosie S wrote a review Jan 2012
Review_Title: A haven of tranquillity, greenery, sunny nooks and Moroccan beauty.
Review_Text: I found Les Jardins de la Medina a very mixed bag. It is a superb property excellently maintained and always exceedingly clean. Breakfast was always fresh and well prepared and with a great variety. We stayed at the hotel in December 2011 for 7 nights. Our highlights can be seen from the photos we really appreciated the roof garden and the fact that the pool was heated and covered at night which meant it was useable even in December. I had a morning cookery school which I thoroughly enjoyed.  We had a couple of problems one of which at the very end of our stay was nothing to do with the hotel or Riad itself and the staff there went overboard to help us out thank you. The other problem was a kind of ‚Äòequipment failure‚Äô all I can say is if you are going to use the Hamman check they now have marble beds and not wooden ones.  I learned whilst in Morocco (we were there for 4 weeks and we have another revue for the Atlas Hotel in Essaouira) two things - if you say something is ‚Äòokay‚Äô and you are actually making a British understatement your okay will be taken at face value so if you have a problem say so and it will be dealt with. I also learned Moroccans are very adept at making decisions on your behalf (most of these are on the street) or on behalf of their employer so your problem may not be passed on unless you make it very clear that the problem should be. It seems to me there is no ‚Äòday book‚Äô in Moroccan hotels as in good UK hotels in which incidents; queries are recorded and discussed or passed on. So don‚Äôt expect people to know or be mind readers.  We found both here and in Essaouira the 7.30 pm time for dinner too late for us although at Les Jardins you can eat a decent and healthy meal up until 6 pm and if you get eh chance to try their rose flavoured ice cream do!  As mentioned by others the Souks or the main square are a good 20 minute from the hotel and this can be a hostile 20 minute walk I would recommend you use the services of a Moroccan guide for many reasons. Or simply stay inside in this haven of tranquillity greenery sunny nooks and Moroccan beauty.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Marrakech itself is very different for a European but still charming  Les jardins de la Medina was a peaceful haven after a day in the crowd and suk  I am a hotel manager in Rome and love hotels I really appreaciated the hotel and would spend there the entire stay  but of course the city itself has important landmarks that cannot be missed .  We booked a solarium room which is wonderful  I loved the gardens the breakfast and ecole de cuisine  all the staff including the Gm and the hotel manager and the chef are always very attent and helpful it is really a hotel de charme  you can book this hotel for an escape from your crowded and busy life for romance and al so for families  I would love to book it again when in marrakech  thank you to LUc and to Christiane with only 3 days break I could recharge my batteries
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A great place to chill out
Review_Text: Oasis is the word. If you just want to chill out in the beautifully peaceful enclosed garden or by the pool this is the place. The buzzing old town part of Marrakech is right outside the front door but you wouldn't know it. Especially good in November & February - a short flight & a very brief transfer get you to warmth sunlight and a different world (just the antidote to a dank cold English winter that doesn't seem to end!)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have visited Marrakech many times with and without our young children and we have stayed in a number of different hotels and riads. The Jardins de la Medina is definitely one of the nicest hotels I have ever stayed in.  The buildings are typically and attractively Moroccan in style but very well thought-through for Western needs and those of small children (the room came with a baby bath bottle warmer travel cot and lots more) the gardens are beautiful (and house a family of tortoises) and the pool is perfect. We stayed during August and outside it was extremely hot but the rooms have good air conditioning and the terrace and restaurant had a clever water sprinkler system to cool people down.  The hotel is very family-friendly (as well as all the baby facilities in the room every evening they cooked the pasta that we brought for our toddler to eat) and the staff were all really helpful. There was a mix of families and couples and everyone seemed to be having an equally wonderful holiday.  We arrived during Ramadan (though we didn't realise beforehand) but we were able to get food and drinks as we wanted. The quality of the food was excellent - we enjoyed breakfasts and dinners on the terrace and lunches at the pool and were often tempted not to even leave the hotel despite all the fab food places Marrakech has to offer!  The hotel is located in the kasbah area of the city away from the wonderful madness of the main square but close enough to walk to. It is also easy for a taxi to get to unlike some Marrakech hotels.  We will undoubtedly stay at the Jardins de la Medina the next time we visit Marrakech - it offers such a perfect mix of riad and hotel - and would highly recommend it to any couple or family visiting Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: The hotels is a beautiful Oasis in a hectic city. Once you're inside the walls you don't notice any of the noise and it's easy to relax by the pool. And thank goodness for the pool - we (rather stupidly) went in June/July - and it was stupidly hot - the only thing stopping us from hiding in our air conditioned rooms was the lovely pool and gardens.  We has lunch at the hotel once which was superb but didn't stay for an evening meal (far too many other places to explore).    It is quite far to the 'square' from here - easy to walk - but by the 3rd day of this daily routine it got a bit tedious. Unfortunately most attractions are the other side of the square. But it's the sacrifice you pay for a pool quietness and open space.    Only annoyance was the fact the hotel charged through the roof for bottled water (around ¬£4 for a 500ml bottle!). So we bought water on a daily basis from a tiny shop right outside and save around ¬£100 in a week compared to if we'd bought it in the hotel. They did tell us off on a number of occasions - but we ignored them. In 45 degree heat you need water and plenty of it - we were buying 5 litres at a time - so there is no way I was going to the bar to buy a 500ml bottle every time I needed a drink. So buy you water outside and ignore them if they try and tell you off - they're not going to chuck you out over it!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fabulous. Weather was not good but always a log fire burning in the salon. For us the location was perfect as although it was a 15 minute walk to the square we loved walking past the locals and chatting to them when we could. Our room looked out on to a quiet alley and it was great standing in the bath with our head sticking out of the little window watching a couple of local election marches with shouting and cheering. Breakfast was great - probably one of the best we've enjoyed in a hotel. Not ridiculous wastage but a great variation - hot/cold sweet/savoury eggs to order and warm pancakes and other local goodies cooked on the spot. Pool looked fabulous but due to weather we didn't try it out.  Staff couldn't do more to help us and their friendliness was genuine. Good pick-up from the airport and he was there waiting for us even though our flight was delayed 1hr.  We left Marrakech for the beach for a week and returned for one night for our flight the next day. We decided to sample another similar priced riad for that night. We were glad to have the comparison and decided Les Jardin wins - absolutely no contest. If we visit Marrakech again we will definintely stay here. Fabulous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a fantastic stay at Les Jardins de la Medina. After the first night we were not that happy with our room because of the noise from the kitchen but without a problem we were offered another room on the other side which was very quiet.  In the morning we were woken up by the birds. Beautiful garden lovely heated pool great views from the terrace. The staff is perfect. We had dinner and lunch in the restaurant and both were very good. Very nice atmosphere in the bar with the fireplace. Breakfast buffet was delicious with freshly squeezed vegetable and fruit juices.  I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone who would like to explore the medina!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Alexander W wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: Excellent hotel in the heart of the Medina
Review_Text: I¬¥ll come back!. Nice garden excellent serviceperfect rooms - a hotel frequented mostly by couples and travelers from all over the word. Not a perfect place for children.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Allan M wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: If you want the Kasbah, this is it!
Review_Text: This amazing property tucked away in the middle of the Kasbah in Marrakech is a hidden gem.  The front door belies the beautiful Hotel/Riad that lies behind it. The garden full of oranges and the associated aromas of that intertwined with the smell of fresh coffee and pastries made this one a winner for me. Yes I did see the owner and his very well behaved little dog and they played very period FRENCH music that gave the eating area a very Piaf mood. The Imam calling the faithful to prayer from the nearby mosque made me realise that I wasn't there for mushy peas and chips and that I was in the middle of the Kasbah. Everybody that was with me were absolutely envious even though they were stay at one of the more "upmarket" Hotels in the newer part of Marrakech! I loved the location and the breakfast were fresh and tasty and very well presented by awesome staff who could not do enough to help. Concierge and Reception were helpful and just plain good people. It is a 15 minute walk through some of the most amazing streets to the main square. I was personally very happy and the rose petals did not worry me in anyway. The shutters were awesome and kept ALL light out until I was ready to wake up. Great room on the second floor and all the facilities I could ask for including an amazing bath!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Myself and 2 children spent 3 days in Les Jardins before taking a 10 day trip out of Marrakech. We very much enjoyed the hotel surroundings and staff our accommodation and the food was great. I would say luxury without an outrageous price. Any request for booking a trip to trek up Ourika Valley or take a transfer to Casablanca was organised and a fair cost. The pool was lovely though the weather wasn't particularly. I have stayed at other 4 star hotels in Morocco and am shocked that this hotel is rated 4 star as it far better than any such rated hotel I have stayed at here. I recommend this hotel to anyone who wants an easy and indulgent time in a beautiful hotel with helpful and lovely staff.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: sullivan d wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Title: great hotel but a bit far from the city center
Review_Text: Great hotel - riad style - with fab surroundings and nice rooms. Very welcoming staff too. Our only disappointment was about the hotel location which is about 20 mns walk to the main square and main places of attraction.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: In order to understand this review you have to acknowledge that I have been to Marrakech many times and have experienced many different styles of riads and hotels. By chance i came across this hotel featured on google and after doing some research and reading all the positive reviews I couldn't figure out why I had  not heard of it or knew anyone who had stayed there. With that in mind you can you only appreciate  my opinion. So.....    I return to Marrakech again and again as I am still fascinated to keep finding the most enchanting riads which have been decorated by such creative people people whom have often come from the art and fashion world and have taken the opportunity to create something unique in these wonderful buildings. Often one goes looking for hidden areas secretly holding interesting art or sculpture an incredible array of bedrooms and lounges or hidden nooks to hide yourself away in and ultimately make you feel very far from home. But the Les Jardins de la Medina totally lacks any such creativity or wow-factor and I really cannot fathom why anyone would think it does. I accept that if you have never been to Marrakech before and know no better you make think the Les Jardins enchanting just because it has a walled garden however there is so much better  to be had elsewhere.    What I also find incredibly strange and suspect is that there is a hotel guide at the hotel called the Chateaux & Hotels Collection (I have also come across this guide in France) and the ONLY hotel/riad it recommends in the whole of Marrakech is the Les Jardins de la Medina and this frankly is ridiculous and misleading and makes me strongly question how much research the producers of this guide have put into investigating the wonderful  hotels and riads Marrakech has to offer or if hotel owner actually paid to be featured in it.    You also need to know and should not be fooled in any way into believing this is a riad it is not. Part of its origins may have been a riad but now it is a purpose built hotel and I very much suspect a hotel that is promoted on package holiday websites for a low-to-middle range price bracket. I have certainly not come across this establishment on any websites I use in fact when I came across it advertised and then looked up various websites to see the outstanding reviews it had been given I was rather baffled as to why I had not heard of it before especially as I have been to Marrakech so many times. But now having stayed at this hotel I now realise why this very average 3 star rated at best hotel does not get featured on the websites I prefer to use when researching properties. It simply isn't good enough.    I presume the owner lives on the premises. I did constantly notice a rather weather beaten Frenchman  grabbing bits of food off the buffet set-up and his rectum-bearing dog trailing behind him. i dont think this is acceptable especially when people are eating their breakfast.    Further do you want to stay at a hotel which from early morning until midnight plays a monotonous selection of British and American pop music warbling French torch songs and any other 'grab a selection of musical tat' from around the world? Personally I would have thought most people go to Marrakech to drink in the  culture relax in the warmth and enjoy this still slightly mediaeval way of life. Does anyone truly come to Marrakech and want to be woken by hearing Barry Manilow at 8.30 in the morning? Further did anyone in the world have a desire to go to Marrakech and hope to listen to The Carpenters singing Jambalaya while  they are having breakfast? I doubt it! All this middle of the road music being played everywhere made me feel like I was staying at a 1970's wet-weekend holiday camp.    I booked the best room available. Though it wasn't important to me it should be noted  there was no bath only a shower. So if you do want a bathtub then ask in advance.    I know some people like it but I find rose petals scattered over the bed and over towels in the bathroom  really tacky and so-1970's ... and I cannot stand towels being twisted into stupid shapes or displayed on beds.  This is supposed to be Marrakech not a holiday camp in Thailand.    The good points. Certainly the restaurant serves very good food in the evenings the standard  is high but again you're subjected to a crass selection of music which kills off any hope of creating a pleasant atmosphere. The breakfast buffet is mediocre. Our room was pleasant enough (apart from the silly towel shapes and rose petals) and we had a good large terrace but ultimately it was just white-washed and simply does not compare to many of the amazing rooms I have rented in Marrakech in the past. Le Jardins - as you would expect - does at least have a rather nice garden area to relax in though that again is spoilt by the music speakers dotted around which drown out the peace the birds the water fountains. And there is certainly a good sized pool which various families happily let their children scream and dive-bomb into without any consideration for others.    I accept this is a perfectly adequate establishment for those on a budget and for families who want to let their children run riot. But it most certainly wasn't for me or for the type of people I know - and it most certainly wasn't the Marrakech that I love and remain enchanted by.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Quiet Oasis 20 mins walk from the chaos
Review_Text: We stayed 3 nights in the jardin based on the fact it was near the centre with a pool to lounge around.    Behind the big door in the dusty street lies an amazing hotel.  We had a superior room which was gorgeous and loads of space.    It's 20min walk to the central square and a few local shops round the corner.    The pool was slightly disappointing as most the beds are in shadow alot of the time (oct)  but you can head to the roof loungers for sun    Overall great place friendly staff nice place to relax    Hints & Tips  1) you must have receipts for any currency changed if u want to change it back at the airport you will have to ask for these  2) we arranged for a guide via the hotel don't! Ours  took us to his mates shop out of the way which we have to pay for the taxi  3) when you first get the main sq look up go relax in one of the roof top bars to acclimatise  4) Watch the taxis they'll try and rip you off 9 times out of 10 the hotel will give u prices  5) smart phones with Gps are a real help get the maps by wifi then head off into the souks.. Even with data turned off  6) you can to agadir we did private tour bus for ¬£100   7) there is very little to do in Agadir.. We spent 3 nights it was a struggle  8) brush up on your French it'll come in handy

Review_Date: Hamish C wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Title: The beautiful Jardin de la Medina Riad, Marakech
Review_Text: An "Alice through the looking glass" experience. Enter the Riad from the busy fascinating ancient streets of the Medina through a simple door in an almost blank wall into an Oasis of calm and beauty. Stunning gardens like a rain forest filled with Orange trees Banana Palms and ferns and one of the biggest pools in the Medina. Amazing restuarant with a simple selection of dishes all beautifully cooked. Staff very friendly and attentive. Rooms with different styles and outlooks and lots of secluded sitting areas both shaded and sunny. You will wonder where the other guests actually are. Just a delight and so different from any other hotel experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: charming hotel with good food helpful staff and nice atmosphere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: First of all i would class this hotel as good not average but not possible on this site.The riad was fine the staff and the managers i found helpful and polite it took about 20 min to walk to main sq.But i think i would have been better staying in a moden hotel in the new townthe experience was not for me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful way to de stress
Review_Text: Having returned on 17/10/11 from Les Jardins de la Medina I cannot speak highly enough of the service we recieved from all the staff in this excellent Riad/hotel. Nothing was to much trouble. As we were driving through the Medina it was like stepping back in time so much so that my partner and I began wondering what we had let ourselves in for as the roads were more like back alleys with hundreds of people thronging the streets.    Our taxi pulled up at the Riad and the first thing we noticed was a very nondescript wooden door However as we opened it it was like being transported into another world. We arrived at the hotel at about 10am so our rooms were not yet ready. We were greeted by the manager who told us they would be ready by 12 noon and asked if we would like some very delicious mint tea. We were shown into the gardens and it was beautiful and sat there drinking our tea and really feeling very relaxed. We were then gven a tour of the Riad by the manager after which we where shown to our delightful room which was on the ground floor with our own litlte patio area with table and chairs. This stepped into the beautiful gardens which are so well looked after. Every day when the rooms were made up the staff sprinkled rose petals over the bed and in the bathroom. We had lunch every day in the outside section of the restaurant overlooking the pool. The food is delicious with the same menu daily but with added "specials of the day". We feel very rejuvinated from our 5 sun filled days at Les Jardins de la Medina and would definately return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Makes you feel you are DISCOVERING something for the 1st time
Review_Text: Upon pulling up outside the cracked wall and old wooden entrance door - I presumed that the taxi driver had made a mistake. "There must be some mistake..." I am suggesting firmly to SuperFiance (at the time) now SuperWife.  30 seconds later as we have walked into a hidden oasis of charm and tradition and welcome and smell and design and comfort - I am literally open-mouthed and speechless.  5 days later and i have not changed my mind.  Likes? Mint-tea courtyard breakfast room within our suite private roof terrace cold shower on said terrace pool ambience staff excellent dining.  Dislikes? The fact that the rest of Marrakech is not like this place. I am amazed this place ranks - relatively lowly - as we wandered around higher rated Riads and hotels - and just don't get it. I would be amazed if anyone failed to be charmed and becalmed by this true gem.  Oh one thing - the girl in the spa who gave Hazel her massage - spent a good 5 minutes of her allotted hour on her mobile phone which i thought was appalling manners. Hopefully she has been sacked by now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Les Jardins de la Medina in October
Review_Text: Great staff great location and a real gem. We stayed for a week and found the whole place to be completely charming. The staff could not be more helpful and the owner introduced himself and was often around ensuring everything was up to standard. A big pool with plenty of sunbeds and many other suntraps around the site made for a great Autumn break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Cannot fault this place, see it to believe it
Review_Text: Just stayed at Les Jardins for one week.  Had read all the reviews before I went and could not believe a place could be that good.........it is !    Marrakech is a wonderful interesting lively city but after a day of sight seeing shopping and walking there is nothing like stepping through the door from the dusty side street like no other approach I have seen to a good hotel (scary when you first see it convinced we had made a mistake) You step into calm cool traquil setting good food quiet lazy evenings a beautiful clean pool attentive and welcoming staff. Walk through the gardens and meet the hotel dog (such a sweetie) spot toroises wondering about in the gardens. Someone likened it to entering Narnia I could not describe it better!  I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent location after a week of biking in rural Morocco
Review_Text: We stayed for 1 night in this hotel after a week of intensive cycling throughout Morocco. Luxurious hotel with absolute calm in the middle of very crowded Marrakech. I can also recommend the kitchen: great Tajine (and we already had many this week). Personnel is friendly and helpful. Not cheap but perfect for what we needed (group of 12 mountainbikers).

My girlfriend and I recently stayed here for a short break and had a wonderful time.    Truly an oasis of calm within the busy 'old' city walls. Room was spacious clean and comfy and freshened every morning without fail (hope you like rose petals). The staff are beyond lovely always calm and very helpful. Choosing a restaurant every evening became a daily ritual between me and the concierge. The pool and gardens are beautiful. Or you can relax on the roof (lots of comfy sofa) overlooking the city. You won't want to leave the hotel trust me. Weather was perfect. You can't really say anything bad about this place you really can't.    I hope your stay will be as good as ours. B
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As someone who travels a lot and stays in many hotels i can truly say this was one of the best experiences i have had in a hotel. its a perfect balance between excellent considered service with all of the facilities one comes to expect from an international hotel however it remains personal and feels private and intimate. As someone who dreads a review which says "its felt like we were a guest in their home" i never felt that here. I didnt feel like i was being watched or pestered i was left to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings. Truly memorable experience and i have reccomended the hotel to all my friends.  My general review of marrakech was gorgeous hotel shame about the city!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: As many other travelers have commented I was slightly worried when our taxi pulled up in what appeared to be a dead end street and announced that we had arrived at the Jardins De La Medina. As with much of Marrakech the building's exterior gives few clues as to what lies beyond but we needn't have worried. The interior of the Riad is stunning and a welcome relief from the hussle and bussle that is Marrakech. Everything about the hotel has an air of peace and calm that I have never felt in any other hotel I have ever stayed in. You are made to feel very welcome right from the very first moment you step foot inside and are served your first traditional Moroccan mint tea.    We stayed in a mid-range 'Superior' room which consisted of private bathroom with shower/bath combo separate lounge area huge (and very comfortable) king sized bed aircon/ceiling fan minibar fridge (useful for storing your own 'contraband' drinks) robes and slippers in room mini safe (free to use) flat screen TV with DVD player and private outdoor patio area with table and chairs. The room itself was well decorated with a nice balance between modern contemporary furnishings and a traditional Moroccan feel. Not that we watched it much but the only TV channel in English was BBC World News so you may want to make use of the free DVD rental service from reception (or for the techies out there you may want to take your own movies as the DVD player has a DivX compatible USB port). Another tip is that if you are trying desperately to save on luggage weight (thank you Ryanair!) then I'm reliably informed that unlike some the in-room hairdryer is more than suitable for the job.    During our 7 day stay at the end of Aug we encountered only a handful of other guests around the hotel (nationalities ranged from French UK German and American). This was perhaps due to the timing of the Ramadan religious festival which ended a few days into our stay. While the local Muslims observe the traditional Ramadan fasting ritual this was barely noticeable once inside the hotel itself with food and drink being available to guests all day as normal. The hotel restaurant serves a mixture of Moroccan and International dishes for both lunch and evening meals. Every meal we had was delicious and the waiter service was excellent. My only negative would be that as with most restaurants in Marrakech prices were much higher for food and drink than expected (we averaged about ¬£40-¬£50 a night for 2 courses and alcoholic drinks for 2 people with mains ¬£15-¬£20 and beer/wine ¬£4-¬£5 a glass).    Having been suitably fed and watered your next priority is to choose from the many different parts of the hotel on offer for you to relax in. The hotel has a roof terrace with tables/chairs single and double loungers and a partially shaded area with arabian-esque floor cushions and sofa (great place to hide from the mid day sun and read one of the many books donated by other guests from the small library in the bar). Also on the roof is a small gym the cookery school and a completely shaded patio area overlooking the bar and pool area. The pool itself is a great place to spend the day with ample loungers both in and out of the sun. Complimentary towels are provided which the staff are very quick to replace on vacated beds once other guests have moved on. There are also the beautiful gardens from which the hotel draws its name. As well as being home to some of the more permanent guests (namely a family of tortoises) hidden in the trees and pathways which criss-cross the garden courtyard are additional secluded beds loungers and tables should you feel like some privacy away from the pool. The hotel also offers a spa with various relaxation and massage treatments. This was perhaps one of the more disappointing elements of our stay with my girlfriend being left slightly underwhelmed with a Hammam and Henna wrap treatment which basically involved a very quick wash from one of the spa attendants and then 20 minutes alone in the steam room. You may wish to venture further afield to one of the dedicated spa's dotted around town if you are looking for a better value and a more indulgent treatment.    Last but not least the staff at the hotel are also worthy of great praise. Forever attentive without being overbearing they really made you feel at home and always welcomed you with a smile. The team on reception were always very approachable and happy to provide local information and phone for taxi's or recommend and/or make restaurant reservations whenever requested. The restaurant bar and maid staff were also excellent and constantly surprised us be it with little cakes each evening delivered to the room with the next days weather report or cold face towels and complimentary fruit kebabs served around the pool each day (it's the little things like that which really do make your stay).    My only other comment on the hotel is that its location in the most southern district of the Old Town may be a bit far out of the way for some. A walk to the main square (next to the Koutoubia mosque) will take a good 25 mins and may be a bit intimidating for some due to the confusing narrow streets and cars/bikes/horses/mopeds which fight for space with the pedestrian foot traffic. The alternative is of course a ¬£3-¬£4 (or cheaper depending on your haggling skills) taxi ride each way. One last tip is that you may want to try and arrange an each way airport transfer either privately or direct with the hotel as we were ripped off to the tune of 300Dh for the 10 minute "big" taxi ride to the hotel which we organised ourselves and only paid 135Dh for the return journey which was organised by the hotel (TIP : big taxi = mercedes = expensive small taxi = hatchback = cheap).    Overall I would highly recommend the Jardins De La Medina. It really is a great place to chill out and is ideally suited to couples looking to relax with a local 'Casablanca' beer after a hard day haggling in the Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I have rarely enjoyed a stay at any hotel more. The setting was unusual in that from the street it gives very little hint of the exceptional hotel behind the entry door. The gardens within were like a small oasis with delightful small private areas to sit and enjoy the calm atmosphere. The meals were such that we chose to eat most of our meals at the hotel and the service was excellent . The accommodation was also very good and had free wireless internet within the hotel grounds. Fresh fruits were in our room on arrival. I liked the loose rose petals strewn around and the small cake bouchees left after the evening turn down.  We felt quite safe when out walking but were accosted a few times by "friends" who wished to show us shopping etc. But most were polite and left you alone if asked to.  I am sure that we will return as the heat was was a dry heat and not overpowering.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: H R wrote a review Sep 2011
Review_Title: Welcoming, friendly, attentive staff; very good facilities cuisine and great location
Review_Text: This is the second time we have stayed at the Jardins de la Medina and loved it. As soon as we arrived we were made to feel very welcomed. Our room (Described in their brochure as ‚ÄúSuperior‚Äù) was comfortable air-conditioned had a seating area and a French door that opened onto a small patio.    Everyone was always very helpful and friendly and spoke French and English. Without exception whether they were looking after us at reception porters housekeepers or waiters they were always friendly attentive and informative. We often spoke with Youssef Hakim and Amin who were exemplars of excellent service in reception but it would be unfair to single out anyone more than another.    Food was always excellent with a very good choice of fare for the outdoor buffet breakfast and a delicious evening menu that was well prepared and presented. It‚Äôs a good place to chill out in the heat of the day with a pool forming the central feature of the Riad. Plants and trees provide ample shade and there is a spacious sun deck on the roof for sun worshipers.    The Jardins de la Medina is very well located and although the narrow streets of the Kasbah and Medina are fascinating in themselves you will want to venture further into the city. The Riad is within easy and safe walking distance of the main attractions of Marrakesh e.g. 10 minutes to the Saadian Tombs; 15 minutes to the Badi Palace; 25 minutes at a steady pace to the Koutoubia Mosque the famous Jemaa El Fna and the adjoining souks. The Majorelle Gardens are best reached by Petit Taxi and you‚Äôll find no shortage of them just about everywhere but agree the price before setting off e.g. a one way journey to The Majorelle Gardens will set you back about 40 Dirhams (approx. ¬£3.20).    The Jardins de la Medina enabled us to take on Marrakesh at its own crazy pace and when we‚Äôd had enough we could just walk through the big door of the riad and relax within its cool calm interior. I‚Äôm confident that this riad will always be our choice when staying in Marrakesh Insha‚ÄôAlah.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a beautiful hotel!  We arrived and walked through the beautiful citrus courtyard surrounding the pool towards our room and were in love with the hotel immediately. A haven away from the hustle and bustle from the outside medina and busy streets this hotel is a paradise in the middle of Marrakesh's busy streets dust and heat!  The courtyard pool and outside lounge is quiet peaceful tranquil relaxing and very beautiful to look at.... plus the service was exceptional - the staff were incredible and were so attentive friendly smiling and always willing to help. Breakfast was fantastic and the rooms were spacious plush and clean.  Definitely recommend this hotel for a stay in Marrakech - great for couples not so great for kids... but it had a great vibe - music by the pool and relaxing atmosphere lanterns and gardens great rooms lovely ambience - a definite must stay!!!  Thankyou everyone for making our stay in Marrakech heavenly!!! We will definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic accommodation and setting and lovely helpful staff. This was a delightful 'oasis' in the heat and bustle of Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Wonderful experience all around, would return and highly recommend
Review_Text: Understated from the outside behind the walls sits an oasis from the craziness of Marrakech. We have traveled extensively and this stands out both in terms of comfort and service. The front desk was extremely helpful in arranging transportation and providing guidance. The small touches were what really got us- complimentary sorbet by the pool in the afternoon and an attendant coming around to clean our sunglasses.

Review_Title: Truely an oasis from the hustle and bustle
Review_Text: We stayed 7 nights here and found the accommodation and staff excellent amd have no qualms recommending Les Jardins to any Marrakesh visitor. The pool is amazing and the staff bring round cold hand towels and treats at least twice a day. We really enjoyed our stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, would definitely go back...
Review_Text: Amazing hotel with charm and character something the newly refurbished Mamounia completely lacks!    Disregard any comments which say the hotel is too far from the central square. It is no more than 15mins walk.    Overall thoroughly recommended although I would definitely advise using the safe. We had approx ¬£50 in local currency taken from pockets on the first morning we were there. The safe did not work on arrival so not much we could have done. Avoid the issue by making sure the safe provided in the room works and use it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great place to relax and unwind on our honeymoon.
Review_Text: We stayed here for part of our honeymoon. I do not regret staying at this beautiful place. Rooms were lovely though some were nicer than others but even these were of great quality. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Pool is amazing and set in gorgeous lush gardens. Only negative thing about this is the price of food in the restaurant. Very nice food and very nice restaurant but will quickly clear your purse.  We loved it and plan on returning again in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Birgit K wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Text: Our 4 days stay at Les Jardins de la medina were fantastic. We stayed with our 2 daughters and all of us had a very good time. The breakfast was first class the staff spoilt us and were very helpful the garden was beautiful. The rooms comfortable and clean. It is a 5* hotel for us and we were very sad to say good bye.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This was our first visit to Morocco and in July not the best time to go as it is very hot 45 degrees and above and were staying in Marrekech for 4 days. As we walked through the doorway of the Riad 'hole in the wall' from the busy hussle and bustle of the Kasbah we entered a world of tranquility relaxation and a caring staff. This hotel has a wonderful warm friendly feel. Our room was lovely (see pictures) and spotlessly clean. Being what is called 'the low season' and only I think 35 rooms it was nice to meet other guests around the pool and disguss where each of us had been that day. The pool was lovely and so were the cool pretty little hideaway gardens. All the food was very good but one small criticism would be breakfast time where each morning we were invaded by 'bees' swarming around the food and fruit juice containers . Because of this my daughter and I decided to have room service in the lovely small courtyard outside our room which was very nice and at no extra cost. The staff couldn't do enough for their guests and always with a lovely genuine smile. You could borrow videos from reception free of charge which was a great help if you didn't speak French as the only TV station in English in Morocco appears to be BBC World News. We visited a few good restaurants for evening meals which had been recommended to us before we left Britain and would be pleased to pass on any tips etc. As we were two ladies on our own the person on reception would order a taxi to pick us up and take us to wherever we wanted and the driver would arrange to pick us up at whatever time we said. We always felt very safe. We also arranged a day trip to the Atlas Mountains and to have lunch at Richard Bransons Retreat. My daughter and I have travelled to many countries around the world in first class hotels and can honestly say Le Jardin de la Medina can be classed as definately 5*. We would highly recommend this Riad and its staff and hope that we will be able to visit again one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: I visited this wonderful hotel and found it a magical experience. Luxury and small attentions touched my heart. A Paradox In the middle of the bustling streets of the Medina this hotel is an oasis of tranquillity where the leaves of palm trees float in the breeze and the smile of the people working there will always be remembered.....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We spent 5 glorious days in March at "les Jardins de la Medina". When the taxi first pulled up in front of the Riad I thought to myself Oh No!! We stepped out the cab to push the big wooden front door of the hotel and just couldn't believe what was on the other side. The contrast was amazing. It was as if we had stepped into a different world. I'll leave it at that and let you discover it.  We reserved two superior rooms and according to our reservation the rooms would have private terraces. That wasn't the case. Most of the terraces were a shared courtyard. Nevertheless the rooms were very nice. Our friends kept their assigned room but we upgraded to the solarium room and the hotel staff apologized and were very accomodating (we paid for the upgrade). Loved our room with a small terrace and a private solarium above it . What a pity we didn't get to enjoy it. The weather was cool and rainy at times. Our room had a fireplace and lots of attention to details was given.  The room came with a complimentary buffet. It was a very nice spread of local flavors plus the standard fare. Most of the food was on the sweet side so I ordered omelets and fried eggs and they obliged.  The front desk recommended restaurants and tour guides. The recommendations were excellent.  I highly recommend "Les Jardins de la Medina". The hotel was wonderful and the staff amazing. Thank you all for making our stay in Marrakech so memorable. c'etait fantastique!!! We will be back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: exquisite luxury and super romantic atmosphere
Review_Text: My boyfriend surprised me with a reservation in this luxury riad that features lush gardens in the inner patio and an amazing swimming pool. We stayed in one of the suites on the ground floor and from our room we could directly access the gardens and pool. The atmosphere is very classy yet warm and truly relaxing and the service is very good in the best Moroccan hospitality stile. Our room was very spacious with a annexed sitting room. The bathroom was decorated with rose petals and flowers and equipped with some very nice amenities. Complimentary fruit basket and large bottle of water is also offered by the hotel upon arrival. More red roses were deposited on our bed to wish us good night and inform about the next day's weather forecast on a little card. The bed in our room was huge with lovely bed linen and cushions and we slept wonderfully. The hotel also features an amazingly charming restaurant that is specialized in both French and Moroccan cuisine but it is very pricey. Breakfast was served for us outdoors under the trees with abundance of fruit pastries jams and many other typical local foods. I would definitely recommend you stay at this hotel which is a real treat for the body and the heart (if you are lucky enough to share the experience with your special one).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Le Jardins de la Medina is incredible. The gardens are huge beautiful and very well maintained. The pool is a great place to hang out and soak up the sun.    Luc and his team of staff are wonderful and went out of their way for us at all hours. All the guests were given little treats by the pool such as cold towels and melon juice which were much needed!    I cannot recommend this hotel enough. The staff rooms and location were all perfect. We will be back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Nivine A wrote a review Jul 2011
Review_Title: I loved it and I will be back soon!
Review_Text: This is one of the greatest hotels and the most relaxing I have been to. I stayed in Jadrins de la Medina after a very stressful business trip. i chose this hotel looking for relaxation and tranquility and I found it at it's best there! how wonderful it is to wake hearing birds singing and to have your breakfast at your private patio which has a beautiful garden view! that's not to mention the private solarium! the staff were very helpful welcoming and nice. I am looking forward to coming back soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Text: A lovely hotel...fresh spacious and clean rooms great well situated pool and a fantastic green and beautiful garden. Birds sang all day and families of tortoises even sat munching the plants outside our bedroom doors. There only a handful of guests whilst we were there so we had our pick of sunbeds and pool space but I fear that we wouldn't be so luck during busier periods. The food is quite expensive and slightly disappointing too which was a shame but overall the lack of other guests the wonderful surroundings and the peace and quiet made it all worthwhile and a great 4 nights stay. We will definately be back again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Matteo e Michel... C wrote a review Jun 2011
Review_Title: A wonderful oasis of quiet in the Medina of Marrakesh
Review_Text: The hotel is a wonderful riad in the old medina. After a day in Marakkesh you will find yourself in the quiet of a small garden with a nice swimming pool.  We stayed there for one night during a trip south of the Atlas and then three days on our way back. Both rooms were very nice and very clean.  The had a very fine dinner at the restaurant the first evening and the breakfast was also very good. We would definitely return there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is a beautiful oasis. Quiet warm welcoming and very well-run with excellent amenities in a very convenient location. Staff were brilliant and the spa sublime! The choice and quality of food and wines in the restaurant is superb. Not the cheapest hotel in town but definitely one of the best. Planning to return in July!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The place and staff were wonderful. It was a perfect place to escape. The resort is beautiful with gardens a pool and balconies from the rooms. The medina outside is busy and hectic and the hotel is an oasis of quiet. The staff was friendly and helpful and the breakfast buffet (included with the room) was fantastic. The garden is full of birds and one of my favorite things about the stay was to wake up to the sound of birds outside. There were only 2 downsides: it was a little far from the Square Djemaa el Fna (10 minute walk) and the fitness center had limited equipment (but made up for by its outdoor location overlooking the gardens of the hotel and the city skyline). The hotel is right near the gardens of the palace so a good place to go running. I would go back without hesitation and can strongly recommend this hotel to other travelers. It was a fantastic stay which exceeded my expectations.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: A QUIET HAVEN IN BUSTLING OLD CITY.
Review_Text: Once you go through the wooden door you enter a haven of peace and good service. Cannot fault the staff at all and they were very helpful with everything we asked. It does take at least half an hour to get to your room having a welcome drink and a tour of the facilities.    We ordered a Privilege room  which had a private outside area with table chairs and loungers. Comfortable bed but small bathroom that was more ancient than old. I am fussy and for the price I would have appreciated a more up to date bathroom with a proper shower. This did not affect our visit at all and I became rather settled with the old fashioned atmosphere. Our daughter had a Superior room this was large and had a proper shower over the bath.    The restaurant is very good for both lunch and dinner. Breakfast has a lot of variety although too much sweet items for my taste. One eats outside and this is where the breakfast buffet is also set up. It seems a losing battle not to share the buffet with the local birds and bugs ! One day they did put the buffet indoors but I think this was to make room for all the guests staying.    The pool area is lovely and the pool is very inviting and clean.    The hotel is a very slow relaxed twenty minute walk from the main square. If it is too hot then a taxi can always be ordered and is very very cheap even if you do pay more as a tourist. Good recommended Restaurants seemed expensive for what they offered so worthwhile to ask the hotel or do some homework before you go out.    If you like TV this is not for you although BBC World might tell you if the world comes to an end. Free WiFi was available both in the rooms and by the pool and worked very well.    We enjoyed our few days immensely and would go again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Cristi P wrote a review Jun 2011
Review_Text: This hotel was more than we expected. The gardens and grounds were luxurious and private. Street noise and local children playing were a constant buzz but manageable. Our room was in the corner and very private. We were fortunate enough to be on the side of the grounds to not hear the 5 calls to prayer everyday including the 5am one! When we walked in off the extreme hustle and bustle of the streets it was like another world. Stress went from a 9 to a 2 within seconds. The staff while extremely curtious and attentive was still a little lacking. An example... we had the front desk order a taxi for us for dinner. We asked him how much we should expect to pay (locals pay a different price) and he told us "usually 30 dirham but probably 40d for the distance of the restaurant never more than 50d". When we walked out the door to get in the taxi we were asked for 60d. While in dollars this only amounts to about 50 cents it was none the less repeatedly irritating. The restaurant we went to was at the front desks recommdation. We picked an 8pm time he made the reservation for us but didn't tell us they don't sit people until 9pm. So the hostess looked at us funny for being so early then she sat us at the bar for an hour and then forgot we were there. They also assured us that an excursion we scheduled took credit cards only to be told at our 5.20am pick-up that that was not the case. We used almost all our cash on hand $512.00 to go anyway. That piece of information would have certainly been helpful! The beds are hard but the rooms are very clean. The tv only gets BBC. We never saw housekeeping because they were in and out in a short anount of time usually while we were at breakfast. Dining in the restaurant was enjoyable. My husband couldn't get enough of the Tanjine chicken and ordered it all three times we ate dinner there. It was good! I varied my order each time and was never totally satisfied with earth shattering delicious meals They were "fine". The pool was great but cold. Most of the lounge charis are in the shade but a nice spot to wile away the afternoon. The rooftop terraces are awesome. The hotel is over all extremely relaxing beautiful and located in a great spot just a 20 minute slow paced walk to the main square. We would stay here again easily.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: last minute thought after cooking a Tagine for friends on the Friday of the Bank Holiday - too close to the computer before bed & booked a trip to Marrakesh as a surprise @ 0130!!!. Woke the wife to tell her flew on Saturday pm a bit of a rush. Flight Ryan Air from Bristol no problems you get what you pay for and it jingled with early landing both ways. Ryad [Hotel] is a must right in the Kasbah behind the closed door the beauty awaits. Excellent staff extremely clean with all facilities. Rooms are individual in four grades Privilege down to Comfort. They are well presented and of a fine local style. Restaurant is well run food very well presented with a very pleasant patio area for food and bar. The pool is surrounded by lush vegetation and when in fruit should be something Jasmine smells wonderful in the evening. As this was unplanned we had to return on the Tuesday but will be back - there is just too much to see and do [no time to try the hotel cookery course]. If for dinner in the main square Jemma-el-Fna only a short safe walk away try out La Boheme a newly furnished venture at a side road to the square which has sound menu and a wide view of the whole square - best time dusk  Many thanks to the friendly staff as I said we will be back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Carolina P wrote a review Jun 2011
Review_Title: Fantastic place and we will be back soon
Review_Text: This is a truly beautiful hotel with excellent service and extremely friendly staff. It is an oasis of beauty and tranquility in the middle of the busy Kasbah.
