From the outside it is almost impossible to guess that such a lovely place exists behind that small door.  Our room was excellent with a door opening to the garden. A lot of attention is paid to detail and everything is in very good taste. It was also very romantic (my husband and I celebrated our 3rd wedding anniversary there) rose petals in the bathroom room a fresh rose everyday candles‚Ä¶  The restaurant is very good the spa facilities too. The pool is lovely everything is extremely clean. I cannot praise this hotel too highly. We will certainly be back and are already recommending it to our friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A haven of peace in a busy city.
Review_Text: Go through the unimposing door in the busy street and enter into the peace and quiet of the hotel reception. Continue on and enter the oasis that is the gardens (les jardin) a cool and pleasant place filled with birdsong. This is the prefect place to stay in Marrakech. Good service and excellent food are a feature. we will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is situated behind a non-descript brown door on going in you enter a world of quality service wonderful gardens making it a very memorable stay.It is located in the medina & its position captures the vibrance of the city;.We felt quite safe out walking.  We thought the Mellah area was far more interesting than Jemma El Fna with the shopkeepers appearing to be less "pushy".The only negative to this review concerns the breakfasts.Some of the food is left uncovered & is too tempting to the birds who drop in for a free meal!    A it isl ocated in the medina seserene peace tranquility .with first-class service hiding all its charms
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent and pleasant service. Despite the bustle of Marrakech this hotel really was a wonderful oasis...Garden was a delight to relax in with lush vegetation..plus lots of quiet seating areas in which to relax. Many thanks to YUSSEF on reception who was extremely helpful and courteous at all times...and particularly at end of holiday when we had a delay. Great hotel and thanks to all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A five star stay in the Medina of Marrakech
Review_Text: We (five people) stayed at Les Jardins de la Medina for four days an we really loved the place. Everything was perfect; very serviceminded staff clean and fresh delicious brekfast and dinner. We can definitely recommend this hotel to other people.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: wonderful holiday at a beautiful and warm hotel
Review_Text: We chose this hotel on the advice of Tripadvisor and couldn't have been more pleased. The weather was glorious for our stay and the pool and gardens provided ample opportunities for sunbathing peacefully. The locality is ideal: close enough to the centre of Marrakech to walk but far enough away to be quiet and secure; its neighbour is the King's Palace so there's high level security around.  We had two Privilege rooms for ourselves and our daughters aged 20 and 24. They were beautiful and very well serviced with some lovely surprises.  The restaurant food is excellent and easily compares with other top restaurants in Marrakech.  The "stand out" quality of the hotel its warm hospitality: very attentive but never intrusive. We used the concierge a lot and they were always most helpful even to the extent of sending a porter who knew us well to the airport very fast with some forgotten keys just before we flew out. They really go the extra mile.  We all had a fantastic time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Colleen & Robin H wrote a review Apr 2011
Review_Text: A lovely peaceful oasis in the Kasbah with friendly and helpful staff. Lovely rooms with excellent disabled facilities. Get the Receptionist to book your taxis and arrange fares - they get much cheaper prices and are happy to help! We'll be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Oasis in the midst of the noisy city
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights in this lovely hotel. It was an oasis amidst the chaos and confustion of the downtown medina. The location is perfect for visiting the center of the medina and the many shopping quarters. Inside the walls of this hidden gem are lovely grounds a helpful staff and comfortable cottages. I would stay here again. The pool area is lovely and the grounds are stunning. It is a relaxing respite from the rest of Marrekech. One night we weren't sure where we were to go for dinner and one of the staff members actually walked us the few blocks to the front door of a great restaurant. The recommendations by the staff proved to be highly acceptable. Lovely stay with our son who lives in Morocco as a Peace Corps volunteer. He found the accommodations far from the life style to which he has grown used to over the last year - in a very positive way!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A calm and peaceful haven away from all the Medina madness!
Review_Text: We had the most wonderful time in Les Jardins de la Medina... I had travelled to Marrakech twice before and always stayed in the Palmerie but this time wanted to be in the thick of things but staying in a hotel with a garden was essential to me. An airy cool place to relax in in the heat of the day and equally a wonderful feeling of calm after spending a couple of hours in the Souk or the main square. The staff were charming and helpful anWonderful spa I had a massage which I think I can honestly say was the best I've ever had. The hotel is kept very clean. Pool side lunch/dinner very good if not a little pricey. I would recommend this hotel highly and long to return very soon - I urge you to stay there.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hotel is set in the Kasbah area of the Medina. We wanted to experience the heart of Marrakesh and this is exactly what we got.  When the taxi stopped outside the red walls & brown wooden door that leads to the Ryad I was a bit concerned. However once through the door we were delighted to find a beautiful building set around a lovely garden with a swimming pool. A royal palace in previous times.  The rooms are large very clean comfortable beds good shower/bath & we had our own terrace. There was flat screen TV & DvD player.  The staff were very helpfull & cheerfull. We also had a drinks & canapes evening  with neck massage to help all the guests intermingle .. very nice!  The breakfasts were great. Lots of variety. Dinner in the restaurant was also worthwhile.  We walked eveywhere to get the feel of life there. Taxi's were everywhere but we enjoyed seeing the local shops & businesses.  Despite the freezing cold & wet weather .. a big surprise to us we loved Marrakesh & this would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superbe Hotel in a less superbe city
Review_Text: A haven of peace tranquility and discrete luxury in a noisy dirty and in this March cold and rainy city. If you had enough of the constant embarrassment by local traders so-called friends and others (which was often the case for us!) just stay in this beautiful place - which thank God also has a very efficient central heating.  Outstanding rooms beautiful garden delicious breakfast relaxing massage kind but discrete service
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An oasis of calm amidst the frenetic bustle of Marrakech
Review_Text: Warm friendly welcome from the staff typified our stay. Our 'Privilege' room with its own balcony was very comfortable and extremely well serviced each day. the public areas were spotless as was the swimming pool and solarium. The bar was cosy and the restaurant exceptionally good serving a mixture of typical Moroccan food and international cuisine at reasonable prices. The front desk staff were very helpful organising trips and guides for us. I can't recommend this hotel highly enough and would happily return for another break and not even leave the premises!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect place to relax after a visit to the Medina: an oasis of tranquility
Review_Text: This hotel is the perfect place to stay in teh Medina of Marrakech: perfect location beautiful rooms (we had a privilege and an a normal room) beautiful inner court garden with big pool; very good food very nice personnel. Breakfast also top. We believe that the combination of this hotel with the impressions of a very unusual town makes for a great holiday. It is also a place that gives a feeling of security to their guests whic is nice especially when you bring children
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Elegant oasis of calm in the heart of the casbah
Review_Text: Rooms refurbished to modern standards set in a beautiful riad. Lush gardens with pool and wonderful rooftop seating to enjoy both sun and shade. Attentive waiters in the restaurant meticulous housekeeping staff and helpful reception personnel. Huge choice at breakfast ranging from a variety of Moroccan dishes tothe usual European fare. Located right in the heart of the old town and 30min gentle walk from the Djem el f'na square. Absolutely lovely and we would strongly recommend this hotel. Hope to return next year!

Review_Title: A Moroccan Gem....beautiful setting in the middle of Kasbar
Review_Text: Just 15 mintues from the airport Jardin de la Medina is a beautifully presented riad just a 15 minute walk from the famous Jamel El Fna square. Set off the Rue de Kasbar it is hidden away and could easily be missed but once inside it is opulent yet understated. The gardens are full of birdsong and you have the choice of sunbathing around the pool or relaxing on the sofas on the terrace as the sun begins to set.  The food was lovely service excellent and setting perfect.  My only criticism would be the courtesy room. We checked out at 12 but were not flying until 8pm. The room is little more than a large toilet cubicle with a shower in it. There is no room to change inside the cubicle so you are forced to change outside with only a few floaty curtains to maintain your dignity.  I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel/riad but hope that they listen to the constructive criticism before we return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our first trip to Maroco with good memories
Review_Text: The hotel was very good our room a little bit loud (123) but no problem. I think we would select the same hotel if we consider to viist Marrakesch again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Come in through a door in the wall out of the noise the busstle and the smells of the Casbah and you are suddenly in a verdant and lush paradise- in- microcosm...one in which the only sounds are those of birdsong. Les Jardins de la Medina is alovely cocooning calm and restful place to stay. It is also small and personal the antithisis of big anonymous holiday hotels. Thoroughly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Riad was absolutely beautiful and very tranquil compared to the bustle in Marrakech.  Was in walking distance of all the main attractions. Rooms were very clean and luxurious and the staff couldn't do enough for us. The food and the spa treatments were fantastic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is absolutely gorgeous..so much character! It is personal and friendly. Our room (3 of us sharing) was spacious and comfortable. It took us about 10 minutes to walk to the main square..No criticism about the hotel or food at all. It really was a relaxing treat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: the hotel was lovely and breakfast was great the staff very friendly and helpful but both of my rooms were very cold.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: Every thing at "Le Jardin de la medina is beautiful  - the rooms the food the eopleand paticulary the courtyard in the middel of it all as close to the garden of eden as you get.  The staff is very very freindly and helpful without being toady and the breakfast to die for -
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Excellent small hotel with an exceptional friendly atmosphere
Review_Text: Room was fantastic - small but very well apointed. We had an upgraded rooms with a private covered balcony and our very own private roof terrasse with sunbeds & shower. Sadly we did not have enough time on the terrasse. Location is excellent in the Medina (old town) within 10-15 minutes walk from Djemma Al Fna - but in a quet section of the Medina. The garden and bar/restaurant is such a charming supprise when you enter the property and the management's coctail reception during our stay is a great success among the guest that get tomingle and meet up to share experiences. We also tried the Spa having a full hammam & 25 minutes massage - the hammam was OK but does not compare to a turkish hammam and the massage were nice - next time I would skip the hammam and spend the money on a 50 minute massage.. :).  Make sure you have time to relax and enjoy the hotel if you go here - meaning dont spend all day sightseeing - but keep a part of the day for the garden/pool aera as it is a treat! Highly reommended!  Beeing in the travel industry I have stayed at many great hotels - but this is ctainly among the most charming!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Title: What a wonderful experience tostay in this very friendly excellent hotel
Review_Text: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay in this small friendly hotel within the city walls of this very interesting city The staff were most helpful and did everything we asked and also did such other things as making excursion reservations  The bedroom and bathroom was very clean with clean towels each day and hot water on tap at all times. The heated swimming pool was excellent and very clean and the gardens were a pleasure to walk through  The choice of food in the dining room was very good and my only criticism would be the cost of the wine and the somewhat restricted choice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stephanie L wrote a review Jan 2011
Review_Text: Absolutely amazing. The Riad is beautiful typically Moroccan but with great service. The staff could not have been more pleasant and helpful. G reat position in the Kasbah. The only downfall was the food okay but not a lot of choice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a long weekend at this hotel in Jan 2011 and had a really great time. Its a bit pricy but is a wonderful oasis in Marrakech's otherwise quite intense medina area. Staff were very welcoming and served us a mint tea and dates in the sun on arrival. The central courtyard is quiet with a good size pool trees and the relaxing birdsong. The roof terrace is nicely furnished and was warm even in Jan. Rooms were large airy and tradtionally decorated. Bed was excellent. Beakfast was a very nice buffet and there were free cocktails and traditional entertainment on one evening. Lunch was also excellent and the staff were happy to serve it on the roof terrace. We didn't have dinner at the hotel. Only downsides were that it is located a good 15 minute walk from the central square also the hammam was a bit cold. All in all I would definately reccommend this hotel as a relaxing place to base yourself for a long weekend in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This place is like an oasis of serenity. The staff cannot help you enough. The rooms are spacious clean and very comfortable the food is divine and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay at Les Jardins. We will definitely be returning and would certainly recommend to our friends. Thank you Les Jardins for making our time so wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a pleasure to step through the door of this hotel with a warm welcome at reception and to the beautiful gardens beyond a world away from the bustling medina .It has a pleasant warm pool (even in January! )and welcoming log fires in the bar and restaurant for the cool evenings.  The staff were very attentive and nothing was too much trouble.  The food in the restaurant was good and the breakfasts very substantial with a good mix of hot and cold dishes.  Our room was spacious spotlessly clean and well equipped even though it was only a standard room.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff were without exception friendly and helpful. Sipping mint tea amongst palm and orange trees was an absolute delight. The rooms were spotless the beds luxurious.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim B wrote a review Dec 2010
Review_Text: After a nightmare journey because of the snow we finally arrived at the hotel more than a day late and at 05:30. The sight that greeted us was exactly what we needed.    The hotel is based around a beautiful courtyard with a lovely pool and exudes an air of calm tranquillity (exactly the opposite of the scenes in the Medina). Located a shortish walk (15min) away from the main sights just about right as the main area is probably a bit too lively if one needs sleep.    I would especially credit the hotel for not charging us for the missed night despite being well within their rights to do so.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Literally a "Les Jardins" in the midst of the chaotic medina.
Review_Text: We stayed 4 nights at Les Jardins de la Medina as part 1 of our 4 part trip to Morocco and what a great place to stay. The place is really peaceful nice garden tranquil roof deck. We stayed in the superior room which had floor to ceiling windows spacious and really cozy. The staff there were so friendly especially Luke Manager and his dog.

If you are looking for a place with a pool and good outdoor space to relax and sunbathe this is a much more interesting place than the boring purpose built new hotels. The main downside is that the main square is a long walk or short taxi ride away the hotel food is way too expensive and there isn't that much locally by way of good places to eat (the stork cafe being the one exception). On the upside there is a charming garden and lots of balconies some rooms have private roof space and generally a pleasure to be outside if the weather is good. It's a great place to explore the staff are very helpful and thefts are a few excise machos most of which work. The pool ISA not quite big enough to be much of an exercise option but was warm enough to swim in at Christmas.    Overall this is a great choice unless you want to be really close to the main nightlife and eating areas around the souks and are willing to trade this off for a higher price or more limited space.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An Oasis in the middle of mayhem!
Review_Text: Located in the centre of the Casbar just down from the main Square and the Souk. Crazy location - the old Casbar with its run down shops coffee bars kids begging but happy bustling motorbikes and pushbikes running beside pedestrians a noisy dusty old part of Marrakech and suddenly you open this old big heavy door into Heaven!! The hotel is superbe and if you wish to experience the real Marrakech this is where you need to be. The hotel is Colonial style with large comfortable rooms each with its own terrace complete with sun loungers beautiful pool and pretty gardens and Spa facilities. Lovely restaurant with great food (stick to the local menu) and very helpful sweet staff. Would definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Our stay at "Les Jardins de la Medina" was superb. We stayed in Room 112 which had a private terrace and a solarium. The room was exceptionally clean and the attention to detail was remarkable. The staff were very professional and attentive the moment we stepped out of the taxi outside the hotel. The porter came immediately to take our cases and we were welcomed with mint tea and dates as the reception staff were dealing with forms. In the room the bouquet of roses and the complimentary bottle of water on arrival were a nice touch. The buffet style breakfast was plentiful and varied. We stayed there for nights and had dinner there every night...The desserts are truly delicious ! We hope to be able to stay there again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Richard Evans wrote a review Oct 2010
Review_Text: This place really is an oasis from the hustle and bustle of the city. The accomodations are wonderful - light and stylish overlooking the large and beautifully kept gardens that give the place its name. The restaurant was amongst the best that we found in Marrakech. The optional cookery course is well worth it: excellent and friendly tuition leading to probably the best tajine we tasted during our stay: it made for a great lunch. The only criticism is the front desk. In contrast to all other staff those who man it are not over-friendly or helpful. Odd that what is often the most important and frequent point of contact for a hotel should be its weakest link when all other staff were exceptionally pleasant and helpful to deal with. This is far from a deal-breaker but needs addressing. We highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The 'Jardin de la Medina' offers a unique service to the visitors.  The rooms range from having a private roof terrasse or alternatively your own garden area. The pool area is integrated in the large garden and the restaurant offers the best from the Morocco cuisine.  Go there - and experience something special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at Les Jardins for 3 nights at the start of our honeymoon and it really was a lovely experience. From the moment you walk through the door from the street you are met with sense of calm that is very welcome after a day in Marrakech.    The hotel is only a short walk to the centre of Marrakech- not far at all.    We booked a 'Superior' room and it was divine had everything we needed and little french doors onto a small shady terrace that led to the pool. One thing that has stuck with me that may seem strange is that our room always seemed to smell gorgeous! The Sens la Marrakech toiletries provided were a treat too. We ate in the hotel one night and the food was very nice and I recommend the Lamb Kofte at lunchtime. The buffet-style breakfast was vast varied and delicious!    This hotel has a quiet serenity and understated style that has stayed with me I would stay here again without a doubt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When we arrived at Les Jardins Hotel (Riad) we were welcomed with a traditional tea drink. We quickly felt welcome and the staff did more than can be expected to make our stay comfortable. The room was spacious and clean as was the whole premises. Les Jardins has a very good restaurant with outstanding service. The swimming pool was clean and at a comfortable temperature. There were plenty of places on the premises where you could enjoy the sunshine and relaxation. We enjoyed the Hammam and the Spa. Les Jardins is situated in the old quarter of the Kasbah and in walking distance to the Jemaa-el-Fna Square as well as the Soucks so we could enjoy the hussel and bussel of that and still go the Les Jardins for some peace and quiet after a busy day. In short we are very pleased with our stay and would recommend it any time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel amidst the madness of Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a gorgeous oasis in the Kasbah region of the medina inside the city walls of Marrakech. The privilege rooms with their own balcony and upstairs terrace with private sunbeds umberella and outdoor shower are well worth the upgrade although make no mistake this hotel is pricey! The atmosphere is one of elegant cool gorgeous garden (renowned in Marrakech) with numerous birds tortoises plants & trees. Gorgeous swimming pool with plenty of sunbeds in and out of the shade - which in September is definitely needed. The temperature was in the 40's and had been in the 50's the last weekend of August . The walk to the main square although only 20 minutes was a tow in this type of heat and is definitely not for the faint hearted. Very much work in progress on some of the streets digging up the road & installing streetlights pavements etc around pedestrians. Food was mainly excellent although service suffered on a busy Saturday night in the restaurant. If I was to return to Marrakech I would stay in a hotel in Le Hivernage - its a much more relaxed and easy walk into the thick of it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: the hotel is so beautiful the garden is very nice and relaxing the swimming pool even if not huge is good to refresh the day under the Moroccan sun. the hotel iscozy little or big enough to be able to have a great relations with all the staff of teh hotel which is really nice and always present. the rooms are nice very clean everything is simple but at the same time rich. The food of the restaurant is delicious and the spa gives great moments of relax. The last important thing is the position of it in the Medina in the middle of the "caotic" Marrakech so you can walk everywhere. But when you come back you will be surprised by the quiet and silence that you find just after you passed the main door.  A lovely stay in Marrakech probably the best!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina was an exquisite riad--elegant relaxing friendly and comfortable. The rooms were fabulous with truly beautiful Moroccan decor and the large pool in the garden provided a perfect way to cool down after a day in the medina. Next time I would love to take one of the Moroccan cooking classes they offer. We were traveling with our teenage son and daughter and we all loved it. Would definitely stay there next time we are in Marrakech--highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: An absolute gem of a hotel!
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a former palace that has been wonderfully converted to provide a hotel with real character and class. Located within the Kasbah it is far enough removed from the centre of Marrakech to provide a real escape. The views from the roof terrace across to the Atlas mountains and the skyline of Marrakech are wonderful and provide a superb setting. Combined with superb but discreet service this French owned hotel has all the facilities of a 5* western hotel with the character of North Africa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful oasis, in a fascinating city.
Review_Text: We loved every minute of our stay.  The hotel was superb.  Relaxing charmingbeautiful surroundings and the service was excellent.  Every small detail was appreciated.    One small point to note:  As we were leaving literally going out the door into our taxi we were stopped to pay (20 dirhams) for a bottle of water. It felt as though we were in some way trying to get out of paying for it. When eveything else was done with such dignity and charm this felt very unnecessary and we left with a bad feeling. We will certainly return but it was a bit unfortunate.    Roz and Robert Nelson.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful riad-style hotel in quiet area of the old city
Review_Text: Would highly recommend to anyone wanting a boutique/luxury small hotel.  Good location - relief from the chaotic centre of the old city.  Breakfasts excellent rooms spacious and spotless.  Lovely clean pool with ample sun-loungers - mostly shady though... there's a fab terrace (and some rooms have their own anyway) if you can't get a sunny one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tranquil & relaxing hideaway tucked away behind the city wall
Review_Text: This place is great - very attentive staff nothing too much. Beautifully converted palace on the south side of town just inside the city wall so a fair walk to town but we went for it as it fitted our bill - getting away from it all with the city there for the occasional trip in for a meal or spot of shopping / sightseeing. Nice size (30 or so rooms); decent pool; lovely gardens; great breakfast; nice restaurant. Only slight disaapointment is ¬£5 for a beer !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: An elegant riad in the Medina
Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is a quiet elegant oasis in the melee of the Medina. The hotel is beautiful and elegant in a simple way. It is not flashy or ostentatious. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The gardens are lovely and well maintained.  The pool area is very nice. The pool isn't huge but it's definitely large enough.  The breakfast buffet is delicious as is all the food at the hotel.  The spa was very nice and the massages were good.  The hotel is theoretically walking distance to Jemma al F'na but we didn't attempt it; partially due to the heat but mainly because it seemed as though it would be pretty hair-raising to accomplish with a child in tow due to the traffic.  The hotel is very child-friendly although it certainly wasn't overrun with children.  We plan to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We were booked into Les Jardins de la Medina by our travel agent. What a delight it turned out to be. Somehow we were put into a room with a private garden patio. It gave us a new dimension to our stay there. It was quiet and lovely. Our room was very clean and comfortable. A bit on the darker side of light but we found that to be true of all our stays in Morocco. The food in the restaurant was also very good and we ate all our dinners there. The entire staff was also quite helpful even though we spoke no French. We would definitely go back there if we return to Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A fantastic hotel in a perfect setting!
Review_Text: The hotel is perfectly located in a quiet part of the Medina but within walking distance of the main attractions. On arrival we were warmly welcomed with a pot of mint tea and led to our room which was sizeable spotless and with adequate facilities overlooking the beautifully maintained gardens. The whole ambience of this hotel is that of style and elegance in a very 'french shabby chic' kind of way it is almost like a hidden gem within the chaos of Marrakesh - a very tranquil place. The food both at lunch time and evening was excellent and the mojito's are too ! We thoroughly enjoyed our time at Les Jardins de la Medina and are planning a return trip in 2011.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful place to recover and relax after intense Marrakesh explorations
Review_Text: The unassuming facade and entrance door of this Kasbah is in surprising contrast to the lush gardens stylish interior and luxurious rooms inside. The hotel is about 15 minutes walking away from the great square. There are no restaurants or other points of interest in the immediate vicinity but all important sites are easily reached by taxi in 5 to 10 minutes. The garden in the hotel is truly wonderful and it has been a special treat to wake up to the chirping of singing birds. The hustle and bustle of Marrakesh is cannot be heard inside the hotel and gardens - it is a perfect place to recover from sightseeing and to relax. The restaurant of the hotel is also very good. Our room was furnished tastefully however I would have liked to have a bit more closet space.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Elizabeth K wrote a review May 2010
Review_Title: Trip advisor reviews got it right
Review_Text: Once again I was grateful that research on trip advisor proved worthwhile. We stayed at Les Jardins for 6 nights with two teen boys and an 11 yr old over the Easter break. Although there the walk to Jemma El Fna is an obstacle course and sidestepping speeding motos caleches and cars can be tiring the boys were tirelessly entertained by all they saw. I would recommend a taxi on your first day until you have adapted to Marrakeshi street life. The hotel itself was a gem...spotlessly clean. wonderful breakfasts and an excellent dinner there (once only for us as it is pretty expensive). We loved the sunbathing terraces overlooking the city with floaty muslin curtains and scatter cushions - all very decadent and appealing. The pool got quite busy around midday but the lush dense gardens give a sense of seclusion and privacy. We all used the mini gym and massage/beauty treatments (adequate - not brilliant). My husband and boys played tennis daily at the Royal Maroc tennis club too - ring the hotel in advance to book. The rooms were lovely - spacious and clean with beautiful tiling and luxorious argan oils to use. Crunchy starched cotton sheets and effective daily room cleaning. It felt very french with its eau de nil shutters and shaded terrace restaurant - until you woke to the sound of the tropical birds calling and noticed friendly tortoises (a great hit with my 11 yr old) bumbling around in the undergrowth. I particularly want to mention how the reception desk (staffed by ever helpful and charming personnel) sent out a porter at 11 pm to find antibiotic eye drops for my son. They arrived within half an hour and the problem was cleared up in24hrs. A lovely place - I was really sad to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: This is a true gem of a Raid with helpful and friendly staff that made our Marrakech visit a lasting and fond memory
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rosalind D wrote a review Apr 2010
Review_Title: a relaxing haven amid the hustle and bustle of the medina
Review_Text: We stayed in this riad a couple of weeks ago for a 4 night break. When we arrived at the door it was difficult to know what to expect but we were nicely surprised. It is very peaceful and attractive with all the rooms set around a courtyard with a small swimming pool and various nooks and crannies to sit in peace. The staff were very nice and helpful and spoke relatively good english but as we speak French it was'nt a problem anyway. Our room which was a superior one was on the first floor and was very big with a bath and shower which had rose petals scattered around on the first night a very nice touch. The only down side was it was extremely noisy as early as 5.30-6 in the morning as it appeared to be above the kitchen and dining area and also opposite the maid's cleaning cupboard and they seemed to start around 6am too! If I went again I would have a room elsewhere as the rooms along the courtyard away from the dining area and pool would be much quieter. The food was very good and we ate there all but one night. I would recommend going from a Thursday til Monday as there is a free drinks party on the Thursday which was nice to meet fellow guests and the owners on Friday they have a typical Morroccan evening and on Sunday there is a brunch. It is about a 20 minute walk to the main square and medina but a pleasant stroll and the taxis are cheap if you need one. A word of caution beware of getting lost in the medina itself as we could'nt find our way out for about two hours! All in all a very pleasant stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Typical of Marrakech you walk through this non-descript door in a wall and find yourself in a really beautiful garden. We had 3 nights here exploring the medina. It's location at the southern end means everything's a bit of a walk (which suited us fine) but it's very quiet. We were a party of 11 so the pool got a good work out (quiet outside I meant); the rooms were fine and the breakfasts excellent. It's quite a large place (36 rooms I think) so it's not the intimate experience you find in a traditional riad. We enjoyed the roof terrace - large banquets interesting roof top views and great for a siesta. Service was of a high quality and the staff friendly and professional. No complaints at all but we didn't fall in love.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: plaisant interesting as experience. Good hotel satisfied with services proposed
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled solo

Review_Title: GREAT and would definitely stay there again.
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel in February for 3 nights with my teenage daughter with another woman and her daughter. We had superior rooms with had a table and chairs on a balcony to sit and have coffee in the morning. Off the balcony you could walk up 17 stairs to a sun deck with 2 lounge chairs in total privacy. This worked for me as I could catch the morning sun after the roomservice delivered the breakfast which my teenage daughter slept until noon. You can listen to the birds which are in the orange trees outside of you room and not realize you are in Marrakesh. Omlettes on the breakfast menu were great and we ate several meals at the hotel which were great. Fries and club sandwiches were on the menu as well as local dishes. Staff were friendly and ordered taxis when needed. You can walk as well to some of the local shops as well as one fixed-priced shop. We had a later flight so after checking out of the room we stayed by the pool which is heated in the winter months. My daughter unknowingly had left her favorite jacket in the room and the cleaners brought it out to her by the pool!!! So small they know who you are after just a few days as the room service waiter my also be your waiter at lunch. Dinner was great and wine is on the menu by a half bottle if you don't want to get a full bottle. The reception desk was also willing to change British pounds to local currency saving us finding the local cash machine which can be a challenge. Also we had wireless internet with I think was free and great connection speed for teenagers to access Facebook. HIGHLY recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Excellent service. Caring hosts. Very relaxing and peaceful. A very special place.
Review_Text: We visited Morocco for our 21st wedding anniversary and spent 4 nights in this Riad. Not a single complaint to be had our hosts were courteous and welcoming to a fault. Back office staff were always very helpful. Restuarant food was marvellous an exceptional chef. On our last day we were invited for welcome drinks where we met the hosts and the chef for a chat and sampled some local punch and Moroccan wines.    Walking into this Riad from the hustle/bustle of Marrakech was a big change ! Marrakech is one City where it might be difficult to find peace and tranquility but certainly Jardins Del La Medina is one such place. If we go back to this City we will definitely go back to this Riad again.    We highly commend this hotel for couples in particular.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a perfect few days at this riad. From the moment we walked in off the busy streets the smell of orange blossom hit us the birds were singing our bags were carried to our rooms and we were given mint tea and dates. We couldn't ask for more! It's important to stay somewhere peaceful and calm in this city and this riad is perfect. The area is about 15 mins walk from the square in a nice neighbourhood with lots of life. Staff really friendly rooms great and a lovely terrace and pool to get away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: John J wrote a review Mar 2010
Review_Title: Look behind the door.....Your eyes do not deceive you!
Review_Text: Just 10 minutes from the airport and you reach paradise. Tucked away at the end of small street you reach the "Door" - a portal to a paradise of pleasure    It is really hard to put into words just how fantastic our stay was at Les Jardins de la Medina. The whole ambience of the hotel is superb everyone smiles all of the time and in turn the guests smile! Our room was a haven of calm and the food was totally superb! The staff in the restaurant always made us feel very welcome; the attention to detail is immense and makes dining a pleasure.  During the stay we celebrated our wedding anniversary the staff presented us with flowers a wonderful pumpkin soufle - it made our anniversary very special!    Our room had a wonderful courtyard with two sun loungers and table and chairs where we had breakfast each day. The bed was so large and comfortable it was hard to leave it!  It is an easy 20 mins walk to the main square Djemaa El Fna from the hotel and even in the Kasbah you can find wonderful crafts gifts herbs and spices - this hotel has everything just outside the door - but inside you are in heaven.  Finally the staff they are all wonderful with special thanks to Jamal the porter/doorman who has the most radiant smile ‚Äì he could light up a room! He never passed by without saying hello ‚Äì a true asset to a beautiful hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we stayed at this lovelypeaceful riad for 5 nights- it was a welcome oasis after the busy streets outside. the staff were very helpful and the hotel was spotlessly clean. We ate in the restaurant several times and the puddings are well worth saving room for. The hotel is a good 20 minute walk from the main square. It is possible to get a taxi but we walked and felt safe even late at night. The only negatives were that we were woken each morning at 5am by the call to prayer from a nearby mosque and we had to share breakfast with some very tame sparrows. This is an excellent hotel and good value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The moment you taxi deposits you in front of a nondescript Riad door you know you are in for a pleasant surprise.The garden in the middle is like an oasis. All the rooms are different and interestingly decorated. The service is very courteous. The food varied We checked out other Riads and found this to be the best.The only small thing I would mention is that the carpets in the rooms could use vacuuming more frequently. We loved the place and will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: great place to relax while being right in the heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay for 4 nights at the Riad. It was a 15-20 minute walk to Jamaa El Fna square - the heart of the city. It was a interesting walk through the streets so did not feel like a long way. Our superior room was very spacious with large bathroom and big corner bath. Your own outdoor lounges and table and chairs made for a relaxing afternoon rest. We did the "Cooking school" which was very interesting and the food "we" cooked and made was eaten a little later at the restuarant. The spa treatment and traditional Hammam was wonderful - just what we needed. The staff were very friendly and helpful and all spoke English very well.    Overall we had a fantasitc time in Marrakech staying at the Les Jardins de le Medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A luxurious jewel of a RIAD in the heart of the pulsating Kasbah
Review_Text: Discrete luxury and beautiful RIAD set in the heart of the Kasbah in Marrakech  Food (especially dinners great) and an oasis to get back to after trekking thru the Souks of he Medina  Pricey but worth it  Strongly recommended
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: Beautiful calm oasis within walking distance of main attractions
Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights and were extremely pleased with what we found. Bedroom was spacious with its own terrace opening out into the garden. Garden is large and well-planted with lots of cool space to sit and relax. We sampled the restaurant which though not cheap offered good value for money and with a fire lit in the cool evenings was very comfortable and atmospheric. Although in the far south of the medina we found the walk up to the souks quite easy and found it better to be further away from the busier sections anyway All staff were delightful so all in all thoroughly recommended and we'd stay here again if we return to Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Wolsey J wrote a review Nov 2009
Review_Title: A beautiful calm luxurious place to stay.
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at Les Jardins. The weather was perfect so we made regular use of the beautiful pool. Our room was large and very luxurious..In the late afternoon we usually retreated to the roof garden to enjoy the last of the days sun.  The restaurant was very good but wine and minibar was very expensive. Breakfast was very good eggs would be severed in any form on request to gether with a wide selection of Morrocan delicacies. A really quiet and luxurious retreat fron the noise and bussle of the towm. We njoyed our stay very much and would return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Les Jardins de la Medina is located in the southern medina (accessible by car) in a former palace. The riad (hotel) has a little bit more than 30 rooms (quite a lot for a riad as they have usually only a few rooms). Our family (with one teen) had a double room ‚Äûprivil√®ge‚Äú which we liked as it was located on the top floor with a bigger room for the adults and a very small adjacent room (without windows) for our son. The bathroom was amply dimensioned and what we liked most was the spacious terrace going to the fantastic garden. You really have to point out this wonderful green oasis with wonderful plants and many birds singing in the morning very nice! There is also a small (outdoor) fitness room and a large swimming pool. Breakfast was good there was a good selection of western and oriental food. As far as dinner is concerned the menu is kept too ambitiously in my opinion. There are a lot of western dishes you wouldn‚Äôt eat in Morocco as you can‚Äôt be sure that these things (raw fish etc) agree with you. On the other hand the choice concerning Moroccan food isn‚Äôt wide.  All in all the riad is a nice accommodation for a few days in Marrakech but I would suggest that you have dinner elsewhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Title: A true haven and oasis in the busy, vibrant medina of Marrakesh
Review_Text: A delightful Riad from all aspects - bedroom/bathroom gardens restaurant swimming pool and close (but not too close) to Djemaa el-Fna and historical sights in the Medina and the souks and a short taxi drive to the gardens and the New Town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laurence A wrote a review Oct 2009
Review_Text: Perfect ! excellent hospitality and service very nice and clean place beautiful and very quiet garden rooms decorated with taste.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: Beautiful Hotel - Attentive and Polite Staff
Review_Text: Delightful quiet hotel/riad with lovely pool area and restaurant. Roof Terrace is a peaceful and relaxing area. Staff are polite efficient attentive and genuine. Excellent location - easily walkable to the city centre but away from the hustle and bustle. Not cheap - Restaurant and Bar pricey compared to UK but one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from the most relaxing 5 days at Jardins de la Medina.    It was such a hidden gem amongst the madness of Marrakech.    The service was very good on the whole however the language barrier was sometimes an issue - they mostly only understand French. So they said NO to some of our requests when they were possible. Occassionally forgot about our drinks order at the pool but we didn't mind as everything else was so perfect.    The only thing I would point out is the breakfast is not as good as it could be. They do offer eggs (found out from room service menu) however none of the staff seemed to be aware of this. We got them in the end!!    Lunch was fab.    If you're a sun lover ask for a room with private roof terrace as pool area gets shaded by palms late afternoon.    Such charm and calming energies - and amazing pool area and gardens.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Noah H wrote a review Sep 2009
Review_Title: This hotel excelled at every little detail, with no exceptions
Review_Text: My wife and I spent four days at the 'Jardins de la Medina' in Marrakech Morocco and found the entire experience to be among the best we have ever had if not the best in regard to a hotel stay. This is to include the grounds the hotel rooms the service the spa and hammam services the treatment of guests the food the beverages the pool the help on any and all of our many many questions to the front desk help with local restaurant recommendations taxi services et cetera. It is incredible to say but there was never a moment at the hotel when we did not feel entirely cared for by a supremely attentive and thoughtful staff.    Though the grounds are a 10-15 minute walk to the medina-proper it provides not only some time to gather your thoughts before you enter the insanity of the Jemaa El-Fnaa and the souks but it also provides a most welcome retreat and respite from the craziness and overwhelming experience of the public squares. It is an entirely different world at the hotel almost as if you have traveled to the middle of nowhere and yet you are only steps from the markets and public squares.    Overall we would recommend this hotel to any couple wishing to stay a few days in Marrakech and experience both the peace and tranquility that comes along with a perfect stay in a hotel but also the feeling of being just proximate to the one of the most amazing cities in all of Morocco and indeed North Africa.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent 3 nights in this hotel with a friend. It is a hidden paradise in the middle of the Medina. It is walking distance from the Djeema-Fnaa area. It was Ramadan when we visited the city but everybody was very kind and helpful in the hotel. The swimming pool y magnific and the food (served at the pool during the day) is delicious and not that expensive. Great experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We had a great stay at Jardins de la Medina. The staff were all extremely friendly courteous and helpful. Stepping through the door off the street is like stepping into another world - calm cool green elegant. My daughters and I enjoyed the hammam experience and very relaxing massages! The food was excellent the rooms comfortable and the pool inviting! The location is great for sightseeing - the Saadian tombs and the Fnaa el Jamaa square are only a short walk away.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Date: Jo T wrote a review Mar 2009
Review_Text: We arrived late in the evening from the hustle and bustle of the street to this oasis of calm. The gardens are beautiful the restaurant was excellent and the staff were very helpful and friendly. BUT 2 days before the end of our week there a skirt was stolen from the wardrobe in our room. When this was reported the staff did not take any action. This really spoiled our holiday
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: We were in Marrakech for a 3 day break with our two 11 year olds.    The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful with good English. The quality of everything was very good. The wow factor was the gardens which really are like they show on their web-site complete with bird song. I'd certainly visit here again.    The hotel offers an option where you can get picked up from the airport in a horse and cart. This worked really well and the kids loved it.    A couple of things to think about. I got money out of the cash point at the airport which worked fine expept that it all comes out in large demomination notes. What I saved on transaction fees I lost in giving the most generous sized tips in Marrakech.    We re-employed the excellent horse and cart driver for the afternoon and he dropped us off at a carpet shop where we "lost" an hour and ended up buying a carpet. It was entertaining but I'm sure we paid well over the top despite the haggle (a common feeling in Marrakech - they are expert negotiatorss we just amatueurs). My advice is to make it clear at the start that you want sightseeing not shopping.    Finally there are no fastfood outlets or supermarkets and none of the restaurants seem to have childrens' (plain food) options - so if you have a fussy eater with you (as we did) then you might want to take out a few snacks with you.    We re-booked the driver for a trip around the
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We spent 3 nights here just after New Year & loved it. Would definitely recommend it as the place is beautifully decorated & the rooms are located around a mature garden & tempting swimming pool. The rooms are well equipped elegant & functional - though our standard room did have a bit of generator noise at night but then we didn't notice a call to prayer!).    Medina is well located in a residential area & handy for the Saadian tombs & walking distance to the Palaces (both recommended). If you've done the souq & Jem area this is an interesting alternative part of the city to base yourself in. Plus the restaurant serves up some delicious food but be warned its not cheap.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My wife and I spent four nights at Jardins de la Medina and found the Riad a thoroughly relaxing experience. The converted Prince's palace is set around a beautiful interior garden. The service from all the staff is welcoming and very efficient. Our room was larger than we expected and the bathroom was also large and very clean.    A buffet breakfast is set out adjoining the gardens and a cooked option is also available. The Riad is a 20 minute walk from the main Square within the Medina. We took a walking guide on Day 1 to aquaint ourselves with the myriad of narrow streets and souks surrounding the Square. Reception also organised a half day tour for us into the Atlas mountains. The price of this Riad is very reasonable as we thought it certainly deserved it's 4 star status.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The first thing to mention about this riad is that it is situated in a residential area a few roads away from the Saadian Tombs and the Sultana Riad but still not in a tourist area so a very authentic atmosphere as you walk/drive up to the riad with lots of locals milling about in the narrow roads fixing bikes selling bread and grilling meat. We arrived at the hotel in the afternoon walked into the cool reception and were whisked through into the garden to sit on the sofas and fill out a form while drinking mint tea and sampling sultanas and dates brought in tagine dishes. There was a wonderful display of flowers next to us in a fountain all very relaxing and easy and when we had finished we were shown to our rooms by the porter.  The room we stayed in was a superior one twin beds two day beds/sofas which i actually slept on split level and a bathroom with bath/shower. The room was clean freshly painted although the decor was a little tired/sparse. It seems dark in the rooms in contrast to outside but warm and cosy enough (it gets cold at night and in the morning in November)  There were rooms around the riad which seemed to have their own private balconies etc but we found plenty of private spaces to sit the roof being particularly lovely. The windows at the back of the room which opened onto the road were double glazed and cut out the 'atmospheric' noise quite well the front windows were shuttered and you could hear quite clearly the hotel noise (people walking to their rooms). Having said this i am an extreemely light sleeper if i get to sleep at all and after the first night i did tune out of the noises calls to prayer etc none of them were what i would class as annoying noise no hotel music etc. The bathroom was ok tiled under floor heating a bit of mould round the fixings. Nice deep bath. Lovely big long mirror.  The accomodation was set on three levels around the garden quite substantial in size with lots of hidden hammocks and little seating daybed areas. The planting was lush with tall palm trees hedges grassy areas lots of bird life and apparently chameleons and tortoises which we couldn't find! Our favourite place to sit was on the roof terrace as it was sunny although in summer season i'm sure the cooler garden would be best! The pool looked lovely although we didn't go in.  There was a hammam on the ground floor a small shop a cookery school and a massage/ beauty centre on the roof. We had massages - very relaxing and generous with the oil in a nice warm room where two people can have massage at the same time.  The restaurant was next to the pool with outdoor and indoor seating. The chairs indoor were more comfortable and a grander affair whereas the outside area was more relaxed with heaters to keep off the cold.  One thing to mention is that the staff were not competent English speakers this is really a French hotel and the lunchtime menus were all in French. The staff were not able to translate all of the dishes so it was a bit of pot luck. There were also no vegetarian options so fish was the closest choice.  The evening menu was varied but not big on traditional Moroccan food which was a shame the dishes all looked lovely and were quite experimental for example john dory and lychees duck sweede and kiwi fruit! Some hits some misses.  For food elsewhere i would reccomend the Sultana up an alleyway next to the Saadian Tombs - amazing atmosphere extreme luxury and food excellent and also Al Fassia in Gueliz area for exceptional Morrocan food and Cafe16 in the New Town for lunch and cake.  Room service was limited to a smallish menu with omlettes burgers at certain times and other more fancy food all a bit strange. There were no tea making facilities which was annoying and meant frequent calls to try to explain that we wanted black tea not mint tea cold milk hot water sugar etc which would then turn up with no spoons! They got used to our order in the end and were really friendly and fun. I happened to celebrate my birthday whilst i was there and they found this out presumably through the card i had in the room and made me a cake and brought me a present and all came to sing me happy birthday! Even more strangely this happened to me in another restaurant i went to - marrakech is an unusual place.  A word of warning the taxis charge all sorts of prices usually much higher than they should. Petit taxis should be on a meter but some insist on charging 50 dirham instead of 6! The ones called from the hotel were just as bad so don't assume they are vetted.  Overall a nice pretty riad with friendly staff in an interesting residential area. Quiet inside the garden apart from the generators. Not bad noise in the rooms and fairly comfortable.  If you want total luxury try the nearby Sultana. If you prefer relaxed open air prettiness this is the one.    In response to the negative feedback -  the walk to the Saadian Tombs we didn't find as difficult as some people have said although you do have to dodge lots of people carts cars and worst many mopeds. I would worry if i had children with me that they may be run over. Nice atmospheric walk (you may be the only tourists) although as with everywhere in Marrakech extremely polluted from moped fumes. Walk to the Djemaa El-Fna for us was too far and we got taxis then walked.  All windows and lights worked perfectly.  Menu was inflexible nothing very light or vegetarian. Expensive.  It was clean the bedroom maids would get you anything you need just not the standard of a luxury hotel bedroom but big.    As for the food we eat most of our meals here and were not ill at all i have a very weak stomach but had no problems. However we were careful and avoided salad peeled fruit and only used bottled water for our teeth etc.

Review_Date: Rodney S wrote a review Nov 2008
Review_Text: My wife and I enjoyed 5 wonderful nights at this hotel. After reading recent reviews we were a little worried about the kitchens but had no cause for concern. We had two most enjoyable dinners there lunch and a great breakfast every morning. The setting is superb the staff caring and friendly. It takes about 20 mins to walk to the Jemaa El Fna square but the route is never uninteresting. We walked back in mid evening and never felt threatened.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel (particularly the common areas) was- beautiful- nice pool and lounge areas. great breakfast. staff was super friendly and very welcoming and accomodating to our 19 month old daughter. the room was nice- nothing fancy but it did the trick (although DEFINITELY not soundproof- we could hear the people in the room next door the entire time).  definitely an oasis of calm in the midst of the chaos that is marrakech!    our big complaint was the driver they hired to drive us to dinner (far out in the suburbs with our little girl)- when he came to pick us up he had another man with him who was obviously drunk the car reeked of alcohol and we were unsure of how sober the driver himself was. being stuck in the middle of NOWHERE though (we went to Chez Ali which is a dinner/show and it's pretty far outside of the city in a very remote location) not speaking french or arabic and with no cell phone at 11:30 pm- we felt completely trapped and had no way to get back to the hotel other than our driver. definitely a terrifying ride back to the hotel. so we wish that the hotel had vetted the drivers they recommend a little more carefully.  otherwise a great stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with family

Review_Text: We decided to have dinner here as a treat on the last night of our holiday in fantastic Marrakech. The setting was wonderful and the service perfect. However my view somewhat changed a few hours later when having collapsed (literally) in the hotel room 6 hours of D&V ensued. The flight home the next morning was far from relaxing.

We arrrived late at night careening through the narrow alleys of the medina in an impossibly cramped cab dodging donkeys and mo-peds swarms of people and children running after the car.. just like in the movies! Madness! And then we pull up to a small wooden door and step into another dimension. Peace and serenity surround you. The garden is lush the pool sparkling the service impeccable. They served us mint tea and snacks upon arrival and offered us a seat in the courtyard. After long hours of travel this was peace at last! The staff was so wonderful and helpful. They assisted us in both making reservations at restaurants and finding a great guide for the city. The breakfast buffet was a perfect way to start each day as the doves coo softly above you. The rooftop "louge" area has a nice view of two mosques illuminated at night. This was such a fantastic place to return after long hot days of exploring Marrakech. It is right in the medina so you are close to the bustling vibrant life of the city but you can escape within moments to this very luxurious retreat. We will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: lovely setting but many tummy problems!
Review_Text: Hotel was a beautiful and tranquil place after the hectic town.The pool area and the rooms were of a good standard.Staff very helpful.Food in the restaurant was very good but expensive as were drinks and snacks.Several people in the hotel unwell.Dont know if it was linked to hotel or just part of visiting Marrakesh in the heat of the Summer?  Location not too good  long way to the main square.Too hot to walk and very easy to get lost.Had to rely on taxis.Interesting place to visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: This Ryad is very nice. Good setting and extremly relaxing. Rooms a decent size with cosy mezzanine and spacious roof terrace. Pool area relaxing. The Restaurant had a decent (if a bit expensive) menu and we enjoyed a few meals there. They would perhaps benefit from more variety? It was bit worrying that so many people suffered from D&V's (including me) and some pointed towards the kitchen (I wasn't pointing). Perhaps the major downside is the location. Its a fair bit away from the main centre (such that it is) and so a taxi was the order of the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: After reading many reviews on various hotels in Marrakech I decided on this hotel. It completely lived up and exceeded my expectations. From the minute we arrived to the time we left the staff and hotel fulfilled our every need. We are were two femail friends travelling together and were very happy with the service we were provided. The walk in to the main square in Marrakech was a hectic but interesting one so don't let this put you off. You are staying in a very nice part of the town and the locals are very friendly.    The swimming pool could have been slightly warmer but the other facilities are all spot on. Breakfast was a very nice relaxing affair. The room was amazing. The balcony and views were a welcome unexpected treat so was the roses that were put on the bed each evening.    I would not hesitate in recomending this hotel to anyone. It is good value for money and makes your trip to Marrakech a very stress free experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Text: Driving down the alleyway in the medina at 10 pm and stopping at a small door we were unprepared for the luxury and quiet that awaited us. We had a lovely chamber et privilege on the second floor with a living area sleeping area and large bath. The pool was fabulous the food top notch and the service smiling. Do not miss the hammam - a steam and scrub that surpassed any spa! This was such a contrast to the dusty noisy medina. If you didn't know you would walk right by without realizing you were steps from paradise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After reading some of the other reviews I did wonder what sort of hotel we had actually booked. Stepping into the Hotel Les Jardins de la Medina off the hot dusty and bustling street in Marrakech you find a haven of peace and tranquility. There is a bar/restaurant set in the magnificent garden with its wonderful trees and tranquil surroundings. The service was excellent the staff were most helpful and could not do enough for us. We had a superior room which was lovely (we looked out onto the garden and we had a terrace with table and chairs). During our 1 week stay we had 3 dinners (one of which was their Moroccan Evening which was excellent value as you paid only for your food and the entertainment was free and 3 lunches in the restaurant all the food was excellent as were the Moroccan wines. The swimming pool was beautifully clean and their were always sunbeds available. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone else as it was gorgeous.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When choosing our hotel for our trip to Marrakech my best friend and I had it narrowed down to either the famous La Mamounia or Les Jardins de la Medina. We opted for the latter because we wanted a more authentic personal experience. As soon as we walked through the massive front door we knew that we had made the right decision. The grounds of the hotel were absolutely charming and the staff very accomodating. The calm and quiet hotel was the perfect sanctuary to come back to after spending the day immersed in the hustle and bustle of the Jemaa el Fna square and shopping in the souks. Our Superior room was perfect immaculate and beautifully decorated.    We booked a personal tour of all of the sites through the hotel. Our tour guide showed up in a 3 piece suit! If you are lucky enough to have a day to spare I recommend booking an excursion to Ait Benhaddou. About a four hour drive from Marrakech but well worth the journey. Gorgeous view of the Atlas Mountains and the Sahara desert from this ancient city...truly magical!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Date: Lorenzo M wrote a review Jul 2007
Review_Title: fantastic rooms, shame about the service
Review_Text: Well it was like walking into paradise after walking through the streets to get there. The hotel is conveniently located about 15-20 minutes walking from Jemma el Fna. But walking there and back can be quite stressful for some people as cars and bikes whiz pass on the narrow and bustling streets.    Once inside it feels very grand. We got offered a drink while we sat and filled in our hotel cards. We were shown to our room which was very nice indeed. Nice comfortable large bed. Beautiful tiles on the floor and walls. Windows overlooking the courtyard and swimming pool. Swimming pool was clean but not nearly enough chairs around the pool for the amount of people using it.    The staff seemed to be trying a bit too hard to please and were always in our face. It just seemed they were being forced to do something they didn't really want to do. I asked myself on various occasions "what happened to a service with a smile?" They didn't help create a relaxing atmosphere which is what I would expect from a hotel at this price.    So overall a very pleasant experience but could have been better.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rik H wrote a review Feb 2007
Review_Text: I've stayed in countless hotels; this was certainly the nicest! The service wasn't perfect the facilities weren't the best of the best but such things didn't matter. The place is beautifully decorated and absolutely charming. It's an oasis of sanity and serenity away from the madness that is the medina.    We were lucky: we had a free room upgrade presumably due to them running out of space. Ours was a 'superior' room with a small lounge area and a private balcony overlooking a part of the downstairs. The room was very tastefully decorated and the cleaners seemed to visit more than once a day. The bed was huge and very comfortable.    The staff were all very friendly and keen to help. They all spoke enough English for us to be able to converse with them when our rudimentary French reached its limits. If you have a basic grasp of French ('O' level) then you'll do fine in Marrakech at least with shopping and eating.    The food in the hotel was superb. Proper vertical food. It was priced appropriately - a three course meal for two with a bottle of wine costing around ¬£50. By contrast a decent meal (tagine and juice) at a restaurant in the main square might cost ¬£8 (for two people).    The restaurant/bar have a decent selection of foreign and Moroccan wines. The Moroccan wines are quite cheap by hotel standards - about ¬£9 for the S√©millant which was fruity and very drinkable. The foreign wines were at more usual prices.    Breakfast was pretty much like you'd find in any decent hotel. There was bread for toasting pastries scrambled egg bacon(!) hot tomatoes sausages dried and fresh fruit yoghurts cheeses those weird spongy pancakes fruit juices plus a woman with a frying pan who would make you an omelette or fried egg to order.    The pool area was relaxed and the pool itself was clean and warm enough at about 11am (bravery required to enter but fine once you're in). Unlike some hotels I've been to you're allowed drinks by the pool. Drinks from the bar always seem to come with nuts and/or olives.    We'd love to go back to this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel but if you're in Marrakech a riad is probably a more interesting option. However if a heated pool spa mini-bar room service restaurant etc is important then this is good. We were happy overall but they kept getting our room service breakfast wrong in spite of it being ¬£15/person! Hence the lower rating...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a fantastic 5 nights at Les Jardins de la Medina in early November. About a 15 minute walk from the square Les Jardins has spacious rooms helpful staff and great food. Each of the six people in our group enjoyed visits to the hotel's hammam and spa. We never wanted to leave!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled with friends

Review_Title: one of the lovliest hotel experiences ever!!
Review_Text: after reading so many bad reviews of this riad it was with great trepidation that we checked in. We found a hotel with great beauty and personality. The staff was always politle and helpful. Breakfast was substanial and the one night that we ate dinner at the hotel was memorable not only for the incredible beauty of the courtyard setting but the excellent quality of the food. The spa service was delightful and not too expensive. Everyone we met who was a guest the week we stayed seemed to be enjoying their stay just as much as we. This is a great place to stay. We recommend it highly
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For the price charged this hotel fell well below expectation. Despite having pre-arranged early breakfast on the first morning of our stay the night manager had no knowledge of this when we arrived at midnight. We were told that early breakfast was impossible. After we persisted he reluctantly agreed to provide a basic breakfast at 6am. He wasn't joking - the breakfast was less than basic. When we requested coffee we were treated to a lecture about his function as a Duty Manager and not a Chef ! The bedrooms were ok but nothing special. The dinner menu was limited and extremely expensive. Minibar prices were outrageous. The Hotel was clean but lacked atmosphere. No water in the shower on the morning of departure. Our rating would be a poor 3 star with very bad customer service and a total rip-off. Give it a miss !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled on business

Review_Text: After hot and hassled days in the Souk or wandering the Kasbah the hotel was like an oasis to come back to. Tucked away in the Kasbah a little door on a dirt track road opens up to a beautiful complex with a fairly good sized pool and great suites.    The service was great from the chocolate left on your pillow to the waiter who gets up and sings and dances with the band on Morrocan night.    Only down side is the food and drink is a bit expensive comparitvely- as you would expect of a hotel of this standard - and they only serve full on meals at lunch time which you don't really want in the midday heat leaving you to wait til 1530 before you can order a simple snack or sandwich.

If you are thinking of going here I wouldnt bother and certainly would not be going back.There are plenty of better places to stay.We stayed a week in May / June 2006. Anyone we met up with said the same-  Very overpriced and not worth it.When we arrived we were promised a welcome drink that never arrived. The staff were very rude and unhelpful with couldnt care less attitudes.(youre only the guest after all who has payed good money to stay here)Breakfast was a shambles of people sharing food with the birds and wasps (I was stung whilst at the pool) they just turn away and are unhelpful - also if you love the sun - get up early as by midday most sun chairs are in the shade) lunch and dinner very overpriced (¬£9.00 for a small portion of goats cheese on toast) water was ¬£2.00 for a bottle (outside there is a small kiosk it costs just over 20p a bottle - the owner is charming)The rooms were basic and bland and need a good overhaul and clean not at all like their website promises and very noisy - not soundproofed at all you can hear all that happens outside without leaving the room. watchout for the dawn chorus it starts at 5.00am and continues until evening! And listen out for the breakfast laying staff at 6.00am no need for an alarm clock at this hotel.If you do need and alarm call ask for one an hour before you need it as you wont get one on time - they have a habit of forgetting. In all VERY DISSAPOINTING-please note the Riad isnt very central for sightseeing and you will need to take a taxi everywhere - thats the only thing thats cheap!! Best wishes to anyone thinking of staying here and Happy holidays at Les Jardins De La Medina!!!!!!!!!

A relaxing haven from the moped fumed Medina.An unpleasant walk from the souks so taxi there/back.Largesubtropical courtyard with hammocksgood sized pool.Restaurant wasin the mainfussily french without the style.Breakfast was buffet by the pool.Beautiful setting-BUT you compete with hundreds of bees for the fruit and hungry birds who gorge-and defecate-on the bread and brioches.All in all a flawed gem.

We had selected Les Jardins de la Medina because it appeared to have the location and quality of facilities that we were looking for to relax after our journey through the desert. Sadly this was not our experience. The welcome was underwhelming and the form filling seemed more ardous than in previous accommodation. There was no offer of mint tea that is wonderfully common as you travel around. Being a small hotel we had expected that there would be greater flexibility with meals than the formal structure of the Riads but the reality was quite the contrary. Food arrangements were limited to set lunch and dinner with many courses and if you wished for something lighter than all they could offer was a selection from those dishes but you paid the full set price. The hotel had been built some years earlier to a reasonable standard but has not been maintained so that doors and shutters are either too loose or do not open without muscles and passage lights don't work. The staff could not have cared less when we made comments. To add insult to injury we were contacted after our return about not having paid all of the accommodation costs even though 100% had been taken by credit card by the hotel before we arrived! Definately not a place to be recommended or worth the price paid.

Beautiful hotel within the old city wall's of Marrakech if you can afford it go for a superior room which has it's own private sun terrace with lounger's umbrella and shower to cool offcharming staff at the hotel it has a very good restaraunt but is pricey compared to many other eating place's in the city. Marrakech is a fascinating place and is well worth visiting we were pleasantly surprised by the lack of hassle on the street's and from the vendor's in the souk's. All in all a very pleasant place to spend a few day's.

Review_Date: Lesley L wrote a review Apr 2006
