Review_Text: A lovely peaceful haven hidden behind a wooden door in one of the quieter streets in the Medina in Marrakech. Everything about this hotel was enchanting. It is a Riad in the Medina (Old Town) of Marrakech and as is typical of this type of accommodation had a lovely central courtyard. This one was big enough to have a nice size swimming pool with plenty of sunbeds around it and lots of trees with tables set out. There was also a marquee structure attached to the main building to provide semi outdoor eating which in April was ideal. We stayed there for 3 nights from 17th April 2006 and would have happily stayed another 2/3 days. We had a lovely room with its own terrace with seating. We also had a lovely massage at a very reasonable price. The staff were all very helpful. It's well located for seeing the sites although a little far away if all you want is the Souks.

My husband and I spent a week in Morocco and ended our trip in Marrakech. We were slightly intimidated by the number or people and motorcycles and donkeys and cars zooming through the Medina at any given moment and were therefore extremely grateful every time we walked inside the serenity of Les Jardins de la Medina. The rooms were large and gorgeous! The courtyard was lined with flowers and orange trees and the pool was warm and private and could barely be seen from each room's private roof top terrace. The spa was cheap and lovely and the restaurant was simply beautiful.

I cant say engough nice things about this place.  If you have been toughing it for a while make sure you treat your self here as it is an oasis in the middle of complete Chaos  Rooms bar lobby staff just awsome not cheap for morroco but cheap compared to western countries  When I get the photos developed I will post

Review_Title: Cancel now, I was in tears!
Review_Text: I arrived at Les Jardins Dec 27 a.m. Broken shoulder teenager husband with cancer and 6 bags> We were exhausted after an all night flight from new york and an overnight train from tangiers. Despite my Orbitz confirmation printouts I was told I had no reservation ane better yet We have never heard of Orbitz!!!! Many tears 3 managers later no room ! Finally after we took up their lobby space quite a while they found us a room at another more expensive hotel.

We stayed at Les Jardins for a week in May. The staff are friendly and extremely helpful booking restaurants guidestaxis etc.  Our privilege room was spacious and shaded with a private patio. The pool is beautiful surrrounded by sun loungers palm trees and jacaranda.  You can choose to eat inside the restaurant or outdoors overlooking the pool. Breakfasts are very good. Dinner is fine though it's more fun and much more interesting to eat in the many restaurants in the city.  Like most riads in Marrakech the entrance to Les Jardins is unremarkable: a plain wooden door in an alleyway. Once inside the space opens to an enchanting courtyard quiet and peaceful.  The hotel has a beauty centre small fitness area and a hammam where you can sit in a steam room and enjoy a "gommage" - an invigorating body scrub. The hotel is about 20 minutes' walk from Jemaa el fna the main square. Taxis are plentiful though the walk is more interesting.

Review_Title: A peaceful haven from Marrakech madness!
Review_Text: We stayed at Les Jardin de las Medina in June this year for a week. On arrival in Marrakech we were knocked over by the heat and the fasinating chaos in the tiny streets on our drive to the hotel and from the outside of the hotel you wouldnt even know it existed but once inside the smart wooden door we entered cool peace and tranquility. Its a wonderful haven from the madness of Marrakech. Our bedroom was beautiful and we had our own private roof terrace along with sunloungers and outside shower. The pool and inner courtyard is simply beautiful with plenty of shade to escape the heat.  The staff were very friendly and drinks at the bar were always accompanied by fabulous olives and homemade pastry nibbles! The food at breakfast (we didnt eat there for dinner as there are so many wonderful restaurants around the city) was excellent with plenty of choice.  I would thoroughly recommend this hotel and felt very pampered.

Review_Date: A G wrote a review Aug 2004
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights here and were very happy with the hotel. It is the only hotel in this particular part of the Medina which makes you a bit of a target for over eager shopowners but that is the only complaint. Our room was spacious and pretty the bar was fun the restaurant very good and reasonably priced and the pool gave a very welcome break from the heat. We got a great deal with four nights for the price of three by booking direct in August 2004. Definitely recommended!
